original: gang zhig gang la chags pa dang ldan pa de la mngon par chags pas byas pa'i 'jug pa dang ldan pa yang yin @130b no zhes bya ba ni bsdus pa'i don to //
analyzed: gang zhig gang la chags pa dang ldan pa de la mngon par chags pas byas pa'i 'jug pa dang ldan pa yang yin @130b no zhes bya ba ni bsdus pa'i don to //
translated: The condensed meaning is: Whoever is endowed with attachment to something is also endowed with engagement that is produced by manifest clinging.

original: mngon par chags pa tsam la rag las pa nyid kyis 'jug pa'i phyir rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: mngon par chags pa tsam la rag las pa nyid kyis 'jug pa'i phyir rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: Since engagement depends on mere manifest clinging, it is a natural reason.

original: re zhig bdag tu 'dzin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la gang la bdag tu 'dzin pa'i 'ching ba yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: re zhig bdag tu 'dzin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la gang la bdag tu 'dzin pa'i 'ching ba yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: First, as for the statement ‚Äúgrasping at self,‚Äù etc., it is so called because it has the bondage of grasping at self.

original: de'i don du zhes bya ba ni bdag la phan 'dogs pa'i don du ste /
analyzed: de'i don du zhes bya ba ni bdag la phan 'dogs pa'i don du ste /
translated: ‚ÄúFor that purpose‚Äù means for the purpose of benefiting the self.

original: nyon mongs pa spangs pa'i de ma thag nyid du de dag phung po lhag ma med pa'i myang ngan las 'das pa thob par 'gyur ro zhes bsams pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa spangs pa'i de ma thag nyid du de dag phung po lhag ma med pa'i myang ngan las 'das pa thob par 'gyur ro zhes bsams pa'o //
translated: Immediately after abandoning the afflictions, they will attain nirvana without remainder of the aggregates. This is the thought.

original: gnas par 'jug pa la zhes bya ba ni gnas pa la rag las pa 'jug pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: gnas par 'jug pa la zhes bya ba ni gnas pa la rag las pa 'jug pa'i don du'o //
translated: ‚ÄúEngagement in abiding‚Äù means engagement for the purpose of depending on abiding.

original: bdag la nye bar mkho ba mthong ba'i rgyu can ni gnas par 'jug pa yin la /
analyzed: bdag la nye bar mkho ba mthong ba'i rgyu can ni gnas par 'jug pa yin la /
translated: The cause of seeing what is useful to oneself is the engagement in abiding.

original: 'di la nye bar mkho ba mthong ba med pa de ltar na rgyu mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di la nye bar mkho ba mthong ba med pa de ltar na rgyu mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: When there is no seeing of what is useful here, that is the non-apprehension of the cause.

original: gzhan la phan 'dogs pa sems can la chags pa'i phyir ma yin zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: gzhan la phan 'dogs pa sems can la chags pa'i phyir ma yin zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: One should add: ‚ÄúIt is not for the sake of benefiting others, because of attachment to sentient beings.

original: mngon par chags pa spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon par chags pa spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚Äù It is because of the abandonment of attachment.

original: nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga ni 'du byed yin la de nyid sdug bsngal yin te /
analyzed: nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga ni 'du byed yin la de nyid sdug bsngal yin te /
translated: The five appropriated aggregates are formations and they are suffering,

original: mi mthun pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi mthun pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are disagreeable.

original: gang la dmigs pa yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: gang la dmigs pa yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: That which has an object is so-called because of that.

original: de la chags pa yi zhes bya ba la sogs pa dpe bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: de la chags pa yi zhes bya ba la sogs pa dpe bstan pa yin te /
translated: The example is taught beginning with ‚Äúattachment to that.

original: de bdag gi bde ba'i don du bstan pa yang ma yin zhing /
analyzed: de bdag gi bde ba'i don du bstan pa yang ma yin zhing /
translated: ‚Äù It is not taught for the sake of one‚Äôs own happiness,

original: chags pas kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: chags pas kyang ma yin te /
translated: nor is it because of attachment.

original: 'on kyang brtse ba kho nas yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang brtse ba kho nas yin no //
translated: Rather, it is solely out of compassion.

original: 'di 'chir par byed pa ma yin zhing zhes bya ba ni de 'jog par byed pa ma yin zhing ngo //
analyzed: 'di 'chir par byed pa ma yin zhing zhes bya ba ni de 'jog par byed pa ma yin zhing ngo //
translated: It does not cause it to die means it does not cause it to cease.

original: gal te yang bar ma dor gags byed pa ni lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gal te yang bar ma dor gags byed pa ni lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If it were to die in the interim, it would be nirvana without remainder.

original: gags byed par nus pa can gyi las kyi 'phangs pa'i srid pa yod na rigs pa 'di yin gyi /
analyzed: gags byed par nus pa can gyi las kyi 'phangs pa'i srid pa yod na rigs pa 'di yin gyi /
translated: This is reasonable if there is a projected existence that is capable of being obstructed, because of the remainder of karma that projects it.

original: de lta ma yin na nges pa'i las nges pas 'phangs pa'i dus nges pa can gyi srid pa la bar ma dor gags byed pa yod pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na nges pa'i las nges pas 'phangs pa'i dus nges pa can gyi srid pa la bar ma dor gags byed pa yod pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: But if that is not the case, then there is no obstruction in the interim for a projected existence that is certain to occur at a certain time, because of certain karma.

original: gla dang rngan pa dang / gla ba'i rin zhes bya ba ni don gzhan nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: gla dang rngan pa dang / gla ba'i rin zhes bya ba ni don gzhan nyid ma yin no //
translated: Wages, a reward, and the price of a hireling are not different things.

original: mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i bdag nyid la zhes bya ba ni mi rta pa dang bde ba ma yin pa dang / bdag med pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i bdag nyid la zhes bya ba ni mi rta pa dang bde ba ma yin pa dang / bdag med pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúin the nature of impermanence, etc.‚Äù means in the nature of impermanence, suffering, and no-self.

original: phyin ci log gi shes pa ni rtag pa dang bde ba la sogs pa'i ngo bor 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: phyin ci log gi shes pa ni rtag pa dang bde ba la sogs pa'i ngo bor 'dzin pa ste /
translated: The erroneous cognition is the apprehension of the nature of permanence, happiness, etc.

original: 'dis ni ma rigs pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni ma rigs pa bstan to //
translated: This shows the irrationality.

original: bdag tu lta ba spangs pa can gang yin pa de la sems can du lta ba sngon du song ba can med pas khyab pa yin la /
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba spangs pa can gang yin pa de la sems can du lta ba sngon du song ba can med pas khyab pa yin la /
translated: In the case of one who has abandoned the view of self, there is the pervasion that the view of sentient beings does not precede.

original: de dang 'gal ba yang sems can du lta ba sngon du song ba can yin pa @131a * //
analyzed: de dang 'gal ba yang sems can du lta ba sngon du song ba can yin pa @131a * //
translated: And that which is contradictory to that is the view of sentient beings that precedes.

original: de ltar na khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar na khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
translated: Thus, there is the observation of the contradiction with the pervasion.

original: sbyor ba gnyis pa yang khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa nyid yin te bdag tu lta ba spangs pa la bdag tu lta ba sngon du song ba can gyi blo dang mi ldan pa nyid kyis khyab pa nyid kyi phyir dang / bdag tu lta ba sngon du song ba can gyi snying rje'i sems dang ldan pa ni de dang 'gal ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sbyor ba gnyis pa yang khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa nyid yin te bdag tu lta ba spangs pa la bdag tu lta ba sngon du song ba can gyi blo dang mi ldan pa nyid kyis khyab pa nyid kyi phyir dang / bdag tu lta ba sngon du song ba can gyi snying rje'i sems dang ldan pa ni de dang 'gal ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The second syllogism is also the observation of the contradiction with the pervasion, because in the case of one who has abandoned the view of self, there is the pervasion that the mind does not possess the view of self that precedes, and because one who possesses the mind of compassion that precedes the view of self is contradictory to that.

original: snying rje rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: snying rje rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Compassion is of two kinds:

original: sems can la dmigs pa dang chos la dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: sems can la dmigs pa dang chos la dmigs pa'o //
translated: It has sentient beings as its object and it has a phenomenon as its object.

original: de la gal te snying rje snga ma la brten nas brjod pa de'i tshe sbyor ba snga ma ni grub pa la sgrub pa yin te /
analyzed: de la gal te snying rje snga ma la brten nas brjod pa de'i tshe sbyor ba snga ma ni grub pa la sgrub pa yin te /
translated: If compassion is mentioned in dependence on the former, then the former application is established in what is already established,

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba dag la ni sems can la dmigs pa'i snying rjes khas mi len pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba dag la ni sems can la dmigs pa'i snying rjes khas mi len pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because those who are free from attachment do not accept compassion that has sentient beings as its object.

original: ci ste snying rje gnyis pa la brten nas brjod pa yin na ni de las gtan tshigs ma grub pa yin te /
analyzed: ci ste snying rje gnyis pa la brten nas brjod pa yin na ni de las gtan tshigs ma grub pa yin te /
translated: But if compassion is mentioned in dependence on the latter, then the reason is not established,

original: chos la dmigs pa'i snying rje ni sems can la lta ba sngon du song ba can nyid du ma grub pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: chos la dmigs pa'i snying rje ni sems can la lta ba sngon du song ba can nyid du ma grub pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because compassion that has a phenomenon as its object is not established as having the observation of sentient beings as its antecedent.

original: de ni sems can la dmigs pa can gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de ni sems can la dmigs pa can gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: He says, ‚ÄúIt is not the case that compassion that has a phenomenon as its object is not preceded by the observation of sentient beings.‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams kyi chos la dmigs pa'i snying rje don dam pa yin gyi /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams kyi chos la dmigs pa'i snying rje don dam pa yin gyi /
translated: Because the compassion that has a phenomenon as its object for those who are free from attachment is ultimate,üîΩand the compassion that has sentient beings as its object is conventional.

original: sems can la dmigs pa ma yin pa'i rgyu de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: sems can la dmigs pa ma yin pa'i rgyu de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: For that very reason,

original: sbyor ba gnyis pa la yang gtan tshigs ma grub pa yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba gnyis pa la yang gtan tshigs ma grub pa yin te /
translated: The second syllogism also has an unestablished reason.

original: grol ba rnams bdag tu lta ba sngon du song ba can gyi snying rje'i sems dang ldan pa nyid ma grub pa'i phyir ro //üîΩsdug bsngal shes la zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa shes pa rnam pa bzhi dag yin te shes pa'o //
analyzed: grol ba rnams bdag tu lta ba sngon du song ba can gyi snying rje'i sems dang ldan pa nyid ma grub pa'i phyir ro // sdug bsngal shes la zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa shes pa rnam pa bzhi dag yin te shes pa'o //
translated: It is not established that those who are liberated have a mind of compassion that is preceded by the view of self.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúknowing suffering‚Äù refers to the four aspects of the knowledge of the truth of suffering: impermanence, suffering,

original: de nyid ni mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal ba dang zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de nyid ni mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal ba dang zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: emptiness, and selflessness.

original: 'di ni yod pa'i bdun pa yin te /üîΩsdug bsngal shes pa yod na zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'di ni yod pa'i bdun pa yin te / sdug bsngal shes pa yod na zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the seventh occurrence of the word ‚Äúexistence.‚Äù

original: zhe sdang spangs pa can gyi zhes bya ba ni zhe sdang can ni 'jig rten na gnod pa yin la de med pa'i phyir zhe sdang spangs ba can yin te /
analyzed: zhe sdang spangs pa can gyi zhes bya ba ni zhe sdang can ni 'jig rten na gnod pa yin la de med pa'i phyir zhe sdang spangs ba can yin te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúhaving abandoned hatred‚Äù means that in the world, those who are hateful are harmful, and since they do not exist, those who have abandoned hatred are not harmful.

original: 'gal ba med pa'i zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'gal ba med pa'i zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: This is what is meant by the phrase ‚Äúthere is no contradiction.‚Äù

original: gal te yang sdug bsngal shes pas 'dod chags la sogs pa yang spangs pa yin pa de lta na yang zhe sdang smos pa byas pa gang yin pa de ni snying rje dngos su zhe sdang dang 'gal ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gal te yang sdug bsngal shes pas 'dod chags la sogs pa yang spangs pa yin pa de lta na yang zhe sdang smos pa byas pa gang yin pa de ni snying rje dngos su zhe sdang dang 'gal ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If, on the other hand, one were to abandon desire, etc. by knowing suffering, then the mention of hatred would be meaningless, because compassion is actually incompatible with hatred.

original: 'dus reg tsam zhes bya ba la tsam smos pa ni don lhag par sgro 'dogs pa spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dus reg tsam zhes bya ba la tsam smos pa ni don lhag par sgro 'dogs pa spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The mere contact, etc. The mere is mentioned in order to avoid the superimposition of an additional object.

original: khro rgyu zhes bya ba ni zhe sdang gi rgyu'o //
analyzed: khro rgyu zhes bya ba ni zhe sdang gi rgyu'o //
translated: The cause of anger is the cause of hatred.

original: de nyid ni bdag dang bdag gi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de nyid ni bdag dang bdag gi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: That itself is mentioned in the phrase ‚Äúthe view of self and mine, etc.‚Äù

original: 'gal ba can ni zhe sdang gi yul du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'gal ba can ni zhe sdang gi yul du 'gyur ro //
translated: The incompatible is the object of hatred.

original: de @131b med par khro ba'i rgyu zhe sdang ma yin gyi zhes /
analyzed: de @131b med par khro ba'i rgyu zhe sdang ma yin gyi zhes /
translated: Without that, there is no cause of anger, i.e., no hatred.

original: 'on kyang bdag tu lta ba nyid yod na zhe sdang 'byung ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'on kyang bdag tu lta ba nyid yod na zhe sdang 'byung ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: However, if the view of self exists, hatred arises. This is the meaning.

original: de nyid ni des na bdag dang bdag gi rnam pa'i zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de nyid ni des na bdag dang bdag gi rnam pa'i zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: That itself is mentioned in the phrase ‚Äúthe view of self and mine, etc.‚Äù

original: de ltar na zhes bya ba la sogs pas grub pa la sgrub pa la sogs pa sngar bshad pa'i mjug sdud par byed do //
analyzed: de ltar na zhes bya ba la sogs pas grub pa la sgrub pa la sogs pa sngar bshad pa'i mjug sdud par byed do //
translated: Thus, etc. concludes the previously explained establishment of the establishment, etc.

original: de yang gong du rnam par phye zin to //üîΩgang 'du byed nus zad med can //üîΩzhes bya ba ni phung po'i rgyun skyon med pa skyed pa la /
analyzed: de yang gong du rnam par phye zin to // gang 'du byed nus zad med can // zhes bya ba ni phung po'i rgyun skyon med pa skyed pa la /
translated: And that has already been analyzed above.üîΩThose who have inexhaustible power of karma

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba gang dag la las kyi nus pa zad pa med pa yod pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba gang dag la las kyi nus pa zad pa med pa yod pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: means those who are free from attachment and have inexhaustible power of karma in producing the faultless continuum of aggregates.üîΩThat is the meaning.

original: dper na byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lta bu'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dper na byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lta bu'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: For example, like the bodhisattvas.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni las kyi nus pa zad pa can ma yin te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni las kyi nus pa zad pa can ma yin te /
translated: The bodhisattvas do not have exhausted power of karma,

original: tshogs thams cad mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i 'bras bu can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshogs thams cad mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i 'bras bu can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because their entire collection has the result of non-abiding nirvana.

original: nyes med can zhes bya ba ni sdig pa med pa can no //
analyzed: nyes med can zhes bya ba ni sdig pa med pa can no //
translated: Those who are without fault means those who are without sin.

original: sems can gyi don yid la byed pas gnas pa zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba gcig go //
analyzed: sems can gyi don yid la byed pas gnas pa zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba gcig go //
translated: Those who abide with attention on the welfare of sentient beings is one thing to be accomplished.

original: yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa ma yin zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa ma yin zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa'o //
translated: The second is ‚Äúnot completely liberated.‚Äù

original: gnas pa ni snying rje'i 'jug pa tsam dang rjes su 'brel pa can nyid yin pa'i phyir rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: gnas pa ni snying rje'i 'jug pa tsam dang rjes su 'brel pa can nyid yin pa'i phyir rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: The reason is natural because the abiding is merely the engagement of compassion and is related to it.

original: yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa las snying rje ldog pas khyab pa nyid kyi phyir dang / gnas pa ni de dang 'gal ba nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa las snying rje ldog pas khyab pa nyid kyi phyir dang / gnas pa ni de dang 'gal ba nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: The pervasion is because compassion is pervaded by turning away from complete liberation, and abiding is contradictory to that.

original: bsgrub par bya ba gnyis pa la ltos nas khyab par byed pa 'gal ba nyid dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba gnyis pa la ltos nas khyab par byed pa 'gal ba nyid dmigs pa'o //
translated: The observation of the contradiction of the pervader in relation to the second probandum.

original: bsgom pa'i lam dang mi slob pa'i lam dang mi slob pa'i lam las sngar byung ba can nyid yin pa'i phyir mthong ba'i lam ni lam dang po'o //
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam dang mi slob pa'i lam dang mi slob pa'i lam las sngar byung ba can nyid yin pa'i phyir mthong ba'i lam ni lam dang po'o //
translated: The path of seeing is the first path because it arises prior to the path of cultivation and the path of no further learning.

original: rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sogs pa'i sgras ni lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba gzung ngo //
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sogs pa'i sgras ni lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba gzung ngo //
translated: The once-returner and non-returner are included by the word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù in the phrase ‚Äústream-enterer and so on.‚Äù

original: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa mthong ba nyid kyis de dag gis 'jig tshogs su lta ba spangs pa yin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa mthong ba nyid kyis de dag gis 'jig tshogs su lta ba spangs pa yin no //
translated: The view of the transitory collection is abandoned by the very seeing of the truth of suffering.

original: kun du brtags pa ni bstan bcos sems pa la sogs pa'i sgo nas byung ba'o //
analyzed: kun du brtags pa ni bstan bcos sems pa la sogs pa'i sgo nas byung ba'o //
translated: The imputed is that which arises from the contemplation of treatises and so on.

original: lhan cig skyes pa ni thog ma med pa'i bag chags las byung ba'o ;
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa ni thog ma med pa'i bag chags las byung ba'o ;
translated: The innate is that which arises from beginningless predispositions.

original: / de dag nyid kyis spangs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni thog ma med pa'i bag chags las byung ba de ni bsgom pa'i lam nyid kyis spang bar bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: / de dag nyid kyis spangs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni thog ma med pa'i bag chags las byung ba de ni bsgom pa'i lam nyid kyis spang bar bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are not abandoned by those very means, because that which arises from beginningless predispositions is to be abandoned by the path of meditation alone.

original: bdag tu chags pa khas len pa nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: bdag tu chags pa khas len pa nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Because they accept attachment to the self,

original: rgyun du zhugs pa la lhan cig skyes pa'i mi shes pa phyin ci log yod pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa la lhan cig skyes pa'i mi shes pa phyin ci log yod pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: in order to demonstrate that the stream enterer has innate ignorance and error,üîΩhe says:

original: @132a * // gang gi phyir /
analyzed: @132a * // gang gi phyir /
translated: Because

original: gang zhig nga zhes mthong med pa //
analyzed: gang zhig nga zhes mthong med pa //
translated: one who does not see the self

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: and so on.

original: 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs so zhes bya ba ni yang srid par nying mtshams sbyor ba ni bdag tu chags pa'i 'bras bu nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs so zhes bya ba ni yang srid par nying mtshams sbyor ba ni bdag tu chags pa'i 'bras bu nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The reason of effect is because the link to rebirth is the effect of self-attachment.

original: gtan tshigs de gnyis ni ma grub pa yin te zhes bya ba ni 'khor ba yang 'ching ba yin no zhes bya ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa yang thar pa yin no zhes bya ba de gnyis so //
analyzed: gtan tshigs de gnyis ni ma grub pa yin te zhes bya ba ni 'khor ba yang 'ching ba yin no zhes bya ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa yang thar pa yin no zhes bya ba de gnyis so //
translated: Those two reasons are unestablished, i.e., cyclic existence is bondage and nirvana is liberation.

original: gal te ji ltar zhe na /üîΩ'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gal te ji ltar zhe na / 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: If one asks, how?

original: bdag tu sogs pa bkag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag tu sogs pa bkag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He says, ‚Äúbecause of the non-existence of the bound one, etc.‚Äù

original: 'ga' zhig bcings pa dang / rang dbang ba 'ga' zhig kyang grol ba ma yin no //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig bcings pa dang / rang dbang ba 'ga' zhig kyang grol ba ma yin no //
translated: Because of the negation of self, etc., there is no one who is bound and no one who is liberated.

original: de med pa'i phyir de la ltos nas 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa dag 'ching ba dang thar pa nyid du brtags pa ma grub pa yin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: de med pa'i phyir de la ltos nas 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa dag 'ching ba dang thar pa nyid du brtags pa ma grub pa yin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: Since that does not exist, the imputation of cyclic existence and nirvana as bondage and liberation, respectively, is not established.

original: 'o na kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i 'jug pa'i go rims ji ltar yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i 'jug pa'i go rims ji ltar yin zhe na /
translated: Now, what is the order of engagement of the thoroughly afflicted and the completely purified?

original: 'on kyang ma rig pa yod na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: 'on kyang ma rig pa yod na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: But when there is ignorance, etc.

original: bar du zhes bya ba'i sgra ni 'du byed yod na rnam par shes pa dang / rnam par shes pa yod na ming dang gzugs zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: bar du zhes bya ba'i sgra ni 'du byed yod na rnam par shes pa dang / rnam par shes pa yod na ming dang gzugs zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
translated: The word ‚Äúand‚Äù is used for the links of compositional activity, consciousness, and name-and-form.

original: gang gi bdag la sogs pa med par yang ma rig pa la sogs pa ngo bo nyid kyis rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por nges pa'i rang bzhin can 'jug bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: gang gi bdag la sogs pa med par yang ma rig pa la sogs pa ngo bo nyid kyis rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por nges pa'i rang bzhin can 'jug bar 'gyur la /
translated: When there is no self, etc., ignorance, etc. are definitely engaged in the nature of being causes and effects by way of their own entities.

original: de 'jug pa tsam yang 'khor ba zhes tha snyad gdags so //
analyzed: de 'jug pa tsam yang 'khor ba zhes tha snyad gdags so //
translated: The mere engagement of that is designated as ‚Äúcyclic existence.‚Äù

original: 'gal ba'i rkyen nye ba las kyang rgyu bcom pa'i sgo nas /
analyzed: 'gal ba'i rkyen nye ba las kyang rgyu bcom pa'i sgo nas /
translated: When the conditions that are incompatible with it are nearby, the cessation of the cause,

original: ma rig pa ldog pa tsam la thar pa zhes tha snyad du byas pa yin no zhes bya ba ni bsdus pa'i don to //
analyzed: ma rig pa ldog pa tsam la thar pa zhes tha snyad du byas pa yin no zhes bya ba ni bsdus pa'i don to //
translated: the mere stopping of ignorance, is designated as ‚Äúliberation.‚Äù This is the condensed meaning.

original: 'ching ba la sdug bsngal skye ba'i rgyu nyid yin pas khyab pa yin te /
analyzed: 'ching ba la sdug bsngal skye ba'i rgyu nyid yin pas khyab pa yin te /
translated: The pervasion is that being a cause of the origination of suffering is the nature of bondage.

original: de dang 'gal ba nyid ni sdug bsngal skye ba dang bral ba nyid yin pa de ltar na khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: de dang 'gal ba nyid ni sdug bsngal skye ba dang bral ba nyid yin pa de ltar na khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
translated: The contradiction of that is the absence of the origination of suffering. Thus, there is the observation of a contradiction with the pervader.

original: 'gyur ba ni bden na sdug bsngal skye ba'i rgyu bdag nyid yin pa de'i phyir gtan tshigs ma grub pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'gyur ba ni bden na sdug bsngal skye ba'i rgyu bdag nyid yin pa de'i phyir gtan tshigs ma grub pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If it is argued that the reason is not established because of the nature of the origination of suffering when there is a change,

original: de'i phyir 'di ni ma grub pa yin bar bsam par mi bya ste zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di ni ma grub pa yin bar bsam par mi bya ste zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: then it is said that this should not be considered as not established.

original: ji skad du bshad pa'i 'ching bas zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal skyed pa'i rgyu'i mtshan nyid can gyis so //
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa'i 'ching bas zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal skyed pa'i rgyu'i mtshan nyid can gyis so //
translated: As to what was explained as bondage, it is characterized by being a cause of the origination of suffering.

original: gnyi ga'i rnam pa ma yin pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa la rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa dag tu brjod par bya ba ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir /üîΩgang zag ni rnam pa gnyi ga dang bral ba nyid yin par 'dod do //
analyzed: gnyi ga'i rnam pa ma yin pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa la rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa dag tu brjod par bya ba ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir /üîΩgang zag ni rnam pa gnyi ga dang bral ba nyid yin par 'dod do //
translated: The person is asserted to be free from both aspects, because it is not to be described as either permanent or impermanent.

original: de lta bur gyur pa'i dngos po ni yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa'i dngos po ni yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Such a thing does not exist,

original: dngos po ni rnam pa gnyi gas khyab pa nyid kyi @132b phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po ni rnam pa gnyi gas khyab pa nyid kyi @132b phyir ro //
translated: because a thing is pervaded by both aspects.

original: de nyid ni rtag pa dang mi rtag pa dag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de nyid ni rtag pa dang mi rtag pa dag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: That is the meaning of the statement, ‚ÄúPermanence and impermanence, etc.‚Äù

original: phan tshun spangs pa ni phan tshun spangs pa ste de dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: phan tshun spangs pa ni phan tshun spangs pa ste de dang bral ba'o //
translated: Mutually exclusive means mutually contradictory.

original: des gnas pa'i mtshan nyid rtag pa dag mi rtag pa gang dag yod pa de dag la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: des gnas pa'i mtshan nyid rtag pa dag mi rtag pa gang dag yod pa de dag la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: Those things that exist in a state of permanence, which is characterized by stability, and impermanence, which is characterized by instability, are said to be mutually exclusive.

original: de'i dngos po yin pa de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de'i dngos po yin pa de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Because of the nature of that,

original: rtag pa spangs te mi rtag pa'i mtshan nyid du gnas pa dang / mi rtag pa spangs te rtag pa'i mtshan nyid du gnas pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rtag pa spangs te mi rtag pa'i mtshan nyid du gnas pa dang / mi rtag pa spangs te rtag pa'i mtshan nyid du gnas pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: it is said that permanence is abandoned and impermanence is characterized by stability, and impermanence is abandoned and permanence is characterized by stability.

original: gal te de las cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de las cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If that is so, what is the consequence?

original: dngos po la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: dngos po la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: The statement, ‚ÄúIn regard to a thing, etc.,‚Äù is made.

original: gang zag la sogs pa'i dngos po la rtag pa'am /
analyzed: gang zag la sogs pa'i dngos po la rtag pa'am /
translated: In regard to a thing, such as a person, etc., permanence or

original: mi rtag pa gcig rnam par bcad pa dang / yongs su gcod pa gang yin pa de dag ni de las gzhan pa rtag pa'am mi rtag pa yongs su bcad pa dang / rnam par bcad pa gang yin pa de med na mi 'byung ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩde skad du dngos po yod na rtag pa rnam par bcad pa'am /
analyzed: mi rtag pa gcig rnam par bcad pa dang / yongs su gcod pa gang yin pa de dag ni de las gzhan pa rtag pa'am mi rtag pa yongs su bcad pa dang / rnam par bcad pa gang yin pa de med na mi 'byung ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro // de skad du dngos po yod na rtag pa rnam par bcad pa'am /
translated: Whatever is the exclusion and determination of impermanence, that is the exclusion and determination of permanence or impermanence, which is other than that, because it is the case that it does not occur if that does not occur.

original: yongs su gcod pa ni go rims bzhin du mi rtag pa yongs su gcod pa med na mi 'byung ba can yin no //
analyzed: yongs su gcod pa ni go rims bzhin du mi rtag pa yongs su gcod pa med na mi 'byung ba can yin no //
translated: In that way, if an entity exists, the exclusion of permanence or the determination of permanence is, respectively, the determination of impermanence, which does not occur if that does not occur.

original: mi rtag pa rnam par bcad pa dang / yongs su gcod pa dang rtag pa yongs su gcod pa dang rnam par bcad pa med na mi 'byung ba can yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi rtag pa rnam par bcad pa dang / yongs su gcod pa dang rtag pa yongs su gcod pa dang rnam par bcad pa med na mi 'byung ba can yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: The exclusion of impermanence and the determination of impermanence and the exclusion of permanence are the case that it does not occur if that does not occur.

original: de bas na gal te gang zag la rtag pa rnam par bcad na mi rtag pa gsal bar bzung ba de'i phyir mi rtag pa nyid du brjod par bya ba yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas na gal te gang zag la rtag pa rnam par bcad na mi rtag pa gsal bar bzung ba de'i phyir mi rtag pa nyid du brjod par bya ba yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, if one excludes permanence in the person and ascertains impermanence, then because of that, impermanence would be expressed as something to be stated.

original: ci ste rtag pa yongs su gcod pa de'i tshe yang mi rtag pa rnam par bcad pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: ci ste rtag pa yongs su gcod pa de'i tshe yang mi rtag pa rnam par bcad pa de'i phyir /
translated: But if permanence is determined, then impermanence is excluded.

original: rtag pa nyid yin pas na rtag pa nyid du brjod par bya ba yin pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rtag pa nyid yin pas na rtag pa nyid du brjod par bya ba yin pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it would follow that permanence itself is what is to be expressed.

original: de bzhin du gal te mi rtag pa nyid rnam par bcad pa de bas na /
analyzed: de bzhin du gal te mi rtag pa nyid rnam par bcad pa de bas na /
translated: Similarly, if impermanence is excluded, then permanence is determined.

original: rtag pa bzung ba de'i phyir rtag pa nyid du brjod par bya ba yin par 'gyur ro //üîΩci ste mi rtag pa yongs su gcod pa yin pa de lta na yang rtag pa rnam par bcad pa yin pa de ltar na /
analyzed: rtag pa bzung ba de'i phyir rtag pa nyid du brjod par bya ba yin par 'gyur ro // ci ste mi rtag pa yongs su gcod pa yin pa de lta na yang rtag pa rnam par bcad pa yin pa de ltar na /
translated: Therefore, it would follow that permanence itself is what is to be expressed.üîΩBut if impermanence is determined, then permanence is excluded.

original: nges par mi rtag pa nyid du brjod par bya ba yin pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nges par mi rtag pa nyid du brjod par bya ba yin pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it would follow that impermanence itself is what is to be expressed.

original: mi rtag pa ste zhes bya ba 'di'i 'grel pa ni skad cig ma nyid du zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: mi rtag pa ste zhes bya ba 'di'i 'grel pa ni skad cig ma nyid du zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The commentary on ‚Äúimpermanence‚Äù is ‚Äúmomentariness.‚Äù

original: de ni med pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni skad cig ma nyid ma yin pa ni don byed par nus pa dang bral ba nyid kyis med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni med pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni skad cig ma nyid ma yin pa ni don byed par nus pa dang bral ba nyid kyis med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúIt would be nonexistent‚Äù means that what is not momentary is nonexistent because it is devoid of the ability to function.

original: de'i tshe ma bcings pa ni zhes bya ba ni 'ching ba med pas ma bcings pa'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe ma bcings pa ni zhes bya ba ni 'ching ba med pas ma bcings pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúAt that time, it would not be bound‚Äù means that it would not be bound because it would not be bound.

original: gal te rtag pa nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir skyon @133a * //
analyzed: gal te rtag pa nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir skyon @133a * //
translated: If you say that there is no error because it is not to be described as permanent,

original: med do zhe na zhes bya ba ni gal te rtag pa nyid du gang zag brjod par bya ba yin pas khas blangs nas skad cig pa nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin par smra bar 'gyur ba de'i tshe yod pa nyid ma yin par 'gyur te
analyzed: med do zhe na zhes bya ba ni gal te rtag pa nyid du gang zag brjod par bya ba yin pas khas blangs nas skad cig pa nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin par smra bar 'gyur ba de'i tshe yod pa nyid ma yin par 'gyur te
translated: if you accept that the person is to be described as permanent, then you would be saying that it is not to be described as momentary. In that case, it would not exist,

original: / rim dang cig car don byed pa 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: / rim dang cig car don byed pa 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is contradictory for something to function sequentially and instantaneously.üîΩIf you say that there is no error because it is not to be described as permanent,

original: gang gi tshe rtag pa nyid kyis brjod par bya ba ma yin pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe rtag pa nyid kyis brjod par bya ba ma yin pa de'i tshe /
translated: then at that time,

original: skyon 'di yod pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: skyon 'di yod pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: this error would not exist.

original: rtag pa dang mi rtag pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa dag med pa'i ngo bo de nyid gang zag gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: rtag pa dang mi rtag pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa dag med pa'i ngo bo de nyid gang zag gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: The phrase permanent and impermanent and so on refers to the person who has a nature that is neither permanent nor impermanent.

original: rtag pa dang mi rtag par lung bstan du med pa'i phyir gang zag tu smra bar brjod par bya ba ma yin pa ste lung du ma bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: rtag pa dang mi rtag par lung bstan du med pa'i phyir gang zag tu smra bar brjod par bya ba ma yin pa ste lung du ma bstan pa yin no //
translated: The phrase not to be described as a person means that the person is indeterminate, because it cannot be described as either permanent or impermanent.

original: rten yongs su gyur pa gang zhe na /üîΩnyes pa dang bcas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: rten yongs su gyur pa gang zhe na / nyes pa dang bcas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: What is the transformation of the basis?üîΩThe root text states, ‚ÄúThe transformation of the basis is the purified realm.‚Äù

original: lam de'i bdag nyid la zhes bya ba ni lam gyi rang bzhin nyid la'o //
analyzed: lam de'i bdag nyid la zhes bya ba ni lam gyi rang bzhin nyid la'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúin the nature of that path‚Äù means in the very nature of the path.

original: de kho na nyid mthong ba'i bdag nyid can yin gyi zhes bya ba ni dngos po ji lta ba bzhin du gnas pa 'dzin pa'i bdag nyid can zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de kho na nyid mthong ba'i bdag nyid can yin gyi zhes bya ba ni dngos po ji lta ba bzhin du gnas pa 'dzin pa'i bdag nyid can zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúit has the nature of seeing reality‚Äù means that it has the nature of apprehending things in accordance with how they exist.

original: tshad ma dang 'gal ba'i rnam pa ni phyin ci log gi rnam pa'o //
analyzed: tshad ma dang 'gal ba'i rnam pa ni phyin ci log gi rnam pa'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúit is the opposite of the form of error that contradicts valid knowledge‚Äù means that it is the opposite of the form of error that contradicts valid knowledge.

original: de dang rjes su 'brel pa ni nye bar bsgyur ba ste /
analyzed: de dang rjes su 'brel pa ni nye bar bsgyur ba ste /
translated: And the secondary afflictions are related to that, because they are the secondary afflictions of the mind.

original: nyes pa gang yin pa de'i bdag nyid can du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyes pa gang yin pa de'i bdag nyid can du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The mind is not transformed into their nature.

original: sems nyid nye bar nyon mongs par byed pas na nye ba'i nyon mongs pa ste 'dod chags la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sems nyid nye bar nyon mongs par byed pas na nye ba'i nyon mongs pa ste 'dod chags la sogs pa'o //
translated: The secondary afflictions are desire, etc., which afflict the mind itself.

original: rgyu mtshan 'ga' zhig las bdag la sogs par sgro btags pas 'jug pa'i 'khrul pa'i shes pa ni glo bur gyi rkyen yin te /
analyzed: rgyu mtshan 'ga' zhig las bdag la sogs par sgro btags pas 'jug pa'i 'khrul pa'i shes pa ni glo bur gyi rkyen yin te /
translated: The erroneous consciousness that engages by superimposing a self, etc., on some causal process is a adventitious condition.

original: de ni tshad ma'i grogs ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni tshad ma'i grogs ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not a companion of valid knowledge.

original: de la gnod pa yod na zhes bya ba ni glo bur ba'i rnam pas de'i rgyu can gyi nye ba'i nyon mongs pa bdag med pa'i lam gyis gsal ba yod na zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de la gnod pa yod na zhes bya ba ni glo bur ba'i rnam pas de'i rgyu can gyi nye ba'i nyon mongs pa bdag med pa'i lam gyis gsal ba yod na zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: When there is an antidote to that, i.e., when there is the clarity of the path of selflessness, which is the cause of the adventitious afflictions, then the mind is said to be clear.

original: rang gis rang bzhin la gnas pa'i zhes bya ba ni bdag med pa'i lam de'i bdag nyid la gnas pa'i'o //
analyzed: rang gis rang bzhin la gnas pa'i zhes bya ba ni bdag med pa'i lam de'i bdag nyid la gnas pa'i'o //
translated: When it abides in its own nature, i.e., when it abides in the nature of that path of selflessness, then it is said to be pure.

original: dngos po'i stobs kyis zhugs pa'i rang bzhin nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni dngos po ji ltar gnas pa bzhin du 'dzin pas zhugs pa'i bdag med pa'i lam ni sems kyi rang bzhin nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po'i stobs kyis zhugs pa'i rang bzhin nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni dngos po ji ltar gnas pa bzhin du 'dzin pas zhugs pa'i bdag med pa'i lam ni sems kyi rang bzhin nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the very nature of the path that is engaged by the power of fact.

original: bdag nyid de'i rten du gyur pa ma yin te zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bdag nyid de'i rten du gyur pa ma yin te zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is not the basis of that self,

original: rnam pa gzhan du 'jug pa'i rten du gyur pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du 'jug pa'i rten du gyur pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: the meaning is that it is not the basis of engagement in another aspect.

original: 'dres pa'i rkyen ni g-ya' la sogs pa 'dres pa'i rgyu'i'o //
analyzed: 'dres pa'i rkyen ni g-ya' la sogs pa 'dres pa'i rgyu'i'o //
translated: The condition of mixing is the cause of mixing with itching, etc.

original: de shin tu med na @133b zhes bya ba ni 'dres pa'i rkyen shin tu med na'o //
analyzed: de shin tu med na @133b zhes bya ba ni 'dres pa'i rkyen shin tu med na'o //
translated: When that is completely absent,

original: 'di lta ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dpe gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: 'di lta ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dpe gnyis pa'o //
translated: the two examples beginning with ‚Äúfor example‚Äù are the second.

original: yang rnam pa gzhan du 'jug pa'i rten du gyur pa las /
analyzed: yang rnam pa gzhan du 'jug pa'i rten du gyur pa las /
translated: Moreover, from being the basis of engagement in another aspect,

original: de las zlog pa'i rnam pa de'i bdag nyid dang bral ba nyid kyis khyab pa yin la /
analyzed: de las zlog pa'i rnam pa de'i bdag nyid dang bral ba nyid kyis khyab pa yin la /
translated: it is pervaded by the absence of that nature, which is the opposite of that.

original: de dang 'gal ba yang bdag nyid du gyur pa yin pa de ltar na khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: de dang 'gal ba yang bdag nyid du gyur pa yin pa de ltar na khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
translated: And that which is contrary to that is of the nature of the self. Thus, there is the observation of an internal contradiction of the pervader.

original: gal te de kho na nyid mthong ba de'i bdag nyid sems la yod pa ma yin pa de bas na gtan tshigs ma grub par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de kho na nyid mthong ba de'i bdag nyid sems la yod pa ma yin pa de bas na gtan tshigs ma grub par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If the nature of the seeing of reality does not exist in the mind, then the reason will not be established.

original: ma grub pa ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: ma grub pa ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: He says, ‚ÄúIt is not the case that it is not established,‚Äù and so on.

original: don dam par rnam par shes pa ni don 'dzin par 'dod pas zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: don dam par rnam par shes pa ni don 'dzin par 'dod pas zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚Äú Because it is asserted that consciousness ultimately apprehends objects‚Äù means

original: don dam par rnam par shes pa don 'dzin pa nyid ni ma yin te /
analyzed: don dam par rnam par shes pa don 'dzin pa nyid ni ma yin te /
translated: that consciousness ultimately does not apprehend objects,

original: gzung ba ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzung ba ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the object does not exist.

original: 'on kyang re zhig phyi rol gyi don yod par 'dod pa gang yin pa des 'di ltar 'dod bar bya'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir de skad du brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang re zhig phyi rol gyi don yod par 'dod pa gang yin pa des 'di ltar 'dod bar bya'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir de skad du brjod pa yin no //
translated: However, in order to demonstrate that those who assert that external objects exist should assert this, he says, ‚ÄúNevertheless, it should be asserted in this way.‚Äù

original: phyi rol lam zhes bya ba ni 'dra ba gzhan dang gzhan 'byung ba la sogs pa'i 'khrul par byed pa'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: phyi rol lam zhes bya ba ni 'dra ba gzhan dang gzhan 'byung ba la sogs pa'i 'khrul par byed pa'i rnam pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú External or‚Äù refers to the aspect that causes error, such as the arising of another similar one.

original: cig shos zhes bya ba ni nang gi bdag nyid can gyi phyin ci log gi rnam par rtog pa'i bag chags zhes bya bas bslad pa'o //
analyzed: cig shos zhes bya ba ni nang gi bdag nyid can gyi phyin ci log gi rnam par rtog pa'i bag chags zhes bya bas bslad pa'o //
translated: The other is contaminated by the latent impressions of the internal erroneous conception.

original: de'i tshe yul 'dzin pa'i chos ma yin no zhes bya ba ni yod pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba yang yod pa ma yin pa'i rnam pa 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe yul 'dzin pa'i chos ma yin no zhes bya ba ni yod pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba yang yod pa ma yin pa'i rnam pa 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: At that time, it is not a dharma that apprehends objects, because it does not exist, and because it apprehends the aspect of nonexistence.

original: de nyid ni de ltar na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de nyid ni de ltar na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: This is what is meant by ‚Äúin that case,‚Äù and so on.

original: 'dod par ni 'gyur mod kyi phyi rol gyi don grub pa med mod /
analyzed: 'dod par ni 'gyur mod kyi phyi rol gyi don grub pa med mod /
translated: Although this is so, external objects are not established.

original: rnam par shes pa ni rab tu grub pa yin na dngos po thams cad ma grub pa yin no zhes bya ba de ci'i phyir brjod ce na /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ni rab tu grub pa yin na dngos po thams cad ma grub pa yin no zhes bya ba de ci'i phyir brjod ce na /
translated: But consciousness is well established. Why is it said that all things are not established?

original: shas pa yang phyin ci log gi rnam pa la dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: shas pa yang phyin ci log gi rnam pa la dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Because consciousness also has an erroneous aspect as its object.

original: gang gi tshe rnam par shes pa yul du gyur pa yang shes gzhan gyi yul du byed pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe rnam par shes pa yul du gyur pa yang shes gzhan gyi yul du byed pa de'i tshe /
translated: When consciousness becomes the object of another consciousness,

original: de la yang sgro btags pa'i rnam pa nyid kyi sgo nas yul du byed pa de ltar na /
analyzed: de la yang sgro btags pa'i rnam pa nyid kyi sgo nas yul du byed pa de ltar na /
translated: Moreover, if one makes an object by way of the aspect of superimposition, then

original: shes pa thams cad log par 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin can du grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shes pa thams cad log par 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin can du grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: it is established that all consciousnesses have the nature of apprehending what is unreal.

original: de nyid ni nga yul dang yul can gyi dngos po rnam par gzhag pa nyid kyi gnas skabs yin no zhes bya ba smos te /üîΩyul dang yul can nyid de shes pa'i gnas skabs ci 'dra ba zhig yin zhes bya ba'i yul dang yul can gyi dngos po rnam par gzhag pa 'di la /
analyzed: de nyid ni nga yul dang yul can gyi dngos po rnam par gzhag pa nyid kyi gnas skabs yin no zhes bya ba smos te / yul dang yul can nyid de shes pa'i gnas skabs ci 'dra ba zhig yin zhes bya ba'i yul dang yul can gyi dngos po rnam par gzhag pa 'di la /
translated: This is the very occasion of the presentation of the entities of object and subject.üîΩWhat is the nature of the occasion of consciousness?üîΩIn this presentation of the entities of object and subject,

original: ci rnam par shes pa'i chos yul 'dzin pa yin nam /
analyzed: ci rnam par shes pa'i chos yul 'dzin pa yin nam /
translated: is the object of consciousness a phenomenon that is apprehended or

original: 'on te log pa 'dzin pa yin zhes bya ba @134a * //
analyzed: 'on te log pa 'dzin pa yin zhes bya ba @134a * //
translated: is it apprehended as unreal?

original: de'i gnas skabs yin no //
analyzed: de'i gnas skabs yin no //
translated: This is the occasion of that.üîΩIf it is presented as the apprehension of what is unreal,

original: de la gal te log pa 'dzin pa 'di nyid chos yin no zhes rnam par gzhag pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: de la gal te log pa 'dzin pa 'di nyid chos yin no zhes rnam par gzhag pa de'i tshe /
translated: then it is not the apprehension of a phenomenon.

original: shes pa'i shes pa yin na yang log pa 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin du 'gyur ba de ltar gang las shes pa grub pa yin /
analyzed: shes pa'i shes pa yin na yang log pa 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin du 'gyur ba de ltar gang las shes pa grub pa yin /
translated: If it were the consciousness of consciousness, it would be the nature of apprehending a false object.üîΩAnd that is established from what?

original: de yang shes pa shes pa gzhan gyis nyams su myong ba yin no zhes bya ba'i gzhung der rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: de yang shes pa shes pa gzhan gyis nyams su myong ba yin no zhes bya ba'i gzhung der rtogs par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood from the treatise that consciousness is experienced by another consciousness.

original: rang rig la ni skyon 'di yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rang rig la ni skyon 'di yod pa ma yin no //
translated: This fault does not exist for reflexive awareness.

original: de'i rang bzhin 'dzin pa'i shes pas shes pa nyid la de la de yod pa nyid kyis khyab pa yin la /
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin 'dzin pa'i shes pas shes pa nyid la de la de yod pa nyid kyis khyab pa yin la /
translated: Because the consciousness that apprehends its nature knows it, it is pervaded by its existence.

original: 'di la de yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di la de yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa dmigs pa'o //
translated: The statement It does not exist here is the observation of the pervader.

original: rang bzhin de la rnam pa gzhan du 'gyur ba can ni rang bzhin de las rnam pa gzhan du 'gyur ba can no //
analyzed: rang bzhin de la rnam pa gzhan du 'gyur ba can ni rang bzhin de las rnam pa gzhan du 'gyur ba can no //
translated: That which has a different aspect from its nature is that which has a different aspect from its nature.

original: gang la glo bur ba'i rkyen gyis byas pa yod pa de ni zhes 'bru mang po pa'o //
analyzed: gang la glo bur ba'i rkyen gyis byas pa yod pa de ni zhes 'bru mang po pa'o //
translated: That which has a modification made by a temporary condition is that which has a modification made by a temporary condition.

original: dper na thag par 'dzin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: dper na thag par 'dzin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: For example, the apprehension of a rope and so on.

original: gang la glo bur ba'i rkyen gyis byas pa'i 'khrul pa'i yul sbrul gyi rnam par zhugs ba'i rang bzhin las rnam pa gzhan du 'gyur ba yod pa de ni zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: gang la glo bur ba'i rkyen gyis byas pa'i 'khrul pa'i yul sbrul gyi rnam par zhugs ba'i rang bzhin las rnam pa gzhan du 'gyur ba yod pa de ni zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: The meaning of the sentence is this: ‚ÄúThat which has a nature that is the object of error, which is produced by adventitious conditions, and which enters into the aspect of a snake, has a transformation into another aspect.‚Äù

original: ldog pa la ni zhes bya ba ldog pa'i rgyu mtshan la ni'o //
analyzed: ldog pa la ni zhes bya ba ldog pa'i rgyu mtshan la ni'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn the case of reversal‚Äù means in the case of the reason for reversal.

original: de ni rang bzhin gnas pa gzhan du 'gyur ba'i ldog pa'i rgyu mtshan ni zhes bya bas 'chad par byed do //
analyzed: de ni rang bzhin gnas pa gzhan du 'gyur ba'i ldog pa'i rgyu mtshan ni zhes bya bas 'chad par byed do //
translated: ‚ÄúThat is the reason for the reversal of the abiding in a nature‚Äù is the explanation.

original: rang dang rigs mthun pa'i nye bar len pa'i zhes bya ba ni gzhi mthun pa'i 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: rang dang rigs mthun pa'i nye bar len pa'i zhes bya ba ni gzhi mthun pa'i 'jug pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe homogeneous cause of the appropriation‚Äù is the common locus.

original: rigs mthun pa'i rgyu ni log pa'i shes pa'o //
analyzed: rigs mthun pa'i rgyu ni log pa'i shes pa'o //
translated: The homogeneous cause is the erroneous consciousness.

original: shin tu skyed nus med yin no zhes bya ba'i shin tu smos pas ni 'di skad du /
analyzed: shin tu skyed nus med yin no zhes bya ba'i shin tu smos pas ni 'di skad du /
translated: ‚ÄúIt is not very capable of producing‚Äù is the addition.

original: gal te rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa skye mod kyi ri mo la gnod sbyin du 'khrul pa dang 'dra bar de la 'di brtan par 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes bstan to //
analyzed: gal te rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa skye mod kyi ri mo la gnod sbyin du 'khrul pa dang 'dra bar de la 'di brtan par 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes bstan to //
translated: If the stream-enterer, etc. do arise, it is not stable, like the error of a yaksha in a painting.

original: shin tu skye ba la de la gnod pa can skyed nus pa'i snying po can dang bral ba nyid kyis khyab pa yin la /üîΩde dang 'gal ba yang gnod pa can skyed nus pa'i snying po can nyid yin pa de ltar na /
analyzed: shin tu skye ba la de la gnod pa can skyed nus pa'i snying po can dang bral ba nyid kyis khyab pa yin la / de dang 'gal ba yang gnod pa can skyed nus pa'i snying po can nyid yin pa de ltar na /
translated: The pervasion is that if something is very much produced, it is necessarily devoid of a core that is able to generate a counteragent.üîΩAnd the contradictory of that is the very core that is able to generate a counteragent.

original: khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
translated: Thus, it is the observation of a contradiction with the pervader.

original: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa rkyen ji lta ba bzhin du zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa rkyen ji lta ba bzhin du zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Direct perception and inference are just as the conditions are.

original: dper na rgyun rnam par 'chad pa'i dus na /
analyzed: dper na rgyun rnam par 'chad pa'i dus na /
translated: For example, at the time of the interruption of a continuum,

original: snga ma las shin tu mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba'i skad cig ma gzhan mngon sum du byed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: snga ma las shin tu mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba'i skad cig ma gzhan mngon sum du byed pa'i phyir /
translated: because a different moment that is very different from the former is directly perceived,

original: mi dmigs pa zhes bya ba'i mngon sum gyis rgyu mi rtag pa nyid dang / de'i stobs kyis bdag med pa nyid rnam par 'jog @134b par byed do //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa zhes bya ba'i mngon sum gyis rgyu mi rtag pa nyid dang / de'i stobs kyis bdag med pa nyid rnam par 'jog @134b par byed do //
translated: The direct perception called ‚Äúnon-apprehension‚Äù establishes the impermanence of the cause, and by the power of that, selflessness.

original: de nas bsgom pa'i rim pa yin pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: de nas bsgom pa'i rim pa yin pa de'i tshe /
translated: Then, when it is the stage of meditation,

original: mngon sum ni bdag med pa nyid mthong ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi gnod pa can rgyu mtshan nyid yin no //
analyzed: mngon sum ni bdag med pa nyid mthong ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi gnod pa can rgyu mtshan nyid yin no //
translated: direct perception is the reason for the characteristic of seeing selflessness.

original: gang gi tshe byas pa nyid yin pa la sogs pa'i rtags kyis bdag med pa rnam bar gzhag nas /
analyzed: gang gi tshe byas pa nyid yin pa la sogs pa'i rtags kyis bdag med pa rnam bar gzhag nas /
translated: When, by means of the reason of being produced, etc., selflessness is established,

original: bsam pa dang bsgom ba la sogs pa rim bzhin rtsom pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: bsam pa dang bsgom ba la sogs pa rim bzhin rtsom pa de'i tshe /
translated: and then reflection, meditation, etc., are undertaken in sequence,

original: rjes su dpag pa yang rgyu mtshan nyid yin no //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa yang rgyu mtshan nyid yin no //
translated: inference is the reason.

original: 'gal ba ni gnyi ga yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'gal ba ni gnyi ga yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚ÄúBecause of the contradiction of both‚Äù means

original: ji ltar lam goms pa nyes pa skyes dang 'gal pa yin pa de ltar nyes pa'i bdag kyang lam skye ba dang 'gal ba yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar lam goms pa nyes pa skyes dang 'gal pa yin pa de ltar nyes pa'i bdag kyang lam skye ba dang 'gal ba yin no //
translated: just as the arising of the path is contradictory to the arising of faults, so the arising of the path is contradictory to the arising of the self of faults.

original: de la gal te 'gal bar mtshungs pa yin na /
analyzed: de la gal te 'gal bar mtshungs pa yin na /
translated: If it is the same in being contradictory,

original: nyes pa'i bdag nyid can la lam skye ba de ltar lam goms pa yang ci'i phyir nyes pa skye ba ma yin zhes bsams pa'o //
analyzed: nyes pa'i bdag nyid can la lam skye ba de ltar lam goms pa yang ci'i phyir nyes pa skye ba ma yin zhes bsams pa'o //
translated: Why is it that when the path arises in one who has a sinful nature, the sin does not arise when one is cultivating the path?

original: lhag mthong yin la zhes bya ba ni bdag med pa la dmigs pa'i shes rab bo //üîΩ'bad rtsol yang nyes pa mthong ba'i sgo nas byed par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni gal te gang zhig bzlog par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: lhag mthong yin la zhes bya ba ni bdag med pa la dmigs pa'i shes rab bo // 'bad rtsol yang nyes pa mthong ba'i sgo nas byed par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni gal te gang zhig bzlog par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Insight is the wisdom that has non-self for its object.

original: 'bad rtsol byed par 'gyur ba de la nyes pa mthong ba de'i tshe 'bad pa rtsol byed pa yin te /
analyzed: 'bad rtsol byed par 'gyur ba de la nyes pa mthong ba de'i tshe 'bad pa rtsol byed pa yin te /
translated: One makes an effort by seeing the sin, i.e., if one makes an effort in order to stop something, then at that time one makes an effort by seeing the sin in that,

original: nyes pa dang ldan pa nyid dor bar 'os pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyes pa dang ldan pa nyid dor bar 'os pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is proper to abandon that which has a sin.

original: nyes pa rnams ni phyin ci log yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni yon tan dang ldan pa ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: nyes pa rnams ni phyin ci log yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni yon tan dang ldan pa ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because the sins are erroneous, i.e., because they are not endowed with virtue.

original: ci ste yang 'bad rtsol byed par 'gyur ba de ltar na yang yon tan dang ldan pa nyid kyi stobs las gyur pa de lta ba yang yon tan dang ldan pa nyid kyi stobs las 'gyur ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste yang 'bad rtsol byed par 'gyur ba de ltar na yang yon tan dang ldan pa nyid kyi stobs las gyur pa de lta ba yang yon tan dang ldan pa nyid kyi stobs las 'gyur ba yin no zhe na /
translated: But if, on the other hand, one makes an effort, then even though it is due to the power of possessing good qualities, it is still due to the power of possessing good qualities.

original: brtson dang ldan yang zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: brtson dang ldan yang zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: The verse says, ‚ÄúEven though one is endowed with effort,‚Äù

original: lhag ma ni snga ma dang 'dra'o//
analyzed: lhag ma ni snga ma dang 'dra'o//
translated: The rest is as before.

original: tshigs su bcad pa 'di nyid kyi bshad pa ni ji ltar le'u dang por gzung mdzad pa rnam par phye ba de ltar rtogs par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa 'di nyid kyi bshad pa ni ji ltar le'u dang por gzung mdzad pa rnam par phye ba de ltar rtogs par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The explanation of this verse should be understood as it was presented in the first chapter.

original: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dag phan tshun 'gal ba yin du zin kyang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dag phan tshun 'gal ba yin du zin kyang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Even though attachment and aversion are mutually exclusive,

original: lhan cig mi gnas pa'i phyir 'di nyid 'gal ba yin par sems so //
analyzed: lhan cig mi gnas pa'i phyir 'di nyid 'gal ba yin par sems so //
translated: we think that this is a contradiction because they do not coexist.

original: rgyu gcig nyid yin pa'i gtan tshigs kyis 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang ba de dag gi nang nas ji ltar 'jig tshogs su lta ba zhes bya ba'i rgyu de yod na /
analyzed: rgyu gcig nyid yin pa'i gtan tshigs kyis 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang ba de dag gi nang nas ji ltar 'jig tshogs su lta ba zhes bya ba'i rgyu de yod na /
translated: By the reason of being the same cause, how is it that from among those attachments and aversions, when the cause called the afflicted view of the self exists,

original: 'dod chags sam zhe sdang gcig 'byung bar 'gyur ba de ltar na /
analyzed: 'dod chags sam zhe sdang gcig 'byung bar 'gyur ba de ltar na /
translated: one attachment or aversion arises?

original: rgyu das de skyed pa na gdon mi za bar thag nye bas 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: rgyu das de skyed pa na gdon mi za bar thag nye bas 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: When that cause generates that, it must be close by.

original: de ltar na yod na 'bras bu @135a * //
analyzed: de ltar na yod na 'bras bu @135a * //
translated: Thus, if it exists, the effect

original: de skye bar 'gyur ro //üîΩde nyid las zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de skye bar 'gyur ro // de nyid las zhes bya ba ni /
translated: will arise.

original: 'jig tshogs su lta ba zhes bya ba'i rgyu de nyid las so //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs su lta ba zhes bya ba'i rgyu de nyid las so //
translated: From that very cause means from that very cause called the afflicted view of the self.

original: gzhan dag kyang zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dag las gang yang rung ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dag las gang yang rung ba'o //
translated: Others means either attachment or aversion.

original: gal te 'o na 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dag rgyu gcig pa can nyid yin pa ci'i phyir cig car 'jug par mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gal te 'o na 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dag rgyu gcig pa can nyid yin pa ci'i phyir cig car 'jug par mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If attachment and aversion have the same cause, why don‚Äôt they occur simultaneously?

original: cig car mi 'jug pa yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: cig car mi 'jug pa yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: He says, ‚ÄúEven though they don‚Äôt occur simultaneously,‚Äù and so on.

original: shing gi khyad par gcig las 'byung ba can gyi me dang du ba lta bu'o zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe me'i skad cig ma snga ma dang dus mnyam du 'byung ba'i shing gi skad cig ma las phyis me dang du ba'i skad cig ma 'byung bar
analyzed: shing gi khyad par gcig las 'byung ba can gyi me dang du ba lta bu'o zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe me'i skad cig ma snga ma dang dus mnyam du 'byung ba'i shing gi skad cig ma las phyis me dang du ba'i skad cig ma 'byung bar
translated: When the prior moment of fire arises simultaneously with the moment of wood, the subsequent moment of fire and smoke arise from that.

original: 'gyur ba de'i tshe /
analyzed: 'gyur ba de'i tshe /
translated: At that time,

original: de dag ni shing gi khyad par gcig las byung ba can nyid yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni shing gi khyad par gcig las byung ba can nyid yin no //
translated: they arise from a particular kind of wood.

original: gnod par bya ba dang gnod par byed pa'i dngos po la rgyu tha dad pa nyid kyis khyab par yin la /
analyzed: gnod par bya ba dang gnod par byed pa'i dngos po la rgyu tha dad pa nyid kyis khyab par yin la /
translated: The relation of the object that is harmed and the object that harms is pervaded by the difference of their causes.

original: de dang 'gal ba yang rgyu gcig pa can nyid yin pa de ltar na khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: de dang 'gal ba yang rgyu gcig pa can nyid yin pa de ltar na khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
translated: The contradiction of that is the sameness of their causes. Thus, there is the observation of a contradiction with the pervader.

original: bdag tu lta ba dang bdag tu chags pa zhes bya ba zlas dbye ba'o //
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba dang bdag tu chags pa zhes bya ba zlas dbye ba'o //
translated: The compound view of self and attachment to self is a dvandva compound.

original: 'jig tshogs la chags pa dang zhes bya ba ni zhig pas na 'jig pa ste /
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la chags pa dang zhes bya ba ni zhig pas na 'jig pa ste /
translated: Attachment to the perishable collection is called ‚Äúperishable‚Äù because it perishes.

original: rnam par 'jig pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rnam par 'jig pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúperishable‚Äù is ‚Äúto be destroyed.‚Äù

original: tshogs pa ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga 'dus pa ste /
analyzed: tshogs pa ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga 'dus pa ste /
translated: The collection is the five appropriated aggregates that are assembled.

original: mi rtag pa'i phung po lnga la chags pa zhes bya ba'i don to ;
analyzed: mi rtag pa'i phung po lnga la chags pa zhes bya ba'i don to ;
translated: The meaning is that one is attached to the five aggregates that are impermanent.

original: / shin tu goms pa'i dbang gis phan tshun gnod pa byed pa gang yin pa de dag las rgyu dang / 'bras bu'i dngos po ma yin pas khyab pa yin la /
analyzed: / shin tu goms pa'i dbang gis phan tshun gnod pa byed pa gang yin pa de dag las rgyu dang / 'bras bu'i dngos po ma yin pas khyab pa yin la /
translated: Whatever is mutually harmful by the power of thorough acquaintance is necessarily not the relation of cause and effect.

original: de dang 'gal ba yang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po yin pa de ltar na /
analyzed: de dang 'gal ba yang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po yin pa de ltar na /
translated: And whatever is contrary to that is the relation of cause and effect.

original: sbyor ba gnyis pa yang khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: sbyor ba gnyis pa yang khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa nyid yin no //
translated: Thus, the second syllogism is the perception of a contradiction with the pervasion.

original: byams pa dang mi gtsang ba la sogs pa ni zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: byams pa dang mi gtsang ba la sogs pa ni zhes bya ba la /
translated: Love and impurity, etc.

original: mi gtsang ba ni 'dod chags kyi rten gyi dngos po la rnam par sun 'byung pa rnam pa can gyi shes rab po //
analyzed: mi gtsang ba ni 'dod chags kyi rten gyi dngos po la rnam par sun 'byung pa rnam pa can gyi shes rab po //
translated: Impurity is the wisdom that has the aspect of disgust toward the thing that is the basis of attachment.

original: sogs pa smos pas ni dbugs 'byung rngub dran pa la sogs pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa smos pas ni dbugs 'byung rngub dran pa la sogs pa gzung ngo //
translated: The word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù includes mindfulness of inhalation and exhalation, and so on.

original: 'on kyang ji srid rigs mi mthun pa'i sems goms pa gnas pa'i zhes bya ba ni byams pa la sogs pa rigs mi mthun pa'i sems de bdag nyid do //
analyzed: 'on kyang ji srid rigs mi mthun pa'i sems goms pa gnas pa'i zhes bya ba ni byams pa la sogs pa rigs mi mthun pa'i sems de bdag nyid do //
translated: the mind of a different type is the self.

original: bad kan can gyi nad kyi rgyu ni bad kan yin la de la gnod pa med pa ni mngar ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bad kan can gyi nad kyi rgyu ni bad kan yin la de la gnod pa med pa ni mngar ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The cause of a disease of phlegm is phlegm, and the non-harmful is sweet, etc.

original: nyon mongs pa skye ba'i rgyu yang de yin la /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa skye ba'i rgyu yang de yin la /
translated: That is the cause of the arising of the defilements,

original: 'jig tshogs su lta ba yang @135b yin pa la gnod par byed pa ma yin no zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs su lta ba yang @135b yin pa la gnod par byed pa ma yin no zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: and it is also the afflicted view of the self, and it is not harmful.

original: 'o na gal te byams pa la sogs pa 'dod chags la sogs pa'i gnyen po ma yin na /
analyzed: 'o na gal te byams pa la sogs pa 'dod chags la sogs pa'i gnyen po ma yin na /
translated: If love, etc. are not antidotes to attachment, etc.,

original: 'on ji ltar mdo las dge slong dag 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'on ji ltar mdo las dge slong dag 'di lta ste /
translated: then how is it that a s≈´tra says,üîΩ‚ÄúMonks, just as oil and oil-cakes are the great source of oil,

original: rlung gi til mar sman chen po yin pa de bzhin du 'dod chags kyi mi gtsang ba dang / ji ltar mkhris pa'i mar sman chen po yin pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: rlung gi til mar sman chen po yin pa de bzhin du 'dod chags kyi mi gtsang ba dang / ji ltar mkhris pa'i mar sman chen po yin pa de bzhin du /
translated: so too, monks, the impure is the great source of desire.‚Äù

original: zhe sdang gi byams pa dang / ji ltar sbrang rtsi sman chen po yin pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: zhe sdang gi byams pa dang / ji ltar sbrang rtsi sman chen po yin pa de bzhin du /
translated: and just as honey is a great medicine,

original: gti mug gi rten cing 'brel par byung ba la dpyod pa yin no zhes gsungs she na /
analyzed: gti mug gi rten cing 'brel par byung ba la dpyod pa yin no zhes gsungs she na /
translated: so too is the analysis of dependent origination the medicine for delusion.

original: de'i phyir rlung dang mkhris pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir rlung dang mkhris pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore it is said, ‚Äúwind, bile, etc.‚Äù

original: chos la dmigs pa la sogs pa'i byams pa la sogs pa la dgongs nas bshad pa yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: chos la dmigs pa la sogs pa'i byams pa la sogs pa la dgongs nas bshad pa yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The meaning is that the love, etc., that have the Dharma as their object are intended.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni dmigs pa med pa'i byams pa la sogs pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni dmigs pa med pa'i byams pa la sogs pa gzung ngo //
translated: The word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù includes the love, etc., that have no object.

original: de dag ni bdag med pa'i rnam par 'jug pa nyid yin pa'i phyir gcig tu gnyen po'i phyogs yin no ;
analyzed: de dag ni bdag med pa'i rnam par 'jug pa nyid yin pa'i phyir gcig tu gnyen po'i phyogs yin no ;
translated: They are exclusively the side of the antidote because they function in the mode of selflessness.

original: / de bzhin du gzhan dag la yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la gang gi tshe ma dang srid mo la sogs pa'i 'du shes 'dod chags la sogs ba'i gnyen po nyid du brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: / de bzhin du gzhan dag la yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la gang gi tshe ma dang srid mo la sogs pa'i 'du shes 'dod chags la sogs ba'i gnyen po nyid du brjod pa yin no //
translated: Similarly, in the case of others, etc. means that the perception of mother, sister, etc., is said to be the antidote to desire, etc.

original: de la yang dus de srid du gnod pa yin par rtogs par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de la yang dus de srid du gnod pa yin par rtogs par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It should be understood that it is a harm that lasts for that long.

original: mig gsal ba'i ngo bo zhes bya ba ni rtogs pa med pa'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: mig gsal ba'i ngo bo zhes bya ba ni rtogs pa med pa'i ngo bo'o //
translated: The nature of clear vision is the nature of non-realization.

original: rang gi sde pa ni bye brag rab tu smra ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi sde pa ni bye brag rab tu smra ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The Buddhist schools are the VaibhƒÅ·π£ikas and so on.

original: phyin ci log par rtogs pa'i ngo bo can nyid yin par khas blang bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni mtshan nyid gzhan mi rigs pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: phyin ci log par rtogs pa'i ngo bo can nyid yin par khas blang bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni mtshan nyid gzhan mi rigs pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: It should be accepted as having the nature of mistaken realization, because another characteristic is not reasonable.

original: de gti mug ces ma shad pa ni log pa'i shes pa'i khyad par gti mug gi phyogs gcig tu gyur pa ste /
analyzed: de gti mug ces ma shad pa ni log pa'i shes pa'i khyad par gti mug gi phyogs gcig tu gyur pa ste /
translated: It is not explained as delusion, but it is a part of delusion, a specific kind of wrong knowledge.

original: gti mug ces bya ba spyi'i sgras chos mngon pa las ma bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: gti mug ces bya ba spyi'i sgras chos mngon pa las ma bshad pa yin no //
translated: The term delusion is a general term not explained in the Abhidharma.

original: 'on kyang 'jig tshogs su lta ba zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang 'jig tshogs su lta ba zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: However, it is called the view of the transitory collection.

original: spyi'i sgras bstan pa na nyon mongs pa'i rgyu'i gtso bor bstan par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: spyi'i sgras bstan pa na nyon mongs pa'i rgyu'i gtso bor bstan par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: When it is taught with a general term, it does not teach it as the primary cause of afflictions.

original: de yang re zhig ces bya ba la sogs pas phyin ci log tu rtogs pa ngo bo nyid ma rig pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir skabs byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang re zhig ces bya ba la sogs pas phyin ci log tu rtogs pa ngo bo nyid ma rig pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir skabs byed pa yin no //
translated: Moreover, ‚Äúfor a while‚Äù and so on are made in order to demonstrate that the intrinsic reality of the error of inverted conception is ignorance.

original: gzugs la sogs pa yang de lta bur thal ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rig pa las gzhan nyid yin pas na ma rig par thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa yang de lta bur thal ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rig pa las gzhan nyid yin pas na ma rig par thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause form and so on would be similar‚Äù means that because it is different from awareness, it would follow that it is ignorance.

original: dngos po mtshan nyid kyi skabs yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni ma @136a * //
analyzed: dngos po mtshan nyid kyi skabs yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni ma @136a * //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause this is the context of the characteristics of things‚Äù means

original: rig pa zhes bya ba'i dngos po'i mtshan nyid kyi'o //
analyzed: rig pa zhes bya ba'i dngos po'i mtshan nyid kyi'o //
translated: that the characteristics of the thing called ‚Äúignorance‚ÄùüîΩare like this.üîΩ‚ÄúIn that case, what is the form of ignorance?‚Äù and so on are questions.

original: de ltar na rnam pa gang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la 'di ltar rig pa'i gnyen po'i phyogs nyid du grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na rnam pa gang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la 'di ltar rig pa'i gnyen po'i phyogs nyid du grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: ‚ÄúThis is how it is‚Äù and so on are the answers.

original: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi 'on kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gzhan gyi yin no //
analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi 'on kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gzhan gyi yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúAlthough this is so‚Äù and so on are objections.

original: yang dag pa'i don mthong bas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni lan yin no //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i don mthong bas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni lan yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause one sees the correct meaning‚Äù and so on are the answers.

original: ci ste 'dod mod kyi yang dag par rtogs pa med pa tsam ni dben pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ci ste 'dod mod kyi yang dag par rtogs pa med pa tsam ni dben pa ma yin no //
translated: But if you admit that, then mere non-understanding is not seclusion.

original: 'o na ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci yin zhe na /
translated: Well then, what is it?

original: rig pa'i mtshan nyid du brjod par 'dod pa'i ngo bo las gzhan yin no zhe na /
analyzed: rig pa'i mtshan nyid du brjod par 'dod pa'i ngo bo las gzhan yin no zhe na /
translated: It is different from the nature that is asserted to be the characteristic of knowledge.

original: de'i phyir ma yin pas zhes pa la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir ma yin pas zhes pa la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, he says, ‚ÄúNo, because . . . ‚Äù

original: ma yin pa ni ma yin par dgag pas so //
analyzed: ma yin pa ni ma yin par dgag pas so //
translated: ‚ÄúNo‚Äù means ‚Äúnot,‚Äù as in a negative.

original: 'on kyang de ni de kho na nyid mthong ba zhes bya ba'i 'bras bu dang 'gal bar brjod pa yin /
analyzed: 'on kyang de ni de kho na nyid mthong ba zhes bya ba'i 'bras bu dang 'gal bar brjod pa yin /
translated: However, that is said to be incompatible with the result called ‚Äúseeing reality.‚Äù

original: de yang ma rig pa'i mtshan nyid ci 'dra ba zhig yin zhes de nges pa med pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de yang ma rig pa'i mtshan nyid ci 'dra ba zhig yin zhes de nges pa med pa nyid yin no //
