translated: Moreover, what is the character of ignorance? It is not ascertained.

original: de ni de'i mtshan nyid kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de ni de'i mtshan nyid kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: He says, ‚ÄúIts character is also . . . ‚Äù

original: rig pas gzung bar bya ba'i rnam pa ni bdag med pa dang sdug bsngal la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rig pas gzung bar bya ba'i rnam pa ni bdag med pa dang sdug bsngal la sogs pa'o //
translated: The aspect apprehended by knowledge is selflessness, suffering, and so on.

original: de las phyin ci log la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de las phyin ci log la sogs pa'o //
translated: The opposite of that is ignorance.

original: de rtogs pa ni de 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: de rtogs pa ni de 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The realization of that is the apprehension of that.

original: ma rig pa gang la de nyid kyi ngo bo yod pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: ma rig pa gang la de nyid kyi ngo bo yod pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: The compound ‚Äúhaving the nature of that‚Äù is to be analyzed as ‚Äúhaving the nature of that reality.‚Äù

original: gang gis rtog pa dang 'gal ba ni gang dang rtog pa 'gal ba'o //
analyzed: gang gis rtog pa dang 'gal ba ni gang dang rtog pa 'gal ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúOpposed to conception‚Äù means opposed to the conception of self.

original: gang la de'i rang bzhin yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: gang la de'i rang bzhin yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: ‚ÄúHaving the nature of that‚Äù means having the nature of the reality that is opposed to the conception of self.

original: dper na bde ba'i 'du shes kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa la sdug bsngal gyi 'du shes dang 'gal ba nyid kyi phyir bde ba'i 'du shes kyi gzung ba'i rnam pa las phyin ci log tu brtag pa'i ngo bo yin pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na bde ba'i 'du shes kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa la sdug bsngal gyi 'du shes dang 'gal ba nyid kyi phyir bde ba'i 'du shes kyi gzung ba'i rnam pa las phyin ci log tu brtag pa'i ngo bo yin pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the conception of pleasure is said to be ‚Äúopposed to the conception of pain‚Äù because it is opposed to the conception of pain. It is to be imagined as having a nature that is the opposite of the aspect apprehended by the conception of pain.

original: rten dang dmigs pa dang dus dang / rdzas mtshungs pa dag gis mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni chos mngon pa las sems las byung ba mtshungs par ldan pa yin par bzhed do //
analyzed: rten dang dmigs pa dang dus dang / rdzas mtshungs pa dag gis mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni chos mngon pa las sems las byung ba mtshungs par ldan pa yin par bzhed do //
translated: The Abhidharma masters assert that mental factors are concomitant with the mind because they are similar in five ways: basis, object, aspect, time, and substance.

original: de la gal te ma rig pa rtog pa med pa'i ngo bo nyid pa de'i tshe dmigs pa dang rnam par mtshungs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la gal te ma rig pa rtog pa med pa'i ngo bo nyid pa de'i tshe dmigs pa dang rnam par mtshungs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If ignorance has a nature that is not conception, then it will not be similar to its object in terms of aspect.

original: de la rten dang dmigs pa mtshungs pa ni mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa dang / rten dang dmigs pa mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la rten dang dmigs pa mtshungs pa ni mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa dang / rten dang dmigs pa mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The similarity of support and object refers to the eye consciousness, etc. because they have the same support and object.

original: rnam par mtshungs pa ni sems dang mtshungs pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par mtshungs pa ni sems dang mtshungs pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The similarity of aspect refers to the similarity of mind.

original: dus mtshungs pa ni dus mnyam du 'byung ba can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dus mtshungs pa ni dus mnyam du 'byung ba can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The similarity of time refers to the fact that they occur at the same time.

original: ji ltar skad cig ma gcig la sems rdzas gcig @136b yin pa de ltar na sems dang sems las byung ba yang rdzas re re'i bdag nyid can yin pa de ltar na rdzas mtshungs pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar skad cig ma gcig la sems rdzas gcig @136b yin pa de ltar na sems dang sems las byung ba yang rdzas re re'i bdag nyid can yin pa de ltar na rdzas mtshungs pa nyid yin no //
translated: Just as one substance of mind exists in one moment, so one substance of mind and mental factor exists in one moment. Thus, there is similarity of substance.

original: de bas na sems las byung ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ma rig pa ni rtog pa med pa'i ngo bo nyid ma yin gyi 'on kyang rtog pa'i ngo bo yin no //
analyzed: de bas na sems las byung ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ma rig pa ni rtog pa med pa'i ngo bo nyid ma yin gyi 'on kyang rtog pa'i ngo bo yin no //
translated: Therefore, ignorance is not by nature non-conception, but rather conception, because it is a mental factor.

original: de la rnam par rtog pa gnyis ni rtog pa'i ngo bo yin du zin kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de la rnam par rtog pa gnyis ni rtog pa'i ngo bo yin du zin kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: In this regard, although the two conceptions are by nature conception, etc. is stated.

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i dge ba'i las ni bsod nams so //
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i dge ba'i las ni bsod nams so //
translated: Virtue is the wholesome action of the realm of desire.

original: zlog ni bsod nams ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: zlog ni bsod nams ma yin pa'o //
translated: Non-virtue is the opposite.

original: gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i las ni mi g-yo ba'o //üîΩ'du byed de bdag gis zhes bya ba ni bsod nams dag gis so //
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i las ni mi g-yo ba'o // 'du byed de bdag gis zhes bya ba ni bsod nams dag gis so //
translated: The unmoving is the action of the realm of form and the formless realm.üîΩThe self-produced is the wholesome of the realm of desire.üîΩThe self-produced is the wholesome of the realm of desire.üîΩThe self-produced is the wholesome of the realm of desire.

original: yongs su bsgos pa'i sems kyis bon la brten nas /üîΩshes pa'i nus pa byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yongs su bsgos pa'i sems kyis bon la brten nas / shes pa'i nus pa byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The self-produced is the wholesome of the realm of desire.

original: sa bon de yang zag pa dang bcas pa yin te /üîΩde la dmigs pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams der rgyas par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sa bon de yang zag pa dang bcas pa yin te / de la dmigs pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams der rgyas par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //

analyzed: sred pa la sogs pa'i grogs can ni 'bras bu 'byin pa'i phyir nye bar len pa dang bcas pa'o //

analyzed: skye ba dang rga shi dang ldan pa'i 'du byed kyi rgyun ni skye ba dang rga shi'i rang bzhin srid pa'o //üîΩde mngon par 'grub cing de 'byung ba ni de nye bar len pa'i nus pa las byung ba yin te /
translated: The self-produced is the wholesome of the realm of desire.üîΩThe self-produced is the wholesome of the realm of

original: de las byung ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las byung ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it arises from that.

original: der nye bar 'gro ba ni ldan pa'o //
analyzed: der nye bar 'gro ba ni ldan pa'o //
translated: Approaching that is possession.

original: gzhung 'dis ji ltar na bdag tu lta ba ma rig pa nyid yin par bstan pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: gzhung 'dis ji ltar na bdag tu lta ba ma rig pa nyid yin par bstan pa yin zhe na /
translated: How does this passage show that the view of self is ignorance?

original: 'di nyid la yang ma rig pa'i yan lag ces bya ba la sogs pas smos pa la 'di nyid la zhes bya ba ni ma rig pa'i yan lag rnam par 'byed pa'i gzhung la'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid la yang ma rig pa'i yan lag ces bya ba la sogs pas smos pa la 'di nyid la zhes bya ba ni ma rig pa'i yan lag rnam par 'byed pa'i gzhung la'o //
translated: In response, he says, ‚ÄúIn this passage, the part that states ‚Äòthe link of ignorance‚Äô and so on. ‚Äù In this passage refers to the passage that analyzes the link of ignorance.

original: bdag tu lta ba bstan pa yin no zhes bya ba ni ji snyed pa de dag thams cad ni bdag tu mngon par zhen pa las zhes bya ba gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba bstan pa yin no zhes bya ba ni ji snyed pa de dag thams cad ni bdag tu mngon par zhen pa las zhes bya ba gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The view of self is taught refers to the statement, ‚ÄúAll of these are due to the adherence to the self. ‚Äù

original: 'dir yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas gzhan gyi dogs pa bsu ba yin no //
analyzed: 'dir yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas gzhan gyi dogs pa bsu ba yin no //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúin this passage‚Äù and so on responds to an objection by another.

original: 'dir yang zhes bya ba ni shes par byed pa nyid du nye bar dgod pa'i mdor yang ngo //
analyzed: 'dir yang zhes bya ba ni shes par byed pa nyid du nye bar dgod pa'i mdor yang ngo //
translated: In this passage refers to the s≈´tra that is cited as a proof.

original: ma rig pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i lta ba yin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ma rig pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i lta ba yin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: The view that is concomitant with ignorance.

original: ma rig pa dang nyon mongs pa thams cad mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma rig pa dang nyon mongs pa thams cad mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is concomitant with ignorance and all the defilements.

original: de bas na bdag tu mngon par zhen pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas gsungs pa gang yin pa de ni ma rig pa'i rang gi ngo bo bshad pa ma yin gyi 'on kyang de'i sgo nas te ma rig pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i lta ba'i sgo
analyzed: de bas na bdag tu mngon par zhen pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas gsungs pa gang yin pa de ni ma rig pa'i rang gi ngo bo bshad pa ma yin gyi 'on kyang de'i sgo nas te ma rig pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i lta ba'i sgo
translated: Therefore, what is stated as ‚Äúattachment to a self‚Äù and so on does not explain the intrinsic nature of ignorance, but rather it is through that, i.e., through the view concomitant with ignorance,
that ignorance is taught.

original: de las tha dad pa gzhan kho nas ma rig pa bstan pa yin no zhes rtog par yang mi bya'o //
analyzed: de las tha dad pa gzhan kho nas ma rig pa bstan pa yin no zhes rtog par yang mi bya'o //
translated: One should not imagine that ignorance is taught by a different means.

original: gal te ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: gal te ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: If one asks why, he says:

original: ma rig pa'i rang gi ngo bo brjod par bya ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: ma rig pa'i rang gi ngo bo brjod par bya ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: ‚ÄúThe intrinsic nature of ignorance should be stated.‚Äù

original: de skad du brjod pa la zhes bya ba ni lta ba'i sgo nas 'dir ma rig pa bstan pa yin gyi 'jig tshogs su lta ba nyid ma rig pa ma yin no zhes de skad du brjod pa la nges par byed pa med pa'i phyir te rigs pa
analyzed: de skad du brjod pa la zhes bya ba ni lta ba'i sgo nas 'dir ma rig pa bstan pa yin gyi 'jig tshogs su lta ba nyid ma rig pa ma yin no zhes de skad du brjod pa la nges par byed pa med pa'i phyir te rigs pa
translated: ‚ÄúIn this way‚Äù refers to the fact that there is no certainty in the statement that ignorance is taught here through the view, and that the view of the perishable collection is not ignorance.

original: med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: because it does not exist.

original: gal te 'jig tshogs su lta ba'i rang bzhin nyid la 'dir ma rig pa nyid bstan pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di la nges par byed pa ci zhig yod ce na /
analyzed: gal te 'jig tshogs su lta ba'i rang bzhin nyid la 'dir ma rig pa nyid bstan pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di la nges par byed pa ci zhig yod ce na /
translated: If ignorance is taught here as the very nature of the view of the transitory collection, what is the certainty in this?

original: ji skad du bshad pa'i don rtogs pa yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa'i don rtogs pa yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: He says, The understanding of the meaning as explained, etc.

original: 'di lta ste zhes bya ba la sogs pas ra zhig 'gog pa ston par byed do //
analyzed: 'di lta ste zhes bya ba la sogs pas ra zhig 'gog pa ston par byed do //
translated: He shows the refutation of that with It is not tenable, etc.

original: mtshungs par ldan pa'i don 'thad pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni gzhan dang gzhan ldan pa yin la /
analyzed: mtshungs par ldan pa'i don 'thad pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni gzhan dang gzhan ldan pa yin la /
translated: It is not tenable that the meaning of association is, because it is associated with one thing and another.

original: de yang lta ba dang ma rig pa gcig gi bdag nyid du rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang lta ba dang ma rig pa gcig gi bdag nyid du rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: Moreover, it is not tenable that view and ignorance have the same nature.

original: de nyid ni bdag nyid bdag dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de nyid ni bdag nyid bdag dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: He says, That very self does not associate with itself, etc.

original: spyir btang ba'i mtshan nyid ma yin gyi zhes bya ba ni sems gcig la sems las byung ba gnyis mtshungs par ldan pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: spyir btang ba'i mtshan nyid ma yin gyi zhes bya ba ni sems gcig la sems las byung ba gnyis mtshungs par ldan pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is not a general characteristic, because two mental factors are said to be associated in one mind.

original: phyogs dang phyogs can gyi dngos po zhes bya ba la 'di la phyogs yod pas na phyogs can ni tshogs pa ste /
analyzed: phyogs dang phyogs can gyi dngos po zhes bya ba la 'di la phyogs yod pas na phyogs can ni tshogs pa ste /
translated: The term ‚Äúentity of direction and that which has direction‚Äù means that which has direction is an aggregate because it has direction.

original: yan lag dang tshogs pa'i dngos po zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yan lag dang tshogs pa'i dngos po zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is an entity of parts and an aggregate.

original: de la spyir log par 'jug pa tsam nyid yin pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi bdag nyid can gyi ma rig pa ni tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la spyir log par 'jug pa tsam nyid yin pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi bdag nyid can gyi ma rig pa ni tshogs pa'o //
translated: In that regard, in general, ignorance that has the nature of all the afflictions is an aggregate because it is merely the engagement in error.

original: 'di'i phyogs gcig ni 'jig tshogs su lta ba la sogs pa'o //üîΩdes na ngag gi don ni 'jig tshogs su lta ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i ma rig pa 'jig tshogs su lta ba zhes bya ba phyogs gcig pa ni phyogs gcig pa dang ldan par gyur pa yin pa de bas na /
analyzed: 'di'i phyogs gcig ni 'jig tshogs su lta ba la sogs pa'o // des na ngag gi don ni 'jig tshogs su lta ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i ma rig pa 'jig tshogs su lta ba zhes bya ba phyogs gcig pa ni phyogs gcig pa dang ldan par gyur pa yin pa de bas na /
translated: One part of it is the afflicted view of the self and so on.üîΩTherefore, the meaning of the sentence is that ignorance that is concomitant with the afflicted view of the self is called the afflicted view of the self. It is a part because it is one part of it.

original: phyogs gcig pa can gyi ma rig pa de'i 'jig tshogs su lta ba ni phyogs gcig pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
analyzed: phyogs gcig pa can gyi ma rig pa de'i 'jig tshogs su lta ba ni phyogs gcig pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
translated: Therefore, the meaning of the sentence is that the afflicted view of the self is a part of that ignorance that has a part.

original: gzhan dag la yang de lta bur gyur pa'i mtshungs par ldan pa'i don mthong ngo zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan dag la yang de lta bur gyur pa'i mtshungs par ldan pa'i don mthong ngo zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to show that the meaning of ‚Äúassociated‚Äù is seen in this way with respect to others, he says:

original: dper na ba la sha la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i nags zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: dper na ba la sha la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i nags zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: For example, a forest that possesses palasha trees and so on.

original: pa la sha la sogs pa'i tshogs zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: pa la sha la sogs pa'i tshogs zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is a collection of palasha trees and so on.

original: sbyor ba 'di la @137b ldan pa yin gyi mi ldan pa ni ma yin nam /
analyzed: sbyor ba 'di la @137b ldan pa yin gyi mi ldan pa ni ma yin nam /
translated: Isn‚Äôt this application ‚Äúpossession,‚Äù not ‚Äúassociation‚Äù?

original: skabs 'di ni mtshungs par ldan pa'i don yin no zhe na /
analyzed: skabs 'di ni mtshungs par ldan pa'i don yin no zhe na /
translated: This context is the meaning of ‚Äúassociation.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir de la 'dir ldan pa nyid la mtshungs par ldan pa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de la 'dir ldan pa nyid la mtshungs par ldan pa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore he says, ‚ÄúHere, possession itself is called association.‚Äù

original: khams nyid la nye bar sgyur ba'i don nang du bsdus pa yin te /
analyzed: khams nyid la nye bar sgyur ba'i don nang du bsdus pa yin te /
translated: The meaning of ‚Äútransformation‚Äù is included within the internal.

original: 'on kyang nye bar sgyur ba ni gsal bar byed pa yin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: 'on kyang nye bar sgyur ba ni gsal bar byed pa yin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: However, the intended meaning is that ‚Äútransformation‚Äù clarifies.

original: phyogs gcig pa'i ngo bo zhes bya ba ni ma rig pa'i phyogs gcig pa'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: phyogs gcig pa'i ngo bo zhes bya ba ni ma rig pa'i phyogs gcig pa'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúhaving the nature of one part‚Äù is ‚Äúhaving the nature of one part of ignorance.‚Äù

original: gal te ma rig pa dang lta ba'i mtshan nyid tha dad pa med na /
analyzed: gal te ma rig pa dang lta ba'i mtshan nyid tha dad pa med na /
translated: If ignorance and the view of the transitory collection have the same defining characteristic,üîΩwhy does the Lord teach them as if they were distinct?

original: 'o na ci'i phyir de ltar 'bad rtsol gyi bshad pa ston par byed ce na de'i phyir de ltar bstan pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: 'o na ci'i phyir de ltar 'bad rtsol gyi bshad pa ston par byed ce na de'i phyir de ltar bstan pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Therefore he says, ‚ÄúThus, the Lord taught the view of the self to be a type of ignorance.‚Äù

original: de'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba la 'dir de'i sgras ni bdag tu lta ba dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba la 'dir de'i sgras ni bdag tu lta ba dang sbyar ro //
translated: The word ‚Äúits‚Äù refers to the view of the self.

original: rang bzhin ni ngo bo nyid dam rgyu yin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin ni ngo bo nyid dam rgyu yin no //
translated: The nature of something is its essence or cause.

original: de nyid kyi phyir bdag tu lta ba'i rang bzhin gyi khyad par can dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir bdag tu lta ba'i rang bzhin gyi khyad par can dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la /
translated: Therefore, he says, ‚ÄúThe Lord taught the view of the self to be a type of ignorance that is distinguished by its nature.‚Äù

original: bdag tu lta ba'i rang bzhin gyi khyad par can ni lta ba po dang za ba po dang bdag nyid du lta ba yin te /
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba'i rang bzhin gyi khyad par can ni lta ba po dang za ba po dang bdag nyid du lta ba yin te /
translated: The view of the self is distinguished by its nature as the view of the one who sees, the one who hears, and the one who experiences.

original: 'di dag ni bdag tu lta ba'i rnam par nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di dag ni bdag tu lta ba'i rnam par nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because these are simply forms of the view of the self.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa ni de las byung ba dag yin no //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa ni de las byung ba dag yin no //
translated: Desire and so on arise from the view of the self.

original: yang na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sbyor ba gnyis pa yin te /
analyzed: yang na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sbyor ba gnyis pa yin te /
translated: The second syllogism is stated by ‚ÄúOr, the seeing of selflessness . . .‚ÄùüîΩIn the former syllogism, the seeing of selflessness is the subject, and the nonexistence of attachment and so on is the predicate.

original: snga ma la ni bdag med pa mthong ba nyid chos can yin la de ltar ni 'dod chags la sogs pa de'i rang bzhin yin no zhes bya ba ni khyad par yin no //
analyzed: snga ma la ni bdag med pa mthong ba nyid chos can yin la de ltar ni 'dod chags la sogs pa de'i rang bzhin yin no zhes bya ba ni khyad par yin no //
translated: The former syllogism is invalid because the reason is not established.üîΩThe reason is not established because the property of the position, ‚Äúthe nature of the cold,‚Äù is not established.üîΩThe property of the position is not established because the nature of the cold is not established as the nature of the view of the transitory collection.

original: sngar bshad pa'i grang ba'i rang bzhin gyi chos nyid ces bya ba ni ba mo la sogs pa'i reg pa'i khyad par spu long zhes byed pa la sogs pa 'jig tshogs su lta ba'i rang bzhin nyid du ma grub pa de bas na gtan tshigs ma grub paüîΩyin no zhe na /
analyzed: sngar bshad pa'i grang ba'i rang bzhin gyi chos nyid ces bya ba ni ba mo la sogs pa'i reg pa'i khyad par spu long zhes byed pa la sogs pa 'jig tshogs su lta ba'i rang bzhin nyid du ma grub pa de bas na gtan tshigs ma grub pa yin no zhe na /
translated: Therefore, the reason is not established.

original: ma grub pa yang ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ma grub pa yang ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The response to that is stated by ‚ÄúNor is it the case that the reason is not established.‚Äù

original: gnas skabs de'i zad pa la /
analyzed: gnas skabs de'i zad pa la /
translated: The exhaustion of that state

original: de'i chos ma ma yin pa nyid kyi khyab pa yin la /
analyzed: de'i chos ma ma yin pa nyid kyi khyab pa yin la /
translated: is pervaded by the nonexistence of its properties.

original: de dang 'gal ba yang de'i chos yin pa de ltar na khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: de dang 'gal ba yang de'i chos yin pa de ltar na khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
translated: The observation of the contradiction of that pervader is the observation of the contradiction of the pervaded.

original: gang la rkyen 'di yod pa de ni rkyen 'di pa'o //
analyzed: gang la rkyen 'di yod pa de ni rkyen 'di pa'o //
translated: That which has this condition is ‚Äúhaving this condition.‚Äù

original: de'i dngos po ni rkyen 'di pa tsam nyid de dngos po'i rkyen gyi mthas rgyu dang 'bras bu'i 'brel pa brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i dngos po ni rkyen 'di pa tsam nyid de dngos po'i rkyen gyi mthas rgyu dang 'bras bu'i 'brel pa brjod pa yin te /
translated: Its state is ‚Äúhaving this condition‚Äù itself. The connection between cause and effect is stated by the limit of the condition of a thing.

original: de la phan pa dang byas pa dang / bsdu ba dag la 'brel pa bstan pa yin no zhes brjod pa'i @138a * //
analyzed: de la phan pa dang byas pa dang / bsdu ba dag la 'brel pa bstan pa yin no zhes brjod pa'i @138a * //
translated: Because it is said that ‚Äúthe connection is shown in the benefit, the action, and the collection.‚Äù

original: phyir ro // rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po tsam zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: phyir ro // rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po tsam zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is ‚Äúthe mere state of cause and effect.‚Äù

original: de bas na rkyen ma tshang ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni bdag med pa nyid mthong ba goms pas bdag tu lta ba'i mtshan nyid ma tshang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bas na rkyen ma tshang ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni bdag med pa nyid mthong ba goms pas bdag tu lta ba'i mtshan nyid ma tshang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, ‚Äúbecause the conditions are incomplete‚Äù means that the characteristics of the view of self are incomplete due to the cultivation of the vision of selflessness.

original: de la rag las pa can gyi skye ba zhes bya ba ni ji skad du bshad pa'i rkyen la rag las pa can gyi skye ba'o //
analyzed: de la rag las pa can gyi skye ba zhes bya ba ni ji skad du bshad pa'i rkyen la rag las pa can gyi skye ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúArising in dependence on that‚Äù means arising in dependence on the conditions as they have been explained.

original: 'di la yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'dod chags la sogs pa ni srog chags kyi chos yin no zhes bya ba 'di la'o //
analyzed: 'di la yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'dod chags la sogs pa ni srog chags kyi chos yin no zhes bya ba 'di la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn this case‚Äù refers to the statement, ‚ÄúAttachment and so on are the qualities of living beings.‚Äù

original: rang bzhin nam zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe chos kyi sgra rang bzhin du brjod pa na'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin nam zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe chos kyi sgra rang bzhin du brjod pa na'o //
translated: ‚ÄúNature‚Äù is when the word ‚Äúdharma‚Äù is used to mean essence.

original: de las byung ba la zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe chos kyi sgra 'bras bu brjod pa na'o //üîΩrang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni srog chags kyi rang bzhin nyid du yang 'dod pas 'dod chags la sogs pa'i sems kyi rang bzhin nyid du yang khas blang bar bya ba na /
analyzed: de las byung ba la zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe chos kyi sgra 'bras bu brjod pa na'o // rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni srog chags kyi rang bzhin nyid du yang 'dod pas 'dod chags la sogs pa'i sems kyi rang bzhin nyid du yang khas blang bar bya ba na /
translated: ‚ÄúArisen from that‚Äù is when the word ‚Äúdharma‚Äù is used to mean effect.

original: lus dang dbang po la sogs pa'i rang bzhin ma yin zhing sems kyi rang bzhin 'dod chags la sogs pa ma yin te rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba nyid du bstan zin to //
analyzed: lus dang dbang po la sogs pa'i rang bzhin ma yin zhing sems kyi rang bzhin 'dod chags la sogs pa ma yin te rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba nyid du bstan zin to //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause of its natural luminosity‚Äù means that since it is accepted that the nature of a living being is the nature of the mind, such as attachment, it is not the nature of the body, the sense faculties, and so on. The nature of the mind is not attachment and so on, because natural luminosity has already been taught.

original: de'i rang bzhin nyid la res 'ga' 'byung ba ma yin pa nyid kyis khyab pa yin la de dang 'gal ba yang res 'ga' 'byung ba can nyid yin pa de ltar na khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin nyid la res 'ga' 'byung ba ma yin pa nyid kyis khyab pa yin la de dang 'gal ba yang res 'ga' 'byung ba can nyid yin pa de ltar na khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
translated: The nature of that is pervaded by the fact that it does not occur sometimes, and that which is incompatible with that does occur sometimes. Thus, there is the observation of a pervasion that is incompatible with that.

original: nges par gdon mi za bar mngon du gyur pa gang la yod pa de ni nges par mngon du gyur pa'i chos can no //
analyzed: nges par gdon mi za bar mngon du gyur pa gang la yod pa de ni nges par mngon du gyur pa'i chos can no //
translated: That which definitely and without doubt has the quality of being manifest is a subject that definitely has the quality of being manifest.

original: mngon du 'gyur ba med pa zhes bya ba ni me thag nye ba nyid kyis zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mngon du 'gyur ba med pa zhes bya ba ni me thag nye ba nyid kyis zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúNot manifest‚Äù means not manifest due to the proximity of the flame.

original: de med par na yang zhes bya ba ni me med pa na yang ngo //
analyzed: de med par na yang zhes bya ba ni me med pa na yang ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúEven in the absence of that‚Äù means even in the absence of fire.

original: gang zhig gang gi rang bzhin yin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sbyor ba la /
analyzed: gang zhig gang gi rang bzhin yin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sbyor ba la /
translated: In the syllogism, ‚ÄúWhatever is the nature of that . . . ,‚Äù and so on,

original: gang zhig gang gi rang bzhin yin pa de'i don gyis 'gal zla de dang lhan cig 'gal bar 'gyur te zhes bya ba la sogs pas gang sngar bshad pa la grub par ston par byed de /
analyzed: gang zhig gang gi rang bzhin yin pa de'i don gyis 'gal zla de dang lhan cig 'gal bar 'gyur te zhes bya ba la sogs pas gang sngar bshad pa la grub par ston par byed de /
translated: whatever is the nature of that is incompatible with the object that is incompatible with that. Thus, it is as was explained earlier. He shows that this is established.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa dag bdag tu lta ba'i rang bzhin nyid du gzhung 'dis rab tu bsgrubs pa'i phyir ro //üîΩchags par khas len pa la rang gi yul gyi skyon mthong ba sngon du song ba'i sun 'byin pas khyab pa yin la /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa dag bdag tu lta ba'i rang bzhin nyid du gzhung 'dis rab tu bsgrubs pa'i phyir ro // chags par khas len pa la rang gi yul gyi skyon mthong ba sngon du song ba'i sun 'byin pas khyab pa yin la /
translated: because this treatise has thoroughly established that desire and so on are of the very nature of the view of self.

original: de 'di la med pa de ltar na khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: de 'di la med pa de ltar na khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: The claim of attachment is pervaded by the antecedent of seeing the faults of one's object, and that is not the case here. Thus, there is non-apprehension of the pervaded.

original: skyon dang ldan pa nyid du ma mthong ba'i yul der chags par byed pas na der 'dod chags so //
analyzed: skyon dang ldan pa nyid du ma mthong ba'i yul der chags par byed pas na der 'dod chags so //
translated: Since one is attached to the object, not seeing it as faulty, there is desire there.

original: bdag nyid mi 'dod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni bdag med pa nyid @138b mthong ba ni mngon sum nyid du mi 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag nyid mi 'dod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni bdag med pa nyid @138b mthong ba ni mngon sum nyid du mi 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of not wanting the self means that one does not want to see the self as non-existent.

original: de med par yang bdag tu chags pa'i yul la skyon du mthong ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de med par yang bdag tu chags pa'i yul la skyon du mthong ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of that, one does not see the faults in the object of attachment to the self.

original: skyon rnams yod pa zhes bya ba ni skye ba dang / rga ba dang na ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: skyon rnams yod pa zhes bya ba ni skye ba dang / rga ba dang na ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The faults are birth, aging, sickness, and so on.

original: yon tan 'dzin par byed ces bya ba ni gal te yon tan gyi ngo bor dngos po de yongs su gcod pa de ltar na skyon rnams sel bar byed par 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: yon tan 'dzin par byed ces bya ba ni gal te yon tan gyi ngo bor dngos po de yongs su gcod pa de ltar na skyon rnams sel bar byed par 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: The phrase because it apprehends the good qualities means that if you determine that entity to be good, then you will not eliminate its faults.üîΩThe phrase because it is contradictory to the pervasion means that the pervasion is this: The perception of one's own faults is invariably concomitant with the absence of craving for one's own pleasure, and the contradiction of that pervasion is craving for one's own pleasure. Thus, the pervasion is contradicted.üîΩThe phrase because it is contradictory to the pervader means that the pervader is this: The perception of one's own faults is invariably concomitant with the absence of craving for one's own pleasure, and the contradiction of that pervader is craving for one's own pleasure. Thus, the pervader is contradicted.

original: bdag gi skyon nye bar mthong ba la bdag gi bde ba la yongs su sred pa dang ldan pa med pas khyab pa yin la de dang 'gal ba yang bdag gi bde ba la yongs su sred pa nyid yin pa de ltar na khyab par byed pa 'galüîΩba dmigs pa'o ;
analyzed: bdag gi skyon nye bar mthong ba la bdag gi bde ba la yongs su sred pa dang ldan pa med pas khyab pa yin la de dang 'gal ba yang bdag gi bde ba la yongs su sred pa nyid yin pa de ltar na khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o ;
translated: The phrase because it is contradictory to the pervaded means that the pervaded is this: The perception of one's own faults is invariably concomitant with the absence of craving for one's own pleasure, and the contradiction of that pervaded is craving for one's own pleasure. Thus, the pervaded is contradicted.üîΩThe phrase because it is contradictory to the similar class means that the similar class is this: The perception of one's own faults is invariably concomitant with the absence of craving for one's own pleasure, and the contradiction of that similar class is craving for one's own pleasure. Thus, the similar class is contradicted.üîΩThe phrase because it is contradictory to the contradictory class means that the contradictory class is this: The perception of one's own faults is invariably concomitant with the absence of craving for one's own pleasure, and the contradiction of that contradictory class is craving for one's own pleasure. Thus, the contradictory class is contradicted.üîΩThe phrase because it is contradictory to the effect means that the effect is this: The perception of one's own faults is invariably concomitant with the absence of craving for one's own pleasure, and the contradiction of that effect is craving for one's own pleasure. Thus, the effect is contradicted.

original: / bsgrub par bya ba gnyis pa la ltos nas rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs yin no zhes bya ba ni yon tan du lta ba ni bdag gi bde ba la yongs su sred pa dang ldan pa nyid tsam dang rjes su 'brel pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: / bsgrub par bya ba gnyis pa la ltos nas rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs yin no zhes bya ba ni yon tan du lta ba ni bdag gi bde ba la yongs su sred pa dang ldan pa nyid tsam dang rjes su 'brel pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase because it is contradictory to the cause means that the cause is this: The perception of one's own faults is invariably concomitant with the absence of craving for one's own pleasure, and the contradiction of that cause is

original: skyes bu bdag tu mthong bas ni bdag tu chags pa la sogs pa'i sred pas zhes bya ba ni bdag tu chags pa'i dbang gis bdag gi nyid la bdag gir byas pa de ltar bdag tu chags pa la sogs pas bde ba'i tshor ba de la sred pa
analyzed: skyes bu bdag tu mthong bas ni bdag tu chags pa la sogs pa'i sred pas zhes bya ba ni bdag tu chags pa'i dbang gis bdag gi nyid la bdag gir byas pa de ltar bdag tu chags pa la sogs pas bde ba'i tshor ba de la sred pa
translated: Since one sees a self in a person, craving such as attachment to a self arises.üîΩCraving for that feeling of pleasure arises due to attachment to a self, since one makes that which is not a self into a self through the power of attachment to a self.

original: ni bdag tu chags pa la sogs pa'i sred pa ste /
analyzed: ni bdag tu chags pa la sogs pa'i sred pa ste /
translated: Thus, craving such as attachment to a self is craving for that feeling of pleasure.

original: bdag tu chags pas sred pa'i zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bdag tu chags pas sred pa'i zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: craving due to attachment to a self.

original: de skad du rtsa ba'i tshigs su bcad pa las kyang /
analyzed: de skad du rtsa ba'i tshigs su bcad pa las kyang /
translated: This is stated in the root text:

original: chags pas bde la sred 'gyur zhing //
analyzed: chags pas bde la sred 'gyur zhing //
translated: Through attachment, one craves pleasure;

original: sred pas skyon rnams sel bar byed //
analyzed: sred pas skyon rnams sel bar byed //
translated: through craving, one conceals faults.

original: ces bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: ces bshad pa yin no //
translated: This is explained.

original: don de nyid kyis 'di ni mjug sdud pa yin no //
analyzed: don de nyid kyis 'di ni mjug sdud pa yin no //
translated: This is a summary of the meaning of that.

original: gzhan dag ni bdag tu chags pa la sogs pa dag la sred pa zhes 'chad par byed do //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni bdag tu chags pa la sogs pa dag la sred pa zhes 'chad par byed do //
translated: Others explain that craving such as attachment to a self arises.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni bde ba'i tshor ba la sogs pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni bde ba'i tshor ba la sogs pa gzung ngo //
translated: The word ‚Äúsuch as‚Äù includes feelings of pleasure and so on.

original: bdag gir yongs su 'dzin pa la sogs pa rtsom pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi 'khor ba zhes bya ba la bdag gi nyid du gzung ba'i srid pa'i longs spyod kyi mtshan nyid can gyi dngos po la mngon par chags pa sngon du song ba can
analyzed: bdag gir yongs su 'dzin pa la sogs pa rtsom pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi 'khor ba zhes bya ba la bdag gi nyid du gzung ba'i srid pa'i longs spyod kyi mtshan nyid can gyi dngos po la mngon par chags pa sngon du song ba can
translated: Samsara is characterized by the performance of such actions as the appropriation of a self, etc. The grasping of the self is the prior condition for the grasping of what belongs to the self.

original: gyi 'dzin pa ni yongs su 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: gyi 'dzin pa ni yongs su 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Grasping is the adherence to the reality of the objects of enjoyment of existence, which are grasped as being one's own.

original: rtsom pa ni mngon par bsgrub pa'o //
analyzed: rtsom pa ni mngon par bsgrub pa'o //
translated: Performance is the accomplishment.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni mngon par grub pa gnas pa zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni mngon par grub pa gnas pa zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa gzung ngo //
translated: The words, etc. , include such things as the accomplishment of abiding.

original: de ltar mi 'dzin pa gang yin pa dang / bdag ces de ltar mi 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar mi 'dzin pa gang yin pa dang / bdag ces de ltar mi 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Not grasping in that way is the non-grasping of a self.

original: 'di dag dang ni zhes bya ba yongs su 'dzin pa dang sdang ba dag la zhes bya ba bdun pa'i tshig gnyis @139a * //
analyzed: 'di dag dang ni zhes bya ba yongs su 'dzin pa dang sdang ba dag la zhes bya ba bdun pa'i tshig gnyis @139a * //
translated: The words, etc. , refer to the grasping of what belongs to the self and to aversion.

original: pa'o ; / de nyid ni 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dag yin te zhes bya bas rnam par phye bas gsal bar byed do //
analyzed: pa'o ; / de nyid ni 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dag yin te zhes bya bas rnam par phye bas gsal bar byed do //
translated: The words, etc. , refer to desire and hatred.

original: bdag tu lta ba med pa nyid kyi phyir de dag thams cad yod pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni bdag tu chags pa dang / bde ba dang sred pa dang / yon tan du lta ba la sogs pa de ma thag tu 'das pa gang yin pa de thams cad yod pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba med pa nyid kyi phyir de dag thams cad yod pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni bdag tu chags pa dang / bde ba dang sred pa dang / yon tan du lta ba la sogs pa de ma thag tu 'das pa gang yin pa de thams cad yod pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: All of that which was just mentioned‚Äîattachment to self, pleasure, craving, the view of good qualities, etc.‚Äîdoes not exist.üîΩThe attachment that is produced by mere association with those who have attachment to self exists.

original: bdag tu chags pa dang ldan pa dag gi dang 'brel ba tsam gyis byas pa'i chags pa yod pa yin no zhes bya ba ni bdag gi chags pa gang yin pa de bdag tu chags pa dang ldan pa dang 'brel pa tsam gyis byas pa yin gyi rgyu
analyzed: bdag tu chags pa dang ldan pa dag gi dang 'brel ba tsam gyis byas pa'i chags pa yod pa yin no zhes bya ba ni bdag gi chags pa gang yin pa de bdag tu chags pa dang ldan pa dang 'brel pa tsam gyis byas pa yin gyi rgyu
translated: The attachment to self is produced by mere association with those who have attachment to self. It is not produced by a cause

original: lhag pa la ltos pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: lhag pa la ltos pa ni ma yin no //
translated: that is superior to that.

original: 'brel pa de yang dus thams cad du khyad par med pa yin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: 'brel pa de yang dus thams cad du khyad par med pa yin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: Moreover, that association is not distinguished by any time.

original: de nyid ni sbyor ba'i sgo nas 'chad par byed do //
analyzed: de nyid ni sbyor ba'i sgo nas 'chad par byed do //
translated: He explains that very point by way of application.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba ni rgyab kyis phyogs pa'i sgo nas so //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba ni rgyab kyis phyogs pa'i sgo nas so //
translated: One who is free from attachment is free from attachment by way of turning away.

original: zhen pa med pa ni btang snyoms kyi sgo nas yin te /
analyzed: zhen pa med pa ni btang snyoms kyi sgo nas yin te /
translated: Non-attachment is by way of equanimity.

original: 'di nyid kyi khyad par ni de yin no //
analyzed: 'di nyid kyi khyad par ni de yin no //
translated: This is the difference between them.

original: de la 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / zhen pa med pa nyid la 'tshe ba med pa nyid la sogs pa 'dod pa dang bral ba nyid kyis khyab pa yin la /
analyzed: de la 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / zhen pa med pa nyid la 'tshe ba med pa nyid la sogs pa 'dod pa dang bral ba nyid kyis khyab pa yin la /
translated: There, non-violence, etc. are pervaded by freedom from attachment, by freedom from passion, by non-attachment.

original: de dang 'gal ba ni de la 'tshe ba med pa nyid la sogs pa 'dod pa yin pa de ltar na khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: de dang 'gal ba ni de la 'tshe ba med pa nyid la sogs pa 'dod pa yin pa de ltar na khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
translated: The opposite of that is attachment, violence, etc. Thus, there is the observation of an incompatible pervasion.

original: de yod pa tsam du lta ba'i ngang tshul can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni bdag tu chags pa ni bdag yod pa nyid du lta ba tsam las skyes pa can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de yod pa tsam du lta ba'i ngang tshul can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni bdag tu chags pa ni bdag yod pa nyid du lta ba tsam las skyes pa can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: attachment to self is produced by the mere view that the self exists.

original: yul gyi yul can bstan pa yin te yon tan dang skyon gyi sgra dag gis yon tan dang skyon du lta ba bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: yul gyi yul can bstan pa yin te yon tan dang skyon gyi sgra dag gis yon tan dang skyon du lta ba bshad pa yin no //
translated: The object and the subject are indicated. The view of good qualities and faults is explained by the words good qualities and faults.

original: 'dod sdang la sogs pa gang la de dang rjes su 'brel zhing de la rag lus pa'i ngang tshul can de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: 'dod sdang la sogs pa gang la de dang rjes su 'brel zhing de la rag lus pa'i ngang tshul can de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: That which is related to and dependent on desire, hatred, etc. is called that.

original: de nyid ni 'dod pa ni yul la la la yon tan mthong ba'i rjes su 'brel pas skye ba yin zhing zhes bya bas 'chad par byed do ;
analyzed: de nyid ni 'dod pa ni yul la la la yon tan mthong ba'i rjes su 'brel pas skye ba yin zhing zhes bya bas 'chad par byed do ;
translated: That very thing is explained by the words: ‚ÄúDesire arises from the perception of a good quality in some object.‚Äù

original: / bdag nyid ji lta ba bzhin du rgyu mtshan mthong bas phrag dog la sogs pa zhes bya ba la /üîΩdngos po mi 'dod pa yang dag par ston pa ni phrag dog go //
analyzed: / bdag nyid ji lta ba bzhin du rgyu mtshan mthong bas phrag dog la sogs pa zhes bya ba la / dngos po mi 'dod pa yang dag par ston pa ni phrag dog go //
translated: Jealousy, etc. arise from the perception of a reason for one‚Äôs own inferiority.üîΩOne should say: ‚ÄúHatred is the manifestation of a dislike for a thing.‚Äù

original: kun nas chags pa'i rten gyi dngos po ston pa ni ser sna yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: kun nas chags pa'i rten gyi dngos po ston pa ni ser sna yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa brjod par bya'o //
translated: ‚ÄúAvarice is the manifestation of a basis for complete attachment.‚Äù

original: spong ba'i thabs ni 'dir @139b spong ba mngon par 'dod pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni rgyu la 'bras bu nye bar btags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spong ba'i thabs ni 'dir @139b spong ba mngon par 'dod pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni rgyu la 'bras bu nye bar btags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The means of abandoning is the desire to abandon here, because the cause is figuratively designated by the effect.

original: thabs de yang gang yin zhe na 'di lta ste /
analyzed: thabs de yang gang yin zhe na 'di lta ste /
translated: What is that means? It is as follows:

original: skyon dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la de dag ces bya ba ni skyon dang yon tan dag go //
analyzed: skyon dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la de dag ces bya ba ni skyon dang yon tan dag go //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúbecause of not seeing‚Äù and so on. The phrase ‚Äúthose‚Äù refers to faults and virtues.

original: ma mthong ba tsam ni thabs su 'gyur ba ma yin te /
analyzed: ma mthong ba tsam ni thabs su 'gyur ba ma yin te /
translated: Mere non-seeing is not a means,

original: med pa ni rgyu ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: med pa ni rgyu ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because non-existence is not a cause.

original: 'on kyang yon tan ma mthong ba dang skyon ma mthong bas 'dod chags dang zhe sdang mi skye ba de la go rims bzhin du yon tan mthong ba ma yin pa dang skyon mthong ba ma yin pa nyid ma yin par dgag pas mthong ba min pa'i sgrasüîΩbshad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang yon tan ma mthong ba dang skyon ma mthong bas 'dod chags dang zhe sdang mi skye ba de la go rims bzhin du yon tan mthong ba ma yin pa dang skyon mthong ba ma yin pa nyid ma yin par dgag pas mthong ba min pa'i sgras bshad pa yin no //
translated: However, because of not seeing virtues and not seeing faults, attachment and aversion do not arise. In that case, respectively, it is not the case that there is no seeing of virtues and no seeing of faults. The word ‚Äúnot seeing‚Äù is explained by the negation ‚Äúis not.‚Äù

original: 'grel pa la yang yon tan mthong ba med pas zhes bya ba med pa'i tshig de las bzlog pa mthong ba nyid yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'grel pa la yang yon tan mthong ba med pas zhes bya ba med pa'i tshig de las bzlog pa mthong ba nyid yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: In the commentary, the phrase ‚Äúbecause of not seeing virtues‚Äù is explained as ‚Äúbecause of seeing non-existence.‚Äù The word ‚Äúnon-existence‚Äù should be understood as ‚Äúseeing.‚Äù

original: de la zhes bya ba ni phyi rol gyi don de la'o //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni phyi rol gyi don de la'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúin that‚Äù refers to external objects.

original: de mthong ba yod na med pa la de mthong ba ma skyes pa nyid kyis khyab pa yin la de dang 'gal ba yang de mthong ba skyes pa nyid yin pa de ltar na khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: de mthong ba yod na med pa la de mthong ba ma skyes pa nyid kyis khyab pa yin la de dang 'gal ba yang de mthong ba skyes pa nyid yin pa de ltar na khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
translated: If there were seeing of that, then non-seeing would be pervaded by non-arising of that seeing. And the contradiction of that is the very arising of that seeing. Thus, there is the observation of a contradiction with the pervasion.

original: bdag tu chags pa la yon tan du lta ba nyid las bdag tu chags pa skye bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: bdag tu chags pa la yon tan du lta ba nyid las bdag tu chags pa skye bar 'gyur la /
translated: Attachment to self arises only from the view of good qualities in self.

original: gang gi tshe bdag tu chags pa yon tan du lta ba ldog pa de'i tshe log pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe bdag tu chags pa yon tan du lta ba ldog pa de'i tshe log pa yin no //
translated: When the view of good qualities in self is reversed, then attachment to self is reversed.

original: de bas bdag tu chags pa la yon tan du lta ba'i sgo nas bdag tu chags pa skye ba de ltar na gtan tshigs ma grub pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de bas bdag tu chags pa la yon tan du lta ba'i sgo nas bdag tu chags pa skye ba de ltar na gtan tshigs ma grub pa yin no zhe na /
translated: Thus, the reason is not established, since attachment to self arises from the view of good qualities in self.

original: de'i phyir gal te bdag tu chags pa la yon tan du lta ba las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir gal te bdag tu chags pa la yon tan du lta ba las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Therefore, he says, ‚ÄúIf attachment to self arises from the view of good qualities in self,‚Äù and so on.

original: gang zhig gang gi rgyu can yin pa de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: gang zhig gang gi rgyu can yin pa de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: That which is the cause of this and that is called ‚Äúthe reason.‚Äù

original: dngos po gang zhig gang gi rgyu can yin pa de'i rgyu can yin pa zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu nyid ston pa yin no //
analyzed: dngos po gang zhig gang gi rgyu can yin pa de'i rgyu can yin pa zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu nyid ston pa yin no //
translated: That which is the effect of some thing is called ‚Äúhaving that as its cause.‚Äù

original: de ma tshang ba med pa yod na zhes bya ba ni rgyu'o //
analyzed: de ma tshang ba med pa yod na zhes bya ba ni rgyu'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIf that is not incomplete‚Äù refers to the cause.

original: de ma tshang ba med pa yod na 'bras bu med pa la de'i rgyu can ma yin pa nyid kyis khyab pa yin la /
analyzed: de ma tshang ba med pa yod na 'bras bu med pa la de'i rgyu can ma yin pa nyid kyis khyab pa yin la /
translated: If that is not incomplete, then the effect is not nonexistent.

original: de dang 'gal ba ni de'i rgyu can yin pa de ltar na khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: de dang 'gal ba ni de'i rgyu can yin pa de ltar na khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
translated: The observation of something incompatible with that is the observation of something incompatible with the pervader.

original: gang las sam ji ltar zhes bya ba la sam gyi sgra ni ci dang 'dra ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang las sam ji ltar zhes bya ba la sam gyi sgra ni ci dang 'dra ba'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúFrom what? In what way?‚Äù The word ‚Äúor‚Äù has the meaning of ‚Äúlike what?‚Äù

original: gang las zhes bya ba 'dis ni rigs pa 'dri bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: gang las zhes bya ba 'dis ni rigs pa 'dri bar byed pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúFrom what?‚Äù asks about the reasoning.

original: ji ltar zhes bya ba ni dpe 'dri bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar zhes bya ba ni dpe 'dri bar byed pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn what way?‚Äù asks about the example.

original: rang nyid mthong phyir zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs brjod pa yin la /
analyzed: rang nyid mthong phyir zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs brjod pa yin la /
translated: ‚ÄúBecause it is seen by itself‚Äù states the reason.

original: dper na bdag bzhin zhes bya ba ni dper brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: dper na bdag bzhin zhes bya ba ni dper brjod pa yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúFor example, like me‚Äù states the example.

original: 'dod chags dang @140a * //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang @140a * //
translated: ‚ÄúDesire‚Äù is the object of desire.

original: bral ba la rang gi blo dor bas khyab pa yin la /
analyzed: bral ba la rang gi blo dor bas khyab pa yin la /
translated: The pervasion is that the presence of the pervasion is invariably concomitant with the relinquishment of one's own mind.

original: de dang 'gal ba yang zhes yongs su ma spangs pa yin pa de ltar na khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: de dang 'gal ba yang zhes yongs su ma spangs pa yin pa de ltar na khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
translated: The observation of something incompatible with that is the observation of something incompatible with the pervader.

original: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa la 'di ltar bdag tu chags pa la sogs pa dang ldan pa la 'di chos dang chos ma yin pa rtsom zhing /
analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa la 'di ltar bdag tu chags pa la sogs pa dang ldan pa la 'di chos dang chos ma yin pa rtsom zhing /
translated: The statement this is so and so on is as follows: One who is endowed with attachment to self and so on composes Dharma and non-Dharma.

original: de nas skye ba las ni de yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de nas skye ba las ni de yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Then, due to birth, that does not exist.

original: de bas na yan gar ba ni sdug bsngal gyi rgyu nyid ma yin no de ltar na chags pa la sogs pa yan gar ba sdug bsngal gyi rgyu ma yin no zhes tshig yongs su bsgyur nas sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na yan gar ba ni sdug bsngal gyi rgyu nyid ma yin no de ltar na chags pa la sogs pa yan gar ba sdug bsngal gyi rgyu ma yin no zhes tshig yongs su bsgyur nas sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the isolated [factors] are not the cause of suffering. Thus, one should apply the transformation of the statement, saying that the isolated attachment and so on are not the cause of suffering.

original: gzhan ni bdag med par chags pa la sogs pa las mngon par 'du byed pa sngon du song ba can gyi skye ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal sgrub par nus pa ma yin par 'dod do //
analyzed: gzhan ni bdag med par chags pa la sogs pa las mngon par 'du byed pa sngon du song ba can gyi skye ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal sgrub par nus pa ma yin par 'dod do //
translated: Others assert that the isolated [factors] are not capable of establishing the suffering of birth and so on, which is preceded by the composition from attachment and so on that is devoid of self.

original: nus pa nyid yin na yang tha dad par rtog pa don med pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: nus pa nyid yin na yang tha dad par rtog pa don med pa nyid yin no //
translated: If it is potency, then it is pointless to imagine it as different.

original: gtan tshigs ma nges pa yin no zhes bya ba ni phyis bdag dang ldan pa'i phyir chags pa la sogs pa sdug bsngal gyi rgyu nyid yin na bdag la skyon dang ldan pa nyid du yang khas mi len pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gtan tshigs ma nges pa yin no zhes bya ba ni phyis bdag dang ldan pa'i phyir chags pa la sogs pa sdug bsngal gyi rgyu nyid yin na bdag la skyon dang ldan pa nyid du yang khas mi len pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The reason is inconclusive, because even though attachment, etc. are the cause of suffering because they are associated with the self, we do not accept that the self has faults.

original: bshad ma thag pa'i gtan tshigs rang nyid ma nges pa yin no //
analyzed: bshad ma thag pa'i gtan tshigs rang nyid ma nges pa yin no //
translated: The reason just stated is itself inconclusive.

original: de ltar gnyi ga yang mtshungs pa nyid kyis zhes bya ba bdag dang bdag gi la chags pa yang ji skad du bshad pa'i rnam pas mtshungs pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: de ltar gnyi ga yang mtshungs pa nyid kyis zhes bya ba bdag dang bdag gi la chags pa yang ji skad du bshad pa'i rnam pas mtshungs pa nyid kyis so //
translated: Thus, since both are the same, attachment to the self and what belongs to the self is the same as explained.

original: de ni med pa'i ngang tshul can zhes bya ba ni gang gis skyon mtshungs pa de la med pa'i ngang tshul can no //
analyzed: de ni med pa'i ngang tshul can zhes bya ba ni gang gis skyon mtshungs pa de la med pa'i ngang tshul can no //
translated: It is the nature of nonexistence, because the nature of nonexistence is the same in both cases.

original: de tsam gyi rgyu mtshan can zhes bya ba ni gnyi ga la skyon mtshungs pa de tsam gyi rgyu mtshan 'dod chags dang bral ba gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de tsam gyi rgyu mtshan can zhes bya ba ni gnyi ga la skyon mtshungs pa de tsam gyi rgyu mtshan 'dod chags dang bral ba gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: The reason for just that is the same fault for both. One who is free from attachment has just that.

original: de med pa'i ngang tshul can 'dod chags dang bral ba gcig gi yul du byed pa de la nyes pa mtshungs pa med pas khyab pa yin la /
analyzed: de med pa'i ngang tshul can 'dod chags dang bral ba gcig gi yul du byed pa de la nyes pa mtshungs pa med pas khyab pa yin la /
translated: There is no fault in making that which is free from attachment and which has the nature of not existing its object.

original: de dang 'gal ba yang nyes pa mtshungs pa nyid yin pa de ltar na khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: de dang 'gal ba yang nyes pa mtshungs pa nyid yin pa de ltar na khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
translated: The contradiction of that is the same fault. Thus, there is the observation of a contradiction with the pervasion.

original: sdug bsngal bsgom pa dang ldan pas spong bar byed pa zhes bya ba ni sbrul gyis bzung ba'i yan lag de la sdug bsngal bsgom pa dang ldan pas so //
analyzed: sdug bsngal bsgom pa dang ldan pas spong bar byed pa zhes bya ba ni sbrul gyis bzung ba'i yan lag de la sdug bsngal bsgom pa dang ldan pas so //
translated: One who is endowed with the meditation on suffering abandons it. One who is endowed with the meditation on suffering abandons the limb that is seized by the snake.

original: gtan tshigs ma grub pa yin no zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i yang bdag dang skyon mtshungs pa yin no zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs 'di ma grub pa yin te /
analyzed: gtan tshigs ma grub pa yin no zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i yang bdag dang skyon mtshungs pa yin no zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs 'di ma grub pa yin te /
translated: The reason is not established. The reason, ‚ÄúThe same fault applies to attachment, etc.,‚Äù is not established.

original: 'di ltar bdag tu chags pa la sogs pa la sdug bsngal @140b bsgom pa yin gyi bdag la ni ma yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩlongs spyod pa'i rten gyi blo zhes bya ba la longs spyod par bya bas na longs spyod de bde ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar bdag tu chags pa la sogs pa la sdug bsngal @140b bsgom pa yin gyi bdag la ni ma yin pa'i phyir ro // longs spyod pa'i rten gyi blo zhes bya ba la longs spyod par bya bas na longs spyod de bde ba'o //
translated: Thus, it is suffering that is cultivated in relation to the self-habit, etc., not in relation to the self.üîΩThe mind that is the basis of enjoyment is the cause of pleasure.

original: de'i rten ni bde ba'i rgyu nyid de de la blo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i rten ni bde ba'i rgyu nyid de de la blo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The mind that is the basis of enjoyment is the cause of pleasure.

original: ma nges pa nyid du bstan to zhes bya ba ni gang zhig gang la sdug bsngal bsgom pa dang ldan pa de ni de la chags pa dang bral ba ma yin te zhes bya ba 'di'o //
analyzed: ma nges pa nyid du bstan to zhes bya ba ni gang zhig gang la sdug bsngal bsgom pa dang ldan pa de ni de la chags pa dang bral ba ma yin te zhes bya ba 'di'o //
translated: It is shown that it is not certain that one who cultivates suffering in relation to something is free from attachment to it.

original: bdag gi blo yongs su dor ba med par sdug bsngal bsgom pa yod na yang dor ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag gi blo yongs su dor ba med par sdug bsngal bsgom pa yod na yang dor ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Even when suffering is cultivated in relation to the self, the mind that is the basis of enjoyment is not abandoned.

original: dbang po la sogs longs spyod pa'i //
analyzed: dbang po la sogs longs spyod pa'i //
translated: The mind that is the basis of enjoyment of the sense faculties, etc.

original: rten nyid du ni bzung ba la //
analyzed: rten nyid du ni bzung ba la //
translated: is taken as the cause of pleasure.

original: rang nyid blo ni gang gis bzlog / de la chags bral de gang las //
analyzed: rang nyid blo ni gang gis bzlog / de la chags bral de gang las //
translated: By what means is it turned away? From what is it free?

original: zhes bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa de las /üîΩdbang po la sogs longs spyod pa'i //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa de las / dbang po la sogs longs spyod pa'i //
translated: The verse is:üîΩThe sense faculties, etc. are grasped

original: rten nyid du ni bzung ba la //üîΩgang las yin zhes bya ba yi //
analyzed: rten nyid du ni bzung ba la // gang las yin zhes bya ba yi //
translated: as the basis of enjoyment.üîΩThe word ‚Äúfrom‚Äù in the verse

original: tshig de rnam par 'grel pa yin no //
analyzed: tshig de rnam par 'grel pa yin no //
translated: is explained as follows.

original: lhag ma ni sbyor ba bstan pa'i sgo nas don brjod par bya'o //üîΩlongs spyod pa'i rten nyid du ni zhes bya ba 'di'i bshad pa ni longs spyod pa'i rten sgrub par byed pa nyid du zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: lhag ma ni sbyor ba bstan pa'i sgo nas don brjod par bya'o // longs spyod pa'i rten nyid du ni zhes bya ba 'di'i bshad pa ni longs spyod pa'i rten sgrub par byed pa nyid du zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The rest of the verse is to be interpreted in terms of the teaching on the application of the sense faculties.üîΩThe explanation of the phrase ‚Äúas the basis of enjoyment‚Äù is ‚Äúas the cause of the enjoyment of the sense faculties, etc.‚Äù

original: longs spyod pa'i rten nyid kyis ni lus bzung ba yin no //
analyzed: longs spyod pa'i rten nyid kyis ni lus bzung ba yin no //
translated: The body is grasped as the basis of enjoyment because it is the basis of the enjoyment of the sense faculties, etc.

original: rten ni de'i sgo nas bdag gi bde ba skye ba'i phyir ro //üîΩlongs spyod sgrub par byed pas dbang po bzung ba yin te //
analyzed: rten ni de'i sgo nas bdag gi bde ba skye ba'i phyir ro // longs spyod sgrub par byed pas dbang po bzung ba yin te //
translated: The basis is the body, because pleasure arises from it.üîΩThe sense faculties are grasped as the cause of enjoyment because they are the cause of the enjoyment of objects.

original: de dag yul 'dzin pa'i sgo nas bde ba sgrub par byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag yul 'dzin pa'i sgo nas bde ba sgrub par byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The sense faculties are the cause of the enjoyment of objects, because pleasure is produced by the apprehension of objects.

original: gang las yin te zhes bya ba'i bshad pa ni ma yin pa nyid do zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang las yin te zhes bya ba'i bshad pa ni ma yin pa nyid do zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúfrom‚Äù in the verse is explained as follows.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba zhes bya ba ni mdo brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba zhes bya ba ni mdo brjod pa yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúFree from attachment‚Äù is the s≈´tra statement.

original: gang las 'dod chags dang bral ba yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang las 'dod chags dang bral ba yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: ‚Äúfree from attachment to what?‚Äù

original: de 'dra ba zhes bya ba ni lus las skra la sogs pa'i yan lag ma thob pa ste /
analyzed: de 'dra ba zhes bya ba ni lus las skra la sogs pa'i yan lag ma thob pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúSuch‚Äù means not yet obtained as a body part, such as hair, etc.

original: de dag dang mtshungs pa la zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de dag dang mtshungs pa la zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: ‚Äúsimilar to those.‚Äù

original: de nyid 'ba' zhig la zhes bya ba la sogs pa phyi ma phyi ma bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid 'ba' zhig la zhes bya ba la sogs pa phyi ma phyi ma bshad pa yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúOnly that‚Äù and so on are the subsequent explanations.

original: bdag gi nyid du kun nas bzung ba yod na zhes bya ba ni bdag gir byas pa yod na'o //
analyzed: bdag gi nyid du kun nas bzung ba yod na zhes bya ba ni bdag gir byas pa yod na'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIf there is the apprehension of ‚Äòmine‚Äô‚Äù means if there is the apprehension of ‚Äúmine.‚Äù

original: bdag gi blo ldog pa'i rgyu longs spyod kyi rten nyid du ma bzung ba de dang 'gal ba ni longs spyod kyi rten nyid du bzung ba de ltar na rgyu 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: bdag gi blo ldog pa'i rgyu longs spyod kyi rten nyid du ma bzung ba de dang 'gal ba ni longs spyod kyi rten nyid du bzung ba de ltar na rgyu 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
translated: The cause of the cessation of the idea of ‚Äúmine‚Äù is the apprehension of the body as not the basis of resources. The opposite of that is the apprehension of the body as the basis of resources. Thus there is the observation of the contradiction of the cause.

original: de las gzhan pa yod na yang med par 'gyur ba ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni gang yod na 'gyur ba zhes bshad pa de nyid la med pa ma yin no zhes blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa yod na yang med par 'gyur ba ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni gang yod na 'gyur ba zhes bshad pa de nyid la med pa ma yin no zhes blta bar bya'o //
translated: If it were different from that, it would not be nonexistent. This should be understood as follows: that which is said to be existent is not nonexistent.

original: @141a * // bdag la gnas pa'i zhes bya ba ni lus la gnas pa'i'o //
analyzed: @141a * // bdag la gnas pa'i zhes bya ba ni lus la gnas pa'i'o //
translated: ‚ÄúResiding in the self‚Äù means residing in the body.

original: de yod pa'i phyir khyad par med pa la yang zhes bya ba ni lus la gnas pa'i skra la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gang yin pa de las khyad par med pa dag la yang zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de yod pa'i phyir khyad par med pa la yang zhes bya ba ni lus la gnas pa'i skra la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gang yin pa de las khyad par med pa dag la yang zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Because it exists, it is said that ‚Äúthere is no difference in the nature of the hair, etc., that resides in the body.‚Äù

original: sa bon la sogs pa las myu gu skyes pa gang yin pa des skyed pa ni skyes shing 'byung ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sa bon la sogs pa las myu gu skyes pa gang yin pa des skyed pa ni skyes shing 'byung ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The sprout that is produced from the seed, etc., is what is produced, that is, what is generated and comes into existence.

original: yul gang la zhe na myu gu la'o //
analyzed: yul gang la zhe na myu gu la'o //
translated: With respect to what object? With respect to the sprout.

original: bskyed pa de gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: bskyed pa de gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is the production?

original: de'i 'bras bu'i tha snyad kyi shes pa lta bu'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu'i tha snyad kyi shes pa lta bu'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: It is like the cognition that is the convention of the effect.

original: sa bon de'i 'bras bu myu gu zhes bya ba de lta bu'i tha snyad do //
analyzed: sa bon de'i 'bras bu myu gu zhes bya ba de lta bu'i tha snyad do //
translated: The sprout, which is the effect of that seed, is so-called.

original: de'i shes pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i shes pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: the cognition of that.

original: de dang de yang zhes bya ba ni 'das ma thag tu bstan pa'i grangs can gyi gzhung ngo //
analyzed: de dang de yang zhes bya ba ni 'das ma thag tu bstan pa'i grangs can gyi gzhung ngo //
translated: And that also means the SƒÅ·πÉkhya text that was just taught.

original: stsogs pa smos pas bsal ba yin no zhes bya ba ni de la rang blo 'phrod 'du ba la sogs pa 'brel pas skyed yin na zhes bya ba der sogs pa'i sgras so //
analyzed: stsogs pa smos pas bsal ba yin no zhes bya ba ni de la rang blo 'phrod 'du ba la sogs pa 'brel pas skyed yin na zhes bya ba der sogs pa'i sgras so //
translated: The word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù indicates that it is excluded. The meaning is: in that case, the word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù in ‚Äúproduction by connection with one‚Äôs own mind, etc.‚Äù refers to that.

original: de ltar na rang bzhin dang skyes bu dag la gcig tu shin tu bzhen pa'i rgyu nyid yod na /
analyzed: de ltar na rang bzhin dang skyes bu dag la gcig tu shin tu bzhen pa'i rgyu nyid yod na /
translated: Thus, if there were a cause that is absolutely real in relation to intrinsic nature and puru·π£a,

original: phyis kyang grol ba'i gnas skabs na yang khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyis kyang grol ba'i gnas skabs na yang khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: then even later, at the time of liberation, there would be no difference.

original: de bas na gcig tu zhen ba nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas na gcig tu zhen ba nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, there would be absolute attachment.

original: de la ltos pa med cing des byas pa yin te zhes bya ba ni gang zhig med na yang 'gyur ba'i dngos po de ni ltos pa med pa ste /
analyzed: de la ltos pa med cing des byas pa yin te zhes bya ba ni gang zhig med na yang 'gyur ba'i dngos po de ni ltos pa med pa ste /
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúnot depending on that and being produced by that‚Äù is this: A thing that would exist even if that did not exist is not dependent on that.

original: brten pa med cing des byas pa yin te /
analyzed: brten pa med cing des byas pa yin te /
translated: And it is not supported by that,

original: gang yod na 'gyur ba ni des byas pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang yod na 'gyur ba ni des byas pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: that is, it is not produced by that. The meaning is: if it exists, it is produced by that.

original: yang na gang med na yang yod pa de ni 'bras bu gang la de ltos pa med pa can no //
analyzed: yang na gang med na yang yod pa de ni 'bras bu gang la de ltos pa med pa can no //
translated: Or, if it exists even when that does not exist, then it is an effect that does not rely on that.

original: gang yod na 'gyur ba ni des byas pa yin te /
analyzed: gang yod na 'gyur ba ni des byas pa yin te /
translated: If it exists when that exists, it is produced by that.

original: de la ltos pa med pa can yang de yin la /
analyzed: de la ltos pa med pa can yang de yin la /
translated: That which does not rely on that is that,üîΩand it is also produced by that.

original: des byas pa yang yin no zhes bya ba ni khyad par gyi bsdu pa'o /
analyzed: des byas pa yang yin no zhes bya ba ni khyad par gyi bsdu pa'o /
translated: This is a special summary.

original: // / tshad ma rnam 'grel gyi 'grel bshad /
analyzed: // / tshad ma rnam 'grel gyi 'grel bshad /
translated: Commentary on Valid Knowledge

original: bam po bzhi bcu rtsa brgyad pa /
analyzed: bam po bzhi bcu rtsa brgyad pa /
translated: Book 48

original: des na gtan tshigs ma grub pa yin no zhes bya ba ni gang zhig gang gis rang gi nyid du bzung ba de la de'i chags pa dang bral ba ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pas gong du bshad pa'i gtan tshigs de ma grub pa yin
analyzed: des na gtan tshigs ma grub pa yin no zhes bya ba ni gang zhig gang gis rang gi nyid du bzung ba de la de'i chags pa dang bral ba ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pas gong du bshad pa'i gtan tshigs de ma grub pa yin
translated: Therefore, the reason is not established. This is because it was explained above with statements such as ‚ÄúThat which is grasped as its own nature by that is not free from attachment to that.‚Äù

original: no // rang gi blo la mi 'dod pa'i tshor ba'i rgyu nyid yin pas khyab pa yin la /
analyzed: no // rang gi blo la mi 'dod pa'i tshor ba'i rgyu nyid yin pas khyab pa yin la /
translated: Because it is the cause of a feeling that is not desired by one‚Äôs own mind, it is pervaded.

original: de dang 'gal ba yang mi 'dod pa'i tshor ba'i rgyu nyid yin pa de ltar na khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: de dang 'gal ba yang mi 'dod pa'i tshor ba'i rgyu nyid yin pa de ltar na khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
translated: And that which is contrary to that is the cause of a feeling that is not desired. Thus, there is the observation of a contradiction with the pervader.

original: gcig tu de ni sdug bsngal min //
analyzed: gcig tu de ni sdug bsngal min //
translated: It is not suffering in one way.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni @141b grub pa'i mtha' smra ba'i'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni @141b grub pa'i mtha' smra ba'i'o //
translated: This is the statement of the philosophical position.

original: de skad du lus kyi dbang po la sogs pa'i tshogs mi 'dod pa'i tshor ba'i rgyu nyid yin pa yang gal te mi 'dod pa tshor ba'i rgyu yin no zhes nges par gzung ba 'dod pa de'i tshe gtan tshigs ma grub pa yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur
analyzed: de skad du lus kyi dbang po la sogs pa'i tshogs mi 'dod pa'i tshor ba'i rgyu nyid yin pa yang gal te mi 'dod pa tshor ba'i rgyu yin no zhes nges par gzung ba 'dod pa de'i tshe gtan tshigs ma grub pa yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur
translated: If one asserts that the collection of the body faculty and so on is the cause of a feeling that is not desired, then if one asserts that it is the cause of a feeling that is not desired, at that time the reason is not established.

original: ro // ci ste 'ga' zhig gi tshe mi 'dod pa'i tshor ba'i rgyu yin zhes bya ba de'i tshe /
analyzed: ro // ci ste 'ga' zhig gi tshe mi 'dod pa'i tshor ba'i rgyu yin zhes bya ba de'i tshe /
translated: If one says that it is the cause of a feeling that is not desired at some time,

original: ma nges pa yin te 'ga' zhig gi tshe mi 'dod pa'i tshor ba'i rgyu yin na yang rnam grangs kyis rang gi blo bde ba'i rgyu nyid du mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma nges pa yin te 'ga' zhig gi tshe mi 'dod pa'i tshor ba'i rgyu yin na yang rnam grangs kyis rang gi blo bde ba'i rgyu nyid du mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not certain, because sometimes, even though it is a cause of unpleasant feeling, it is seen as a cause of mental pleasure in some way.

original: de nyid ni gang bdag tu chags pa bstan pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sbyor bas bstan to //
analyzed: de nyid ni gang bdag tu chags pa bstan pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sbyor bas bstan to //
translated: This is indicated by the passage beginning, ‚ÄúFor one who is attached to the self. . . .‚Äù

original: de sdug bsngal gyi rgyu nyid yin par shes na yang zhes bya ba ni bde ba'i rgyu de rnam grangs kyis sdug bsngal gyi rgyu nyid yin par shes nas yang ngo //
analyzed: de sdug bsngal gyi rgyu nyid yin par shes na yang zhes bya ba ni bde ba'i rgyu de rnam grangs kyis sdug bsngal gyi rgyu nyid yin par shes nas yang ngo //
translated: Even though one knows that it is a cause of suffering, means that even though one knows that this cause of pleasure is a cause of suffering in some way,

original: bde ba nye bar byed pa'i blo can du 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni bde ba spyod pa'i blo can du 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: bde ba nye bar byed pa'i blo can du 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni bde ba spyod pa'i blo can du 'gyur ba'o //
translated: one becomes one who is intent on pleasure, means that one becomes one who is intent on experiencing pleasure.

original: de lta na yang de las gzhan pa'i srog la gnod pa mi byed pa'i zhes bya ba ni dug dang bcas pa la sogs pa las gzhan du dug dang bcas pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: de lta na yang de las gzhan pa'i srog la gnod pa mi byed pa'i zhes bya ba ni dug dang bcas pa la sogs pa las gzhan du dug dang bcas pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: Even so, one does not harm another‚Äôs life, means that one does not harm another‚Äôs life except in the case of poisonous etc. ,

original: de'i phyir srog la sogs pa dang bde ba'i longs spyod shin tu khyad par can zhes bya ba la sogs pa las /
analyzed: de'i phyir srog la sogs pa dang bde ba'i longs spyod shin tu khyad par can zhes bya ba la sogs pa las /
translated: Therefore, because of the special attachment to life and so on and to the enjoyment of pleasure,

original: khyad par can gyi bde chags las //
analyzed: khyad par can gyi bde chags las //
translated: from that special attachment to pleasure,

original: rgyu de'i phyir zhes bya ba 'chad par 'gyur ba dang sbyar ro ;
analyzed: rgyu de'i phyir zhes bya ba 'chad par 'gyur ba dang sbyar ro ;
translated: the cause is connected with the explanation that will come.

original: / srog la sogs pa'i sgras ni stobs dang kha dog la sogs pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: / srog la sogs pa'i sgras ni stobs dang kha dog la sogs pa gzung ngo //
translated: The words ‚Äúand so on‚Äù in ‚Äúlife and so on‚Äù include strength, complexion, and so on.

original: srog la sogs pa dang bde ba'i longs spyod shin tu khyad par can ni zlas dbye ba'o //üîΩde dag de las thob par 'gyur ba de ltar na zhes bya ba ni srog dang rjes su 'brel pa can gyi bde ba sgrub par byed pa la sogs /
analyzed: srog la sogs pa dang bde ba'i longs spyod shin tu khyad par can ni zlas dbye ba'o // de dag de las thob par 'gyur ba de ltar na zhes bya ba ni srog dang rjes su 'brel pa can gyi bde ba sgrub par byed pa la sogs /
translated: The special enjoyment of life and so on is a compound.üîΩ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to the attainment of life and so on.üîΩThe attainment of life and so on is the attainment of pleasure that is connected with life and so on.

original: de las gzhan pa'i bde ba sgrub par byed pa 'byung ba'i ngang tshul can ni /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i bde ba sgrub par byed pa 'byung ba'i ngang tshul can ni /
translated: The attainment of pleasure that is different from that is the attainment of pleasure that is not connected with life and so on.

original: khyad par bde la sred pa yis //
analyzed: khyad par bde la sred pa yis //
translated: From that special attachment to pleasure,üîΩthe cause is connected with the explanation that will come.

original: zhes bya ba ni phal cher sdug bsngal sgrub par byed pa de las shin tu gzhan pa'i de lta bur gyur pa yang de yin la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni phal cher sdug bsngal sgrub par byed pa de las shin tu gzhan pa'i de lta bur gyur pa yang de yin la /
translated: That which is the opposite of that which is for the most part the producer of suffering is like that.

original: bde ba sgrub par byed pa yang de yin pas na de las gzhan pa'i bde ba sgrub par byed pa'o //
analyzed: bde ba sgrub par byed pa yang de yin pas na de las gzhan pa'i bde ba sgrub par byed pa'o //
translated: And it is the producer of pleasure, therefore it is the producer of pleasure that is the opposite of that.

original: de las 'byung ba'i ngang tshul gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de las 'byung ba'i ngang tshul gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: That which has the nature of arising from that is so-called.

original: de nas khyad par bde ba'i sgra dang las 'dzin pa bya ste /
analyzed: de nas khyad par bde ba'i sgra dang las 'dzin pa bya ste /
