translated: Then the word pleasure and the word life should be taken as different.

original: de la sred pa des so //
analyzed: de la sred pa des so //
translated: In that case, by that craving.

original: de las gzhan pa'i 'tsho ba rten med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni dug dang bcas pa'i zas las 'tsho ba'i rgyu gzhan med pa'i phyir ro zhes @142a * //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i 'tsho ba rten med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni dug dang bcas pa'i zas las 'tsho ba'i rgyu gzhan med pa'i phyir ro zhes @142a * //
translated: Because there is no other life apart from that, means because there is no other cause of life apart from poisoned food.

original: bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: chu bsil mo 'thung ba'am zhes bya ba 'jug par 'gyur te zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: chu bsil mo 'thung ba'am zhes bya ba 'jug par 'gyur te zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
translated: Or drinking cool water, means that one would enter.

original: bkres pa'i sdug bsngal gyis zhes bya ba ni dpe gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: bkres pa'i sdug bsngal gyis zhes bya ba ni dpe gnyis pa'o //
translated: The suffering of hunger, means the second example.

original: ci ste mya ngan las 'das pa'i gnas skabs na bde ba dang sdug bsngal thams cad nyams su myong ba'i rten gyi ngo bo dang bral ba nyid yin pa de bas na /
analyzed: ci ste mya ngan las 'das pa'i gnas skabs na bde ba dang sdug bsngal thams cad nyams su myong ba'i rten gyi ngo bo dang bral ba nyid yin pa de bas na /
translated: But if, at the time of nirvana, it is devoid of the entity that is the basis for the experience of all pleasure and pain,

original: de la bde ba'i srid pa yod pa ma yin na /
analyzed: de la bde ba'i srid pa yod pa ma yin na /
translated: then how could it be that ‚Äúthere is no existence of pleasure‚Äù for it?üîΩHow could it be that one would strive for it?

original: de ji ltar don du gnyer bar byed ces 'dod pa de'i phyir longs spyod la sogs pa'i rten thams cad zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de ji ltar don du gnyer bar byed ces 'dod pa de'i phyir longs spyod la sogs pa'i rten thams cad zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: In response to that assertion, he says, ‚Äúall the bases of enjoyment, etc.,‚Äù

original: med par khyad par med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar gal te bde ba dang sdug bsngal la sogs pa bdag gi yon tan gyi rten bdag gi rang gi ngo bo de las nyams pa de bas na ngo bo med pa nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: med par khyad par med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar gal te bde ba dang sdug bsngal la sogs pa bdag gi yon tan gyi rten bdag gi rang gi ngo bo de las nyams pa de bas na ngo bo med pa nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: ‚ÄúBecause there is no difference in nonexistence‚Äù means that if pleasure, pain, etc. were the qualities of the self, the self would lose its nature as the basis of those qualities, and therefore it would be nonexistent.

original: rang gi ngo bo khas mi len pa'i phyir dang / ngo bo gzhan skye ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo khas mi len pa'i phyir dang / ngo bo gzhan skye ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because its own nature is not accepted and because another nature does not arise.

original: ngo bo gzhan skye na ni bdag nyid mi rtag pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: ngo bo gzhan skye na ni bdag nyid mi rtag pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: If another nature arose, the self would be impermanent.

original: chags pa yis ni ji ltar 'dod //
analyzed: chags pa yis ni ji ltar 'dod //
translated: How could there be attachment to that which is desired?

original: chags pa byed pa po nyid du'o //
analyzed: chags pa byed pa po nyid du'o //
translated: The agent of attachment is the self.

original: myong dang tha snyad yon tan dag / kun gyi rten ni ldog pa can //
analyzed: myong dang tha snyad yon tan dag / kun gyi rten ni ldog pa can //
translated: The basis of all experience, convention, and qualities is the opposite.

original: zhes bya ba ni mdo yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni mdo yin no //
translated: This is the s≈´tra.

original: nyams su myong ba dang tha snyad dang / yon tan dag ces bya ba ni zlas dbye ba'o //
analyzed: nyams su myong ba dang tha snyad dang / yon tan dag ces bya ba ni zlas dbye ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúExperience, convention, and qualities‚Äù is a dvandva compound.

original: de nas kun gyi sgra dang zlas dbye ba bya'o //
analyzed: de nas kun gyi sgra dang zlas dbye ba bya'o //
translated: Then the word ‚Äúall‚Äù and the dvandva compound are to be construed.

original: de dag gi rten ni dngos po gtso bo yin te /
analyzed: de dag gi rten ni dngos po gtso bo yin te /
translated: The basis of those is the primary thing.üîΩThe basis of experience, convention, and qualities is the opposite.

original: gang la nyams su myong ba dang / tha snyad dang yon tan gyi rten nyid ldog pa yod pa zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: gang la nyams su myong ba dang / tha snyad dang yon tan gyi rten nyid ldog pa yod pa zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: This is how the sentence is to be analyzed.

original: de nyid ni nyams su myong ba thams cad kyi rten ldog pa can dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas tha dad pa'i sgo nas 'chad par byed do //
analyzed: de nyid ni nyams su myong ba thams cad kyi rten ldog pa can dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas tha dad pa'i sgo nas 'chad par byed do //
translated: That very thing is explained by the words ‚Äúthe basis of all experience is the opposite‚Äù and so on, by way of distinguishing it.

original: de ltar rang bzhin med pa las te ri bong gi rva la sogs pa las zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de ltar rang bzhin med pa las te ri bong gi rva la sogs pa las zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Thus, from that which lacks intrinsic nature, that is, from such things as the horns of a rabbit, it is said that ‚Äúall experience, convention, and qualities are the opposite.‚Äù

original: rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so zhes bya ba ni bdag med pa nyid ni nyams su myong ba dang tha snyad dang yon tan thams cad kyi rten ldog pa can gyi bdag nyid tsam dang rjes su 'brel pa can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so zhes bya ba ni bdag med pa nyid ni nyams su myong ba dang tha snyad dang yon tan thams cad kyi rten ldog pa can gyi bdag nyid tsam dang rjes su 'brel pa can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The argument from intrinsic nature is this: the very absence of self is related to the mere identity of the negation of the self that is the basis of experience, conventions, and all good qualities.

original: de ltar na don byed par nus pa'i mtshan nyid can ni yod pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: de ltar na don byed par nus pa'i mtshan nyid can ni yod pa nyid yin te /
translated: Thus, the characteristic of existence is the ability to perform a function.

original: re zhig 'di lta ste /
analyzed: re zhig 'di lta ste /
translated: The meaning of this is as follows:

original: nyams su myong ba skyed par byed pa'i don gyi bya ba 'di ni tha ma yin no //
analyzed: nyams su myong ba skyed par byed pa'i don gyi bya ba 'di ni tha ma yin no //
translated: The activity of an object that produces experience is the ultimate.

original: de las kyang de ldog pa yin na ji ltar na rang bzhin med par mi 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: de las kyang de ldog pa yin na ji ltar na rang bzhin med par mi 'gyur zhing /
translated: If that is negated, how could it not be the case that it lacks intrinsic nature?

original: nyams su myong ba dang tha snyad dang yon tan thams cad kyi rten @142b ldog pa can du 'dod pa la thams cad med par 'dod pas khyab pa yin te /
analyzed: nyams su myong ba dang tha snyad dang yon tan thams cad kyi rten @142b ldog pa can du 'dod pa la thams cad med par 'dod pas khyab pa yin te /
translated: If you assert that the basis of experience, conventions, and all good qualities is a negation, then it follows that you assert that everything is nonexistent.

original: de yang med pa de ltar na khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: de yang med pa de ltar na khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: If that is nonexistent, then the pervasion is the nonobservation of a pervader.

original: gang zhig gang yod na yang mi 'gyur ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sbyor ba la gang yod na mi 'gyur ba zhes bya ba 'di la gags byed par nus pa nyid ces bya ba'i khyad par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: gang zhig gang yod na yang mi 'gyur ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sbyor ba la gang yod na mi 'gyur ba zhes bya ba 'di la gags byed par nus pa nyid ces bya ba'i khyad par blta bar bya'o //
translated: In the syllogism ‚Äúwherever something exists, it does not change,‚Äù the phrase ‚Äúwherever something exists‚Äù should be understood as meaning ‚Äúwherever something is capable of obstructing.‚Äù

original: de lta ma yin na sbyang na gnas pa'i sa bon yod na myu gu 'byung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na sbyang na gnas pa'i sa bon yod na myu gu 'byung ba ma yin no //
translated: Otherwise, if the seed that exists in the burned area were the cause of the sprout, then the sprout would not arise from the seed that exists in the burned area.

original: de ltar na de'i rgyu mtshan can zhes bya ba 'khrul par 'gyur ro //üîΩyang na khyad par du byas pa la dogs pa cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar na de'i rgyu mtshan can zhes bya ba 'khrul par 'gyur ro // yang na khyad par du byas pa la dogs pa cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: In that case, the syllogism would be fallacious, because the reason would not be a property of the subject.

original: 'di ltar sbyang na gnas pa'i sa bon gyi rgyu mtshan can du myu gu mi 'gyur ba nyid yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar sbyang na gnas pa'i sa bon gyi rgyu mtshan can du myu gu mi 'gyur ba nyid yin te /
translated: Or, if the seed that exists in the burned area were the cause of the sprout, then the sprout would not be the effect of the seed that exists in the burned area.

original: de ni skad cig ma gzhan la rag lus pa'i skye ba can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni skad cig ma gzhan la rag lus pa'i skye ba can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the sprout would arise in dependence on another moment.

original: rgyu'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir nye bar btags nas de la rgyur tha snyad du byas pa yin pa de ltar na skyon yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rgyu'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir nye bar btags nas de la rgyur tha snyad du byas pa yin pa de ltar na skyon yod pa ma yin no //
translated: But because the seed that exists in the burned area is the material cause of the sprout, it is designated as the cause of the sprout. Therefore, there is no error.

original: de'i rgyu mtshan can nyid la de yod na yod par khyab pa yin la de dang 'gal bar yang med pa nyid yin pa de ltar na khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i rgyu mtshan can nyid la de yod na yod par khyab pa yin la de dang 'gal bar yang med pa nyid yin pa de ltar na khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
translated: The reason for that is: if it exists, it is pervaded by existence. And it is also non-existence, which is incompatible with that. Thus, there is the observation of an incompatible pervasion.

original: de yang ldog pa med pa nyid yin pa zhes bya ba ni bdag tu chags pa'o //üîΩde las lhag pa'i 'bras bu'i khyad par grub pa med pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba ni grub pas na grub pa ste ;
analyzed: de yang ldog pa med pa nyid yin pa zhes bya ba ni bdag tu chags pa'o // de las lhag pa'i 'bras bu'i khyad par grub pa med pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba ni grub pas na grub pa ste ;
translated: And that is attachment to self.üîΩBecause there is no establishment of a special result beyond that,

original: mngon sum gyi 'jug pa de las lhag pa'i 'bras bu'i khyad par grub pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon sum gyi 'jug pa de las lhag pa'i 'bras bu'i khyad par grub pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no establishment of a special result beyond that direct engagement.

original: mngon sum gyi 'jug pa nyid bsgoms pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mngon sum gyi 'jug pa nyid bsgoms pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the direct engagement itself is the result of cultivation and so on.

original: de yod na yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la so so'i skye bo'i gnas skabs na /
analyzed: de yod na yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la so so'i skye bo'i gnas skabs na /
translated: Even if it exists, etc. In the state of an ordinary being,

original: sdug bsngal mngon sum du byas pa yod na /
analyzed: sdug bsngal mngon sum du byas pa yod na /
translated: if suffering is made manifest,

original: yang 'dod chags dang bral ba mi 'byung ba ni'o //
analyzed: yang 'dod chags dang bral ba mi 'byung ba ni'o //
translated: there is no further occurrence of detachment.

original: de sngar yang ni zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags dang bral ba ma yin pa'i gnas skabs na'o //üîΩde la 'dod chags dang bral ba thob pa'i rgyu ni de la chags pa med pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: de sngar yang ni zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags dang bral ba ma yin pa'i gnas skabs na'o // de la 'dod chags dang bral ba thob pa'i rgyu ni de la chags pa med pa nyid yin la /
translated: ‚ÄúPreviously‚Äù refers to the time when one is not free from attachment.üîΩThe cause of attaining freedom from attachment is the absence of attachment.

original: de dang 'gal ba ni chags pa dang ldan pa yin la /
analyzed: de dang 'gal ba ni chags pa dang ldan pa yin la /
translated: The cause of that is the presence of attachment.

original: de ltar na rgyu 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //üîΩgtan tshigs ma nges pa'am zhes bya ba ni bdag tu chags pa dang bral ba la yod na yang skyon mthong ba'i yul la 'dod chags dang bral ba dmigs pa'i phyir ro //üîΩci ste ma nges pa'i skyon bsal bar bya ba'i phyir skyon ma mthong ba yod na bdag tu @143a * //
analyzed: de ltar na rgyu 'gal ba dmigs pa'o // gtan tshigs ma nges pa'am zhes bya ba ni bdag tu chags pa dang bral ba la yod na yang skyon mthong ba'i yul la 'dod chags dang bral ba dmigs pa'i phyir ro // ci ste ma nges pa'i skyon bsal bar bya ba'i phyir skyon ma mthong ba yod na bdag tu @143a * //
translated: Thus, the cause of the cause is observed.üîΩ‚ÄúThe reason is indeterminate‚Äù means that even when one is free from attachment to the self, one can still observe the absence of attachment to objects that are seen to be faulty.

original: chags pa dang ldan pa'i zhes bya ba khyad par dang bcas pa'i gtan tshigs la brten pa yin pa de bas na ma grub pa nyid yin no zhes smos te /
analyzed: chags pa dang ldan pa'i zhes bya ba khyad par dang bcas pa'i gtan tshigs la brten pa yin pa de bas na ma grub pa nyid yin no zhes smos te /
translated: If one were to add the qualification ‚Äúwhen one does not see any faults‚Äù to the reason, then the reason would not be established.

original: thar pa'i gnas skabs na dor bar bya ba'i dngos po la skyon du ma mthong ba nyid ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thar pa'i gnas skabs na dor bar bya ba'i dngos po la skyon du ma mthong ba nyid ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not established that one sees faults in the things to be abandoned at the time of liberation.

original: yul gzhan la 'byung ba can gyi 'dod chags kyi lhag ma ni zhes bya ba ni bud med gang la 'dod chags dang ma bral ba de la 'byung ba can gyi'o //
analyzed: yul gzhan la 'byung ba can gyi 'dod chags kyi lhag ma ni zhes bya ba ni bud med gang la 'dod chags dang ma bral ba de la 'byung ba can gyi'o //
translated: The remainder of attachment that occurs in relation to other objects refers to that which occurs in relation to a woman from whom one is not detached.

original: bud med de la yang zhes bya ba ni gang la rnam pa 'ga' zhig gi 'dod chags dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: bud med de la yang zhes bya ba ni gang la rnam pa 'ga' zhig gi 'dod chags dang bral ba'o //
translated: And in relation to that woman refers to one from whom one is detached in some way.

original: de nyid ni de ltar na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de nyid ni de ltar na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: That very is stated in the verse that begins, ‚ÄúIn that case.‚Äù

original: gang la bdag tu chags pa la sogs pa 'byung ba'i ngang tshul can de'i skyon yod pa zhes bya ba ni bdag tu chags pa la sogs pa la 'byung ba'i ngang tshul can gyi skyon gang yin pa'i skyon de nyid ni sdug bsngal gyi rgyu nyid yin no
analyzed: gang la bdag tu chags pa la sogs pa 'byung ba'i ngang tshul can de'i skyon yod pa zhes bya ba ni bdag tu chags pa la sogs pa la 'byung ba'i ngang tshul can gyi skyon gang yin pa'i skyon de nyid ni sdug bsngal gyi rgyu nyid yin no
translated: The faults that occur in the nature of attachment to self and so on are the faults that occur in the nature of attachment to self and so on. Those faults are the cause of suffering.

original: // chags pa de ni bdag yod na yang ngo //
analyzed: // chags pa de ni bdag yod na yang ngo //
translated: That attachment occurs even when the self exists.

original: bdag gi chags pa'i rgyu bdag gi blo la zhes bya ba ni gzhi mthun pa'i drug pa'o //
analyzed: bdag gi chags pa'i rgyu bdag gi blo la zhes bya ba ni gzhi mthun pa'i drug pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe cause of my attachment is my mind‚Äù is the sixth case, the genitive, in common usage.

original: de bas na nye bar zhi ba la de'i rgyu la gnod par byed pas khyab pa yin la /
analyzed: de bas na nye bar zhi ba la de'i rgyu la gnod par byed pas khyab pa yin la /
translated: Therefore, the cause of pacification is the harm to that.

original: de 'di la med pa de ltar na khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: de 'di la med pa de ltar na khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: That is not found here. Thus, there is non-observation of the pervader.

original: ma grub pa yang rigs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni bdag gir chags pa'i rgyu yon tan du lta ba'i gnod par byed par sdug bsngal bsgom pa yin pa de bas na bdag gir chags pa'i rgyu'i gnod par byed pa nyid skyon mthong ba yin pa
analyzed: ma grub pa yang rigs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni bdag gir chags pa'i rgyu yon tan du lta ba'i gnod par byed par sdug bsngal bsgom pa yin pa de bas na bdag gir chags pa'i rgyu'i gnod par byed pa nyid skyon mthong ba yin pa
translated: It is also unreasonable to claim that the reason is not established. The meditation on suffering is the harm to the cause of attachment to ‚Äúmine,‚Äù the view of the qualities. Therefore, the harm to the cause of attachment to ‚Äúmine‚Äù is the observation of faults.

original: de ltar na /
analyzed: de ltar na /
translated: Thus,

original: bdag bshad ma thag pa'i gtan tshigs ma grub par dogs pa gang yin pa de rigs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bdag bshad ma thag pa'i gtan tshigs ma grub par dogs pa gang yin pa de rigs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: it is unreasonable to doubt that the reason just explained is not established. This is the meaning.

original: bdag gi nyid yod na'ang /
analyzed: bdag gi nyid yod na'ang /
translated: Even if ‚Äúmine‚Äù exists,

original: 'das sogs la ni zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe sngar bdag gi nyid yod na yang 'das pa la sogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'das sogs la ni zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe sngar bdag gi nyid yod na yang 'das pa la sogs par 'gyur te /
translated: ‚Äúin the past, etc.‚Äù means that even if ‚Äúmine‚Äù exists, it would be in the past, etc.

original: de la med pa ni bdag tu chags pa dang bral ba nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de la med pa ni bdag tu chags pa dang bral ba nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúnon-existence‚Äù is the absence of attachment to a self.

original: de ni gang gi tshe bdag gi'i yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed do //
analyzed: de ni gang gi tshe bdag gi'i yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed do //
translated: He explains that with ‚Äúwhen there is attachment to a self,‚Äù and so on.

original: de la yon tan du mthong bas byas pa nyid la skyon dang ldan du zin kyang skyon med par mthong bas khyab pa yin la de dang 'gal ba yang skyon mthong ba nyid yin pa de ltar na /
analyzed: de la yon tan du mthong bas byas pa nyid la skyon dang ldan du zin kyang skyon med par mthong bas khyab pa yin la de dang 'gal ba yang skyon mthong ba nyid yin pa de ltar na /
translated: There, the reason is established by the evidence, because of seeing the qualities. Even if there is a fault in the action, it is seen as faultless. And the evidence is contradictory, because of seeing the fault.

original: sbyor ba gnyis pas yang khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: sbyor ba gnyis pas yang khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the second syllogism is also a case of the perception of a contradiction with the pervasion.

original: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi bdag gir chags pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pas gzhan gyi bsam pa'i dogs pa bsu ba @143b yin no //
analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi bdag gir chags pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pas gzhan gyi bsam pa'i dogs pa bsu ba @143b yin no //
translated: That is true, but he anticipates the opponent‚Äôs doubt with ‚Äúbecause of attachment to a self,‚Äù and so on.

original: gtan tshigs ma grub pa yin no zhe na zhes bya ba ni dbang po la sogs pa yul la chags pa'i rgyu bdag gi blo la sdug bsngal bsgom pa gnod par byed pa yin pa de ltar na /
analyzed: gtan tshigs ma grub pa yin no zhe na zhes bya ba ni dbang po la sogs pa yul la chags pa'i rgyu bdag gi blo la sdug bsngal bsgom pa gnod par byed pa yin pa de ltar na /
translated: If you say that the reason is not established, the reason is that the faculties and so on are the cause of attachment to objects. The meditation on the suffering of the mind is the harm.

original: gtan tshigs su bshad pa de ma grub pa yin te /
analyzed: gtan tshigs su bshad pa de ma grub pa yin te /
translated: The reason is not established.

original: sdug bsngal bsgom pa bdag gi blo la gnod par byed pa yin no zhes bshad pa ma thag pa'i tshul gyis so //
analyzed: sdug bsngal bsgom pa bdag gi blo la gnod par byed pa yin no zhes bshad pa ma thag pa'i tshul gyis so //
translated: The cultivation of suffering is harmful to my mind, as was just explained.

original: gtan tshigs gang dag gis zhes bya ba ni /üîΩbyis stsogs la yang yod phyir dang / skyon ldan pa yang yod phyir ro //
analyzed: gtan tshigs gang dag gis zhes bya ba ni / byis stsogs la yang yod phyir dang / skyon ldan pa yang yod phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúBy what reasons?‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa dag gis so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa dag gis so //
translated: Because it exists even in fools and so on, and because it exists even in those with faults.üîΩ‚ÄúBecause it is not the cause of seeing good qualities‚Äù means that it is a bahuvrƒ´hi compound.

original: yon tan mthong ba'i rgyu can ma yin pa de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gang la yon tan mthong ba'i rgyu yod pa zhes bya ba ni 'bru mang po pa'o //
analyzed: yon tan mthong ba'i rgyu can ma yin pa de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gang la yon tan mthong ba'i rgyu yod pa zhes bya ba ni 'bru mang po pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause it is not the cause of seeing good qualities‚Äù means that it is a bahuvrƒ´hi compound.

original: gang zhig gis gang gi rgyu la gnod pa byed pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba la sogs ba'i sbyor ba 'dir yang brjod par bya ste zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gang zhig gis gang gi rgyu la gnod pa byed pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba la sogs ba'i sbyor ba 'dir yang brjod par bya ste zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚ÄúOne should state the application here, such as ‚ÄòThat which is not harmful to the cause of that . . .‚Äô‚Äù

original: gang zhig gang gi rgyu la gnod par byed pa ma yin pa de ni de las de nye bar zhi ba ma yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig gang gi rgyu la gnod par byed pa ma yin pa de ni de las de nye bar zhi ba ma yin te /
translated: That which is not harmful to the cause of that is not pacified from that.

original: dper na bad kan gyi nad kyi gzhi la gnod pa byed pa ma yin pa mngar zhing bsil la snum pa la sogs pa bad kan gyi nad rab tu zhi ba ma yin pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na bad kan gyi nad kyi gzhi la gnod pa byed pa ma yin pa mngar zhing bsil la snum pa la sogs pa bad kan gyi nad rab tu zhi ba ma yin pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, sweet, cold, oily, etc. are not harmful to the basis of a phlegm disease, but they are not pacifiers of a phlegm disease.

original: sdug bsngal bsgom pa yang dbang po la sogs pa'i yul la chags pa'i rgyu bdag gi blo la gnod pa byed pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal bsgom pa yang dbang po la sogs pa'i yul la chags pa'i rgyu bdag gi blo la gnod pa byed pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: And the cultivation of suffering is not harmful to the idea of self, which is the cause of attachment to the objects of the senses, etc.

original: ma grub pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar bdag gi blo yon tan mthong ba'i rgyu can ma yin gyi /
analyzed: ma grub pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar bdag gi blo yon tan mthong ba'i rgyu can ma yin gyi /
translated: Nor is it unestablished. It is not unestablished in this way: the idea of self is not caused by the perception of a quality,

original: 'on kyang bdag tu chags pa'i rgyu can yin la /
analyzed: 'on kyang bdag tu chags pa'i rgyu can yin la /
translated: but rather it is caused by attachment to self.

original: de la sdug bsngal bsgom pa gnod pa byed pa ma yin pa de ltar na ma grub pa yang ma yin no //üîΩmchog kyang de yin la gzhan yang yin pa zhes bya ba ni khyad par gyi bsdu ba'i khyad par du 'phags pa'i yin pa'i phyir mchog yin no //
analyzed: de la sdug bsngal bsgom pa gnod pa byed pa ma yin pa de ltar na ma grub pa yang ma yin no // mchog kyang de yin la gzhan yang yin pa zhes bya ba ni khyad par gyi bsdu ba'i khyad par du 'phags pa'i yin pa'i phyir mchog yin no //
translated: And the cultivation of suffering is not harmful to that.üîΩIt is supreme and it is also other. It is supreme because it is the supreme inclusion of distinctions.

original: cig shos nyid yin pa'i phyir gzhan yin te /
analyzed: cig shos nyid yin pa'i phyir gzhan yin te /
translated: It is other because it is the other.

original: cig shos khyad par du 'phags pa don du gnyer ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: cig shos khyad par du 'phags pa don du gnyer ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The other is for the sake of the special.

original: de nyid ni gang gi phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed do //
analyzed: de nyid ni gang gi phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed do //
translated: That is what is being said by ‚Äúbecause of that‚Äù and so on.

original: gzhan dang gzhan zhes bya ba ni sngar rnyed pa de las gzhan no //üîΩgal te nga'i bdag lha la sogs par gyur cig ces /
analyzed: gzhan dang gzhan zhes bya ba ni sngar rnyed pa de las gzhan no // gal te nga'i bdag lha la sogs par gyur cig ces /
translated: ‚ÄúAnother and another‚Äù means other than the one previously obtained.üîΩ‚ÄúIf I were a god, and so on‚Äù is for the sake of one‚Äôs own self.

original: bdag gzhan don du gnyer ba yang yod pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: bdag gzhan don du gnyer ba yang yod pa yin no zhe na /
translated: ‚ÄúIf I were a god, and so on‚Äù is for the sake of others.

original: gang gi tshe yang nga'i bdag 'di lta bur gyur cig ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: gang gi tshe yang nga'i bdag 'di lta bur gyur cig ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: ‚ÄúIf I were like this‚Äù and so on is for the sake of both.

original: dper na lha sbyin ji skad du bshad pa'i rim pa zhes bya @144a * //
analyzed: dper na lha sbyin ji skad du bshad pa'i rim pa zhes bya @144a * //
translated: ‚ÄúFor example, Devadatta‚Äù is as explained in the stages.

original: ba ni bdag las ba lang la sogs pa tha dad pa'i blo'i rgyu mtshan nyid kyis zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ba ni bdag las ba lang la sogs pa tha dad pa'i blo'i rgyu mtshan nyid kyis zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúThe reason for the cognition of a cow and so on as different from the self‚Äù is the meaning.

original: dpe 'di nyid kyis bsgrub par bya ba'i chos kyi rjes su 'gro ba bstan to //
analyzed: dpe 'di nyid kyis bsgrub par bya ba'i chos kyi rjes su 'gro ba bstan to //
translated: By this very example, the pervasion of the probandum is shown.

original: med pa can ma yin te zhes bya ba ni rtag tu thag nye ba nyid do //
analyzed: med pa can ma yin te zhes bya ba ni rtag tu thag nye ba nyid do //
translated: ‚ÄúNot without‚Äù means always nearby.

original: de yang zhes dang yin te zhes bya ba ni yid mi bde bas byas pa'i khro ba ni zhe sdang ngo //
analyzed: de yang zhes dang yin te zhes bya ba ni yid mi bde bas byas pa'i khro ba ni zhe sdang ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúMoreover‚Äù and ‚Äúbecause‚Äù mean that anger produced by mental dissatisfaction is hatred.

original: gal te zhe sdang dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i yid mi bde ba tsam gyi yid byung ba de ji ltar na zhe sdang yin par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gal te zhe sdang dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i yid mi bde ba tsam gyi yid byung ba de ji ltar na zhe sdang yin par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If mental dissatisfaction is merely mental dissatisfaction that is concomitant with hatred, how can it be hatred?

original: zhe sdang dang bral ba'i yid mi bde ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhe sdang dang bral ba'i yid mi bde ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no mental dissatisfaction that is free from hatred.

original: yid mi bde ba rang gi yul la skye bar 'gyur ba na yongs su dor ba la ltos nas skye bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: yid mi bde ba rang gi yul la skye bar 'gyur ba na yongs su dor ba la ltos nas skye bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: When mental dissatisfaction arises with regard to its object, it arises in dependence on the rejection of that object.

original: yongs su spong ba'i rnam pa can yang zhe sdang yin no //
analyzed: yongs su spong ba'i rnam pa can yang zhe sdang yin no //
translated: Moreover, hatred has the aspect of rejection.

original: lung pa yad don 'di mthong ngo zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: lung pa yad don 'di mthong ngo zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate this meaning of the scriptures, he says,

original: dper na 'phags pa gnas brtan pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos to de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: dper na 'phags pa gnas brtan pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos to de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: for example, the noble Sthavira.

original: phyir mi 'ong ba dang dgra bcom pa la yid me bde ba mi 'dod do //
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba dang dgra bcom pa la yid me bde ba mi 'dod do //
translated: Therefore, mental dissatisfaction is not accepted for nonreturners and arhats.

original: de dag gi lung gi khyad par gang la yang dgra bcom pa dag kyang yi rangs te zhes 'don pa de la yang yi rang ba las sdug bsngal la dmigs pa'i sems kyi 'jug pa yi rang ba med pa gzhan yin gyi /
analyzed: de dag gi lung gi khyad par gang la yang dgra bcom pa dag kyang yi rangs te zhes 'don pa de la yang yi rang ba las sdug bsngal la dmigs pa'i sems kyi 'jug pa yi rang ba med pa gzhan yin gyi /
translated: And in the scriptures of those schools, the phrase ‚Äúeven the Arhats rejoice‚Äù is interpreted as meaning that they rejoice in the scriptures, not that they rejoice in the mental activity that focuses on suffering.

original: yid mi bde ba ma yin zhes de dag gis khas blangs pa yin no//
analyzed: yid mi bde ba ma yin zhes de dag gis khas blangs pa yin no//
translated: Thus they accept that it is not mental dissatisfaction.

original: skyo ba dang skyo ba med pa'i mtshan nyid can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags dang bral ba la zhe sdang dang rdzas su chags pa med pa'i rang bzhin can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: skyo ba dang skyo ba med pa'i mtshan nyid can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags dang bral ba la zhe sdang dang rdzas su chags pa med pa'i rang bzhin can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Because it has the characteristics of weariness and non-weariness, it is by nature free from attachment and aversion, and it is not substantially existent.

original: gal te 'on de bas na zhe sdang dang mtshungs par ldan pa yin mi bde ba nyid yin pa de bas na ;
analyzed: gal te 'on de bas na zhe sdang dang mtshungs par ldan pa yin mi bde ba nyid yin pa de bas na ;
translated: If mental dissatisfaction is associated with aversion, then it is unpleasant.

original: mi dge ba nyid yin pa'i phyir de bsten par bya ba nyid du bstan par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: mi dge ba nyid yin pa'i phyir de bsten par bya ba nyid du bstan par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it should not be taught as something to be cultivated, because it is nonvirtuous.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang dge slong dag yid 'byung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan pa de ci ltar 'thad pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang dge slong dag yid 'byung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan pa de ci ltar 'thad pa yin zhe na /
translated: And how is it tenable that the Lord taught, ‚ÄúMonks, in order to turn away from the world,‚Äù and so on?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis yid mi bde ba de 'dra ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis yid mi bde ba de 'dra ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la /
translated: The Lord said, ‚ÄúMonks, that kind of mental dissatisfaction,‚Äù and so on.

original: dge ba'i chos skyed par byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dge ba'i chos skyed par byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Because it generates virtuous qualities.

original: de las yid 'byung bas nges par de'i gnyen po'i phyogs kyi dge ba'i chos bstan ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las yid 'byung bas nges par de'i gnyen po'i phyogs kyi dge ba'i chos bstan ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Since one turns away from the world through that, the Lord taught the virtuous qualities that are its antidote.

original: gang gi tshe yang de 'jug pa'i rgyu dang 'gal ba'i rkyen zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: gang gi tshe yang de 'jug pa'i rgyu dang 'gal ba'i rkyen zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: When it is the cause of engaging that, and the conditions are adverse,

original: sdug bsngal de'i 'jug pa'i rgyu gang yin pa de dang @144b 'gal ba bde ba'i rgyu de nye bas zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sdug bsngal de'i 'jug pa'i rgyu gang yin pa de dang @144b 'gal ba bde ba'i rgyu de nye bas zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: it is the cause of pleasure, which is incompatible with the cause of engaging that suffering. The meaning is that it is close by.

original: bdag gi dngos po zhes bya ba nye bar len pa'i phung po'i tshogs sred pa las zhes bya ba ni gzhi ma thun pa'i bdun pa'o //
analyzed: bdag gi dngos po zhes bya ba nye bar len pa'i phung po'i tshogs sred pa las zhes bya ba ni gzhi ma thun pa'i bdun pa'o //
translated: The collection of appropriated aggregates is called ‚Äúone‚Äôs own thing.‚Äù Craving is the common ground.

original: tsandan dang ste'u dag dang 'dra bar zhes bya ba la 'dra ba'i sgra ni mtshungs pa'i rnam grangs yin no //
analyzed: tsandan dang ste'u dag dang 'dra bar zhes bya ba la 'dra ba'i sgra ni mtshungs pa'i rnam grangs yin no //
translated: Like sandalwood and a goad means that the word like is a synonym for as.

original: de nyid kyi phyir tsandan dang ste'u dag dang 'dra ba zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir tsandan dang ste'u dag dang 'dra ba zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: For that very reason, it says like sandalwood and a goad.

original: de nyid ni de la skyas bu gcig sems dang ba can gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pas gsal bar byed do //üîΩde bzhin du tsandan dang ste'u dag la yin te zhes bya ba ni zhe sdang dang mngon par chags pa ma yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //üîΩji ltar skyes bu byed pa po la rjes su chags pa dang khong khro ba med ba de ltar tsandan dang ste'u byed par gyur pa la yang ngo zhes bya ba'i dob to //
analyzed: de nyid ni de la skyas bu gcig sems dang ba can gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pas gsal bar byed do // de bzhin du tsandan dang ste'u dag la yin te zhes bya ba ni zhe sdang dang mngon par chags pa ma yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro // ji ltar skyes bu byed pa po la rjes su chags pa dang khong khro ba med ba de ltar tsandan dang ste'u byed par gyur pa la yang ngo zhes bya ba'i dob to //
translated: That very thing is clarified by In that regard, a person with a pure mind... and so on.üîΩSimilarly, in the case of sandalwood and a goad means without hatred and attachment, as should be connected.üîΩThe meaning is: Just as the person, without attachment and aversion, is the agent, in the same way, sandalwood and a goad become the agent.

original: gal te sdug bsngal bsgom bas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: gal te sdug bsngal bsgom bas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: If it is asked, How is it that the person, without attachment and aversion, is the agent? it is said, Just as the person, without attachment and aversion, is the agent, in the same way, sandalwood and a goad become the agent.üîΩIf it is asked, How is it that sandalwood and a goad become the agent? it is said, Just as the person, without attachment and aversion, is the agent, in the same way, sandalwood and a goad become the agent.

original: 'di ltar gzhung 'dis ni yon tan mthong ba las 'jug bar brjod cing yang yon tan ma mthong bas spong ba brjod pa de bas na /
analyzed: 'di ltar gzhung 'dis ni yon tan mthong ba las 'jug bar brjod cing yang yon tan ma mthong bas spong ba brjod pa de bas na /
translated: Thus, this passage states that one enters into the desire realm through seeing its virtues, and it states that one abandons it through not seeing its virtues.

original: rang nyid sdug bsngal bsgom pas 'dod pa spong ba'i thabs bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rang nyid sdug bsngal bsgom pas 'dod pa spong ba'i thabs bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it teaches the method of abandoning desire through cultivating the contemplation of suffering.

original: de dang mtshungs par ldan ba ni sems dang sems las byung ba'i tshogs so //
analyzed: de dang mtshungs par ldan ba ni sems dang sems las byung ba'i tshogs so //
translated: ‚Äú Associated with that‚Äù refers to the collection of mind and mental factors.

original: de dang 'brel pa las ni sdug bsngal gyi nyams su myong ba'i 'gyur ba'i yul lo //
analyzed: de dang 'brel pa las ni sdug bsngal gyi nyams su myong ba'i 'gyur ba'i yul lo //
translated: ‚Äú Related to that‚Äù refers to the object of the experience of suffering.

original: rtog par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba mngon sum du byed pa'o //
analyzed: rtog par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba mngon sum du byed pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú One conceives‚Äù means one actualizes.

original: nga'i zhes bya ba ni bdag tha dad ba ste /
analyzed: nga'i zhes bya ba ni bdag tha dad ba ste /
translated: ‚Äú Mine‚Äù refers to a separate self.

original: bdag gi rten du gyur to zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩ'di ni nga'i zhes bya ba ni bdag tha dad pa med par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: bdag gi rten du gyur to zhes bya ba'i don to // 'di ni nga'i zhes bya ba ni bdag tha dad pa med par rtog pa'o //
translated: It means ‚Äúit becomes the basis of my self.‚ÄùüîΩ‚Äú This is mine‚Äù refers to the conception of a non-separate self.

original: 'di ni bdag go zhes bya ba ni gcig tu tha dad pa nyid yin mod kyi /
analyzed: 'di ni bdag go zhes bya ba ni gcig tu tha dad pa nyid yin mod kyi /
translated: ‚Äú This is my self‚Äù refers to the conception of a separate self.

original: 'on kyang blo'i dbang po la sogs pa rnams kyi rten du gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang blo'i dbang po la sogs pa rnams kyi rten du gyur ba yin no //
translated: but it is the support of the faculties of sensation, etc.

original: de ltar mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal ba dag la gnas par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la 'gyur bar ni 'dod mod kyi gdul bya'i khyad par gyis thams mang po bstan par bya ba'i phyir rnam pa gzhan bstan pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal ba dag la gnas par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la 'gyur bar ni 'dod mod kyi gdul bya'i khyad par gyis thams mang po bstan par bya ba'i phyir rnam pa gzhan bstan pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that the S≈´tra teaches the impermanence and the suffering of the aggregates in order to introduce the non-self of the aggregates, we would reply that the S≈´tra would not speak of abiding in impermanence and in suffering.

original: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi bdag med pa nyid mthong ba dang 'dra ba mi rtag pa la sogs pa mthong ba yang nyon mongs pa'i rgyu 'jig tshogs su lta ba dang / dngos su 'gal bar 'gyur na 'gal ba yang ma yin no //üîΩbya dang longs spyod bdag gi mtshan nyid can gyi'o zhes bya ba ni bya ba dang longs spyod kyi rten yin pa las na bya ba dang longs spyod kyi sgra dag gis bshad do //
analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi bdag med pa nyid mthong ba dang 'dra ba mi rtag pa la sogs pa mthong ba yang nyon mongs pa'i rgyu 'jig tshogs su lta ba dang / dngos su 'gal bar 'gyur na 'gal ba yang ma yin no // bya dang longs spyod bdag gi mtshan nyid can gyi'o zhes bya ba ni bya ba dang longs spyod kyi rten yin pa las na bya ba dang longs spyod kyi sgra dag gis bshad do //
translated: But, even if this is so, the seeing of impermanence, etc., is similar to the seeing of non-self, for both are opposed to the afflicted view of self, which is the cause of the defilements.üîΩThe self is the object of the notion of ‚ÄúI‚Äù and of the idea of ‚Äúmine.‚Äù The self is the object of the notion of ‚ÄúI,‚Äù of the idea of ‚Äúmine,‚Äù and of the affection that one has for oneself.

original: bya ba dang @145a * //
analyzed: bya ba dang @145a * //
translated: The self is the object of the notion of ‚ÄúI‚Äù and of the idea of ‚Äúmine.‚Äù

original: longs spyod kyi bdag nyid can gyi bdag gi rang gi ngo bo de dang 'gal ba yang bya ba dang longs spyod dang bral pa nyid yin pa de ltar na rang bzhin 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: longs spyod kyi bdag nyid can gyi bdag gi rang gi ngo bo de dang 'gal ba yang bya ba dang longs spyod dang bral pa nyid yin pa de ltar na rang bzhin 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
translated: The self that has the nature of enjoyment is incompatible with the nature of the self that is devoid of action and enjoyment. Thus, there is the observation of an intrinsic nature that is incompatible.

original: yang na zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba gnyis pa ste /
analyzed: yang na zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba gnyis pa ste /
translated: Or, the second application is as follows:

original: 'di las byas ba'i 'bras bu longs mi spyod pa zhes brjod kyi /
analyzed: 'di las byas ba'i 'bras bu longs mi spyod pa zhes brjod kyi /
translated: It is said that the result of an action is not enjoyed from this action,

original: rang gis byas pa'i zhes bya ba ma yin pa de ltar ni khyad par ni de yod do //
analyzed: rang gis byas pa'i zhes bya ba ma yin pa de ltar ni khyad par ni de yod do //
translated: but not that the result of an action is not enjoyed by the self that performs the action. Thus, there is this difference.

original: de yang rgyas par bstan zin to zhes bya ba ni le'u dang por lung tshad ma ma yin par ro //
analyzed: de yang rgyas par bstan zin to zhes bya ba ni le'u dang por lung tshad ma ma yin par ro //
translated: And that has been explained extensively, in the first chapter, in the demonstration that scripture is not a means of valid knowledge.

original: sa dang chu'i chos yin gyi zhes bya ba la lci ba ni sa dang chu'i rdzas kyi chos yin gyi'o //
analyzed: sa dang chu'i chos yin gyi zhes bya ba la lci ba ni sa dang chu'i rdzas kyi chos yin gyi'o //
translated: Weight is a quality of the substances earth and water.

original: lus dang ldan pa la la yang zhes bya ba ni ma lce la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: lus dang ldan pa la la yang zhes bya ba ni ma lce la sogs pa'o //
translated: Some who possess a body are snakes, etc.

original: gal te sdig pa lci ba'i mtshan nyid yin pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gal te sdig pa lci ba'i mtshan nyid yin pa de'i tshe /
translated: If weight is the characteristic of sin,

original: phyi rol gyi lci ba la yang 'gyur na yod ba la yang 'gyur na yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi lci ba la yang 'gyur na yod ba la yang 'gyur na yod pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not the case that what exists is heavy.

original: de nyid ni tshva la sogs pa'i bdag nyid rang bzhin nyid kyis lci ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de nyid ni tshva la sogs pa'i bdag nyid rang bzhin nyid kyis lci ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: It is just that salt, etc. are heavy by their very nature.

original: mig la sogs pa lnga dang yin ni skye mched de drug go //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa lnga dang yin ni skye mched de drug go //
translated: The six sense bases are the five beginning with the eye and the sixth being mind.

original: 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur ba dang sems las byung ba dang ni ci rigs de dang lhan cig 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur ba dang sems las byung ba dang ni ci rigs de dang lhan cig 'byung ba'o //
translated: The elements and the derivative of the elements and the mental factors arise together with them as is appropriate.

original: log par shes dang de las byung ba ni //üîΩlog shes dang ni de las byung //
analyzed: log par shes dang de las byung ba ni // log shes dang ni de las byung //
translated: From that, the false view arises.

original: sred dang ngo //
analyzed: sred dang ngo //
translated: From that, craving arises.

original: de dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems pa de'i dbang gis so //
analyzed: de dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems pa de'i dbang gis so //
translated: From that, the volition that is concomitant with that arises.

original: de nyid ni sdug bsngal la phyin ci log pa'i blo dang bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed do //
analyzed: de nyid ni sdug bsngal la phyin ci log pa'i blo dang bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed do //
translated: That is explained by the intellect that is mistaken about suffering, action, etc.

original: de yang bstan zin to zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de yang bstan zin to zhes bya ba ni /
translated: That has already been explained.

original: sdug bsngal phyin ci log blo dang / sred pa kun nas 'ching pa'i rgyu //
analyzed: sdug bsngal phyin ci log blo dang / sred pa kun nas 'ching pa'i rgyu //
translated: The intellect that is mistaken about suffering, and craving, are the cause of the bondage of action.

original: gang gi skye ba zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
analyzed: gang gi skye ba zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause of the cessation of that‚Äù and so on.

original: de'i phyir de bcad skye mi 'gyur //
analyzed: de'i phyir de bcad skye mi 'gyur //
translated: Therefore, there is no arising of that.

original: 'khor bar skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'khor bar skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: There is no arising in cyclic existence.

original: bshad ma thag pa'i sems de gcod par byed pas na /
analyzed: bshad ma thag pa'i sems de gcod par byed pas na /
translated: Because of the cessation of the mind that was just explained,

original: de bcad pa'i sems pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi las snga ma snga ma mngon par 'dus byas pa las zhes bya ba ni khyad par can gyi nus pa dang ldan pa'i skad cig ma phyi ma phyi ma skyed pa las zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de bcad pa'i sems pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi las snga ma snga ma mngon par 'dus byas pa las zhes bya ba ni khyad par can gyi nus pa dang ldan pa'i skad cig ma phyi ma phyi ma skyed pa las zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: ‚Äúfrom the prior performance of the action that has the nature of the mind‚Äù means from the prior performance of the action that has the nature of the mind, which is the cause of the cessation of that mind. The meaning is: from the production of the subsequent moment that possesses special potency.

original: de nyid ni phyi ma phyi ma zhes bya bas 'chad par byed do //
analyzed: de nyid ni phyi ma phyi ma zhes bya bas 'chad par byed do //
translated: That is explained by ‚Äúthe subsequent‚Äù and so on.

original: tha ma'i zhes bya ba ni thams cad kyi phyi ma'o //
analyzed: tha ma'i zhes bya ba ni thams cad kyi phyi ma'o //
translated: ‚ÄúFinal‚Äù means the last of all.

original: nus pa ni gags byed pa med pa can no //
analyzed: nus pa ni gags byed pa med pa can no //
translated: ‚ÄúPotency‚Äù means the absence of obstruction.

original: gang de ma thag tu skye ba'o //üîΩci rigs par rten yin te zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gang de ma thag tu skye ba'o // ci rigs par rten yin te zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚ÄúThat which arises immediately‚Äù is the result.üîΩ‚ÄúThe basis‚Äù means the basis of the realization.

original: byed pa ni rtogs pa'i rten yin zhing gnas gzhan thob pa gzugs la sogs pa'i 'bras bu rten yin no //
analyzed: byed pa ni rtogs pa'i rten yin zhing gnas gzhan thob pa gzugs la sogs pa'i 'bras bu rten yin no //
translated: The basis of the result, such as form, is the attainment of another state.

original: @145b rtogs pa dang mngon par 'dod pa'i gnas skabs su phyin ba sgrub par byed pa zhes bya ba ni rtogs pa dang mngon par 'dod pa'i gnas su phyin ba dag gis sgrub par byed pa ni zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: @145b rtogs pa dang mngon par 'dod pa'i gnas skabs su phyin ba sgrub par byed pa zhes bya ba ni rtogs pa dang mngon par 'dod pa'i gnas su phyin ba dag gis sgrub par byed pa ni zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúThe establishment of the state of realization and the state of desire‚Äù means that the establishment of the state of realization and the state of desire is the establishment.

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba nyid shu'i zhes bya pa ni dge pa dang mi dge ba re re la rnam ba bcu yin te tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba nyid shu'i zhes bya pa ni dge pa dang mi dge ba re re la rnam ba bcu yin te tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúThe virtue and nonvirtue of each‚Äù means that each of the virtues and nonvirtues is of ten kinds, because they are different.

original: de'i 'jug pas bskyed pa'i 'du byed ches bya ba ni bdag gi yon tan no //
analyzed: de'i 'jug pas bskyed pa'i 'du byed ches bya ba ni bdag gi yon tan no //
translated: ‚ÄúThe volitions generated by their engagement‚Äù are the qualities of the self.

original: gtan tshigs ma grub pa yin no zhes bya ba ni skyes bu dbang dang ldan pa la yang skye ba'i rgyu tshang ba yod pa yin zhes bya ba 'di'o //
analyzed: gtan tshigs ma grub pa yin no zhes bya ba ni skyes bu dbang dang ldan pa la yang skye ba'i rgyu tshang ba yod pa yin zhes bya ba 'di'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe reason is not established‚Äù means that even for a powerful person, the complete cause of birth exists.

original: gang 'bras bu dang byed pa'i tshogs pa dang bral ba can zhes bya ba ni gang la 'bras bu dang byed pa'i tshogs pa dang bral ba yod ba zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: gang 'bras bu dang byed pa'i tshogs pa dang bral ba can zhes bya ba ni gang la 'bras bu dang byed pa'i tshogs pa dang bral ba yod ba zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: ‚ÄúThat which is devoid of the collection of effect and activity‚Äù means that which is associated with the phrase ‚Äúthat which is devoid of the collection of effect and activity.‚Äù

original: skyes bu sngar dbang bskur ba phyis shi ba ni skyes bu dbang skyur ba phyis shi ba'i //
analyzed: skyes bu sngar dbang bskur ba phyis shi ba ni skyes bu dbang skyur ba phyis shi ba'i //
translated: A person who has previously been consecrated and later dies is a person who has been consecrated and later dies.

original: yul gzhan las mngon par 'dod pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed do //
analyzed: yul gzhan las mngon par 'dod pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed do //
translated: He answers with ‚Äúfrom another country, etc.‚Äù

original: bdag gi yon tan la sogs pa'i khyad par la zhes bya ba ni bdag gi yon tan ma mthong ba'i'o //
analyzed: bdag gi yon tan la sogs pa'i khyad par la zhes bya ba ni bdag gi yon tan ma mthong ba'i'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn the case of the special qualities, etc., of the self‚Äù means in the case of the non-perception of the self‚Äôs qualities.

original: sogs pa'i sgra ni 'bras bu dang byed pa'i tshogs pa'i rang bzhin gang yin pa'i khyad par la ste /
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgra ni 'bras bu dang byed pa'i tshogs pa'i rang bzhin gang yin pa'i khyad par la ste /
translated: The word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù refers to the special nature of the collection of effects and agents.

original: dbang bskur gyis yang srid ba skyed pa'i nus pa ma bcom pa de la ltos nas zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: dbang bskur gyis yang srid ba skyed pa'i nus pa ma bcom pa de la ltos nas zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: ‚ÄúIn dependence on the non-destruction of the potency of rebirth by the consecration‚Äù is to be supplied.

original: ma nges pa yin no zhen zhes bya ba ni sems pa gnyis dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i blo yod na yang ji skad du bshad pa'i lhan cig byed pa dang bral na yul gzhan du phyin par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma nges pa yin no zhen zhes bya ba ni sems pa gnyis dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i blo yod na yang ji skad du bshad pa'i lhan cig byed pa dang bral na yul gzhan du phyin par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúIt is not definite‚Äù means that even if there is a cognition concomitant with two intentions, if it is devoid of the previously mentioned cooperating conditions, it will not go to another country.

original: byed pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin la gnod pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: byed pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin la gnod pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Because there is no harm to the nature of action, etc.

original: gal te rang bzhin la gnod pa med pa nyid la ltos nas blo las byed pa la sogs pa 'phen par byed pa de'i tshe dbang bskur ba'i blo gang yin pa de khyed kyi gzhung gis byed pa rnams kyi rang bzhin la gnod pa med pa'i phyir blo
analyzed: gal te rang bzhin la gnod pa med pa nyid la ltos nas blo las byed pa la sogs pa 'phen par byed pa de'i tshe dbang bskur ba'i blo gang yin pa de khyed kyi gzhung gis byed pa rnams kyi rang bzhin la gnod pa med pa'i phyir blo
translated: If the action, etc. are projected from the mind in reliance on the mere non-harm to the nature, then the mind of consecration, which is yours, does not project the action, etc. because your texts do not harm the nature of the actions.

original: de las sems kyi dbang gis byed pa la sogs pa 'phen pa la sogs par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni bsdu ba'i don yin no //
analyzed: de las sems kyi dbang gis byed pa la sogs pa 'phen pa la sogs par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni bsdu ba'i don yin no //
translated: The meaning of the summary is this: the mind of consecration does not project the action, etc. due to the power of the mind.

original: blo'i khyad par dang ji ltar 'jug pa bzhin du byed pa'i rgyu yod na zhes bya ba blo'i khyad par 'dod pa dang ldan pa dang / ji ltar 'jug pa bzhin du byed pa'i rgyun yod na zhes bya ba ni zlas dbye ba'o //
analyzed: blo'i khyad par dang ji ltar 'jug pa bzhin du byed pa'i rgyu yod na zhes bya ba blo'i khyad par 'dod pa dang ldan pa dang / ji ltar 'jug pa bzhin du byed pa'i rgyun yod na zhes bya ba ni zlas dbye ba'o //
translated: If there is a cause for action in accordance with the specific mind, means if there is a continuum of a cause for action in accordance with the specific mind that is possessed by one who desires it, and in accordance with how it is engaged. This is an analysis.

original: byed pa 'phen pa'i blo la zhes bya ba ni byed pa 'phen pa yang de yin la blo yang @146a * //üîΩyin no zhes bya ba ni khyad par gyi bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: byed pa 'phen pa'i blo la zhes bya ba ni byed pa 'phen pa yang de yin la blo yang @146a * // yin no zhes bya ba ni khyad par gyi bsdu ba'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe mind that projects the instigator‚Äù is a special determinative compound, meaning that it is both the instigator and the mind.

original: srid pa de ma 'ongs pa'i skye ba la byed pa rnams 'phen par byed pa ni blo yin no //
analyzed: srid pa de ma 'ongs pa'i skye ba la byed pa rnams 'phen par byed pa ni blo yin no //
translated: The mind projects the instigators of future birth and existence.

original: dri ma rnams kyis blo mtshams sbyor bar byed cing skyed par byed ces bya bar sbyar ro //üîΩdbang bskur ba dri ma rnams la zhes bya ba la sogs pa rnams ni gzhan gyi yin te /
analyzed: dri ma rnams kyis blo mtshams sbyor bar byed cing skyed par byed ces bya bar sbyar ro // dbang bskur ba dri ma rnams la zhes bya ba la sogs pa rnams ni gzhan gyi yin te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe mind is connected with and generates the defilements‚Äù is to be supplied.

original: dbang bskur ba dri ma rnams la gnod pa byed pa ma yin no zhes bya ba gang las yin /
analyzed: dbang bskur ba dri ma rnams la gnod pa byed pa ma yin no zhes bya ba gang las yin /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe defilements do not harm the consecration‚Äù and so on is the opponent‚Äôs view.

original: bshad pa 'ga' zhig gi tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni grub pa'i mtha' smra ba'i'o //üîΩgnyen po'i phyogs 'phel na 'grib pa dang rang gi phyogs 'phel ba na phul du byung ba yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: bshad pa 'ga' zhig gi tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni grub pa'i mtha' smra ba'i'o //üîΩgnyen po'i phyogs 'phel na 'grib pa dang rang gi phyogs 'phel ba na phul du byung ba yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //

original: gnyen po'i phyogs bdag med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa de'i bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: gnyen po'i phyogs bdag med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa de'i bshad pa yin no //
translated: The explanation of the term ‚Äúantidote‚Äù is ‚Äúthe absence of self, etc.‚Äù

original: bud shing sngon du song ba can gyi me'i khyad par zhes bya ba ni bud shing sngon du song ba can gyi me'i khyad par 'phel ba na zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bud shing sngon du song ba can gyi me'i khyad par zhes bya ba ni bud shing sngon du song ba can gyi me'i khyad par 'phel ba na zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe particular fire that is preceded by fuel‚Äù means ‚Äúthe particular fire that is preceded by fuel, when it is increasing.‚Äù

original: de bas na dus sngar byung ba can gyi dri ma rnams kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa mjug sdud par byed do //
analyzed: de bas na dus sngar byung ba can gyi dri ma rnams kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa mjug sdud par byed do //
translated: Therefore, the phrase ‚Äúthe previously arisen defilements‚Äù is a summary

original: byed pa 'phen par byed pa yang de nyid yin la blo yang yin pas zhes bya ba ni khyad par gyi bsdu ba'o //üîΩbyed dang mi byed dus dag tu //
analyzed: byed pa 'phen par byed pa yang de nyid yin la blo yang yin pas zhes bya ba ni khyad par gyi bsdu ba'o // byed dang mi byed dus dag tu //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúit is the impelling of the activity and it is the cognition‚Äù is a summary of the distinctions.

original: bdag nyid dag ni 'dra ba dang // zhes bya ba ni mdo yin no //
analyzed: bdag nyid dag ni 'dra ba dang // zhes bya ba ni mdo yin no //
translated: The sutra states:üîΩ‚ÄúThe self is the same in the periods of activity and inactivity.‚Äù

original: 'bras bu byed pa'i dus dang 'bras bu mi byed pa'i dus dag tu bdag nyid mtshungs pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'bras bu byed pa'i dus dang 'bras bu mi byed pa'i dus dag tu bdag nyid mtshungs pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of this is that the self is the same in the periods of activity and inactivity.

original: de nyid ni 'bras bu mngon par 'dod pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de nyid ni 'bras bu mngon par 'dod pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: That itself is the time of the effect that is desired and not desired, etc.

original: mngon par 'dod pa dang mngon par 'dod pa ma yin pa ni go rims bzhin du 'bras bu byed pa dang mi byed pa'i dus dag yin no //üîΩde bas na byed pa zhes bya ba ni mngon par 'dod pa'i don gyi 'bras bu byed pa'i dus yin la /
analyzed: mngon par 'dod pa dang mngon par 'dod pa ma yin pa ni go rims bzhin du 'bras bu byed pa dang mi byed pa'i dus dag yin no // de bas na byed pa zhes bya ba ni mngon par 'dod pa'i don gyi 'bras bu byed pa'i dus yin la /
translated: The desired and not desired are the times of the effect being produced and not being produced, respectively.

original: mi byed pa zhes bya ba ni mngon par 'dod pa'i don gyi 'bras bu mi byed pa'i dus la zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: mi byed pa zhes bya ba ni mngon par 'dod pa'i don gyi 'bras bu mi byed pa'i dus la zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, the time of production is the time of the effect of the desired object, and the time of non-production is the time of the non-production of the effect of the desired object.

original: de'i 'bras bu yang zhes bya ba ni byed pa'i 'bras bu yin pa de bas na bdag las gzhan pa zhes bya ba'i don to ;
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu yang zhes bya ba ni byed pa'i 'bras bu yin pa de bas na bdag las gzhan pa zhes bya ba'i don to ;
translated: The effect of that is the effect of production. Therefore, it is the meaning of ‚Äúother than the self.‚Äù

original: / byed pa po mi 'dod pa gang yin pa des kyang zhes bya ba ni grangs can pa de skyes bu btang snyoms su byed pa 'dod do //
analyzed: / byed pa po mi 'dod pa gang yin pa des kyang zhes bya ba ni grangs can pa de skyes bu btang snyoms su byed pa 'dod do //
translated: Even the one who does not assert the agent, that is, the SƒÅ·πÉkhya, asserts that the person is indifferent.

original: skyes bu'i 'dod pa nyid las zhes bya ba ni skyes bu'i sred pas so //
analyzed: skyes bu'i 'dod pa nyid las zhes bya ba ni skyes bu'i sred pas so //
translated: From the desire of the person means from the craving of the person.

original: rang bzhin zhes bya ba ni gtso bo'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin zhes bya ba ni gtso bo'o //
translated: ‚ÄúNature‚Äù means the principal.

original: de bas na sbyor ba gnyis pa tshad mar 'gyur ba gang yin pa de la @146b gtan tshigs ma grub pa'am grub pa la sgrub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na sbyor ba gnyis pa tshad mar 'gyur ba gang yin pa de la @146b gtan tshigs ma grub pa'am grub pa la sgrub pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the second syllogism is not unestablished or established as non-existent with respect to the valid cognition.

original: yul longs spyod pa ni sems pa can no //
analyzed: yul longs spyod pa ni sems pa can no //
translated: The experiencer of objects is the sentient being.

original: rang bzhin 'gal ba dmigs pa ni rgyu dang 'bras bu dag phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin 'gal ba dmigs pa ni rgyu dang 'bras bu dag phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The observation of a contradictory nature is because the cause and effect have the characteristic of mutually excluding each other.

original: de lta ma yin na rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were not so, they would not be cause and effect.

original: gzhan gyi nyams su myong ba gzhan gyis dran pa'am zhes bya ba ni skad cig mar smra ba dag ni bdag mi 'dod pas de thob pa yin na de yang rigs pa ma yin te thal ches pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi nyams su myong ba gzhan gyis dran pa'am zhes bya ba ni skad cig mar smra ba dag ni bdag mi 'dod pas de thob pa yin na de yang rigs pa ma yin te thal ches pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúThe memory of the experience of another by another‚Äù means that the proponents of momentariness do not assert a self, therefore, it is not logical that it is obtained, because it is too broad.

original: des 'ga' 'ang dran pa med phyir ro //
analyzed: des 'ga' 'ang dran pa med phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no memory of anything by that.

original: zhes bya ba ni dran pa po rang dbang can gyi dran pa kho bo cag mi 'dod do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni dran pa po rang dbang can gyi dran pa kho bo cag mi 'dod do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of this is that we do not accept a self-sufficient recollector.

original: phyis kyang nyams su myong ba la sogs pas de 'chad par byed do //
analyzed: phyis kyang nyams su myong ba la sogs pas de 'chad par byed do //
translated: Later, he explains that by ‚Äúexperience‚Äù and so on.

original: nyams su myong las dran pa 'byung //
analyzed: nyams su myong las dran pa 'byung //
translated: Recollection arises from experience.

original: zhes bya ba 'dis ni skad cig ma nyid yin na yang rgyud gcig la nye bar len pa dang nye bar len pa can gyi dngos po gang yin pa de la dran pa skye bar 'gyur gyi rgyud gzhan la ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa yin no
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'dis ni skad cig ma nyid yin na yang rgyud gcig la nye bar len pa dang nye bar len pa can gyi dngos po gang yin pa de la dran pa skye bar 'gyur gyi rgyud gzhan la ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa yin no
translated: This shows that even though there is momentariness, recollection arises in regard to that which is the appropriator and that which is appropriated in a single continuum, but not in regard to a different continuum.

original: // gal te byed pa po rang dbang can yod pa ma yin na /
analyzed: // gal te byed pa po rang dbang can yod pa ma yin na /
translated: If there is no self-sufficient agent,

original: 'o na ci la ltos nas dran pa nyid ces bya ba'i dngos po rkyen yin /
analyzed: 'o na ci la ltos nas dran pa nyid ces bya ba'i dngos po rkyen yin /
translated: in dependence upon what is there the thing called ‚Äúrecollection,‚Äù which is a condition?

original: yod pa ni yod bar byed pa med par rigs so zhe na /
analyzed: yod pa ni yod bar byed pa med par rigs so zhe na /
translated: It is not reasonable that an existent should be made to exist.

original: de'i phyir 'dir dngos po'i rkyen yin na yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dir dngos po'i rkyen yin na yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Therefore, here he says, ‚ÄúEven though it is a condition of an existent thing,‚Äù and so on.

original: rnam pa 'ga' zhig la sgro btags pa zhes bya ba ni dran pa nyams su myong ba'i dngos po'i rnam par skyes pas bya ba dang bcas pa'i shes pa la brten nas byed pa po nyid du sgro btags pa dang yul rtogs pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i
analyzed: rnam pa 'ga' zhig la sgro btags pa zhes bya ba ni dran pa nyams su myong ba'i dngos po'i rnam par skyes pas bya ba dang bcas pa'i shes pa la brten nas byed pa po nyid du sgro btags pa dang yul rtogs pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i
translated: In some cases, ‚Äúsuperimposition‚Äù is the imputation of an agent on the basis of a cognition that has an object, which arises in the aspect of an experienced memory.

original: phyir / sgro btags pa nyid yin pa de bas na dngos po'i rkyen yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: phyir / sgro btags pa nyid yin pa de bas na dngos po'i rkyen yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Because it is the nature of the object that is realized, it is a superimposition. Therefore, the meaning is that it is a condition of an entity.

original: kun rdzob la zhes bya ba ni phyin ci log gi rnam pa can gyi blo la'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob la zhes bya ba ni phyin ci log gi rnam pa can gyi blo la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn the conventional‚Äù means in a mind that has an erroneous aspect.

original: tshad ma dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni sgro 'dogs par byed pa'i blos rnam par gzhag pa ni ci rigs par mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshad ma dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni sgro 'dogs par byed pa'i blos rnam par gzhag pa ni ci rigs par mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause it contradicts valid knowledge‚Äù means that the presentation by a superimposing mind contradicts direct perception and inference, as appropriate.

original: de ltar na dngos po gcig la yang ci ltar brda ji lta ba bzhin du phan tshun 'gal ba'i tha snyad mthong ba yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na dngos po gcig la yang ci ltar brda ji lta ba bzhin du phan tshun 'gal ba'i tha snyad mthong ba yin no //
translated: Thus, even in a single entity, one sees mutually contradictory conventions in accordance with the conventions.

original: de'i dbang gis dngos po gcig du ma nyid ma yin te bdag med pa nyid du thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i dbang gis dngos po gcig du ma nyid ma yin te bdag med pa nyid du thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, one thing is not many, because it would follow, absurdly, that it would be without self.

original: de yang gzhan dag tu bshad zin ba nyid yin pa de ltar na 'dir ma spos so //üîΩgnyen po'i phyogs nyid yin par bya ba ni bdag med pa nyid @147a * //
analyzed: de yang gzhan dag tu bshad zin ba nyid yin pa de ltar na 'dir ma spos so // gnyen po'i phyogs nyid yin par bya ba ni bdag med pa nyid @147a * //
translated: And that has already been explained elsewhere, so it is not mentioned here.

original: kyi lam gnyen po'i phyogs nyid yin par ro //
analyzed: kyi lam gnyen po'i phyogs nyid yin par ro //
translated: The antidote is the path of selflessness.

original: ji ltar de sdug bsngal gyi rgyu'i gnyen po'i phyogs nyid yin pa zhes bya ba ni bdag med pa'i lam nyid do //üîΩde yang ma rig pa las byung ba'am /
analyzed: ji ltar de sdug bsngal gyi rgyu'i gnyen po'i phyogs nyid yin pa zhes bya ba ni bdag med pa'i lam nyid do // de yang ma rig pa las byung ba'am /
translated: How is it the antidote to the cause of suffering? The path of selflessness is the antidote to the cause of suffering.üîΩAnd that is either arisen from ignorance or is a particular type of ignorance.

original: ma rig pa'i khyad par yin grang na zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe 'jig tshogs su lta ba ma rig pa nyid yin pa de'i tshe ma rig pa las byung ba'o //
analyzed: ma rig pa'i khyad par yin grang na zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe 'jig tshogs su lta ba ma rig pa nyid yin pa de'i tshe ma rig pa las byung ba'o //
translated: When the view of the transitory collection is ignorance itself, then it is arisen from ignorance.

original: gang gi tshe log pa'i shes pa tsam yin pa de'i ma rig pa'i khyad par yin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe log pa'i shes pa tsam yin pa de'i ma rig pa'i khyad par yin no //
translated: When it is merely a wrong consciousness, then it is a particular type of ignorance.

original: rnam pa gnyi ga ltar yang bdag med pa nyid mthong ba tsam ni srid pa dang 'gal ba yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: rnam pa gnyi ga ltar yang bdag med pa nyid mthong ba tsam ni srid pa dang 'gal ba yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: In both cases, it is the mere seeing of selflessness that is incompatible with existence.

original: bdag med pa nyid mthong ba ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /
analyzed: bdag med pa nyid mthong ba ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /
translated: What is the seeing of selflessness like?

original: ma rig pa dang 'gal ba'i zhes bya ba smos so //üîΩ'gal ba de yang zhes bya ba ni ma rigs pa dang bdag med pa nyid mthong ba 'gal ba'o //
analyzed: ma rig pa dang 'gal ba'i zhes bya ba smos so // 'gal ba de yang zhes bya ba ni ma rigs pa dang bdag med pa nyid mthong ba 'gal ba'o //
translated: It is said to be incompatible with ignorance.üîΩThat incompatibility is also said to be in terms of the object-field.üîΩThe object-field of ignorance is the object-field of the seeing of selflessness.

original: dmigs pa'i rnam par phyin ci log pa'i sgo nas yin no zhes bya ba ni ma rig pa'i dmigs pa'i rnam pa 'dzin pa'i rnam pa'o//
analyzed: dmigs pa'i rnam par phyin ci log pa'i sgo nas yin no zhes bya ba ni ma rig pa'i dmigs pa'i rnam pa 'dzin pa'i rnam pa'o//
translated: The incompatibility is in terms of the perversion of the object-field.üîΩThe object-field of ignorance is the object-field of the grasping of the form of the perversion.

original: de las phyin ci log pa'i sgo nas yin no //
analyzed: de las phyin ci log pa'i sgo nas yin no //
translated: The incompatibility is in terms of the perversion of that.

original: bdag med pa nyid mthong ba'i dmigs pa'i rnam pa phyin ci log pa nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: bdag med pa nyid mthong ba'i dmigs pa'i rnam pa phyin ci log pa nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the perversion of the object-field of the seeing of selflessness,

original: re zhig ma rig pa nyid kyi rnam pa ni ma rig pa des kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ston par byed do //
analyzed: re zhig ma rig pa nyid kyi rnam pa ni ma rig pa des kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ston par byed do //
translated: he demonstrates the form of ignorance with ‚ÄúThat ignorance is also...‚Äù.

original: sdug bsngal la zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la rtag pa zhes bya ba'i rnam par 'dzin par byed pa'o //üîΩ'dis ni mi rtag pa las log par sgro btags nas bshad pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rtag pa ni mi rtag pa las bzlog pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal la zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la rtag pa zhes bya ba'i rnam par 'dzin par byed pa'o // 'dis ni mi rtag pa las log par sgro btags nas bshad pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rtag pa ni mi rtag pa las bzlog pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúIn regard to suffering‚Äù means in regard to the truth of suffering.üîΩThis is an explanation of the superimposition of the opposite of impermanence.

original: mi rtag pa las bzlog pas rtag pa smos pa nyid gsal bar mdos bzung bar 'os pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: mi rtag pa las bzlog pas rtag pa smos pa nyid gsal bar mdos bzung bar 'os pa ma yin nam /
translated: Since permanence is the opposite of impermanence, is it not appropriate to simply state permanence, the opposite of impermanence?

original: ci'i phyir bstan pa smos pa byas she na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir bstan pa smos pa byas she na /
translated: Why is the term ‚Äútaught‚Äù used?

original: bzlog pas rtag pa zhes brjod par bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: bzlog pas rtag pa zhes brjod par bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The term ‚Äútaught‚Äù is used because permanence is stated as the opposite of impermanence.

original: 'di skad du bstan par byed de /
analyzed: 'di skad du bstan par byed de /
translated: This is explained as follows.

original: ther zug tu gnas pa'i rtag pa gang yin pa dang / skad cig ma gnyis pa la sogs par gnas pa'i ngang tshul can dus gzhan du gnas pa can gang yin pa de thams cad ni 'dir rtag par 'dod pa yin gyi /
analyzed: ther zug tu gnas pa'i rtag pa gang yin pa dang / skad cig ma gnyis pa la sogs par gnas pa'i ngang tshul can dus gzhan du gnas pa can gang yin pa de thams cad ni 'dir rtag par 'dod pa yin gyi /
translated: Whatever is permanent in the sense of enduring and whatever is permanent in the sense of abiding in a mode of being in the second moment and in other times is asserted here as permanence.

original: ther zug tu gnas pa nyid ni ma yin no zhes de bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ther zug tu gnas pa nyid ni ma yin no zhes de bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: but not as something permanent.

original: mdo mdzad pas rtag pa'i don las brtan pa smos pas bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: mdo mdzad pas rtag pa'i don las brtan pa smos pas bstan pa yin no //
translated: The author of the sutra has shown this by using the word ‚Äúfirm‚Äù in the sense of ‚Äúpermanent.‚Äù

original: de ltar na ji ltar rnam pa gnyi ga la yang brtan pa @147b zhes brjod pa de ltar rtag pa la yang yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na ji ltar rnam pa gnyi ga la yang brtan pa @147b zhes brjod pa de ltar rtag pa la yang yin no //
translated: Thus, just as the word ‚Äúfirm‚Äù is used in both senses, so also is the word ‚Äúpermanent.‚Äù

original: de bas na skad cig ma ma yin par smra ba gang yin pa de dag kyang rtag par sgro 'dogs nas 'jug pa nyid yin no //üîΩbde dang zhes bya ba ni zag pa dang bcas pa ma yin pa'am zhes bya ba la sogs pa la sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa las phyin ci log pas bde ba'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na skad cig ma ma yin par smra ba gang yin pa de dag kyang rtag par sgro 'dogs nas 'jug pa nyid yin no // bde dang zhes bya ba ni zag pa dang bcas pa ma yin pa'am zhes bya ba la sogs pa la sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa las phyin ci log pas bde ba'i rnam pa'o //
translated: Therefore, those who maintain that the Buddha is not momentary impute permanence to him.üîΩ‚ÄúHappy‚Äù and so on. The word ‚Äúhappy‚Äù is the opposite of the aspect of suffering.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa nyid kyi sdug bsngal yin te /
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa nyid kyi sdug bsngal yin te /
translated: Suffering is that which is associated with the outflows.

original: nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga ni sdug bsngal yin no zhes bya ba dang rgyu'i gzhan gyi dbang gis gzhan dbang thams cad sdug bsngal yin no zhes gsungs pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga ni sdug bsngal yin no zhes bya ba dang rgyu'i gzhan gyi dbang gis gzhan dbang thams cad sdug bsngal yin no zhes gsungs pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The five appropriated aggregates are suffering.üîΩTherefore, the aspect of happiness is the opposite of that, i.e., it is not contaminated,

original: de bas na de las bzlog pa'i zag pa dang bcas pa ma yin pa'am /üîΩrgyu'i gzhan gyi dbang las phyin ci log pa ni bde ba'i rnam pa yin no //üîΩsogs pa smos pas ni zhes bya ba ni bden pa bzhi la brtan pa dang / bde ba dang nga dang nga'i zhes sogs zhes bya ba 'dis so //
analyzed: de bas na de las bzlog pa'i zag pa dang bcas pa ma yin pa'am / rgyu'i gzhan gyi dbang las phyin ci log pa ni bde ba'i rnam pa yin no // sogs pa smos pas ni zhes bya ba ni bden pa bzhi la brtan pa dang / bde ba dang nga dang nga'i zhes sogs zhes bya ba 'dis so //
translated: or it is the opposite of the other-dependent that is caused by the other-dependent.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúand so on‚Äù refers to the four noble truths, i.e., ‚Äúthe noble truth of suffering, the noble truth of the origin of suffering, the noble truth of the cessation of suffering, and the noble truth of the path.‚ÄùüîΩThe phrase ‚Äúand so on‚Äù refers to the four noble truths, i.e., ‚Äúthe noble truth of suffering, the noble truth of the origin of suffering, the noble truth of the cessation of suffering, and the noble truth of the path.‚ÄùüîΩThe phrase ‚Äúand so on‚Äù refers to the four noble truths, i.e., ‚Äúthe noble truth of suffering, the noble truth of the origin of suffering, the noble truth of the cessation of suffering, and the noble truth of the path.‚Äù

original: de bzhin du 'gog pa dang lam gyi bden pa dag la yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la 'gog pa ma yin pa dang / zhi ba ma yin pa dang / gya nom ba ma yin pa dang / nges par 'byung ba ma yin pa'i rnam par sgro 'dogs pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'gog pa dang lam gyi bden pa dag la yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la 'gog pa ma yin pa dang / zhi ba ma yin pa dang / gya nom ba ma yin pa dang / nges par 'byung ba ma yin pa'i rnam par sgro 'dogs pa'o //
