translated: The phrase ‚Äúand so on‚Äù refers to the four noble truths, i.e., ‚Äúthe noble truth of suffering, the noble truth of the origin of suffering, the noble truth of the cessation of suffering, and the noble truth of the path.‚ÄùüîΩThe phrase ‚Äúand so on‚Äù refers to the four noble truths, i.e., ‚Äúthe noble truth of suffering, the noble truth of the origin of suffering, the noble truth of the cessation of suffering, and the noble truth of the path.‚ÄùüîΩThe phrase ‚Äúand so on‚Äù refers to the four noble truths, i.e., ‚Äúthe noble truth of suffering, the noble truth of the origin of suffering, the noble truth of the cessation of suffering, and the noble truth of the path.‚ÄùüîΩThe phrase ‚Äúand so on‚Äù refers to the four noble truths, i.e., ‚Äúthe noble truth of suffering, the noble truth of the origin of suffering, the noble truth of the cessation of suffering, and the noble truth of the path.‚ÄùüîΩThe phrase ‚Äúand so on‚Äù refers to the four noble truths, i.e., ‚Äúthe noble truth of suffering, the noble truth of the origin of suffering, the noble truth of the cessation of suffering, and the noble truth of the path.‚ÄùüîΩThe phrase ‚Äúand so on‚Äù refers to the four noble truths, i.e., ‚Äúthe noble truth of suffering, the noble truth of the origin of suffering, the noble truth of the cessation of suffering, and the noble

original: lam gyi lam ma yin pa dang / rigs pa ma yin pa dang / sgrub pa ma yin pa dang / nges par 'byin pa ma yin pa'i rnam par sgro 'dogs pa'o //
analyzed: lam gyi lam ma yin pa dang / rigs pa ma yin pa dang / sgrub pa ma yin pa dang / nges par 'byin pa ma yin pa'i rnam par sgro 'dogs pa'o //
translated: It is the superimposition of a path that is not a path, of what is not logical, of what is not an attainment, and of what does not liberate.

original: de las byung ba dang de'i rang bzhin can gyi zhes bya ba ni ma rig pa las byung ba dang / ma rig pa'i rang bzhin can zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de las byung ba dang de'i rang bzhin can gyi zhes bya ba ni ma rig pa las byung ba dang / ma rig pa'i rang bzhin can zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúarising from that and having that as its nature‚Äù is ‚Äúarising from ignorance‚Äù and ‚Äúhaving the nature of ignorance.‚Äù

original: sgro btags nas ni yongs su sred //
analyzed: sgro btags nas ni yongs su sred //
translated: Craving arises due to superimposition.

original: ces bya ba'i tshig gis log par sgro 'dogs pa sngon du song ba can gyi sred pa nyid gsal bar bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: ces bya ba'i tshig gis log par sgro 'dogs pa sngon du song ba can gyi sred pa nyid gsal bar bstan pa yin no //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúcraving arises due to superimposition‚Äù clarifies that craving is preceded by a false superimposition.

original: sgro btags pa'i yul la 'jug pa'i sred pa de yang sgro 'dogs pa'i rnam pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: sgro btags pa'i yul la 'jug pa'i sred pa de yang sgro 'dogs pa'i rnam pa nyid yin la /
translated: Moreover, that craving which engages the object of superimposition has the aspect of superimposition.

original: sgro 'dogs pa'i rnam pa can gyi yul can gyi nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad nyid ma rig pa nyid yin pa de ltar na de'i rang bzhin can nyid kyang bstan pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: sgro 'dogs pa'i rnam pa can gyi yul can gyi nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad nyid ma rig pa nyid yin pa de ltar na de'i rang bzhin can nyid kyang bstan pa nyid yin no //
translated: And all the afflictions and secondary afflictions that have the aspect of superimposition are ignorance itself. Thus, it is also taught that they have the nature of ignorance.

original: sred pa yang don gyi 'gal ba nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni sred pa'i rgyu bdag tu lta ba dang / lam dngos su 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sred pa yang don gyi 'gal ba nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni sred pa'i rgyu bdag tu lta ba dang / lam dngos su 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Craving is also ultimately contradictory to the meaning of the self, because the view of self is the cause of craving, and the path is directly contradictory to it.

original: 'bras bur gyur pa'i sred pa dang yang don dam par 'gal bar bstan to zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'bras bur gyur pa'i sred pa dang yang don dam par 'gal bar bstan to zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Thus, it is explained that craving, which is the result, is also ultimately contradictory to the meaning of the self.

original: sdug bsngal gyi rgyu'i rang bzhin las phyin ci log @148a * //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi rgyu'i rang bzhin las phyin ci log @148a * //
translated: Because it is the opposite of the nature of the cause of suffering.

original: pa yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni ma rig pa dang sred pa ni sdug bsngal gyi rgyu nyid yin te phyin ci log pa'i rang bzhin can zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: pa yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni ma rig pa dang sred pa ni sdug bsngal gyi rgyu nyid yin te phyin ci log pa'i rang bzhin can zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Ignorance and craving are the cause of suffering, and they have the nature of error.

original: gnyen po'i phyogs ni med phyir dang // zhes mdo mdzad pas bshad pa de ci ltar rung ste /
analyzed: gnyen po'i phyogs ni med phyir dang // zhes mdo mdzad pas bshad pa de ci ltar rung ste /
translated: How can it be correct that the author of the sutra explains that the antidote does not exist?

original: 'di ltar bdag med pa nyid kyi lam gyis nyon mongs pa spangs pa'i sgo nas /
analyzed: 'di ltar bdag med pa nyid kyi lam gyis nyon mongs pa spangs pa'i sgo nas /
translated: Thus, through the path of selflessness, by abandoning the afflictions,

original: ma 'ongs pa'i las dang lus zad par byed pa'i rgyu tshad mas grub pa nyid yin no zhe na /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i las dang lus zad par byed pa'i rgyu tshad mas grub pa nyid yin no zhe na /
translated: the cause of exhausting future karma and the body is established by valid cognition.

original: de'i phyir de de ltar na /
analyzed: de'i phyir de de ltar na /
translated: Therefore, it is like that.

original: gnyen po'i phyogs ni mad phyir dang // zhes bya ba 'dis rtogs par mi nus pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba khong nas dbyung bar bya ba yin pas na zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: gnyen po'i phyogs ni mad phyir dang // zhes bya ba 'dis rtogs par mi nus pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba khong nas dbyung bar bya ba yin pas na zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: This is the meaning of the passage, ‚Äúbecause it is impossible.‚Äù

original: 'di skad du bstan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di skad du bstan par 'gyur te /
translated: This is what is being said:

original: gnyen po'i phyogs ni med phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyen po'i phyogs ni med phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause the side of the antidote is absent‚ÄùüîΩmeans that it is impossible.

original: zhes bya ba'i mdo 'dis rtogs par mi nus pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba'i ngag khong nas dbyung bar bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i mdo 'dis rtogs par mi nus pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba'i ngag khong nas dbyung bar bya'o //
translated: This is the meaning of the passage, ‚Äúbecause it is impossible.‚Äù

original: des na ngag gi don ni bdag tu lta ba'i zhen pa 'dis nyon mongs pa zad pa'i thabs por nas /
analyzed: des na ngag gi don ni bdag tu lta ba'i zhen pa 'dis nyon mongs pa zad pa'i thabs por nas /
translated: Therefore, the meaning of the passage is this: Since this reification of the view of self is the method for exhausting the afflictions,üîΩthey say that one is liberated merely through the exhaustion of karma and the body.

original: las dang lus zad pa tsam las grol bar smra bas gnyen po'i phyogs rtogs pa med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: las dang lus zad pa tsam las grol bar smra bas gnyen po'i phyogs rtogs pa med pa'i phyir te /
translated: Therefore, since the side of the antidote is not realized,

original: mi nus pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
analyzed: mi nus pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
translated: it is impossible.

original: de bas na rtogs pa nyid med par bshad pa yin gyi gnyen po'i phyogs ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na rtogs pa nyid med par bshad pa yin gyi gnyen po'i phyogs ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore it is explained that they do not have realization, not that they do not have the side of the antidote.

original: gang zhig rtog pa sngon du gtong ba can yin yang de'i rang bzhin mi shes pa can yin pa de ni zhes bya ba'i yang gi sgras ni ma lus pa gnyi ga yang gtan tshigs nyid du bstan te /
analyzed: gang zhig rtog pa sngon du gtong ba can yin yang de'i rang bzhin mi shes pa can yin pa de ni zhes bya ba'i yang gi sgras ni ma lus pa gnyi ga yang gtan tshigs nyid du bstan te /
translated: The word ‚Äúand‚Äù indicates that both are reasons in their entirety.

original: gal te rtog pa sngon du gtong ba can yang yin zhing de'i rang bzhin mi shes pa can du yang 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: gal te rtog pa sngon du gtong ba can yang yin zhing de'i rang bzhin mi shes pa can du yang 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: If one is one who formulates concepts, then one is one who does not know their nature.

original: gang gis spang bar bya ba'i rang bzhin mi shes pa de ni de'i rang bzhin mi shes pa can no //
analyzed: gang gis spang bar bya ba'i rang bzhin mi shes pa de ni de'i rang bzhin mi shes pa can no //
translated: One who does not know the nature of that which is to be abandoned is one who does not know its nature.

original: don de rtogs par nus pa ma yin te zhes bya ba ni gang la nges pa med par 'jug pa yod na don med pa la the tshom za ba yin no zhes bya ba khong nas dbyung bar bya'o //
analyzed: don de rtogs par nus pa ma yin te zhes bya ba ni gang la nges pa med par 'jug pa yod na don med pa la the tshom za ba yin no zhes bya ba khong nas dbyung bar bya'o //
translated: One is not able to understand the meaning, that is, one is uncertain about the meaning, if one engages in it without certainty.

original: de nyid kyi phyir dug ma yin pa nyid du ma brtags par zhes bya ba ni de lta bur gyur pa'i dpe nyid bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir dug ma yin pa nyid du ma brtags par zhes bya ba ni de lta bur gyur pa'i dpe nyid bstan pa yin no //
translated: For that very reason, it is said, ‚Äúwithout examining whether it is poison or not,‚Äù and this is the example that illustrates the above.

original: de ltar na gang la don med pa'i the tshom za ba med cing don la the tshom za ba yod pa de la rtog pa dang ldan pa yang 'jug par bya ba nyid yin te /
analyzed: de ltar na gang la don med pa'i the tshom za ba med cing don la the tshom za ba yod pa de la rtog pa dang ldan pa yang 'jug par bya ba nyid yin te /
translated: Thus, one who has no doubt about the non-existence of an object, but does have doubt about the object, is also engaged in having conception.

original: de lta bur gyur pa la 'jug par byed pa ni rtog pa dang ldan pa ma yin pa ma yin no zhes bshad zin to //
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa la 'jug par byed pa ni rtog pa dang ldan pa ma yin pa ma yin no zhes bshad zin to //
translated: It has been explained that one who is engaged in that way is not one who is without conception.

original: rtog pa sngon du gtong ba can ni ji skad @148b du bshad pa'i yul la 'jug pa de'i rang bzhin shes pa can nyid kyis khyab la /
analyzed: rtog pa sngon du gtong ba can ni ji skad @148b du bshad pa'i yul la 'jug pa de'i rang bzhin shes pa can nyid kyis khyab la /
translated: One who proceeds with conception is necessarily one who knows the nature of the object as it has been explained.üîΩAnd one who is in contradiction with that is one who does not know the nature of that. Thus, there is the observation of a contradiction with the pervasion.üîΩOne who has wisdom is one who has the wisdom that is the antidote to the conception that is the opposite of the conception of the impermanence of all compounded phenomena.

original: de dang 'gal ba yang de'i rang bzhin mi shes pa can yin pa de ltar na khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: de dang 'gal ba yang de'i rang bzhin mi shes pa can yin pa de ltar na khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
translated: One who has no conception is one who has no conception of the impermanence of all compounded phenomena.

original: lus can shes rab ldan pa zhes bya bar sbyar ro //üîΩ'ga' zhig kyang zhes bya ba ni nam mkha'i gos can 'phel byed la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: lus can shes rab ldan pa zhes bya bar sbyar ro // 'ga' zhig kyang zhes bya ba ni nam mkha'i gos can 'phel byed la sogs pa'o //
translated: One who has conception is one who has conception of the impermanence of all compounded phenomena.üîΩOne who has no conception is one who has no conception of the impermanence of all compounded phenomena.üîΩOne who has conception is one who has conception of the impermanence of all compounded phenomena.üîΩOne who has no conception is one who has no conception of the impermanence of all compounded phenomena.üîΩOne who has conception is one who has conception of the impermanence of all compounded phenomena.üîΩOne who has no conception is one who has no conception of the impermanence of all compounded phenomena.üîΩOne who has conception is one who has conception of the impermanence of all compounded phenomena.üîΩOne who has no conception is one who has no conception of the impermanence of all compounded phenomena.üîΩOne who has conception is one who has conception of the impermanence of all compounded phenomena.üîΩOne who has no conception is one who has no conception of the impermanence of all compounded phenomena.üîΩOne who has conception is one who has conception of the impermanence of all compounded phenomena.üîΩOne who has no conception is one who has no conception of the impermanence of all compounded phenomena.

original: las byas pa dengs par gyur pa ni zad pa'o //
analyzed: las byas pa dengs par gyur pa ni zad pa'o //
translated: One who has conception is one who has conception of the impermanence of all compounded phenomena.üîΩOne who has no conception is one who has no conception of the impermanence of all compounded phenomena.

original: 'bras bu sna tshogs mthong ba'i phyir //
analyzed: 'bras bu sna tshogs mthong ba'i phyir //
translated: One who has conception is one who has conception of the impermanence of all compounded phenomena.üîΩOne who has no conception is one who has no conception of the impermanence of all compounded phenomena.üîΩOne who has conception is one who has conception of

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa de'i rnam par 'grel pa bor nas rang gi sde pa 'ga' zhig gis nam mkha'i gos can la lan bshad pa gang yin pa de nye bar bkod nas re zhig 'grel pa byed pa bdag nyid kyis /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa de'i rnam par 'grel pa bor nas rang gi sde pa 'ga' zhig gis nam mkha'i gos can la lan bshad pa gang yin pa de nye bar bkod nas re zhig 'grel pa byed pa bdag nyid kyis /
translated: Having cast aside the commentary on that passage, some of our own Buddhist schools set forth the following response to the sky-clad, and then comment on it.

original: de la 'dir kha cig ni gdung ba rtsom pa la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de la 'dir kha cig ni gdung ba rtsom pa la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Here, some say: The composition of austerities.

original: gdung ba rtsom pa las te lus gdung ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can las mi 'dod pa nyams su myong ba gang yin pa de ni sngon byas pa'i las kyi 'bras bu ma yin pa de bas na /
analyzed: gdung ba rtsom pa las te lus gdung ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can las mi 'dod pa nyams su myong ba gang yin pa de ni sngon byas pa'i las kyi 'bras bu ma yin pa de bas na /
translated: The experience of undesirable results from the composition of austerities, from the characteristics of tormenting the body and so on, is not the result of previously committed karma.

original: gang las de'i 'bras bu longs spyod pa zhes bya ba gdung bas bskyed pa mi 'dod pa nyams su myong ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi 'bras bu de longs spyod pa las sam /
analyzed: gang las de'i 'bras bu longs spyod pa zhes bya ba gdung bas bskyed pa mi 'dod pa nyams su myong ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi 'bras bu de longs spyod pa las sam /
translated: Therefore, from what is the result of that karma experienced? The result of that karma is experienced from the composition of austerities, from the experience of undesirable results generated by austerities.

original: las de'i 'bras bu longs spyod pa las zad pa yin no //
analyzed: las de'i 'bras bu longs spyod pa las zad pa yin no //
translated: The result of that karma is exhausted from the experience of the result of that karma.

original: gal te rgyu gang gis de'i gdung ba rtsom pa las skyes pa'i sdug bsngal sngon gyi las kyis byas pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te rgyu gang gis de'i gdung ba rtsom pa las skyes pa'i sdug bsngal sngon gyi las kyis byas pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that the suffering that arises from the beginning of that torment is not produced by prior karma,

original: 'dod pa'i dbang gis 'jug pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i dbang gis 'jug pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: we say that it is engaged by the power of desire.

original: 'dod pa'i dbang gis 'jug pa gang yin pa de ni las kyi rnam par smin pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i dbang gis 'jug pa gang yin pa de ni las kyi rnam par smin pa ma yin te /
translated: That which is engaged by the power of desire is not the ripening of karma,

original: dper na dge ba'i las lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na dge ba'i las lta bu'o //
translated: like, for example, virtuous karma.

original: de ltar na de dang da 'dod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'gog par byed do //
analyzed: de ltar na de dang da 'dod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'gog par byed do //
translated: Thus, he refutes the assertion that it is not like that.üîΩIt is not dependent on the cooperating conditions of a person,

original: skyes bu byed pa'i lhan cig byed pa la ltos pa ma yin zhes bya ba ni skra 'bal ba la sogs pa'i byed pa la ltos pa'o //
analyzed: skyes bu byed pa'i lhan cig byed pa la ltos pa ma yin zhes bya ba ni skra 'bal ba la sogs pa'i byed pa la ltos pa'o //
translated: that is, it is not dependent on the activity of pulling out hair, and so on.

original: skye mched lnga yi rkyen can gyi //
analyzed: skye mched lnga yi rkyen can gyi //
translated: The five sense faculties are its conditions.

original: zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa lnga'i dmigs pa can no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa lnga'i dmigs pa can no //
translated: It has as its object the five such as form.

original: de bas na gtan tshigs 'di ma des pa yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de bas na gtan tshigs 'di ma des pa yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Therefore, this reason is inconclusive.

original: 'dod pa'i dbang gis 'jug pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs 'di ma nges pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i dbang gis 'jug pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs 'di ma nges pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The verse says:

original: de ni // 'bras bu sna tshogs mthong ba'i phyir //
analyzed: de ni // 'bras bu sna tshogs mthong ba'i phyir //
translated: Because of seeing various results.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni tshigs su bcad pa longs spyod chen po dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas @149a * //üîΩ'chad par byed pa la /üîΩlongs spyod chen po nyid dang nad med pa dang yan lag dang nying lag la sogs pa tshang ba ni las dge ba gcig gi 'bras bu sna tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni tshigs su bcad pa longs spyod chen po dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas @149a * // 'chad par byed pa la / longs spyod chen po nyid dang nad med pa dang yan lag dang nying lag la sogs pa tshang ba ni las dge ba gcig gi 'bras bu sna tshogs pa'o //
translated: The verse beginning with ‚Äúgreat enjoyment‚Äù explains this.üîΩGreat enjoyment, health, completeness of major and minor body parts, etc., are the various results of a single virtuous action.

original: nad dang dbul phongs pa dang yan lag dang nying lag la sogs pa ma tshang ba ni las mi dge ba gcig gi yang sna tshogs pa'i 'bras bu yin no //
analyzed: nad dang dbul phongs pa dang yan lag dang nying lag la sogs pa ma tshang ba ni las mi dge ba gcig gi yang sna tshogs pa'i 'bras bu yin no //
translated: Sickness, poverty, and incompleteness of major and minor body parts, etc., are also the various results of a single non-virtuous action.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i 'bras bu sna tshogs pa can gyi zhes bya ba ni nad la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kun nas nyon mongs pa'i 'bras bu sna tshogs pa gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i 'bras bu sna tshogs pa can gyi zhes bya ba ni nad la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kun nas nyon mongs pa'i 'bras bu sna tshogs pa gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: That which has various effects of the thoroughly afflictive is so called because it has various effects of the thoroughly afflictive, characterized by disease and so on.

original: nas la sogs pa'i sa bon spyir dpe nyid yin no //
analyzed: nas la sogs pa'i sa bon spyir dpe nyid yin no //
translated: The seed of barley, etc. is just an example in general.

original: 'bras bu'i ngo bo gcig 'byin par nus pa la 'bras bu sna tshogs pa can nyid ma yin pas khyab pa yin la /
analyzed: 'bras bu'i ngo bo gcig 'byin par nus pa la 'bras bu sna tshogs pa can nyid ma yin pas khyab pa yin la /
translated: It is pervaded by the capacity to produce a single nature of effect, and not by the capacity to produce various effects.

original: de dang 'gal ba yang 'bras bu sna tshogs pa can nyid yin pas khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: de dang 'gal ba yang 'bras bu sna tshogs pa can nyid yin pas khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
translated: And the observation of a contradictory pervasion is the observation of a contradictory pervader, since it is pervaded by the capacity to produce various effects.

original: 'bras bu'i ngo bo gcig 'byin par nus pas nus pa zad pa la 'bras bu gcig 'byin pa'i nus pa nyid kyis khyab pa yin la /
analyzed: 'bras bu'i ngo bo gcig 'byin par nus pas nus pa zad pa la 'bras bu gcig 'byin pa'i nus pa nyid kyis khyab pa yin la /
translated: It is pervaded by the capacity to produce a single effect by the exhaustion of the capacity to produce a single nature of effect.

original: de dang 'gal ba yang 'bras bu sna tshogs pa 'byin pa'i nus pa nyid yin pa de ltar na sbyor ba gnyis pa yang khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: de dang 'gal ba yang 'bras bu sna tshogs pa 'byin pa'i nus pa nyid yin pa de ltar na sbyor ba gnyis pa yang khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the second syllogism is also an inference of contradiction of the pervasion.

original: skra 'bal ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal nyams su myong ba las /
analyzed: skra 'bal ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal nyams su myong ba las /
translated: From the experience of the suffering of pulling out hair and so on,

original: de'i 'bras bu can nyid kyi las mi 'dod pa zad pa ni bla ste /
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu can nyid kyi las mi 'dod pa zad pa ni bla ste /
translated: it is better to exhaust the karma that has the result of that.

original: dge ba 'dod pa'i 'bras bu can gang yin pa de yang ci ltar yin te /
analyzed: dge ba 'dod pa'i 'bras bu can gang yin pa de yang ci ltar yin te /
translated: But how is it that the virtuous karma that has the result of the desired

original: dge ba ni mi 'dod pa'i 'bras bu can ma yin no //
analyzed: dge ba ni mi 'dod pa'i 'bras bu can ma yin no //
translated: is not the virtuous karma that has the result of the undesired?

original: las mi dge ba dag kyang mang po yod pa yin na de la skra 'bal ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal byed pas sdug bsngal gyi gnod pa mi dge ba'i las nges pa 'di ci ltar zad pa yin te /
analyzed: las mi dge ba dag kyang mang po yod pa yin na de la skra 'bal ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal byed pas sdug bsngal gyi gnod pa mi dge ba'i las nges pa 'di ci ltar zad pa yin te /
translated: If there is much nonvirtuous karma, how is it that the suffering of pulling out hair and so on is the definite nonvirtuous karma that exhausts the harm of suffering?

original: las gzhan gyi 'bras bu gzhan gyi 'gyur ba rigs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: las gzhan gyi 'bras bu gzhan gyi 'gyur ba rigs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not logical that the result of one karma is the transformation of another.

original: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir gal te lhan cig byed pa'i khyad par yod pa dang med pa dag las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir gal te lhan cig byed pa'i khyad par yod pa dang med pa dag las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: In order to demonstrate that, he says, ‚ÄúIf there is a difference in the co-operating causes, then the effect will be different, even if the primary cause is the same.‚Äù

original: de skyed ces bya ba la sogs pa ni lhan cig byed pa rgyas par byed pas skyed pa'o //
analyzed: de skyed ces bya ba la sogs pa ni lhan cig byed pa rgyas par byed pas skyed pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIt produces‚Äù and so on means that the co-operating causes produce the effect in detail.

original: rgyu 'dra ba las 'byung ba can zhes bya ba ni nye bar len par gyur pa rjes su mthun pa'i las las byung ba can no //
analyzed: rgyu 'dra ba las 'byung ba can zhes bya ba ni nye bar len par gyur pa rjes su mthun pa'i las las byung ba can no //
translated: ‚ÄúArising from a cause that is similar‚Äù means arising from a similar action that is appropriated.

original: snga ma de nyid kyi gzhung btsugs pa yin no zhes bya ba ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i ngo bo gcig las las rnams zad pa ma yin no zhes @149b bya ba de nyid kyi'o //
analyzed: snga ma de nyid kyi gzhung btsugs pa yin no zhes bya ba ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i ngo bo gcig las las rnams zad pa ma yin no zhes @149b bya ba de nyid kyi'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe same argument applies‚Äù means that the same argument applies to the statement, ‚ÄúThe defilements do not cease from a single real entity that is the essence of defilement.‚Äù

original: ci ste'ang zhes bya ba la sogs pas bsam pa rnam pa gnyis su rtog par byed pa'o //
analyzed: ci ste'ang zhes bya ba la sogs pas bsam pa rnam pa gnyis su rtog par byed pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIf, on the other hand‚Äù and so on considers two other opinions.

original: nus pa 'dres pa can nyid ni 'bras bu gzhan la nges pa'i las kyang 'bras bu gzhan dang ldan pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: nus pa 'dres pa can nyid ni 'bras bu gzhan la nges pa'i las kyang 'bras bu gzhan dang ldan pa nyid kyis so //
translated: ‚ÄúThe mixing of capacities‚Äù means that even though an action is certain to produce a particular effect, it can also produce another effect.

original: las kyi nus pa sna tshogs pa de nyid ces bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa'o ;
analyzed: las kyi nus pa sna tshogs pa de nyid ces bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa'o ;
translated: The second conception is that the various potencies of karma are real entities.

original: / gal te dka' thub can gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa re zhig nus pa zad pa'i phyogs bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: / gal te dka' thub can gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa re zhig nus pa zad pa'i phyogs bstan pa yin no //
translated: The statement beginning with ‚ÄúIf the ascetic‚Äù teaches the position that the potency is exhausted.

original: sdug bsngal cung ba gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //üîΩsdug bsngal cung ba can yang de yin la /
analyzed: sdug bsngal cung ba gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o // sdug bsngal cung ba can yang de yin la /
translated: One who has a little suffering is called ‚Äúhaving a little suffering.‚Äù

original: lus kyi gdung ba nyams su myong ba tsam yang yin pas na zhes bya ba ni las 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: lus kyi gdung ba nyams su myong ba tsam yang yin pas na zhes bya ba ni las 'dzin pa'o //
translated: One who has a little suffering and experiences the mere torment of the body is called ‚Äúhaving a little suffering and experiencing the mere torment of the body.‚ÄùüîΩThis is the definition of the term.

original: de 'bras bu bsal zhing 'dra bar bya bar nus pa gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de 'bras bu bsal zhing 'dra bar bya bar nus pa gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: One who is able to remove the result and make it similar is called ‚Äúable to remove the result and make it similar.‚Äù

original: las gzhan 'dod ces bya ba ni gal te dge ba'i rang bzhin can gyi dka' thub gzhan nyid 'dod par 'gyur na zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: las gzhan 'dod ces bya ba ni gal te dge ba'i rang bzhin can gyi dka' thub gzhan nyid 'dod par 'gyur na zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: If one asserts another karma that is virtuous in nature, this is the meaning of ‚Äúif one asserts another karma.‚Äù

original: dka' thub de las 'bras bu yin zhes bya ba ni kun nas nyon mongs pa las kyi 'bras bu nyid du 'dod pa'i phyir de'i rang bzhin can gyi dka' thub kyang las kyi 'bras bur 'gyur ro //üîΩde las nus pa 'dres pa'am zad pa ma yin te zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: dka' thub de las 'bras bu yin zhes bya ba ni kun nas nyon mongs pa las kyi 'bras bu nyid du 'dod pa'i phyir de'i rang bzhin can gyi dka' thub kyang las kyi 'bras bur 'gyur ro // de las nus pa 'dres pa'am zad pa ma yin te zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The result of austerity is also the result of karma.

original: dper na glang gi las kyi 'bras bu lta bu'o zhes bya ba ni dpe yin no //
analyzed: dper na glang gi las kyi 'bras bu lta bu'o zhes bya ba ni dpe yin no //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe result of the karma of an ox‚Äù is an example.

original: glang gi las kyi 'bras bu dka' thub tu 'gyur ba ma yin la /
analyzed: glang gi las kyi 'bras bu dka' thub tu 'gyur ba ma yin la /
translated: The result of the karma of an ox is not austerity.

original: de las kyang glang gi las 'dres pa'am zad par 'gyur ba ma yin na /
analyzed: de las kyang glang gi las 'dres pa'am zad par 'gyur ba ma yin na /
translated: Nor is the karma of an ox mixed with or exhausted by austerity.

original: bsgrub par bya ba dang po la dper na glang gi las kyi 'bras bu'o zhes rnam par dbye ba bsgyur nas sbyar ba yin no //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba dang po la dper na glang gi las kyi 'bras bu'o zhes rnam par dbye ba bsgyur nas sbyar ba yin no //
translated: The example is stated in the root text by the phrase ‚Äúthe result of the karma of an ox.‚Äù

original: dka' thub nyid dang nus pa 'dres pa dang zad pa'i rgyu nyid la las kyi 'bras bu ma yin pa nyid kyis khyab pa yin la /
analyzed: dka' thub nyid dang nus pa 'dres pa dang zad pa'i rgyu nyid la las kyi 'bras bu ma yin pa nyid kyis khyab pa yin la /
translated: The result of austerity is not the result of karma because it is not mixed with or exhausted by karma.

original: de dang 'gal ba yang las kyi 'bras bu nyid yin pa de ltar na khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: de dang 'gal ba yang las kyi 'bras bu nyid yin pa de ltar na khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
translated: And the effect of that action is also indeterminate. Thus, the observation of an effect that is contradictory with the pervader is the third type of observation of a contradictory effect.

original: de ltar na las kyi 'bras bu ni lung du ma bstan pa yin la /
analyzed: de ltar na las kyi 'bras bu ni lung du ma bstan pa yin la /
translated: Thus, the effect of an action is indeterminate.

original: de dang dge ba dang mi dge ba dag dang 'gal ba yin na ji ltar dka' thub yin par 'gyur /
analyzed: de dang dge ba dang mi dge ba dag dang 'gal ba yin na ji ltar dka' thub yin par 'gyur /
translated: And if it is contradictory with virtue and nonvirtue, how could it be austerity?

original: dka' thub ni sdig pa zad par byed pa'i nus pa'i mchan nyid can nyid yin pa'i phyir ci ltar na las kyi rnam par smin pa nus pa 'dres pa'i rgyur 'gyur /
analyzed: dka' thub ni sdig pa zad par byed pa'i nus pa'i mchan nyid can nyid yin pa'i phyir ci ltar na las kyi rnam par smin pa nus pa 'dres pa'i rgyur 'gyur /
translated: Because austerity is characterized by the power to destroy sin, how could the effect of an action be the cause of the mixing of powers?

original: de bas na ldog pa la the tshom za ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na ldog pa la the tshom za ba ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, there is no doubt that the effect of an action is destroyed.

original: skye bar 'dod pa'i skyon gyis skyed pa'i las la nus par 'gyur gyi zhes bya ba ni de skye @150a * //
analyzed: skye bar 'dod pa'i skyon gyis skyed pa'i las la nus par 'gyur gyi zhes bya ba ni de skye @150a * //
translated: The fault of the assertion that an action produces an effect is that the action would have the power to produce an effect.

original: ba dang 'gal ba'i rten skyed pa nyid phyir ro //
analyzed: ba dang 'gal ba'i rten skyed pa nyid phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the cause of the production of that which is contradictory with the production of the effect.

original: sngar byas pa dag la ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni de dag lam skyed pa las sngar byas pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: sngar byas pa dag la ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni de dag lam skyed pa las sngar byas pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: But it is not the case for actions that were previously performed, because they were performed prior to the production of the path.

original: ma grub pa yin la zhes bya ba ni lam yang las kyi rgyu sred pa la sogs pa la gnod pa yin no zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs 'di'o //
analyzed: ma grub pa yin la zhes bya ba ni lam yang las kyi rgyu sred pa la sogs pa la gnod pa yin no zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs 'di'o //
translated: The reason is this: the path is also a harm to the cause of karma, craving, etc.

original: las 'das pa'i rgyu sred pa gang yin pa de la lam gnod par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: las 'das pa'i rgyu sred pa gang yin pa de la lam gnod par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: The craving which is the cause of past karma is not harmed by the path,

original: de skye ba'i dus na de med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de skye ba'i dus na de med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because when it arises, it does not exist.

original: bcom ldan 'das tshad ma nyid du sgrub pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das tshad ma nyid du sgrub pa /
translated: The Blessed One is established as a valid cognizer,

original: lugs las bzlog pas sngar dam bcas nas /
analyzed: lugs las bzlog pas sngar dam bcas nas /
translated: and he has reversed the order of the thesis,

original: de bden pa ston par mdzad pas na zhes bya ba la sogs pas sbyor bar byed do //
analyzed: de bden pa ston par mdzad pas na zhes bya ba la sogs pas sbyor bar byed do //
translated: and he teaches the truth of that, saying, etc.

original: blangs bar bya ba dang dor bar bya ba'i de kho na nyid thabs dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: blangs bar bya ba dang dor bar bya ba'i de kho na nyid thabs dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The reality of what is to be adopted and what is to be rejected, together with the means,

original: sdug bsngal dang 'gog pa'i bden pa kun 'byung dang lam dang bcas pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang 'gog pa'i bden pa kun 'byung dang lam dang bcas pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: means the truth of suffering and cessation, together with the origin and path.üîΩFrom the refuge which is the result

original: 'bras bur gyur pa'i skyob pa las zhes bya ba ni bde bar gshegs pa'i 'bras bu skyob pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bur gyur pa'i skyob pa las zhes bya ba ni bde bar gshegs pa'i 'bras bu skyob pa'o //
translated: means from the blissful result of the refuge.

original: de nyid brtan pa dang / ma lus khyad par mkhyen pa sgrub //
analyzed: de nyid brtan pa dang / ma lus khyad par mkhyen pa sgrub //
translated: The establishment of the knowledge of reality, stability, and the absence of remainder is the knowledge of the distinctions.

original: ces bya ba ni de kho na nyid dang / brtan pa dang / ma lus pa'i yon tan de dag gsum gyis khyad par du byed pas khyad par mkhyen pa ste de kho na nyid dang brtan pa dang / ma lus pa'i khyad par mkhyen pa'i bde bar gshegs pa nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni de kho na nyid dang / brtan pa dang / ma lus pa'i yon tan de dag gsum gyis khyad par du byed pas khyad par mkhyen pa ste de kho na nyid dang brtan pa dang / ma lus pa'i khyad par mkhyen pa'i bde bar gshegs pa nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The knowledge of the distinctions is distinguished by these three qualities: reality, stability, and the absence of remainder. The meaning is that the knowledge of the distinctions of reality, stability, and the absence of remainder is the state of the Sugata.

original: de grub pa ni de kho na nyid dang brtan pa dang / ma lus pa'i khyad par mkhyen pa sgrub pa ste /
analyzed: de grub pa ni de kho na nyid dang brtan pa dang / ma lus pa'i khyad par mkhyen pa sgrub pa ste /
translated: The establishment of that is the establishment of the knowledge of reality, stability, and the absence of remainder.

original: sgrub pa'i sgra'i ngo bo sgrub par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgrub pa'i sgra'i ngo bo sgrub par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the word ‚Äúestablishment‚Äù has the nature of an agent.

original: de nyid kyi phyir grub pa sgrub pa yin no zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir grub pa sgrub pa yin no zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, it is said that it is the establishment of the established.

original: sngar ni zhes bya ba lugs las bzlog pa bshad pa la'o //
analyzed: sngar ni zhes bya ba lugs las bzlog pa bshad pa la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúPreviously‚Äù refers to the explanation in reverse order.

original: par gyi zhes bya ba smos pas ni slar ldog pa med par thugs su chud pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba nang du bsdu ba ston to //
analyzed: par gyi zhes bya ba smos pas ni slar ldog pa med par thugs su chud pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba nang du bsdu ba ston to //
translated: The word only shows that the meaning of not turning back is included in the phrase possessing the understanding that there is no turning back.

original: de kho na nyid smos pas ni bsngags pa'i don bstan to //
analyzed: de kho na nyid smos pas ni bsngags pa'i don bstan to //
translated: The word reality shows the meaning of praise.

original: brtan pa'i tshig gis slar ldog pa med pa dang / ma lus pa'i don ni rang gi sgra nyid gzung bas bstan to //
analyzed: brtan pa'i tshig gis slar ldog pa med pa dang / ma lus pa'i don ni rang gi sgra nyid gzung bas bstan to //
translated: The word firm shows the meaning of not turning back and complete.

original: de kho na nyid mkhyen pa la sogs pas bcom ldan 'das yin par ci ltar rtogs par bya zhe na /
analyzed: de kho na nyid mkhyen pa la sogs pas bcom ldan 'das yin par ci ltar rtogs par bya zhe na /
translated: How is it understood that the Blessed One is so because of knowing reality and so forth?

original: de kho na nyid mkhyen pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de kho na nyid mkhyen pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The phrase because of knowing reality and so forth is stated.

original: de kho na nyid mkhyen pa ni tshad mas mi slu ba las rjes su dpag pa yin no zhes 'chad par 'gyur ba dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: de kho na nyid mkhyen pa ni tshad mas mi slu ba las rjes su dpag pa yin no zhes 'chad par 'gyur ba dang sbyar ro //
translated: The phrase because of knowing reality is to be connected with the explanation that knowing reality is inferred from being undeceived by valid cognition.

original: gang gi phyir bcom ldan 'das kyi bka' tshad ma mi @150b slu ba yin pa de'i phyir de'i mkhyen pa phyin ci ma log par rjes su dpog pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir bcom ldan 'das kyi bka' tshad ma mi @150b slu ba yin pa de'i phyir de'i mkhyen pa phyin ci ma log par rjes su dpog pa yin no //
translated: Because the words of the Blessed One are valid and undeceptive, his knowledge is inferred to be unmistaken.

original: lam nges pa'am zhes bya ba ni nges pa ste /
analyzed: lam nges pa'am zhes bya ba ni nges pa ste /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúor the path is certain‚Äù means that it is certain.

original: the tshom med par ston pa las brtan pa'i mkhyen pa rjes su dpog pa yin te /
analyzed: the tshom med par ston pa las brtan pa'i mkhyen pa rjes su dpog pa yin te /
translated: One can infer the Buddha‚Äôs knowledge from his teaching, which is free of doubt.

original: shes bya gang la brtan pa'i shes pa yod pa ma yin pa gang yin pa de ni rnam pa gsal ba'i sgo nas ston par nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: shes bya gang la brtan pa'i shes pa yod pa ma yin pa gang yin pa de ni rnam pa gsal ba'i sgo nas ston par nus pa ma yin no //
translated: That which is not known by the Buddha cannot be taught clearly.

original: bka' snga phyi 'gal ba med pa zhes bya ba'i rnam par bshad pa ni gnod pa med pas zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: bka' snga phyi 'gal ba med pa zhes bya ba'i rnam par bshad pa ni gnod pa med pas zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The explanation of the phrase ‚Äúthe earlier and later statements are not contradictory‚Äù is ‚Äúbecause it is not damaged.‚Äù

original: rnam pa des 'gyur ba med pa las brtan bstan pa las brtan pa'i mkhyen pa rjes su dpog pa yin no zhes pa'i skabs yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa des 'gyur ba med pa las brtan bstan pa las brtan pa'i mkhyen pa rjes su dpog pa yin no zhes pa'i skabs yin no //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúbecause it is not changed by any of these‚Äù is the context for inferring the Buddha‚Äôs knowledge from his steadfastness.

original: gal te 'gal ba med pa yang ci ltar yin zhe na /
analyzed: gal te 'gal ba med pa yang ci ltar yin zhe na /
translated: If it is asked how it is not contradictory,

original: ston pa'i bstan pa yan lag dgu dang zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: ston pa'i bstan pa yan lag dgu dang zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: the text says, ‚ÄúThe Teacher‚Äôs teaching has nine limbs.‚Äù

original: ston pa'i bstan pa ni bka' yin no //
analyzed: ston pa'i bstan pa ni bka' yin no //
translated: The Teacher‚Äôs teaching is the Buddha‚Äôs words.

original: de ni mdo'i sde dang / dbyangs kyis bsnyad pa'i sde dang / lung bstan pa'i ste dang / tshigs su bcad pa la sogs pa'i khyad par gyi yan lag dgu yin no //
analyzed: de ni mdo'i sde dang / dbyangs kyis bsnyad pa'i sde dang / lung bstan pa'i ste dang / tshigs su bcad pa la sogs pa'i khyad par gyi yan lag dgu yin no //
translated: It is the nine branches of the scriptures, namely, the Sutra, the Geva, the Vyakarana, the Gatha, the Udana, the Nidana, the Avadana, the Itivrttaka, and the Jataka.

original: lus pa yang gang yin gang gi mi shes pa spangs pas ma lus pa mkhyen pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: lus pa yang gang yin gang gi mi shes pa spangs pas ma lus pa mkhyen pa yin zhe na /
translated: What is the remainder, and what is the non-remainder, by the abandonment of which ignorance is the knowledge of the non-remainder?

original: lus pa ni 'dir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: lus pa ni 'dir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The remainder is here, etc.

original: bcom ldan 'das la de mnga' ba ma yin te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la de mnga' ba ma yin te /
translated: The Blessed One does not have that,

original: thabs sna tshogs pas bden pa bzhi ston par mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thabs sna tshogs pas bden pa bzhi ston par mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he teaches the Four Noble Truths by various methods.

original: de'i phyir ma lus pa mkhyen pa rjes su dpog pa yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir ma lus pa mkhyen pa rjes su dpog pa yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Therefore, the knowledge of the non-remainder is inferred.

original: de'i rjes su slob pa yin no zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyi rjes su slob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rjes su slob pa yin no zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyi rjes su slob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He is a follower, etc. because he follows the Blessed One.

original: lhan cig skyes pa'i 'jig tshogs su lta ba zhes bya ba ni mngon par 'dus ma byas so //
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa'i 'jig tshogs su lta ba zhes bya ba ni mngon par 'dus ma byas so //
translated: The innate view of the transitory collection is not fully formed.

original: de de ltar na 'bras bu skyob pa nyid yin pa'i phyir rgyu bde bar gshegs pa nyid bsgrubs nas /
analyzed: de de ltar na 'bras bu skyob pa nyid yin pa'i phyir rgyu bde bar gshegs pa nyid bsgrubs nas /
translated: Since it is thus a refuge for the result, the cause, the state of a sugata, is established.

original: da ni bde bar gshegs pa 'bras bur gyur pa nyid kyis lam goms pa'i mtshan nyid can ston pa nyid bsgrub pa'i phyir de kho na nyid dang bstan pa dang ma lus pa'i khyad par mkhyen pa de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: da ni bde bar gshegs pa 'bras bur gyur pa nyid kyis lam goms pa'i mtshan nyid can ston pa nyid bsgrub pa'i phyir de kho na nyid dang bstan pa dang ma lus pa'i khyad par mkhyen pa de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Now, in order to establish the teacher himself through the fact that the state of a sugata is the result of the path of cultivation, he says, because he knows suchness, the teaching, and all that is to be known.

original: rgyu'i gnas skabs su goms pa'i lam gang yin pa de gzhan gyi don yin gyi rang gi don ma yin no zhes ci ltar shes par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: rgyu'i gnas skabs su goms pa'i lam gang yin pa de gzhan gyi don yin gyi rang gi don ma yin no zhes ci ltar shes par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How is it known that the path of cultivation in the state of the cause is for the sake of others and not for one's own sake?

original: de'i phyir gang gis de ltar thugs su chud na yang zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gang gis de ltar thugs su chud na yang zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore he says, although he has thus realized,

original: gang bya ba byas pa yin na yang gzhan gyi don la 'jug pa ldog pa med pa ni sngon yang @151a * //
analyzed: gang bya ba byas pa yin na yang gzhan gyi don la 'jug pa ldog pa med pa ni sngon yang @151a * //
translated: even though he has completed what was to be done, his engagement in the welfare of others is unceasing, because he previously possessed that.

original: de la mnga' ba yin na zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de la mnga' ba yin na zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: de yang ston par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de yang ston par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: And that will be taught.

original: grub phyir chags bral med phyir ro //
analyzed: grub phyir chags bral med phyir ro //
translated: because he is not detached in order to attain.

original: zhes bya bas de ma thag tu bstan par 'gyur ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya bas de ma thag tu bstan par 'gyur ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it will be explained immediately below.üîΩThe continuum of the TathƒÅgata‚Äôs thought is the cause of his remaining in equanimity, etc.

original: gang 'di btang snyoms su bzhugs par ston pa la sogs pa'i rgyud pa zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i de ma thag tu thugs ngas zab pa'i phyir chos 'di rtog pa gzhan dag gis 'di rtogs par bya bar mi nus
analyzed: gang 'di btang snyoms su bzhugs par ston pa la sogs pa'i rgyud pa zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i de ma thag tu thugs ngas zab pa'i phyir chos 'di rtog pa gzhan dag gis 'di rtogs par bya bar mi nus
translated: Immediately after the Bhagavat‚Äôs complete enlightenment, because his thought was profound, he thought, ‚ÄúOthers cannot understand this Dharma through other contemplations.

original: pas ni kho bo cang mi smra bas btang snyoms su bzhugs pa la dmigs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i don 'byung ba'i phyir ro //üîΩsems can yongs su smin par byed pa'i rgyu nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni zab pa ston par mdzad pas /
analyzed: pas ni kho bo cang mi smra bas btang snyoms su bzhugs pa la dmigs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i don 'byung ba'i phyir ro // sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'i rgyu nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni zab pa ston par mdzad pas /
translated: Therefore, I will remain in equanimity, thinking, ‚ÄòI will not teach the Dharma.‚Äô‚ÄùüîΩThe cause of the maturation of sentient beings is the teaching of the profound.

original: mngon par 'dod chags pa ches lhag pa skyed pa'i sgo nas sems can rnams yongs su smin par mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon par 'dod chags pa ches lhag pa skyed pa'i sgo nas sems can rnams yongs su smin par mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he causes the maturation of sentient beings through the generation of even greater desire for the manifest.

original: de ni de'i 'bras bu de tsam 'dod pa ma yin te zhes bya ba ni thugs su chud pa'i 'bras bu tsam bzhed par 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de ni de'i 'bras bu de tsam 'dod pa ma yin te zhes bya ba ni thugs su chud pa'i 'bras bu tsam bzhed par 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is not that he desires only that much result, i.e., it is not that he desires only the result of understanding.

original: 'bras bu de tsam 'dod pa nyid la de rtogs pa yod na byed pa rdzogs pa can gyis khyab pa yin la /
analyzed: 'bras bu de tsam 'dod pa nyid la de rtogs pa yod na byed pa rdzogs pa can gyis khyab pa yin la /
translated: If one desires only that much result, then it is pervaded by being a completed action.

original: de dang 'gal ba yang byed pa rdzogs pa can ma yin pa nyid yin pa de ltar khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: de dang 'gal ba yang byed pa rdzogs pa can ma yin pa nyid yin pa de ltar khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
translated: And the contradictory of that is not being a completed action. Thus, there is the observation of a contradiction with the pervader.

original: brtse bas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la gzhung des ni snying rje dang ye shes gnyis ni tshad ma nyid kyi sgrub par bshad do //
analyzed: brtse bas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la gzhung des ni snying rje dang ye shes gnyis ni tshad ma nyid kyi sgrub par bshad do //
translated: By compassion, etc. This passage explains that compassion and wisdom are the proof of validity.

original: gnyis po de yang go rims bzhin du 'gro ba la phan par bzhed pa nyid dang bde bar gshegs pa nyid kyi tshig dag gis bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: gnyis po de yang go rims bzhin du 'gro ba la phan par bzhed pa nyid dang bde bar gshegs pa nyid kyi tshig dag gis bshad pa yin no //
translated: And those two are explained by the words ‚Äúdesire to benefit the world‚Äù and ‚Äúsugata,‚Äù respectively.

original: lam goms pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi bstan pa nyid gang yin pa de tshad ma nyid du nye bar spyor ba ma yin na de ci'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa smos she na /
analyzed: lam goms pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi bstan pa nyid gang yin pa de tshad ma nyid du nye bar spyor ba ma yin na de ci'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa smos she na /
translated: If the teaching itself, which has the characteristic of being cultivated on the path, is not applied as valid knowledge, why then is it mentioned in the verse?üîΩTherefore he says:

original: de'i phyir / shes pa de yang sgrub byed bcas //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / shes pa de yang sgrub byed bcas // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: That knowledge is also established by proof.

original: yon tan gsum mkhyen pa de yang bde bar gshegs ba'i tshig gis bstan pa yin la /
analyzed: yon tan gsum mkhyen pa de yang bde bar gshegs ba'i tshig gis bstan pa yin la /
translated: That knowledge of the three qualities is also taught by the words of the Sugata.

original: sgrub par byed pa dang bcas pas ni lam goms pa sgrub par byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa dang bcas pas ni lam goms pa sgrub par byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And because it is accompanied by proof, it is established as the cultivation of the path.

original: gal te 'o na skyob pa nyid kyi tshig ji ltar tshad mar sgrub pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: gal te 'o na skyob pa nyid kyi tshig ji ltar tshad mar sgrub pa yin zhe na /
translated: If so, how is the word protector established as valid knowledge?

original: de gsung bar ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de gsung bar ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: He says that speaker and so on.

original: mngon par sbyor ba'i sgo nas gsung ba po de @151b nyid kyang 'gro ba la phan par mdzad pa nyid dang bde bar gshegs pa'i tshig dag gis skyob pa yin zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mngon par sbyor ba'i sgo nas gsung ba po de @151b nyid kyang 'gro ba la phan par mdzad pa nyid dang bde bar gshegs pa'i tshig dag gis skyob pa yin zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to show that the speaker himself, through his application, is a protector for beings through his benefit and the words of the Sugata,üîΩhe says:

original: gal te brtse ba dang ldan pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: gal te brtse ba dang ldan pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: If one is endowed with love, etc.

original: ji skad du bshad pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa'i mkhan po ston par byed pa zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa'i mkhan po ston par byed pa zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The master who teaches the qualities as they have been explained is to be praised.

original: ji skad du bshad pa'i yon tan zhes bya ba ni legs pa dang bden pa 'chad pa dang de rtogs pa dang rjes su brtson pa'o //
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa'i yon tan zhes bya ba ni legs pa dang bden pa 'chad pa dang de rtogs pa dang rjes su brtson pa'o //
translated: The qualities as they have been explained are the explanation of the good and the true, the realization of that, and the striving for that.

original: ston pa de lta'i dngos bstod ni //
analyzed: ston pa de lta'i dngos bstod ni //
translated: The master who teaches such things is to be praised.

original: zhes bya ba ni ston pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni ston pa ste /
translated: The master is the one who teaches.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i bka' de lta bu'i dngos po ston pa de lta'i dngos bstod de tshad mas bstod pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i bka' de lta bu'i dngos po ston pa de lta'i dngos bstod de tshad mas bstod pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The teaching of the things of suchness is the teaching of the things of the Tathagata's word. The master who teaches such things is to be praised. The meaning of praise by means of valid cognition is that.

original: de ltar na bstod pa de lta bu'i ngo bo nyid kyis bcom ldan 'das tshad ma nyid yin pa de'i phyir tshad ma'i sgo nas bstod pa ni /
analyzed: de ltar na bstod pa de lta bu'i ngo bo nyid kyis bcom ldan 'das tshad ma nyid yin pa de'i phyir tshad ma'i sgo nas bstod pa ni /
translated: Thus, the Blessed One is valid cognition by the nature of such praise. Therefore, the praise by means of valid cognition is:

original: ston pa de lta'i dngos bstod ni //
analyzed: ston pa de lta'i dngos bstod ni //
translated: The master who teaches such things is to be praised.

original: zhes bya ba'i don gcig tu gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i don gcig tu gyur pa yin no //
translated: The meaning of this is the same as the previous one.

original: de nyid kyi phyir chos mngon pa las kyang bshad pa yin no zhes bya ba ni tshad ma rnam par nges pa bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir chos mngon pa las kyang bshad pa yin no zhes bya ba ni tshad ma rnam par nges pa bshad pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is also explained in the Abhidharma.üîΩThis is the explanation of the Ascertainment of Valid Knowledge.

original: re zhig mngon sum gyi tshad ma zhes bya ba la sogs ba ni rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga bstan pa'i sgo nas de bstan cing bshad pa nyid kyi phyir ro //üîΩslob dpon sh'akya blo gros kyis sbyar ba tshad ma rnam 'grel gyi 'grel pa'i dka' 'grel las /
analyzed: re zhig mngon sum gyi tshad ma zhes bya ba la sogs ba ni rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga bstan pa'i sgo nas de bstan cing bshad pa nyid kyi phyir ro // slob dpon sh'akya blo gros kyis sbyar ba tshad ma rnam 'grel gyi 'grel pa'i dka' 'grel las /
translated: The five collections of consciousness are taught and explained by the words direct perception, etc.

original: le'u gnyis pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: le'u gnyis pa rdzogs so /
translated: This is the commentary on the second chapter of the Tika composed by Acharya Shakyamati.

original: // / tshad ma rnam 'grel gyi 'grel bshad /
analyzed: // / tshad ma rnam 'grel gyi 'grel bshad /
translated: The commentary on the PramanavarttikaüîΩThe commentary on the Pramanavarttika

original: bam po bzhi bcu rtsa dgu pa /
analyzed: bam po bzhi bcu rtsa dgu pa /
translated: The commentary on the Pramanavarttika

original: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dag la mi slu ba'i mtshan nyid gcig yod pa yin te /
analyzed: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dag la mi slu ba'i mtshan nyid gcig yod pa yin te /
translated: Direct perception and inference have the same characteristic of non-deception,

original: dngos po la gnyi ga mi slu ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po la gnyi ga mi slu ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because both are non-deceptive with regard to things.

original: gang gi tshe de nyid mtshon par bya bar gyur pa zhes bya ba ni mi slu ba de nyid de /
analyzed: gang gi tshe de nyid mtshon par bya bar gyur pa zhes bya ba ni mi slu ba de nyid de /
translated: When that very [non-deception] becomes the object of expression...

original: gang gi phyir mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa gsal ba'i dbye bas mtshon par 'dod pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang gi phyir mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa gsal ba'i dbye bas mtshon par 'dod pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: because it is held to be indicated by the division of direct perception and inference.

original: mi slu ba'i de nyid gsal ba'i dbye bas shes par 'dod na yang mtshan nyid gcig gis mtshon par bya ba yin nam /
analyzed: mi slu ba'i de nyid gsal ba'i dbye bas shes par 'dod na yang mtshan nyid gcig gis mtshon par bya ba yin nam /
translated: If it is held that it is known by the division of the manifestation of reality, is it indicated by a single characteristic?

original: khyad par gyi mtshan nyid kyis 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: khyad par gyi mtshan nyid kyis 'gyur grang na /
translated: Or is it by a specific characteristic?

original: re zhig rnam pa dang po ni ma yin te mi slu ba nyid ma gtogs par mngon sum dang / rjes su dpag pa la khyab par byed pa gzhan mtshan nyid gcig med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: re zhig rnam pa dang po ni ma yin te mi slu ba nyid ma gtogs par mngon sum dang / rjes su dpag pa la khyab par byed pa gzhan mtshan nyid gcig med pa'i phyir te /
translated: First, it is not the first, because apart from non-deceptiveness, there is no other pervader of direct perception and inference that is indicated by a single characteristic.

original: de las gzhan pa'i mtshan nyid gcig yod pa ma yin zhes bya ba gang smos pa yin no //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i mtshan nyid gcig yod pa ma yin zhes bya ba gang smos pa yin no //
translated: What is meant by there is no other single characteristic?

original: de las zhes bya ba ni mi slu ba nyid las so//
analyzed: de las zhes bya ba ni mi slu ba nyid las so//
translated: From that means from non-deceptiveness.

original: @152a * // de nyid ni spyi'i mtshan nyid yin la des kyang khyad par rtogs par nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: @152a * // de nyid ni spyi'i mtshan nyid yin la des kyang khyad par rtogs par nus pa ma yin no //
translated: That is the general characteristic, and it cannot be known by that.

original: de dag ces bya ba ni mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa'o //
analyzed: de dag ces bya ba ni mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThose‚Äù refers to direct perception and inference.

original: dbye ba ma byas par khyad par gyi mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag par mi nus pas na /
analyzed: dbye ba ma byas par khyad par gyi mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag par mi nus pas na /
translated: Since it is impossible to posit the defining characteristics of those without making a division,

original: de dbye ba'i sgo nas bstan na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de dbye ba'i sgo nas bstan na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: he says, ‚ÄúIf it is taught by way of division,‚Äù and so on.

original: gang gi tshe yul ma yin pa 'dzin pa tshad mar 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: gang gi tshe yul ma yin pa 'dzin pa tshad mar 'gyur ba ste /
translated: When a nonobject is apprehended, it is valid knowledge.

original: gang gi tshe rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yul can nyid mngon sum yin no zhes rnam par 'jog par mi byed pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yul can nyid mngon sum yin no zhes rnam par 'jog par mi byed pa de'i tshe /
translated: When one does not posit that direct perception is only that which has a particular characteristic as its object,

original: ji ltar yul gyi dbye ba mi shes pa rab rib can la sogs pa'i shes pa la snang ba'i skra bshad la sogs pa gang yin pa yul ma yin pa de la yang mngon sum 'di tshad mar 'dzin par 'gyur ba de'i tshe /
analyzed: ji ltar yul gyi dbye ba mi shes pa rab rib can la sogs pa'i shes pa la snang ba'i skra bshad la sogs pa gang yin pa yul ma yin pa de la yang mngon sum 'di tshad mar 'dzin par 'gyur ba de'i tshe /
translated: then at that time, just as with respect to a nonobject, such as the hairs seen by the eye consciousness of someone with an eye disease, which is not an object, this direct perception apprehends it as valid knowledge.

original: de la slu ba yin na de dang 'dra bar rang gi yul la yang ste /
analyzed: de la slu ba yin na de dang 'dra bar rang gi yul la yang ste /
translated: If it is deceptive with respect to that, then it is the same with respect to its own object.

original: sngon po la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid la de tshad ma ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid la de tshad ma ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: It would not be a valid cognition with regard to the characteristics of blue, etc.

original: yul bstan na ni skyon 'dir mi 'gyur te ;
analyzed: yul bstan na ni skyon 'dir mi 'gyur te ;
translated: If it were to reveal the object, this fault would not occur.

original: yul ma yin pa la slu ba'i phyir rjes su mthun pa'i yul la yang tshad ma ma yin par rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: yul ma yin pa la slu ba'i phyir rjes su mthun pa'i yul la yang tshad ma ma yin par rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: But it is not reasonable that it is not a valid cognition with regard to a similar object because it is deceptive with regard to a non-object.

original: re zhig 'bras bu gdon mi za bar don rtogs pa'i ngo bo nyid yin gyi zhes bya ba ni tshad ma byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir 'bras bu bya ba'i mtshan nyid can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: re zhig 'bras bu gdon mi za bar don rtogs pa'i ngo bo nyid yin gyi zhes bya ba ni tshad ma byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir 'bras bu bya ba'i mtshan nyid can du 'gyur ro //
translated: The result is certainly the nature of the realization of the object, because it is the nature of the activity of a valid cognition.

original: de yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: It is twofold:

original: nges pa ni gang byed pa 'jug pa yod na gdon mi za bar 'gyur ba ste byed pa po gzhan gyis chod pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nges pa ni gang byed pa 'jug pa yod na gdon mi za bar 'gyur ba ste byed pa po gzhan gyis chod pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The certain is that which occurs when the engagement of the activity exists, because there is no interruption by another agent.

original: ma nges pa ni 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa dag thob pa dang spong ba zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: ma nges pa ni 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa dag thob pa dang spong ba zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The uncertain is the attainment of the desired and the abandonment of the undesired.

original: de la dang po nyid ni 'bras bu yin te byed par rnam par gzhag pa'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la dang po nyid ni 'bras bu yin te byed par rnam par gzhag pa'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The first is the effect, because it is the cause that is posited as the agent.

original: de yang don rtogs pa'i ngo bo can yin te /
analyzed: de yang don rtogs pa'i ngo bo can yin te /
translated: And that is of the nature of the understanding of the object,

original: de nyid ni tshad ma 'jug pa na gdon mi za bar 'gyur ba can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid ni tshad ma 'jug pa na gdon mi za bar 'gyur ba can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because when the valid cognition is engaged, it necessarily becomes that.

original: ma nges pa gang yin pa de ni rgyu gzhan gyis chod pa'i phyir tshad ma 'jug pa na /
analyzed: ma nges pa gang yin pa de ni rgyu gzhan gyis chod pa'i phyir tshad ma 'jug pa na /
translated: Whatever is uncertain is interrupted by another cause, so when the valid cognition is engaged,

original: gdon mi za bar 'gyur ba can ma yin no //
analyzed: gdon mi za bar 'gyur ba can ma yin no //
translated: it does not necessarily become that.

original: de bas na des byas pa ni byed par rnam par 'jog pa ma yin zhing byed pas byas pa nyid kyang 'bras bu de nyid ma yin pa de'i phyir de lta ma yin na 'bras bur mi rung ba nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de bas na des byas pa ni byed par rnam par 'jog pa ma yin zhing byed pas byas pa nyid kyang 'bras bu de nyid ma yin pa de'i phyir de lta ma yin na 'bras bur mi rung ba nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, what is produced by that is not posited as the agent, and what is produced by the agent is not the effect itself. Therefore, it is said, ‚Äúbecause it would not be tenable as the effect if that were not so.‚Äù

original: mi shes pa'i ngo bo yang tshad mar mi rung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni mi shes pa'i ngo bo bum pa la sogs pa dang 'dra bar cung @152b zad kyang shes pa ma yin te /
analyzed: mi shes pa'i ngo bo yang tshad mar mi rung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni mi shes pa'i ngo bo bum pa la sogs pa dang 'dra bar cung @152b zad kyang shes pa ma yin te /
translated: The nature of non-knowledge is not knowledge in the slightest, like a pot, etc.

original: shes pa las tha dad pa'i tshad ma thams cad la ches shin tu sgrub bar byed pa nyid yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: shes pa las tha dad pa'i tshad ma thams cad la ches shin tu sgrub bar byed pa nyid yod pa ma yin te /
translated: For all valid cognitions that are different from knowledge do not exist at all,

original: yul gyi rnam pas chod pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: yul gyi rnam pas chod pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because they are obstructed by the form of the object.

original: de ni rgyas par 'og nas 'chad par 'gyur ro //üîΩautpala sngon po la sogs pa lta bu'o zhes bya ba ni sngon po ni spyi yin la /
analyzed: de ni rgyas par 'og nas 'chad par 'gyur ro // autpala sngon po la sogs pa lta bu'o zhes bya ba ni sngon po ni spyi yin la /
translated: This will be explained in detail below.üîΩLike a blue lotus, etc.

original: autpala ni khyad par yin pa de ltar na gnyi ga'i bdag nyid can gyi yul gcig yin par sems so //
analyzed: autpala ni khyad par yin pa de ltar na gnyi ga'i bdag nyid can gyi yul gcig yin par sems so //
translated: Blue is a universal, and lotus is a particular. Thus, it is thought that there is one object that has the nature of both.

original: dpe ma grub pa nyid sgrub par byed pa'i chos dang mi ldan pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: dpe ma grub pa nyid sgrub par byed pa'i chos dang mi ldan pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because the example is not established, it lacks the property to be proven.

original: de ni rang rig pa'i shes pa nyid du zhes bya ba la sogs pa la 'di skad du ston par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ni rang rig pa'i shes pa nyid du zhes bya ba la sogs pa la 'di skad du ston par 'gyur te /
translated: That is self-aware cognition, etc. This is taught as follows:

original: 'dzin pa'i rnam pa las gzhan rig pa ma yin te gang gis na de 'dzin pa'i rnam pa yul du 'gyur /
analyzed: 'dzin pa'i rnam pa las gzhan rig pa ma yin te gang gis na de 'dzin pa'i rnam pa yul du 'gyur /
translated: It is not cognition that is different from the aspect of apprehending, by virtue of which that aspect of apprehending would be the object.

original: 'on kyang 'dzin pa'i rnam pa rang rig pa'i bdag nyid can de skyes pa nyid na rig pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang 'dzin pa'i rnam pa rang rig pa'i bdag nyid can de skyes pa nyid na rig pa yin no //
translated: However, when the aspect of apprehending, which has the nature of reflexive awareness, is produced, it is cognition.

original: tha dad pa med na yul dang yul can gyi dngos po gang las yin zhing gang gis na dpe ma grub par 'gyur /
analyzed: tha dad pa med na yul dang yul can gyi dngos po gang las yin zhing gang gis na dpe ma grub par 'gyur /
translated: If there is no difference, then what is the basis of the object and subject, and how could the example be unestablished?

original: ci ste shes pa gzhan gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa la gal te rang rig pa 'dzin pa'i rnam pa la tha dad pa med na yang shes pa gzhan gyi tha dad par brtags nas 'dzin pa'i rnam pa yul du rnam par gzhag pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: ci ste shes pa gzhan gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa la gal te rang rig pa 'dzin pa'i rnam pa la tha dad pa med na yang shes pa gzhan gyi tha dad par brtags nas 'dzin pa'i rnam pa yul du rnam par gzhag pa de'i tshe /
translated: If you say, ‚ÄúIt is the other cognition,‚Äù and so on, then if there is no difference between reflexive awareness and the aspect of apprehending, but you still posit the aspect of apprehending as the object by imputing a difference of other cognition,

original: rang rig pa yang 'dzin pa'i rnam pa las tha dad pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rang rig pa yang 'dzin pa'i rnam pa las tha dad pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: then because reflexive awareness is not different from the aspect of apprehending,

original: de bzhin du ste 'dzin pa'i rnam pa bzhin du yul nyid yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du ste 'dzin pa'i rnam pa bzhin du yul nyid yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: it would be the object, just like the aspect of apprehending.

original: 'di ni yul yin la 'di ni yul can yin no zhes 'di shin tu ma 'chol bar brjod par nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni yul yin la 'di ni yul can yin no zhes 'di shin tu ma 'chol bar brjod par nus pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not possible to say, ‚ÄúThis is the object, and this is the subject,‚Äù without confusion.

original: rig pa yang yul nyid yin na gzhan yul can yang ci zhig yod /
analyzed: rig pa yang yul nyid yin na gzhan yul can yang ci zhig yod /
translated: And if consciousness is the object, what else is there that is the subject?

original: gang la ltos nas yul nyid yin //
analyzed: gang la ltos nas yul nyid yin //
translated: With respect to what is it the object?

original: de ltar na gcig la yul dang yul can gyi dngos po yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na gcig la yul dang yul can gyi dngos po yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Thus, the relation of object and subject does not exist for a single thing.

original: de nyid ni de bas na /
analyzed: de nyid ni de bas na /
translated: This is the point.

original: rnam pa tha dad pa med pa can ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: rnam pa tha dad pa med pa can ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Therefore, he says, ‚ÄúIf there is no difference in form . . . ‚Äù

original: yul las rgyu mtshan gzhan zhes bya ba la sogs pa la rnam par shes pa snga ma shes pa de ma thag pa'i rgyu ni yid la byed pa'o //
analyzed: yul las rgyu mtshan gzhan zhes bya ba la sogs pa la rnam par shes pa snga ma shes pa de ma thag pa'i rgyu ni yid la byed pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúAnother cause for the object‚Äù and so on. The prior consciousness is the cause of the immediately antecedent condition of consciousness.

original: de nyid 'bras bu skyed pa la nus pa yod pa ni de dang rjes su mthun pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid 'bras bu skyed pa la nus pa yod pa ni de dang rjes su mthun pa'o //
translated: That which has the power to generate an effect is similar to it.

original: sngon gyi brda dran pa ni brda 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: sngon gyi brda dran pa ni brda 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The memory of a prior sign is the apprehension of the sign.

original: de dag yod pa zhes bya ba ni de dag yod pa na ste /
analyzed: de dag yod pa zhes bya ba ni de dag yod pa na ste /
translated: ‚ÄúTheir existence‚Äù means when they exist.

original: phyi rol gyi don med par yang zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don med par yang zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that external objects do not exist.

original: don gyi byed par nus pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid de nyid rang gi mtshan nyid la sogs pa la sbyar @153a * //üîΩbar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: don gyi byed par nus pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid de nyid rang gi mtshan nyid la sogs pa la sbyar @153a * // bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The verse ‚ÄúBecause of the ability or inability to perform a function‚Äù should be applied to intrinsic identity, etc.üîΩThat is, the ability to perform a function, the non-universality, the non-verbality, and the absence of awareness when the reason is absent, should be applied to intrinsic identity.üîΩThe inability to perform a function, the universality, the verbality, etc., should be applied to the universal.

original: don byed nus dang mi nus phyir //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs par de la don byed par nus pa gang yin pa dang / thun mong ma yin pa dang / sgra'i yul ma yin pa dang / rgyu mtshan gzhan yod na gang med pa las blo med par bshad pa gang yin pa de rang gi mtshan nyid la sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: don byed nus dang mi nus phyir // zhes bya ba la sogs par de la don byed par nus pa gang yin pa dang / thun mong ma yin pa dang / sgra'i yul ma yin pa dang / rgyu mtshan gzhan yod na gang med pa las blo med par bshad pa gang yin pa de rang gi mtshan nyid la sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The verse ‚ÄúBecause of the ability or inability to perform a function‚Äù should be applied to intrinsic identity, etc.üîΩThat is, the ability to perform a function, the non-universality, the non-verbality, and the absence of awareness when the reason is absent, should be applied to intrinsic identity.üîΩThe inability to perform a function, the universality, the verbality, etc., should be applied to the universal.üîΩThe verse ‚ÄúBecause of the ability or inability to perform a function‚Äù should be applied to intrinsic identity, etc.

original: de ltar na nus pa med pa gang yin pa dang / thun mong dang sgra'i yul zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang yin pa de ni spyi'i mtshan nyid la sbyar bar bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar na nus pa med pa gang yin pa dang / thun mong dang sgra'i yul zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang yin pa de ni spyi'i mtshan nyid la sbyar bar bya ste /
translated: That is, the ability to perform a function, the non-universality, the non-verbality, and the absence of awareness when the reason is absent, should be applied to intrinsic identity.üîΩThe inability to perform a function, the universality, the verbality, etc., should be applied to the universal.

original: 'chad par 'gyur ba'i tshigs su bcad pas zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'chad par 'gyur ba'i tshigs su bcad pas zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The verse ‚ÄúBecause of the ability or inability to perform a function‚Äù should be applied to intrinsic identity, etc.üîΩThat is, the ability to perform a function, the non-universality, the non-verbality, and the absence of awareness when the reason is absent, should be applied to intrinsic identity.üîΩThe inability to perform a function, the universality, the verbality, etc., should be applied to the universal.üîΩThe verse ‚ÄúBecause of the ability or inability to perform a function‚Äù should be applied to intrinsic identity, etc.

original: de nyid ni /
analyzed: de nyid ni /
translated: That is, the ability to perform a function, the non-universality, the non-verbality, and the absence of awareness when the reason is absent, should be applied to intrinsic identity.

original: don dam par don byed nus gang//
analyzed: don dam par don byed nus gang//
translated: The inability to perform a function, the universality, the verbality, etc., should be applied to the universal.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed do //
translated: Thus, he explains.

original: mdor don byed nus pa smos pa ni nye bar mtshon pa yin no //
analyzed: mdor don byed nus pa smos pa ni nye bar mtshon pa yin no //
translated: The statement ‚Äúthat which is able to perform a function‚Äù is a mere illustration.

original: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi gal te thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pas dbu ma pa'i 'dod pa'i dogs pa bsu ba yin no //
analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi gal te thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pas dbu ma pa'i 'dod pa'i dogs pa bsu ba yin no //
translated: This is the case, but he anticipates an objection of the MƒÅdhyamika with ‚ÄúIf you say that all . . .‚Äù

original: de dag gis 'di ltar rtogs pa yin te re zhig rtag pa skad cig ma ma yin pa de ni don byed par nus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de dag gis 'di ltar rtogs pa yin te re zhig rtag pa skad cig ma ma yin pa de ni don byed par nus pa ma yin te /
translated: They understand this as follows: First, a permanent thing that is not momentary is not able to perform a function,

original: rim dang cig car dag gis don byed par 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rim dang cig car dag gis don byed par 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is contradictory for it to perform a function either gradually or instantaneously.

original: skad cig ma zhig zin pa yang don byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: skad cig ma zhig zin pa yang don byed pa ma yin te /
translated: Also, a thing that has already ceased is not able to perform a function,

original: de ni med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because it does not exist.

original: ma zhig pa yang ma yin te rgyu dang 'bras bu cig car 'byung bar thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma zhig pa yang ma yin te rgyu dang 'bras bu cig car 'byung bar thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Nor is it not ceased, because it follows that cause and effect would occur simultaneously.

original: zhig pa dang ma zhig pa las ma gtogs pa yod pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: zhig pa dang ma zhig pa las ma gtogs pa yod pa yang ma yin no //
translated: Nor is there anything other than ceased and not ceased.

original: re zhig 'bras bu yang yod pa skye ba ma yin te /
analyzed: re zhig 'bras bu yang yod pa skye ba ma yin te /
translated: First, an existent effect is not produced,üîΩbecause it exists.

original: yod pa nyid skye ba 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yod pa nyid skye ba 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is contradictory for that which exists to arise.

original: med pa yang ma yin te de skye ba'i rten med pa'i phyir dang / med par khyad par med pa'i phyir rgyu gcig las kyang med pa ma lus pa cig car skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: med pa yang ma yin te de skye ba'i rten med pa'i phyir dang / med par khyad par med pa'i phyir rgyu gcig las kyang med pa ma lus pa cig car skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Nor is it nonexistent, because that which is nonexistent has no basis for arising, and because, if there were no basis for arising, then everything would arise from everything, since there would be no difference between what is nonexistent and what is not.
