original: de lta na med pa skyed par byed pa nyid rgyu'i bdag nyid du 'gyur ba de yang /
analyzed: de lta na med pa skyed par byed pa nyid rgyu'i bdag nyid du 'gyur ba de yang /
translated: If that were so, then the cause itself would be the producer of what is nonexistent.

original: ji ltar mngon par 'dod pa'i myu gu la sogs pa'i 'bras bu la yin pa de ltar ri bong gi rva la sogs pa la yang yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar mngon par 'dod pa'i myu gu la sogs pa'i 'bras bu la yin pa de ltar ri bong gi rva la sogs pa la yang yin no //
translated: And just as it is the cause of the sprout, etc., which are as it is desired, so it is also of the rabbit‚Äôs horns, etc.

original: de bas na don dam par don byed par nus pa cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na don dam par don byed par nus pa cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, ultimately, nothing has the capacity to perform a function.

original: sa bon stsogs ni myug sogs la //
analyzed: sa bon stsogs ni myug sogs la //
translated: The capacity of seeds, etc.

original: nus mthong zhes bya ba la mthong ba smos pa ni nye bar mtshon pa yin no //
analyzed: nus mthong zhes bya ba la mthong ba smos pa ni nye bar mtshon pa yin no //
translated: To produce sprouts, etc. is seen.

original: de ltar na 'bras bu ldog pa'i sgo nas mig gi rnam par shes pa la mig la sogs pa'i nus pa rjes su dpog pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na 'bras bu ldog pa'i sgo nas mig gi rnam par shes pa la mig la sogs pa'i nus pa rjes su dpog pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the capacity of the eye, etc. is inferred from the cessation of visual consciousness, etc.

original: bsod nams dang sdig pa dag ni 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa'i 'bras bu @153b 'byin pa la nus pa khas len pa dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po tha snyad 'jig rten las rab tu grags pa nyid kyi phyir nges pa yin no //
analyzed: bsod nams dang sdig pa dag ni 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa'i 'bras bu @153b 'byin pa la nus pa khas len pa dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po tha snyad 'jig rten las rab tu grags pa nyid kyi phyir nges pa yin no //
translated: Merit and sin are definitely accepted as having the power to produce desired and undesired results, and the fact of cause and effect is well known in the world.

original: de bas na dngos po don byed par nus pa khas mi len na mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dang khas blangs pa dang grags pa dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: de bas na dngos po don byed par nus pa khas mi len na mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dang khas blangs pa dang grags pa dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: Therefore, if one does not accept that things are able to perform functions, one will contradict perception, inference, testimony, and what is commonly acknowledged.üîΩThis is the idea.üîΩIf you accept that as conventional,üîΩthen, because we accept the fact of cause and effect conventionally,üîΩwe do not contradict perception and so on.

original: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
translated: This is true, but

original: gal te de kun rdzob 'dod na //
analyzed: gal te de kun rdzob 'dod na //
translated: if you accept that as conventional,

original: zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob tu rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po khas blangs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob tu rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po khas blangs pa'i phyir /
translated: then, because we accept the fact of cause and effect conventionally,

original: mngon sum la sogs pa dang 'gal ba yod pa ma yin no zhes bya bar bsams pa'o //
analyzed: mngon sum la sogs pa dang 'gal ba yod pa ma yin no zhes bya bar bsams pa'o //
translated: we do not contradict perception and so on.

original: mtshon par bya ba khyab pa med pas mtshan nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba ni 'jug pa med pa nyid khyab pa med pa yin te /
analyzed: mtshon par bya ba khyab pa med pas mtshan nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba ni 'jug pa med pa nyid khyab pa med pa yin te /
translated: Since the object to be characterized is not pervaded, it is not a characteristic.

original: mtshon par bya ba 'ga' zhig la yang don dam par don byed pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtshon par bya ba 'ga' zhig la yang don dam par don byed pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since the object to be characterized does not ultimately perform a function, it is not pervaded.

original: de bas na med pa nyid kyi phyir mtshan nyid ma yin pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas na med pa nyid kyi phyir mtshan nyid ma yin pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, because it does not exist, it is not a characteristic.

original: spyi la yang de yod pa zhes bya ba ni don byed par nus pa ste /
analyzed: spyi la yang de yod pa zhes bya ba ni don byed par nus pa ste /
translated: The existence of that in the universal is the ability to perform a function.

original: des kyang rang gi rnam par shes pa kun rdzob tu skyed par byed pa yin no lo //
analyzed: des kyang rang gi rnam par shes pa kun rdzob tu skyed par byed pa yin no lo //
translated: That also generates its own consciousness conventionally.

original: shin tu khyab pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba ni lhag pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: shin tu khyab pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba ni lhag pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because it is completely pervaded,

original: mtshan nyid 'chol bar 'gyur pa ni spyi yang don gyi bya ba byed pa nyid kyis rang gi mtshan nyid du thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtshan nyid 'chol bar 'gyur pa ni spyi yang don gyi bya ba byed pa nyid kyis rang gi mtshan nyid du thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because of the excess, the characteristic would be confused, because the universal would also be its own characteristic due to performing the function of the object.

original: ji lta de ltar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar kun rdzob kyis kyang don byed par nus par khas len na /
analyzed: ji lta de ltar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar kun rdzob kyis kyang don byed par nus par khas len na /
translated: ‚ÄúIf it were like that, it would be like that‚Äù means that if one accepts that even the conventional can perform a function,

original: dngos po nyid du khas blang bar 'gyur ba yin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: dngos po nyid du khas blang bar 'gyur ba yin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: then one would have to accept that it is a real thing.

original: 'di ltar don byed par nus pa nyid kyis nye bar brjod pa dang bral ba las ldog pa kun rdzob kyi ming can de yang dbu ma pas kyang 'dod par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar don byed par nus pa nyid kyis nye bar brjod pa dang bral ba las ldog pa kun rdzob kyi ming can de yang dbu ma pas kyang 'dod par bya ba yin te /
translated: Thus, the Madhyamaka must accept that which is called ‚Äúconventional‚Äù as the opposite of that which is free from expression by virtue of its ability to perform a function.

original: de tsam ni dngos po'i mtshan nyid yin no //
analyzed: de tsam ni dngos po'i mtshan nyid yin no //
translated: That much is the definition of a real thing.

original: kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i sgra dag gis brjod pa na don byed par nus pa sgra'i dbang gis tha dad pa nyid du dmigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i sgra dag gis brjod pa na don byed par nus pa sgra'i dbang gis tha dad pa nyid du dmigs pa ma yin no //
translated: When it is expressed by the words ‚Äúconventional‚Äù and ‚Äúultimate,‚Äù the ability to perform a function is not observed to be different by virtue of the power of words.

original: zhig pa dang ma zhig pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa rnams ni /
analyzed: zhig pa dang ma zhig pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa rnams ni /
translated: The conceptual thoughts of ‚Äúdestruction‚Äù and ‚Äúnon-destruction‚Äù and so on

original: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po la 'jug pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po la 'jug pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: do not exist in the things that are the causes and effects spoken of by the Transcendent Conqueror.

original: 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das 'di yod na 'di 'byung zhes rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po ston par mdzad pas /
analyzed: 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das 'di yod na 'di 'byung zhes rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po ston par mdzad pas /
translated: Thus, the Lord, by teaching the existence of cause and effect, saying, ‚ÄúWhen this exists, that comes to be,‚Äù

original: rnam par rtog pa gsum bor nas rnam par rtog pa bzhi ba zhal gyis bzhes so //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa gsum bor nas rnam par rtog pa bzhi ba zhal gyis bzhes so //
translated: has rejected the three misconceptions and has accepted the fourth misconception.

original: 'di ltar yang rnam bar rtog pa ni rgyu las 'bras bu sngon rol nas yod par @154a * //üîΩ'gyur ba'am / rgyu dang lhan cig yod pa'am /
analyzed: 'di ltar yang rnam bar rtog pa ni rgyu las 'bras bu sngon rol nas yod par @154a * // 'gyur ba'am / rgyu dang lhan cig yod pa'am /
translated: Thus, the misconception is that the effect exists prior to the cause,üîΩthat it exists simultaneously with the cause,

original: skad cig ma gzhan gyis chod pa ste /
analyzed: skad cig ma gzhan gyis chod pa ste /
translated: or that it is separated from the cause by another moment.

original: skad cig ma gsum par 'byung ba can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skad cig ma gsum par 'byung ba can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is because the effect arises in the third moment.

original: ma chod par skad cig ma gnyis pa la yod pa zhes bya ba bzhi 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ma chod par skad cig ma gnyis pa la yod pa zhes bya ba bzhi 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The fourth misconception is that it exists in the second moment without being separated from the cause.

original: de la sngon gyi dus na yod pa ni rgyu yod na 'byung ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de la sngon gyi dus na yod pa ni rgyu yod na 'byung ba ma yin te /
translated: The effect that exists prior to the cause does not arise when the cause exists,

original: de ni dang po nyid nas grub zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni dang po nyid nas grub zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it already existed before.

original: dus mnyam du skye ba yang rgyu yod na 'byung ba ma yin te /
analyzed: dus mnyam du skye ba yang rgyu yod na 'byung ba ma yin te /
translated: Nor does the effect that arises simultaneously with the cause arise when the cause exists,

original: de yang yod pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang yod pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because it already exists.

original: 'di ltar dus mnyam pa nyid ni 'bras bu med pa'i dus na rgyu yang med la rgyu yod na 'bras bu yang yod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar dus mnyam pa nyid ni 'bras bu med pa'i dus na rgyu yang med la rgyu yod na 'bras bu yang yod pa yin no //
translated: Thus, when there is no effect, there is no cause, and when there is a cause, there is an effect.

original: skad cig ma gsum pa la sogs pa na yod pa yang rgyu yod na 'byung ba ma yin te /
analyzed: skad cig ma gsum pa la sogs pa na yod pa yang rgyu yod na 'byung ba ma yin te /
translated: The effect does not occur in the third moment, etc., when the cause exists,

original: skad cig ma gnyis pa kho na la rgyu zhig pa nyid kyis med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skad cig ma gnyis pa kho na la rgyu zhig pa nyid kyis med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the cause ceases in the second moment itself and does not exist.

original: de lta bas na skad cig ma gnyis pa la yod pa'i 'bras bu nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta bas na skad cig ma gnyis pa la yod pa'i 'bras bu nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the effect exists in the second moment.

original: de ltar na skad cig ma gnyis pa la yod pa'i mtshang nyid can nyid 'bras bu yin gyi sngar ma yin zhing lhan cig kyang ma yin la /
analyzed: de ltar na skad cig ma gnyis pa la yod pa'i mtshang nyid can nyid 'bras bu yin gyi sngar ma yin zhing lhan cig kyang ma yin la /
translated: Thus, the effect has the characteristic of existing in the second moment, not in the first, nor simultaneously,

original: skad cig ma gsum par yod pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: skad cig ma gsum par yod pa yang ma yin no //
translated: nor does it exist in the third moment.

original: skad cig ma gnyis pa la yod pa'i 'bras bu skye ba yang rgyu ma zhig pa nyid las 'byung ba yin te /
analyzed: skad cig ma gnyis pa la yod pa'i 'bras bu skye ba yang rgyu ma zhig pa nyid las 'byung ba yin te /
translated: The arising of the effect existing in the second moment occurs from the non-ceasing of the cause,

original: skad cig ma dang por rgyu ma zhig pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: skad cig ma dang por rgyu ma zhig pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because the cause does not cease in the first moment.

original: skad cig ma gnyis pa la 'bras bu yod pa'i dus na /
analyzed: skad cig ma gnyis pa la 'bras bu yod pa'i dus na /
translated: At the time when the effect exists in the second moment,

original: skad cig ma nyid yin pa'i phyir rgyu gnas pa med pa de ltar na gang las lhan cig gnas pa yin /
analyzed: skad cig ma nyid yin pa'i phyir rgyu gnas pa med pa de ltar na gang las lhan cig gnas pa yin /
translated: the cause does not endure because it is momentary. Thus, what endures simultaneously?

original: gal te med pa skye bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te med pa skye bar 'gyur na /
translated: If that which does not exist were to arise,

original: med pa nyid du khyad par med pa'i phyir rta'i rva la sogs pa yang 'gyur ro zhes bshad pa gang yin pa de yang phyin ci log pas skyug ldad byed pa yin te /
analyzed: med pa nyid du khyad par med pa'i phyir rta'i rva la sogs pa yang 'gyur ro zhes bshad pa gang yin pa de yang phyin ci log pas skyug ldad byed pa yin te /
translated: then even the horn of a donkey and so on would arise, because it would not differ from that which does not exist.

original: shes pa nyid 'di tsam du smra ba 'di khas ma blangs pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: shes pa nyid 'di tsam du smra ba 'di khas ma blangs pa nyid yin no //
translated: This is also a case of vomiting up what was wrongly ingested, because you do not accept that consciousness itself is merely this.

original: yod na bkag pa tsam nyid las gzhan med pa zhes bya ba cung zad kyang mi 'dod na gang skye ba dang 'brel bar 'gyur /
analyzed: yod na bkag pa tsam nyid las gzhan med pa zhes bya ba cung zad kyang mi 'dod na gang skye ba dang 'brel bar 'gyur /
translated: If it exists, then apart from the mere negation of existence, we do not assert anything else called nonexistence, so what would arise?

original: 'on kyang skad cig ma gcig gnas pa'i chos can yin pa'i rgyu'i phyir /
analyzed: 'on kyang skad cig ma gcig gnas pa'i chos can yin pa'i rgyu'i phyir /
translated: However, because it is the cause that has the attribute of enduring for one moment,

original: skad cig ma gcig gnas pa'i chos can ni rang gi mtshan nyid 'ba' zhig tu 'gyur ba yin la de nyid skye ba yin no //
analyzed: skad cig ma gcig gnas pa'i chos can ni rang gi mtshan nyid 'ba' zhig tu 'gyur ba yin la de nyid skye ba yin no //
translated: that which has the attribute of enduring for one moment is only its own characteristic, and that itself is arising.

original: de yang sngar yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba de tsam du brjod kyi /
analyzed: de yang sngar yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba de tsam du brjod kyi /
translated: Moreover, we say that it does not exist previously, but

original: 'ga' zhig skye bar 'gyur ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig skye bar 'gyur ba ni ma yin te /
translated: we do not say that something arises that did not exist.

original: dngos po la cha med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po la cha med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because a thing is partless.

original: de bas na 'di'i snga ma'i gnas skabs cung zad kyang yod pa @154b ma yin pa de ltar na /
analyzed: de bas na 'di'i snga ma'i gnas skabs cung zad kyang yod pa @154b ma yin pa de ltar na /
translated: Therefore, since it has no previous state of existence at all,

original: de la ltos nas yod pa yang ma yin zhing med pa yang skye ba ma yin pa'i phyir gang las thal ba yin /
analyzed: de la ltos nas yod pa yang ma yin zhing med pa yang skye ba ma yin pa'i phyir gang las thal ba yin /
translated: it does not exist in dependence on that. Nor does it arise from what does not exist. Therefore, what is the entailment?

original: med pa nyid du khyad par med pa'i phyir zhes brjod pa gang yin pa khyad par med pa zhes bya ba 'di yang gang yin /
analyzed: med pa nyid du khyad par med pa'i phyir zhes brjod pa gang yin pa khyad par med pa zhes bya ba 'di yang gang yin /
translated: What is this so-called ‚Äúnondifference‚Äù that you assert is the reason for the error that ‚Äúbecause they are not different, there is no arising from another‚Äù?

original: gal te rang bzhin gcig pa nyid yin na de ci ltar na med pa nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te rang bzhin gcig pa nyid yin na de ci ltar na med pa nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: If they are the same in nature, how could they be nonexistent?

original: tha dad pa dang tha dad pa med pa ni dngos po'i chos nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha dad pa dang tha dad pa med pa ni dngos po'i chos nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because difference and nondifference are the nature of things.

original: ji ste khyad par 'gog pa tsam yin na de ni cir yang mi rung ba de ltar na ji ltar de'i dbang gis dngos po thams cad skye bar 'gyur /
analyzed: ji ste khyad par 'gog pa tsam yin na de ni cir yang mi rung ba de ltar na ji ltar de'i dbang gis dngos po thams cad skye bar 'gyur /
translated: If it is the mere negation of a difference, then it is not suitable for anything at all. In that case, how could all things arise by its power?

original: de bas na ji skad du bshad pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po la zhig pa dang ma zhig pa la sogs pa'i rtag pa 'jug pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na ji skad du bshad pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po la zhig pa dang ma zhig pa la sogs pa'i rtag pa 'jug pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, as explained, the state of being a cause and effect does not apply to things that are destroyed or not destroyed, and so on.

original: gal te khyed cag gis 'jig pa la sogs par kun du brtags pa 'di skye ba la gnod par 'gyur ba de'i tshe kun rdzob tu skye ba la yang ci'i phyir gnod par mi byed de /
analyzed: gal te khyed cag gis 'jig pa la sogs par kun du brtags pa 'di skye ba la gnod par 'gyur ba de'i tshe kun rdzob tu skye ba la yang ci'i phyir gnod par mi byed de /
translated: If you think that this imputation of destruction and so on would undermine arising, then why does it not undermine arising in the relative?

original: de la yang zhig ba dang ma zhig pa la sogs pa ma gtogs par rnam pa gzhan yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de la yang zhig ba dang ma zhig pa la sogs pa ma gtogs par rnam pa gzhan yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Because in that context, apart from being destroyed or not destroyed, and so on, there is no other way that it exists.

original: dngos po'i stobs las 'ongs pa'i gtan tshigs kyi yul ni skyes bu'i 'dod pa'i dbang gis rnam par dbye bar rigs pa ma yin na /
analyzed: dngos po'i stobs las 'ongs pa'i gtan tshigs kyi yul ni skyes bu'i 'dod pa'i dbang gis rnam par dbye bar rigs pa ma yin na /
translated: It is not logical to divide the domain of a reason that proceeds from the power of things according to the power of the wish of a person.

original: gang gis na don dam par skye ba nyid la gnod par byed pa yin gyi kun rdzob pa la ma yin /
analyzed: gang gis na don dam par skye ba nyid la gnod par byed pa yin gyi kun rdzob pa la ma yin /
translated: How could it be that it refutes ultimate production, and not conventional production?

original: gal te mngon sum la gnod par dogs pas de la gtan tshigs mi 'jug go zhe na /
analyzed: gal te mngon sum la gnod par dogs pas de la gtan tshigs mi 'jug go zhe na /
translated: If you say that the reason does not apply to direct perception because it is suspected of being invalidated,

original: 'o na de ni gtan tshigs ma yin te /
analyzed: 'o na de ni gtan tshigs ma yin te /
translated: then it is not a reason,

original: gnod par byar rung ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: gnod par byar rung ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because it is suitable to be invalidated.

original: de ltar na gzhan la yang yid brtan du med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na gzhan la yang yid brtan du med par 'gyur ro //
translated: In that case, it would be unreliable for others as well.

original: de skad du /
analyzed: de skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: dngos rnams ngo bo gang dang gang //
analyzed: dngos rnams ngo bo gang dang gang //
translated: Whatever the nature of things,

original: don dam par ni bkag pa na //
analyzed: don dam par ni bkag pa na //
translated: if they are refuted ultimately,

original: de la kun rdzob nyid kyis kyang //
analyzed: de la kun rdzob nyid kyis kyang //
translated: then even conventionally

original: mdor bsdus khyad par 'gyur yin nam //üîΩzhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: mdor bsdus khyad par 'gyur yin nam // zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: would they not be distinguished?

original: de dag thams cad blo la bzhag nas kho bo cag gi don byed bus pa'i mtshan nyid kyis khyad par med par zhes bya ba la sogs pas rnam par 'grel bar byed do //
analyzed: de dag thams cad blo la bzhag nas kho bo cag gi don byed bus pa'i mtshan nyid kyis khyad par med par zhes bya ba la sogs pas rnam par 'grel bar byed do //
translated: Having set forth all of those, he explains with ‚Äúbecause they are not distinguished by the characteristic of being produced by us‚Äù and so on.

original: gal te bdag nyid thams cad kyis med pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gal te bdag nyid thams cad kyis med pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If ‚Äúit does not exist by its own nature‚Äù means

original: gal te thams cad med pa kun rdzob kyi bden pa de lta bur 'gyur ba mthong ba log pa brdzun pa rigs pa ma yin ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gal te thams cad med pa kun rdzob kyi bden pa de lta bur 'gyur ba mthong ba log pa brdzun pa rigs pa ma yin ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: If all things were non-existent, that would be the conventional truth, and seeing that would be false, unreal, and irrational.

original: yang na kun rdzob kyi sgras skye ba la sogs pa 'dod pa yin na /
analyzed: yang na kun rdzob kyi sgras skye ba la sogs pa 'dod pa yin na /
translated: Or, if the term ‚Äúconventional‚Äù refers to the acceptance of arising, etc.,

original: gang gi tshe bdag nyid thams cad kyis med pa kun rdzob ma yin gyi @155a * //
analyzed: gang gi tshe bdag nyid thams cad kyis med pa kun rdzob ma yin gyi @155a * //
translated: then that which is nonexistent in every respect is not conventional.

original: 'on kyang dngos po yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang dngos po yin te /
translated: Rather, it is a thing.

original: kun rdzob ni rnam par gzhag pa thams cad kyi rten nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun rdzob ni rnam par gzhag pa thams cad kyi rten nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the conventional is the basis of all presentations.

original: de'i tshe dngos po ni skye ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe dngos po ni skye ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: At that time, a thing is the nature of arising, etc.

original: skye ba la sogs pa kun rdzob kyi sgras bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skye ba la sogs pa kun rdzob kyi sgras bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Arising, etc., are indicated by the term ‚Äúconventional.‚Äù

original: skye ba med pa la sogs pa ni don dam pa yin te /
analyzed: skye ba med pa la sogs pa ni don dam pa yin te /
translated: Non-arising, etc., are the ultimate.

original: don dam pa'i sgra ni kun rdzob las bzlog pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don dam pa'i sgra ni kun rdzob las bzlog pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the term ‚Äúultimate‚Äù is the opposite of ‚Äúconventional.‚Äù

original: de bas na don dam par skye ba med pa ni skye ba med pa la sogs pas skye ba med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas na don dam par skye ba med pa ni skye ba med pa la sogs pas skye ba med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, non-production in the ultimate sense is taught by such expressions as ‚Äúnon-production, etc.‚Äù

original: de ltar na kun rdzob tu skye ba ni skye ba la sogs pas skye ba zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na kun rdzob tu skye ba ni skye ba la sogs pas skye ba zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Thus, production in the conventional sense is taught by such expressions as ‚Äúproduction, etc.‚Äù

original: de la don dam pa'i sgra'i don bzung nas des kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de la don dam pa'i sgra'i don bzung nas des kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: There, having taken the meaning of the word ‚Äúultimate,‚Äù he says, ‚Äúby that, etc.‚Äù

original: kun rdzob kyi sgra'i don la brten nas 'on kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi sgra'i don la brten nas 'on kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Having taken the meaning of the word ‚Äúconventional,‚Äù he says, ‚Äúbut, etc.‚Äù

original: des ni kun rdzob kyi don la rnam par rtog pa gzhan la yang brgal zhing brtag par byas pa yin no //
analyzed: des ni kun rdzob kyi don la rnam par rtog pa gzhan la yang brgal zhing brtag par byas pa yin no //
translated: Thus, he has refuted and examined other concepts of the meaning of ‚Äúconventional.‚Äù

original: gang kun rdzob kyi don mi rtag pa'i shes don yin nam /
analyzed: gang kun rdzob kyi don mi rtag pa'i shes don yin nam /
translated: If one says that the meaning of ‚Äúconventional‚Äù is the meaning of impermanence,

original: sgyu ma'i don yin nam /
analyzed: sgyu ma'i don yin nam /
translated: or the meaning of illusion,

original: 'jig rten la grags pa'i don yin par smra'o zhe na /
analyzed: 'jig rten la grags pa'i don yin par smra'o zhe na /
translated: or the meaning of what is well known in the world,

original: re zhig mi rtag pa gang yin /
analyzed: re zhig mi rtag pa gang yin /
translated: then, first, what is impermanent?

original: gal te rtag pa med pa tsam zhig yin na de'i tshe ji ltar sde ba'i sgo nas 'gro ba la grags par 'gyur /
analyzed: gal te rtag pa med pa tsam zhig yin na de'i tshe ji ltar sde ba'i sgo nas 'gro ba la grags par 'gyur /
translated: If it is just the mere absence of permanence, then how could it be known in the world by means of the schools?

original: 'on te rtag pa las gzhan mi rtag pa yin na /
analyzed: 'on te rtag pa las gzhan mi rtag pa yin na /
translated: But if it is impermanent, other than permanent,

original: rtag pa yang rnam par rtog pa'i rnam par shes pa yin pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: rtag pa yang rnam par rtog pa'i rnam par shes pa yin pa de'i tshe /
translated: and permanent is a conceptual consciousness, then at that time

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes pas rtogs pa yod do zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes pas rtogs pa yod do zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: it is taught that it is realized by a nonconceptual consciousness.

original: de lta yin na ji ltar dngos po'i ngo bo nyid khas ma blangs pa yin /
analyzed: de lta yin na ji ltar dngos po'i ngo bo nyid khas ma blangs pa yin /
translated: If that is so, how could you not accept the nature of things?

original: rjes su dpag pas rtogs pa yang spangs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pas rtogs pa yang spangs par 'gyur te /
translated: Also, realization by inference would be rejected,

original: de ni rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that is conceptual.

original: 'on te sgyu ma'i don yin na yang gal te thams cad med pa yin pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: 'on te sgyu ma'i don yin na yang gal te thams cad med pa yin pa de'i tshe /
translated: But if it is the meaning of illusion, and if everything is nonexistent,

original: kun rdzob kyang thams cad med pa yin pa de ltar na ji ltar kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byad par 'gyur /
analyzed: kun rdzob kyang thams cad med pa yin pa de ltar na ji ltar kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byad par 'gyur /
translated: then even the conventional would be nonexistent. In that case, how could there be affliction and purification?

original: 'on te sgyu ma 'khrul pa'i shes pa yin pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: 'on te sgyu ma 'khrul pa'i shes pa yin pa de'i tshe /
translated: But if it is the illusory consciousness,üîΩthen what is the difference between it and the mode of being of the internal object of knowledge?

original: shes bya nang gi yin pa'i tshul las khyad par ci yong kun rdzob kyi don 'jig rten la grags pa'i don yin no zhes bya ba 'di la yang 'jig rten zhes bya ba 'di bstan bcos byed pa'am 'on te skye bo phal pa yin zhes dpyad par byaüîΩba yin no //
analyzed: shes bya nang gi yin pa'i tshul las khyad par ci yong kun rdzob kyi don 'jig rten la grags pa'i don yin no zhes bya ba 'di la yang 'jig rten zhes bya ba 'di bstan bcos byed pa'am 'on te skye bo phal pa yin zhes dpyad par bya ba yin no //
translated: This statement, ‚ÄúThe meaning of the conventional is the meaning renowned in the world,‚Äù must be analyzed: Is the ‚Äúworld‚Äù the treatises or is it ordinary beings?

original: rnam par rtog pa dang po ltar na dngos po la phan tshun 'gal ba'i rang bzhin du mar 'gyur te /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa dang po ltar na dngos po la phan tshun 'gal ba'i rang bzhin du mar 'gyur te /
translated: If it is the former, then things would have many mutually contradictory natures,

original: gcig la yang bstan bcos @155b byed pa mang po rnams rnam pa du mar sgro 'dogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig la yang bstan bcos @155b byed pa mang po rnams rnam pa du mar sgro 'dogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because many authors of treatises superimpose many aspects on a single thing.

original: gnyis pa ltar na bdag med pa la sogs pa yang khas blang bar mi bya ste /
analyzed: gnyis pa ltar na bdag med pa la sogs pa yang khas blang bar mi bya ste /
translated: If it is the latter, then one should not accept such things as selflessness,

original: 'di dag ni skye po tha mal pa la grags pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di dag ni skye po tha mal pa la grags pa ma yin no //
translated: because these are not renowned to ordinary beings.

original: kun rdzob tu smra ba 'di gzhan dag tu dpyad zin pa'i phyir 'dir ma spros so //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu smra ba 'di gzhan dag tu dpyad zin pa'i phyir 'dir ma spros so //
translated: I will not elaborate on this point, because the statements about the conventional have already been analyzed elsewhere.

original: 'bad rtsol ni yid la byed pa snga ma'o //
analyzed: 'bad rtsol ni yid la byed pa snga ma'o //
translated: Effort is the previous mental activity.

original: brda dran pa ni brda tsam gyi sgras bstan to //
analyzed: brda dran pa ni brda tsam gyi sgras bstan to //
translated: The memory of the sign is indicated by the mere word sign.

original: de'i 'di'i bum pa'i rnam par snang ba dang 'brel pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni spyi dang 'brel pa can gyi bum pa'i rnam par snang ba dang 'brel pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de'i 'di'i bum pa'i rnam par snang ba dang 'brel pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni spyi dang 'brel pa can gyi bum pa'i rnam par snang ba dang 'brel pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Because it is related to the appearance of a pot that is related to the universal, means because it is related to the appearance of a pot that is related to the universal.

original: mthun pa'i 'bad rtsol dang brda 'dzin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni zlas dbye ba'o //
analyzed: mthun pa'i 'bad rtsol dang brda 'dzin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni zlas dbye ba'o //
translated: Effort and the apprehension of the sign are in apposition.

original: tsam gyi sgra ni nges par gzung ba'o //üîΩde las tha dad pa'i rgyu mtshan gzhan la ltos pa nyid la de yod na gdon mi za bar mi 'gyur ba nyid kyis khyab pa yin la /
analyzed: tsam gyi sgra ni nges par gzung ba'o // de las tha dad pa'i rgyu mtshan gzhan la ltos pa nyid la de yod na gdon mi za bar mi 'gyur ba nyid kyis khyab pa yin la /
translated: The word mere is for the purpose of exclusion.üîΩThe existence of that is pervasion by the fact that it is not necessarily the case when there is that.

original: de dang 'gal ba yang gdon mi za bar 'gyur ba nyid yin pa de ltar na khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: de dang 'gal ba yang gdon mi za bar 'gyur ba nyid yin pa de ltar na khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
translated: And the contradiction of that is necessarily the case. Thus, the observation of a contradiction with the pervader.

original: 'gyur bar ni 'dod mod kyi gsal ba bum pas stong ba'i sa phyogs na yang bum pa'i spyi nyid yod pa nyid yin te khyab pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gyur bar ni 'dod mod kyi gsal ba bum pas stong ba'i sa phyogs na yang bum pa'i spyi nyid yod pa nyid yin te khyab pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Although it is accepted that there is a transformation, the universal of pot itself exists in the place that is empty of the manifest pot, because of the pervasion.

original: de bas na bum pa'i rnam par rtog pa de la de'i yang nus pa nyid yod pa yin pa de ltar na gtan tshigs ma grub pa nyid yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de bas na bum pa'i rnam par rtog pa de la de'i yang nus pa nyid yod pa yin pa de ltar na gtan tshigs ma grub pa nyid yin no zhe na /
translated: Therefore, since the capacity of that [universal] exists in the conception of pot, in that case the reason is not established.

original: de ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: That is not so.

original: gal te 'bad rtsol dang brda 'dzin pa yod na yang la lar bum pa'i rnam par rtog pa mi skye ba de'i tshe /
analyzed: gal te 'bad rtsol dang brda 'dzin pa yod na yang la lar bum pa'i rnam par rtog pa mi skye ba de'i tshe /
translated: Even if there is effort and the apprehension of signs, if the conception of pot does not arise for someone at that time,

original: 'bras bu ldog pa'i sgo nas spyi'i nus pa rtogs par 'gyur na /
analyzed: 'bras bu ldog pa'i sgo nas spyi'i nus pa rtogs par 'gyur na /
translated: the capacity of the universal would be understood through the cessation of the effect.

original: ji skad du bshad pa'i 'bras bu'i ldog pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa'i 'bras bu'i ldog pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: But the cessation of the effect as explained does not exist.

original: khyab pa nyid yin na yang spyi rtag pa thams cad la dus thams cad na yod pa de ltar na shin tu ldog pa ma yin na /
analyzed: khyab pa nyid yin na yang spyi rtag pa thams cad la dus thams cad na yod pa de ltar na shin tu ldog pa ma yin na /
translated: Even if there is pervasion, since the permanent universal exists for all at all times, it is not at all ceased.

original: gang gis na de ldog pa'i rjes su byed pas 'bras bul de'i nus pa rtogs par 'gyur /
analyzed: gang gis na de ldog pa'i rjes su byed pas 'bras bul de'i nus pa rtogs par 'gyur /
translated: Since it is the case that the effect is produced in conformity with the cause, the potency of the cause is understood from the effect.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir sbyor ba gnyis pa smos pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir sbyor ba gnyis pa smos pa yin no //
translated: In order to demonstrate just this, the second syllogism is stated.

original: de nyid kyi phyir sbyor ba yongs su rdzogs pa las /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir sbyor ba yongs su rdzogs pa las /
translated: Therefore, in the complete syllogism,

original: gtan tshigs snga ma ni ma grub pa ma yin no zhes bstan to //
analyzed: gtan tshigs snga ma ni ma grub pa ma yin no zhes bstan to //
translated: the former reason is not unestablished.

original: spyi bum pa nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa la de yang spyi thams cad du song bar smra ba'i gzhung ston pa ma yin te /
analyzed: spyi bum pa nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa la de yang spyi thams cad du song bar smra ba'i gzhung ston pa ma yin te /
translated: As for the statement ‚Äúuniversality is a pot, etc.,‚Äù this is not a statement of the doctrine of the universal that pervades everything.

original: thams cad du song bar smra ba'i ni snam bu la sogs pa la yang bum pa nyid yod pa de ltar na gang las ldog pa yin /
analyzed: thams cad du song bar smra ba'i ni snam bu la sogs pa la yang bum pa nyid yod pa de ltar na gang las ldog pa yin /
translated: For the proponent of the universal that pervades everything maintains that a pot exists in a cloth, etc., so what is it that is excluded?

original: ldog pa de 'dra ba las zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni grub pa'i mtha' smra ba yin no //
analyzed: ldog pa de 'dra ba las zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni grub pa'i mtha' smra ba yin no //
translated: The statement ‚Äúexclusion is from what is similar to that‚Äù and so on is the proponent of the thesis.

original: de 'dra @156a * //
analyzed: de 'dra @156a * //
translated: What is similar to that?

original: ba las zhes bya ba ni gang la yul med pas byas pa nyid ni 'bras bu'i ldog pa ma yin gyi 'on kyang rgyu mtshan gzhan las yin no //
analyzed: ba las zhes bya ba ni gang la yul med pas byas pa nyid ni 'bras bu'i ldog pa ma yin gyi 'on kyang rgyu mtshan gzhan las yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúFrom the cow‚Äù means that the product is not the negation of the effect, but rather it is from another reason.

original: de yang phyis 'chad pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang phyis 'chad pa yin no //
translated: And that will be explained later.

original: 'o na ci 'dra ba las grub pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci 'dra ba las grub pa yin zhe na /
translated: Well then, how is it established?

original: ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la de mthong ba la zhes bya ba ni bum pa mthong ba'i phyir skye ba can gyi yang ngo //
analyzed: ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la de mthong ba la zhes bya ba ni bum pa mthong ba'i phyir skye ba can gyi yang ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúJust as‚Äù and so on. ‚ÄúSeeing that‚Äù means seeing the pot. ‚ÄúThe arising‚Äù is of the cognition.

original: mthong ba grub pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni mig gi rnam par shes pa ma grub pa'o //üîΩgal te de ltar bum pas stong pa'i sa phyogs nyid la spyi shes par 'dod pa yod na yang de'i shes pa mi 'gyur ba de'i tshe /
analyzed: mthong ba grub pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni mig gi rnam par shes pa ma grub pa'o // gal te de ltar bum pas stong pa'i sa phyogs nyid la spyi shes par 'dod pa yod na yang de'i shes pa mi 'gyur ba de'i tshe /
translated: ‚ÄúThe seeing is not established‚Äù means that the eye consciousness is not established.üîΩIf, in that way, the cognition of the universal exists in the very place that is empty of the pot, then its cognition would not occur.

original: de ldog pa las spyi yang spyi'i shes pa la nus pa nyid yod par 'gyur na de yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ldog pa las spyi yang spyi'i shes pa la nus pa nyid yod par 'gyur na de yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: At that time, the universal would have the capacity for the cognition of the universal, but that does not exist.

original: bum pas stong pa'i sa phyogs la yang 'bad rtsol dang brda dran pa tsam gyis bum pa'i rnam par rtog pa skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bum pas stong pa'i sa phyogs la yang 'bad rtsol dang brda dran pa tsam gyis bum pa'i rnam par rtog pa skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the idea of a pot can arise in a place empty of a pot by mere effort and recollection of the sign.

original: snam bu la sogs pa la bum ba'i rnam par rtog pa mi skye ba gang yin pa de spyi bum pa nyid med pa'i phyir ma yin gyi /
analyzed: snam bu la sogs pa la bum ba'i rnam par rtog pa mi skye ba gang yin pa de spyi bum pa nyid med pa'i phyir ma yin gyi /
translated: It is not that the idea of a pot does not arise in regard to a cloth, etc. because of the absence of the universal ‚Äúpotness.‚Äù

original: 'on kyang snam bu la sogs pa'i rnam pa can gyi rnam par rtog pas bsgribs pa nyid kyi phyir dang / rnam par rtog pa gnyis cig car mi skye ba'i phyir dang / rnam par rtog pa gcig la yang 'gal bar snang ba mi rung pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'on kyang snam bu la sogs pa'i rnam pa can gyi rnam par rtog pas bsgribs pa nyid kyi phyir dang / rnam par rtog pa gnyis cig car mi skye ba'i phyir dang / rnam par rtog pa gcig la yang 'gal bar snang ba mi rung pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But rather, because it is obscured by the idea of a cloth, etc., because two ideas cannot arise simultaneously, and because it is not possible for a single idea to appear as contradictory.

original: de nyid ni yang bum pa'i rjes su byed pa can gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de nyid ni yang bum pa'i rjes su byed pa can gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: He says, ‚ÄúIt is just like the idea of a pot that arises in regard to a lump of clay, etc.‚Äù

original: de bas na ldog pa de 'dra ba las nus pa grub pa ma yin te zhes bshad pa gang yin pa de ni 'dis bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na ldog pa de 'dra ba las nus pa grub pa ma yin te zhes bshad pa gang yin pa de ni 'dis bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, this shows what was said above, namely, that a universal is not established from such an exclusion.

original: spyi 'ba' zhig 'dzin pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: spyi 'ba' zhig 'dzin pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: because there is no apprehension of a universal alone.

original: gsal ba 'dzin pa'i sgo nas de 'dzin pa khas len pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsal ba 'dzin pa'i sgo nas de 'dzin pa khas len pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For, it is accepted that the apprehension of a universal is through the apprehension of an individual.

original: rten chod pa can la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras ni rig pa'i rten can gzung ngo //
analyzed: rten chod pa can la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras ni rig pa'i rten can gzung ngo //
translated: The words ‚Äúhaving a basis, etc.‚Äù include the apprehension of a universal having a basis.

original: brda yid la byed pa ni brda 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: brda yid la byed pa ni brda 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The apprehension of a sign is the apprehension of a convention.

original: gzhan gal te don la ltos pa med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas spyi'i mtshan nyid shin tu khyab par byed pa nyid smras te /
analyzed: gzhan gal te don la ltos pa med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas spyi'i mtshan nyid shin tu khyab par byed pa nyid smras te /
translated: If you say that a universal is not a real entity, etc.,

original: don la stos pa med pa yang de yin la rgyu mtshan gzhan yod na 'byung ba yang yin pas na zhes khyad par gyi bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: don la stos pa med pa yang de yin la rgyu mtshan gzhan yod na 'byung ba yang yin pas na zhes khyad par gyi bsdu ba'o //
translated: you are saying that the universal is a pervader, and that it is not dependent on an object, and that it occurs when there is another reason.üîΩThe words ‚Äúthe universal is the object of the word ‚Äòhair,‚Äô etc.‚Äù

original: skra bshad sogs pa ni spyi yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed do //
analyzed: skra bshad sogs pa ni spyi yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed do //
translated: is the answer.

original: de skad du gang zhig 'ga' zhig dang 'brel ba can du zhen pas shes bya nyid du tha snyad du byed pa de ni spyir 'gyur te /
analyzed: de skad du gang zhig 'ga' zhig dang 'brel ba can du zhen pas shes bya nyid du tha snyad du byed pa de ni spyir 'gyur te /
translated: He says: ‚ÄúThat which is conceived as related to something is a universal, because it is designated as an object of knowledge.

original: 'di ltar mtshungs par yod pas na spyi yin gyi rab rib @156b can la sogs pa'i mig gi rnam par shes pa 'khrul pa la snang ba'i ngo bo la /
analyzed: 'di ltar mtshungs par yod pas na spyi yin gyi rab rib @156b can la sogs pa'i mig gi rnam par shes pa 'khrul pa la snang ba'i ngo bo la /
translated: Thus, because it exists as a universal, it is a universal. It is not a universal when it is the nature that appears to the mistaken eye consciousness of someone with an eye disease, etc.,

original: la lar sgro btags nas tha snyad du byed pa ma yin pa de ltar na spyi ma yin no zhes bstan to //
analyzed: la lar sgro btags nas tha snyad du byed pa ma yin pa de ltar na spyi ma yin no zhes bstan to //
translated: and it is designated as such by some people.

original: de bas na ji skad du bshad pa'i khyad par gyis khyad par dang bcas pa nyid yin pa'i phyir spyi'i mtshan nyid la 'khrul pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na ji skad du bshad pa'i khyad par gyis khyad par dang bcas pa nyid yin pa'i phyir spyi'i mtshan nyid la 'khrul pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, since it has the distinction as explained, there is no error in the definition of a universal.

original: 'dis shes par bya ba yin pas na shes bya ste shes pa'i 'jug pa'i yan lag go //
analyzed: 'dis shes par bya ba yin pas na shes bya ste shes pa'i 'jug pa'i yan lag go //
translated: It is an object of knowledge because it is known by that, i.e., it is a factor of the engagement of knowledge.

original: shes bya nyid kyang de yin la /
analyzed: shes bya nyid kyang de yin la /
translated: It is an object of knowledge and

original: spyi yang yin pas na spyi la sogs pa ni shes bya ste las 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: spyi yang yin pas na spyi la sogs pa ni shes bya ste las 'dzin pa'o //
translated: it is a universal, and thus universals, etc., are objects of knowledge, i.e., they are the object of the action of knowledge.

original: don 'ga' zhig la shes pa 'jug pa'i yan lag tu gyur pa spyi la sogs pa'i ngo bo gang yin pa der mngon par zhen pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: don 'ga' zhig la shes pa 'jug pa'i yan lag tu gyur pa spyi la sogs pa'i ngo bo gang yin pa der mngon par zhen pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúadherence to that‚Äù is that it is the nature of universals, etc., which is a factor of the engagement of knowledge in regard to some object.

original: de'i ngo bo nyid la de la spyi la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid du zhen pas tha snyad du byed pa nyid kyis khyab pa yin la /
analyzed: de'i ngo bo nyid la de la spyi la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid du zhen pas tha snyad du byed pa nyid kyis khyab pa yin la /
translated: The nature of that is to be conceived as the nature of universals, etc., and it is pervaded by the fact that it is conventionally designated.

original: de 'di la med pa de ltar na khyab par byed pa 'gal ba mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: de 'di la med pa de ltar na khyab par byed pa 'gal ba mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: If it does not exist in this way, then the preclusion of the contradictory of the pervader is the logical reason.

original: gal te shes pa gzhan gyis gzung bar bya ba nyid yin pas na /
analyzed: gal te shes pa gzhan gyis gzung bar bya ba nyid yin pas na /
translated: If it is the object of another cognition,

original: rab rib can gyis mthong ba'i skra la sogs pa'i spyi'i ngo bo nyid yin na ji ltar na skra bshad sogs ni spyi min no zhes bya ba de bshad ce na /
analyzed: rab rib can gyis mthong ba'i skra la sogs pa'i spyi'i ngo bo nyid yin na ji ltar na skra bshad sogs ni spyi min no zhes bya ba de bshad ce na /
translated: then how can it be the universal nature of the hair, etc., seen by one with myodesopsia?

original: de'i phyir 'on kyang shes pa gang la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'on kyang shes pa gang la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, he says, ‚ÄúBut if it is the object of another cognition,‚Äù etc.

original: rang gi shes pa la ltos nas spyi ma yin no zhes bya ba ni bsdus pa'i don yin no //
analyzed: rang gi shes pa la ltos nas spyi ma yin no zhes bya ba ni bsdus pa'i don yin no //
translated: The meaning of the compound is that it is not a universal in relation to its own cognition.

original: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gzhan gyi'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gzhan gyi'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIf it is the object of another cognition,‚Äù etc., is the opponent‚Äôs position.

original: de ldog pa la brten phyir te //
analyzed: de ldog pa la brten phyir te //
translated: Because it is based on the cessation of that.

original: mtshungs pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni sngar tha snyad 'dogs pa po rnams gsal ba thams cad la mtshungs par zhen pa'i dor snang ba la spyi nyid du bstan nas /
analyzed: mtshungs pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni sngar tha snyad 'dogs pa po rnams gsal ba thams cad la mtshungs par zhen pa'i dor snang ba la spyi nyid du bstan nas /
translated: The word ‚Äújust‚Äù means that the universal is not different from the appearance of the universal in the cognition.üîΩThe universal is not different from the appearance of the universal in the cognition.

original: da ni brgyud pas dngos po ldog pa'i 'bras bu nyid las so //üîΩming dang mtshan ma zhes bya ba ni mang pos bkur ba'i gzhung yin no //
analyzed: da ni brgyud pas dngos po ldog pa'i 'bras bu nyid las so // ming dang mtshan ma zhes bya ba ni mang pos bkur ba'i gzhung yin no //
translated: The word ‚Äújust‚Äù means that the universal is not different from the appearance of the universal in the cognition.üîΩThe universal is not different from the appearance of the universal in the cognition.üîΩThe word ‚Äújust‚Äù means that the universal is not different from the appearance of the universal in the cognition.üîΩThe universal is not different from the appearance of the universal in the cognition.üîΩThe word ‚Äújust‚Äù means that the universal is not different from the appearance of the universal in the cognition.

original: bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa'i ming sgra dang don dang shes pa las tha dad pa ni ming yin no //üîΩgang la brten nas don brjod pa de ni mtshan ma yin te /
analyzed: bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa'i ming sgra dang don dang shes pa las tha dad pa ni ming yin no // gang la brten nas don brjod pa de ni mtshan ma yin te /

analyzed: sgra dang don dang shes pa dag las tha dad pa'o //üîΩde dag kyang sems dang sems las byung ba'i tshogs dang mi ldan par 'jug pa nyid kyi phyir mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin pa'i 'du byed kyi ming can no //

original: 'chad pa po dang nyan pa po dang 'brel pa can gyi ming dang mtshan ma rjod par byed pa can gyi sgra las zhes bya ba ni 'chad pa po dang nyan pa po dang 'brel ba can gyi ming dang mtshan ma de brjod pa can gyi'o //üîΩming @157a * //
analyzed: 'chad pa po dang nyan pa po dang 'brel pa can gyi ming dang mtshan ma rjod par byed pa can gyi sgra las zhes bya ba ni 'chad pa po dang nyan pa po dang 'brel ba can gyi ming dang mtshan ma de brjod pa can gyi'o // ming @157a * //
translated: The words ‚Äúfrom a sound that expresses a name and a mark that is related to the speaker and the hearer‚Äù means that it is related to the name and the mark that are related to the speaker and the hearer.

original: dang mtshan ma dag la don zhes bya ba ni ming dang mtshan ma dag la don zhes nye bar 'dogs pa zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩgnyi ga la phan tshun nye bar 'dogs pa yin no zhes bya ba ni /üîΩdus gcig la don la ming dang mtshan ma nye bar 'dogs pa'am /
analyzed: dang mtshan ma dag la don zhes bya ba ni ming dang mtshan ma dag la don zhes nye bar 'dogs pa zhes bya ba'i don to // gnyi ga la phan tshun nye bar 'dogs pa yin no zhes bya ba ni / dus gcig la don la ming dang mtshan ma nye bar 'dogs pa'am /
translated: The words ‚Äúthe name and the mark‚Äù means that the name and the mark are figuratively designated as the object.

original: ming dang mtshan ma la don nye bar 'dogs pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ming dang mtshan ma la don nye bar 'dogs pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The words ‚Äúmutually in both‚Äù means that the name and the mark are figuratively designated as the object, or the object is figuratively designated as the name and the mark.

original: phyi rol gyi don nyid la bsnyon par mi nus par zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gcig tu gyur pa la ming dang mtshan ma'i rang bzhin can gyi don nam /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don nyid la bsnyon par mi nus par zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gcig tu gyur pa la ming dang mtshan ma'i rang bzhin can gyi don nam /
translated: The words ‚Äúit is not possible to deny the external object itself‚Äù means that it is not possible to deny the object that has the nature of a single entity and the nature of the name and the mark.

original: don gyi rang bzhin can gyi ming dang mtshan ma khas lan par 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: don gyi rang bzhin can gyi ming dang mtshan ma khas lan par 'gyur grang na /
translated: If you say that it is the nature of the object, then you are accepting names and signs as the nature of the object.

original: de la phyogs dang po ltar na de ming dang mtshan ma'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la phyogs dang po ltar na de ming dang mtshan ma'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If it is the first position, then it is the nature of names and signs,

original: de ltar na sngon po la sogs pa'i rang bzhin nyams par 'gyur te gcig la rang bzhin gnyis mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar na sngon po la sogs pa'i rang bzhin nyams par 'gyur te gcig la rang bzhin gnyis mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: and in that case, the nature of blue, etc., is lost, because two natures are not possible in one.

original: sngon po la sogs pa'i don mngon sum du grags pa la ci ltar na bsnyon par nus /
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa'i don mngon sum du grags pa la ci ltar na bsnyon par nus /
translated: How can you deny the well-known fact that blue, etc., are directly perceived objects?

original: de bas na phyogs gnyis pa khas blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na phyogs gnyis pa khas blang bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, you must accept the second position.

original: de ltar na ming dang mtshan mar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar na ming dang mtshan mar mi 'gyur te /
translated: In that case, it is not names and signs,

original: don gyi rang bzhin thob pas ming dang mtshan ma'i rang bzhin dor ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don gyi rang bzhin thob pas ming dang mtshan ma'i rang bzhin dor ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because by obtaining the nature of the object, the nature of names and signs is lost.

original: ji skad du bshad pa'i rnam pas phyi rol gyi don gyi rang bzhin gcig pur gnas so //
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa'i rnam pas phyi rol gyi don gyi rang bzhin gcig pur gnas so //
translated: In the manner explained, the nature of external objects remains as one.

original: de yang gal te sgra'i brjod par bya ba yin na dbang po 'bras bu med pa can gyi gnas skabs de nyid yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de yang gal te sgra'i brjod par bya ba yin na dbang po 'bras bu med pa can gyi gnas skabs de nyid yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Moreover, if it is the object of verbal expression, then it is just the occasion when the sense faculty is without effect.

original: de'i tshe yang sgra las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de'i tshe yang sgra las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: In order to demonstrate this, he says, ‚ÄúEven at that time, from sound, etc.‚Äù

original: ming la sogs pa brjod par bya ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa la ming dang rgyu mtshan dag sgras bstan pa'i gnas skabs gang yin pa de nyams pas yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ming la sogs pa brjod par bya ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa la ming dang rgyu mtshan dag sgras bstan pa'i gnas skabs gang yin pa de nyams pas yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúThe object of verbal expression, such as name, etc.‚Äù means that the occasion when name and reason are indicated by sound is impaired. This is the meaning of ‚Äúeven.‚Äù

original: phyogs gnyis pa la yang zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe /
analyzed: phyogs gnyis pa la yang zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe /
translated: ‚ÄúIn the second case, also‚Äù means when

original: don la ming dang mtshan ma dag nye bar 'dogs pa la'o //
analyzed: don la ming dang mtshan ma dag nye bar 'dogs pa la'o //
translated: the name and the sign are figuratively applied to the object.

original: gang gi tshe don la ming la sogs pa la zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: gang gi tshe don la ming la sogs pa la zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: ‚ÄúWhen the name, etc., are figuratively applied to the object‚Äù meansüîΩthat the name and the sign are figuratively applied to the object.

original: ming dang mtshan ma la gtso bor zhes bya ba ni de la sgra 'khrul pa med pa nyid 'jug pa med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: ming dang mtshan ma la gtso bor zhes bya ba ni de la sgra 'khrul pa med pa nyid 'jug pa med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúPrimarily to the name, etc.‚Äù means that sound is non-erroneous with regard to that, because it is non-erroneous with regard to the name.

original: de'i tshe don la 'jug par mi 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni phyi rol gyi don la ste de ma brjod pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe don la 'jug par mi 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni phyi rol gyi don la ste de ma brjod pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: At that time, one does not engage in the object, i.e., the external object, because it is not expressed.

original: ming dang mtshan ma la don nyid du nye bar btags nas brjod pa yin gyi /
analyzed: ming dang mtshan ma la don nyid du nye bar btags nas brjod pa yin gyi /
translated: Name and sign are superimposed as the object and are expressed.

original: phyi rol gyi don ni gtso bo ma yin te /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don ni gtso bo ma yin te /
translated: The external object is not primary.

original: de nyid ni dper na skyes bu zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston par byed do //
analyzed: de nyid ni dper na skyes bu zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston par byed do //
translated: That is shown by the example, ‚Äúfor example, a person,‚Äù and so on.

original: phan tshun nye bar @157b btags pa la yang ci rigs par dbang po 'bras bu med pa can dang 'jug par mi 'gyur ba zhes bya ba yang don dang mi dang mtshan ma dag nyid cig car phan tshun nye bar btags pa nas /
analyzed: phan tshun nye bar @157b btags pa la yang ci rigs par dbang po 'bras bu med pa can dang 'jug par mi 'gyur ba zhes bya ba yang don dang mi dang mtshan ma dag nyid cig car phan tshun nye bar btags pa nas /
translated: Even in mutual superimposition, the sense faculty is without result and does not engage, as appropriate. The object, person, and sign are mutually superimposed simultaneously.

original: gang gi tshe don la yang ming dang mtshan ma la don nye bar btags pa de'i tshe dbang po 'bras bu med pa can yin te dper na phyogs gnyis pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe don la yang ming dang mtshan ma la don nye bar btags pa de'i tshe dbang po 'bras bu med pa can yin te dper na phyogs gnyis pa lta bu'o //
translated: When the name and sign are superimposed as the object on the object, at that time the sense faculty is without result, for example, like the second part.

original: gang gi tshe ming dang mtshan ma la don nye bar btags pa de'i tshe phyi rol gyi don la 'jug par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe ming dang mtshan ma la don nye bar btags pa de'i tshe phyi rol gyi don la 'jug par mi 'gyur te /
translated: When a name and a sign are applied to an object, then one does not engage in an external object.

original: dper na phyogs gsum ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na phyogs gsum ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like the third example.üîΩFor example, it is like the past life.

original: dper na tshe snga ma lta bu'o zhes bya ba ni de la gzugs mtshungs pa can la skyes bu 'khrul pas 'jug pa na 'ga' zhig gi tshe gcig la 'jug par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: dper na tshe snga ma lta bu'o zhes bya ba ni de la gzugs mtshungs pa can la skyes bu 'khrul pas 'jug pa na 'ga' zhig gi tshe gcig la 'jug par 'gyur zhing /
translated: When a person engages in error with respect to a form that is similar, sometimes he engages in one, and sometimes he engages in another.

original: 'ga' zhig gi tshe gzhan la 'jug par 'gyur ba de bzhin du ming dang mtshan ma la sogs pa la 'jug pa na yang 'khrul pas 'ga' zhig gi tshe don la 'gyur zhing 'ga' zhig gi tshe ming dang mtshan ma dag la 'jug par 'gyur ro zhes bya
analyzed: 'ga' zhig gi tshe gzhan la 'jug par 'gyur ba de bzhin du ming dang mtshan ma la sogs pa la 'jug pa na yang 'khrul pas 'ga' zhig gi tshe don la 'gyur zhing 'ga' zhig gi tshe ming dang mtshan ma dag la 'jug par 'gyur ro zhes bya
translated: In the same way, when one engages in error with respect to a name, a sign, and so on, sometimes one engages in an object, and sometimes one engages in a name and a sign.

original: ba'o don to //
analyzed: ba'o don to //
translated: This is the meaning.üîΩEven when there is a similar object,

original: don 'dra ba yod na yang zhes bya ba ni yul tha dad pa can gyi don gnyis gzugs mtshungs pa zhes bya ba'o don to //
analyzed: don 'dra ba yod na yang zhes bya ba ni yul tha dad pa can gyi don gnyis gzugs mtshungs pa zhes bya ba'o don to //
translated: means that two objects with different locations are called similar forms.

original: gal te gang gi yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas nyes pa mtshungs pa thob par dogs pa'i lan 'debs par byed do //
analyzed: gal te gang gi yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas nyes pa mtshungs pa thob par dogs pa'i lan 'debs par byed do //
translated: If you think that the objection that the same fault applies to both is the response,

original: min zhes bya ba ni shes pa 'ba' zhig brjod par bya ba yin no zhes rnam par dbye ba bsgyur nas sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: min zhes bya ba ni shes pa 'ba' zhig brjod par bya ba yin no zhes rnam par dbye ba bsgyur nas sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: then the response is: ‚ÄúNo.‚Äù The analysis should be applied by changing the wording to ‚Äúonly consciousness is the object of expression.‚Äù

original: de ltar na sgra las nyan pa po rnams kyi don gyi spyi'i rnam pa nyid kyi rnam par rtog pa skye bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: de ltar na sgra las nyan pa po rnams kyi don gyi spyi'i rnam pa nyid kyi rnam par rtog pa skye bar 'gyur la /
translated: Thus, a conception of the mere general aspect of the object arises in the hearer from the sound.

original: rnam par rtog pa la snang ba'i spyi'i rnam pa de nyid brjod par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa la snang ba'i spyi'i rnam pa de nyid brjod par bya ba yin no //
translated: That general aspect that appears to the conception is the object of expression.

original: sgra las byung ba'i shes pa la snang ba gang yin pa de nyid sgra'i don yin no //
analyzed: sgra las byung ba'i shes pa la snang ba gang yin pa de nyid sgra'i don yin no //
translated: That which appears to the consciousness that arises from the sound is the meaning of the sound.

original: rnam pa de yang shes pa las tha mi dad pa de ltar na shes pa brjod par bya bar bstan to //
analyzed: rnam pa de yang shes pa las tha mi dad pa de ltar na shes pa brjod par bya bar bstan to //
translated: Since that aspect is not different from the consciousness, it is shown that consciousness is the object of expression.

original: gal te 'di ltar shes pa las tha mi dad pa nyid kyis de rang gi mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir rang gi mtshan nyid kho na brjod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te 'di ltar shes pa las tha mi dad pa nyid kyis de rang gi mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir rang gi mtshan nyid kho na brjod par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is argued that because it is not different from consciousness, it is its own characteristic, and therefore only its own characteristic is stated,

original: skyon 'di yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: skyon 'di yod pa ma yin te /
translated: this fault does not exist.

original: 'di ltar ji ltar rnam pa de shes pas rig par 'gyur ba de ltar shes pa'i bdag nyid brjod par bya ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar ji ltar rnam pa de shes pas rig par 'gyur ba de ltar shes pa'i bdag nyid brjod par bya ba ma yin gyi /
translated: Because it is not the case that the nature of consciousness is stated in the way that aspect is cognized by consciousness.

original: 'on kyang phyi rol du zhen pa yin la de la de yang spyi nyid yin gyi rang gi mtshan nyid ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang phyi rol du zhen pa yin la de la de yang spyi nyid yin gyi rang gi mtshan nyid ni ma yin te /
translated: However, it is a generality, not an individual characteristic, for the mind that conceives external objects.

original: ji skad du don gyi ngo bo nyid kyis spyi zhes bya bas bshad pa lta @158a * //
analyzed: ji skad du don gyi ngo bo nyid kyis spyi zhes bya bas bshad pa lta @158a * //
translated: As it is said, ‚ÄúThe nature of an object is called a generality.‚Äù

original: bu'o ; / rnam pa de 'dra ba yi blo dag ni //
analyzed: bu'o ; / rnam pa de 'dra ba yi blo dag ni //
translated: Because minds that resemble that aspect

original: skye phyir sgra'i nus pa las 'ongs pa rang gi snang ba la phyi rol gyi don gyi ngo bor zhen pa can gyi blo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: skye phyir sgra'i nus pa las 'ongs pa rang gi snang ba la phyi rol gyi don gyi ngo bor zhen pa can gyi blo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: arise from the potency of sound, the meaning of the statement is that the mind conceives the appearance of sound to be the nature of an external object.

original: de dang de tshul 'dra ba las zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dang de tshul 'dra ba las zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: The rest of the verse beginning with ‚Äúand so on‚Äù will be explained.

original: nyams su myong pas byas pa yin te zhes bya ba 'di'i rnam par bshad pa ni don gyi rnam pa ci 'dra ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: nyams su myong pas byas pa yin te zhes bya ba 'di'i rnam par bshad pa ni don gyi rnam pa ci 'dra ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
translated: ‚Äú It is produced by experience‚Äù is the explanation of this. ‚Äú What is the form of the object?‚Äù and so on.

original: gang gis na de ltar mthong bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni 'di nyid dngos su sgra la sogs pa'i dngos po yin no zhes mthong bar 'gyur zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gang gis na de ltar mthong bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni 'di nyid dngos su sgra la sogs pa'i dngos po yin no zhes mthong bar 'gyur zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: ‚Äú By what means is it seen?‚Äù This is the direct perception of sound and so on.

original: nyams su myong ba'i rnam pa can gyi rnam par rtog pa'i blo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: nyams su myong ba'i rnam pa can gyi rnam par rtog pa'i blo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚Äú The conceptual cognition that has the form of experience‚Äù is the explanation of this.

original: nyam su myong ba'i rnam pa'i cha'i rjes su byed pa zhes bya bas de'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir nyams su myong ba'i rnam pa can zhes brjod do //
analyzed: nyam su myong ba'i rnam pa'i cha'i rjes su byed pa zhes bya bas de'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir nyams su myong ba'i rnam pa can zhes brjod do //
translated: ‚Äú It is said to have the form of experience because it conforms to the aspect of the experience.‚Äù

original: dngos su de la nyams su myong ba'i rnam pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos su de la nyams su myong ba'i rnam pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: In reality, it does not have the form of experience.

original: ming dang mtshan ma so sor rig pa'i ngo bo can gyi rnam par shes pa'i ngo bo nyid yin par zhes bya ba ni phyi rol gyi don du snang ba'i blo khas len pa de'i tshe rnam pa dang bcas pa'i blo khas blang par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ming dang mtshan ma so sor rig pa'i ngo bo can gyi rnam par shes pa'i ngo bo nyid yin par zhes bya ba ni phyi rol gyi don du snang ba'i blo khas len pa de'i tshe rnam pa dang bcas pa'i blo khas blang par 'gyur ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe nature of consciousness, which has the nature of discerning names and signs‚Äù means that when you accept that the mind appears as an external object, you must accept that the mind has aspects.

original: de bas na ming dang mtshan ma dag 'dzin par byed pa'i blo gang yin pa de yang ming dang mtshan ma'i rnam pa can du khas blang par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na ming dang mtshan ma dag 'dzin par byed pa'i blo gang yin pa de yang ming dang mtshan ma'i rnam pa can du khas blang par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, you must accept that the mind that apprehends names and signs has the aspect of names and signs.

original: de ltar na blo'i rnam pa'i bdag nyid can blo'i ngo bo rig pa nyid kyis rig pa'i ngo bo'i ming dang mtshan ma rnam par shes pa'i ngo bo nyid yin te /
analyzed: de ltar na blo'i rnam pa'i bdag nyid can blo'i ngo bo rig pa nyid kyis rig pa'i ngo bo'i ming dang mtshan ma rnam par shes pa'i ngo bo nyid yin te /
translated: Thus, the mind that has the nature of the aspects of the mind is the nature of consciousness, which has the nature of discerning names and signs.

original: snang ba'i shes pa las tha dad pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snang ba'i shes pa las tha dad pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it is not different from the consciousness that appears as an object.

original: 'gyur bar ni 'dod mod kyi shes pa'i rnam pa'i ming dang mtshan ma dag rnam par shes pa'i ngo bo nyid yin ba ni bla ste /
analyzed: 'gyur bar ni 'dod mod kyi shes pa'i rnam pa'i ming dang mtshan ma dag rnam par shes pa'i ngo bo nyid yin ba ni bla ste /
translated: You may accept that the mind is the nature of consciousness, but it is not tenable that names and signs, which are the aspects of consciousness, are the nature of consciousness.

original: rnam par shes pa las tha dad pa rnam par 'jog par byed pa dag ni mi ldan pa nyid yin no zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa las tha dad pa rnam par 'jog par byed pa dag ni mi ldan pa nyid yin no zhe na /
translated: But if they are not associated with consciousness, then they are not consciousness.

original: de'i phyir rnam par shes pa las tha dad pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam par shes pa las tha dad pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Therefore, it says, ‚ÄúIf they are different from consciousness . . . ‚Äù

original: ji ltar na don gyi rnam pa can gyi rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pa las zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: ji ltar na don gyi rnam pa can gyi rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pa las zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: How is it that the form of the object is the nature of consciousness?

original: rnam par shes pa rnam pa dang bcas pa la /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa rnam pa dang bcas pa la /
translated: Consciousness has form.

original: don gyi rnam pa sngon po la sogs pa rig pa gang yin pa de ni shes pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: don gyi rnam pa sngon po la sogs pa rig pa gang yin pa de ni shes pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pa nyid yin te /
translated: That which is aware of the form of the object, such as blue, is the nature of consciousness,

original: rtag tu shes ba'i cha rig pa yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩdon gzhan zhes bya ba ni phyi rol rnam par 'jog par byed pa'o //
analyzed: rtag tu shes ba'i cha rig pa yin pa'i phyir ro // don gzhan zhes bya ba ni phyi rol rnam par 'jog par byed pa'o //
translated: because the aspect of consciousness is always aware.üîΩ‚ÄúAnother object‚Äù refers to the external form that is posited.

original: de las gzhan pa'i dbang po la @158b sogs pa zhes bya ba ni don las gzhan pa'i dbang po dang yid la byed pa dang snang ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i dbang po la @158b sogs pa zhes bya ba ni don las gzhan pa'i dbang po dang yid la byed pa dang snang ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúOther than that‚Äù refers to the sense faculties, etc.

original: 'bras bu rnam par shes pa rgyu gzhan la ltos pa dang bcas par skye bar mi 'gyur bar zhes bya ba ni yul la lar ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu rnam par shes pa rgyu gzhan la ltos pa dang bcas par skye bar mi 'gyur bar zhes bya ba ni yul la lar ro //
translated: The phrase the effect, consciousness, would not arise in dependence on other causes means in some places.

original: de dang 'dis ni 'bras bu ldog pa las phyi rol gyi don grub par shes so //
analyzed: de dang 'dis ni 'bras bu ldog pa las phyi rol gyi don grub par shes so //
translated: By this, he shows that the establishment of external objects is refuted by the refutation of the effect.

original: de ltar ming la sogs pa grub pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'bad rtsol dang brda dran pa tsam gyis ming la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar ming la sogs pa grub pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'bad rtsol dang brda dran pa tsam gyis ming la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase because the establishment of name, etc., is thus means that the conceptualization of name, etc., arises merely through effort and the recollection of signs.

original: de yang gzugs la sogs pa ma yin na zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa'i don byed par nus pa sgra'i shes pa la snang ba mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang gzugs la sogs pa ma yin na zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa'i don byed par nus pa sgra'i shes pa la snang ba mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase and that is not form, etc. means that it is not suitable for the object, form, etc., which is able to perform the function of form, etc., to appear in the cognition of sound.

original: snang na ni dbang po 'bras bu med pa can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: snang na ni dbang po 'bras bu med pa can du 'gyur ro //
translated: If it did appear, the sense faculty would be without effect.

original: spyi'i dngos po ni gzhan sel bar 'dod pas khas ma blangs pa yin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: spyi'i dngos po ni gzhan sel bar 'dod pas khas ma blangs pa yin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: The intended meaning is that the universal entity is not accepted because it is asserted to be the exclusion of other.

original: de dang ni khyab pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa la shes pa gang yin pa de thams cad don dang ldan pa yin te zhes bya 'di la bzlog na /
analyzed: de dang ni khyab pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa la shes pa gang yin pa de thams cad don dang ldan pa yin te zhes bya 'di la bzlog na /
translated: and ‚Äúbecause there is no pervasion‚Äù and so on, all cognitions are said to be meaningful.

original: gnod pa can gyi tshad ma med pa'i phyir ldog pa med pa la the tshom za ba yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gnod pa can gyi tshad ma med pa'i phyir ldog pa med pa la the tshom za ba yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: If one reverses that, since there is no valid cognition that contradicts it, one doubts that there is no reversal.

original: de ltar don gyis stong pa dang shes pa yin par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba 'di la 'gal ba ci zhig yod /
analyzed: de ltar don gyis stong pa dang shes pa yin par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba 'di la 'gal ba ci zhig yod /
translated: Thus, what contradiction is there in saying that it is empty of objects and is cognition?

original: 'gyur bar ni 'dod mod kyi 'gal ba ni yod de /
analyzed: 'gyur bar ni 'dod mod kyi 'gal ba ni yod de /
translated: We do accept that, but there is a contradiction.

original: 'di ltar gang gis de shes pas na shes pa yin na don med pa na yang des ci zhig shes /
analyzed: 'di ltar gang gis de shes pas na shes pa yin na don med pa na yang des ci zhig shes /
translated: If it is cognition because it cognizes that, then if there is no object, what does it cognize?

original: de bas na shes pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de bas na shes pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Therefore, it would not be cognition.

original: de la 'di ni ma dpyad par brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: de la 'di ni ma dpyad par brjod pa yin te /
translated: This is a statement made without analysis.

original: de lta yin na phyi rol gyi don la ltos nas byed pa'i ngo bo nyid du rnam par gzhag pa gang yin pa de mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta yin na phyi rol gyi don la ltos nas byed pa'i ngo bo nyid du rnam par gzhag pa gang yin pa de mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were so, then the presentation of the nature of the activity in dependence on external objects would not be tenable.

original: nye bar len pa snga ma la rag lus pa gzung pa dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par dbye ba can nye bar bstan pa rang rig pa'i bdag nyid can gyi shes pa gang gis bzlog par nus /
analyzed: nye bar len pa snga ma la rag lus pa gzung pa dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par dbye ba can nye bar bstan pa rang rig pa'i bdag nyid can gyi shes pa gang gis bzlog par nus /
translated: How can one reverse the consciousness that has the nature of self-awareness, which is taught to be the possessor of the division of apprehended object and apprehending subject, dependent on the prior appropriation?

original: de ni phyi rol gyi don la rag las pas gnas pa can ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni phyi rol gyi don la rag las pas gnas pa can ma yin no //
translated: That is not the possessor of the external object.

original: rnam pa gzhan du na yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas nges pa kho nar mi mthun pa'i phyogs la 'jug pa nyid bstan to //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du na yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas nges pa kho nar mi mthun pa'i phyogs la 'jug pa nyid bstan to //
translated: Moreover, the statement ‚Äúin another way, etc.‚Äù teaches that it definitely engages the contrary position.

original: gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Moreover, the statement ‚Äúin a dream, etc.‚Äù

original: gzugs la sogs pa de ji lta bur gyur pa zhig ce na /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa de ji lta bur gyur pa zhig ce na /
translated: What is the form, etc. of that?

original: rmi lam gyi rnam par shes pas gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: rmi lam gyi rnam par shes pas gzung bar bya'o //
translated: It is to be apprehended by the consciousness of a dream.

original: shes pa ni shes pa'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: shes pa ni shes pa'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Consciousness is the nature of consciousness.

original: don min ni phyi rol gyi'o //
analyzed: don min ni phyi rol gyi'o //
translated: The non-object is the external.

original: yul rung ba mtshungs pa can zhes bya ba ni yul rung ba la sogs pa @159a * //
analyzed: yul rung ba mtshungs pa can zhes bya ba ni yul rung ba la sogs pa @159a * //
translated: The statement ‚Äúhaving a similar suitable object‚Äù means having a suitable object, etc.

original: mtshungs pa gang la yod pa de dag ni yul rung ba mtshungs pa can la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: mtshungs pa gang la yod pa de dag ni yul rung ba mtshungs pa can la sogs pa'o //
translated: Those that have similarity are similar in terms of the object, and so on.

original: sogs pa smos ba ni dus mtshungs pa'i gnas skabs can gyi skyes bu gzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa smos ba ni dus mtshungs pa'i gnas skabs can gyi skyes bu gzung ngo //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúand so on‚Äù includes those that are similar in terms of time.

original: gal te rmi lam gyi nang gi gzugs la sogs pa gnyid ma log pa'i gnas skabs na yod pa'i gzugs la sogs pa las khyad par med par 'byung bar 'gyur ba de'i tshe /
analyzed: gal te rmi lam gyi nang gi gzugs la sogs pa gnyid ma log pa'i gnas skabs na yod pa'i gzugs la sogs pa las khyad par med par 'byung bar 'gyur ba de'i tshe /
translated: If the forms and so on that appear in a dream were not different from the forms and so on that exist in the waking state,

original: yul dang dus der gnas pa gzhan dag gis kyang ci'i phyir dmigs par 'gyur /
analyzed: yul dang dus der gnas pa gzhan dag gis kyang ci'i phyir dmigs par 'gyur /
translated: then why would other people who are in the same place at the same time not observe them?

original: gal te gnyid kyis 'dus byas pa'i rnam par shes pas de dag dmigs so zhe na /
