analyzed: gal te gnyid kyis 'dus byas pa'i rnam par shes pas de dag dmigs so zhe na /
translated: If you say that they are observed by the consciousness that is affected by sleep,

original: 'o na gzhan dag gis kyang der rmi lam gyi nang gi sngon po la sogs pa gnyid ma log pa na ci'i phyir ma mthong /
analyzed: 'o na gzhan dag gis kyang der rmi lam gyi nang gi sngon po la sogs pa gnyid ma log pa na ci'i phyir ma mthong /
translated: then why don‚Äôt other people who are not asleep also see the blue and so on that is in the dream?

original: gal te de 'dra ba ni gnyis kyi khyad par nyid yin te /
analyzed: gal te de 'dra ba ni gnyis kyi khyad par nyid yin te /
translated: If you say that the difference between the two is just that,

original: gang gis gcig kho nas mthong ba nyid yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gang gis gcig kho nas mthong ba nyid yin no zhe na /
translated: then why is it that only one person sees the dream and not the other?

original: 'o na de ltar na ni gcig nyid kyis so sor rig pa nyid yin pa'i phyir de ni shes pa'i ngo bo nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'o na de ltar na ni gcig nyid kyis so sor rig pa nyid yin pa'i phyir de ni shes pa'i ngo bo nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: If that is so, then because of being individually cognized by the one, it becomes the nature of consciousness.

original: shes pa ni de tsam gyi mtshan nyid can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes pa ni de tsam gyi mtshan nyid can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because consciousness has the characteristic of just that.

original: de nyid ni shes pa'i mtshan nyid yin no zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de nyid ni shes pa'i mtshan nyid yin no zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: That itself is the characteristic of consciousness.

original: yul rung ba can 'dzin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gang dag la yul rung ba yod pa de dag 'dzin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yul rung ba can 'dzin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gang dag la yul rung ba yod pa de dag 'dzin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Because it apprehends the object that is suitable. The meaning is: because it apprehends those that have the object that is suitable.

original: de ltar na rnal 'byor pas sprul pa'i gzugs yul der gnas pa dag gis mthong bar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de ltar na rnal 'byor pas sprul pa'i gzugs yul der gnas pa dag gis mthong bar 'gyur gyi /
translated: Thus, the yogi sees the emanated forms abiding in that place.

original: de lta ma yin na de yang shes pa'i ngo bo nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na de yang shes pa'i ngo bo nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were not so, then that would become the nature of consciousness.

original: bum pa'i ngo bos sgyur bar byed pa zhes bya ba ni de la bum pa'i ngo bor sgro btags pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bum pa'i ngo bos sgyur bar byed pa zhes bya ba ni de la bum pa'i ngo bor sgro btags pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The statement ‚Äúit is transformed by the nature of the pot‚Äù means that it is superimposed as the nature of the pot.

original: rnam par rtog pa rang dga' ba dngos po gzhan la yang zlog pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa rang dga' ba dngos po gzhan la yang zlog pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no contradiction in the occurrence of other random thoughts.

original: snam bur mi rtog pa zhes bya ba ni snam bu yod du zin kyang bor nas yul de la rang dgar bum par rtog pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: snam bur mi rtog pa zhes bya ba ni snam bu yod du zin kyang bor nas yul de la rang dgar bum par rtog pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúNot conceiving of a cloth‚Äù means that even if a cloth exists, one can discard it and conceive of the object at will as a pot.

original: 'gyur bar ni 'dod mod kyi gang gi tshe snam bu la bum pa'i ngo bor sgyur bar byed pa'am /
analyzed: 'gyur bar ni 'dod mod kyi gang gi tshe snam bu la bum pa'i ngo bor sgyur bar byed pa'am /
translated: ‚ÄúWe agree that it can be transformed,‚Äù but when one transforms a cloth into the nature of a pot,

original: snam bu por nas de nyid la bum par rtog par byed pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: snam bu por nas de nyid la bum par rtog par byed pa de'i tshe /
translated: or when one discards the cloth and conceives of the pot in that very place,

original: bum pa'i rnam pa'i rnam par rtog pa gang yin pa de yul med pa ma yin te /
analyzed: bum pa'i rnam pa'i rnam par rtog pa gang yin pa de yul med pa ma yin te /
translated: then the conception of the aspect of a pot is not without an object,

original: yul gzhan na gnas pa'i bum pa'i yul can nyid yin pa'i phyir ram de la yod pa'i bum pa nyid kyi spyi'i yul can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: yul gzhan na gnas pa'i bum pa'i yul can nyid yin pa'i phyir ram de la yod pa'i bum pa nyid kyi spyi'i yul can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: because it has as its object a pot that exists in another place, or because it has as its object the universal that exists in that place.

original: de'i phyir de nyid kyi phyir gsal ba yul gzhan na @159b gnas pa'am zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la /
analyzed: de'i phyir de nyid kyi phyir gsal ba yul gzhan na @159b gnas pa'am zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la /
translated: ‚ÄúFor that very reason,‚Äù the master says, ‚Äúthe manifestation of an object in another place,‚Äù and so on.

original: de nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni snam bu'i yul can nyid la bum pa'i rnam par rtog pa skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni snam bu'i yul can nyid la bum pa'i rnam par rtog pa skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, because a conceptual thought of a pot arises in regard to the object of a cloth,

original: de'i yul dang 'brel pa can nyid dam zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de'i yul dang 'brel pa can nyid dam zhes bya ba ni /
translated: it is related to its object.

original: snam bu'i yul dang 'brel pa can nyid kyis so //
analyzed: snam bu'i yul dang 'brel pa can nyid kyis so //
translated: Because it is related to the object of a cloth.

original: des ni snam bur mi rtog pas yul de la bum par rtog pa zhes bya ba'i phyogs 'di bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: des ni snam bur mi rtog pas yul de la bum par rtog pa zhes bya ba'i phyogs 'di bstan pa yin no //
translated: This shows the position that it is a conceptual thought of a pot in regard to that object, because it does not conceive a cloth.

original: snam bu der gyur pa'am zhes bya ba ni bum pa'i ngo bo des snam bu yongs su bsgyur ba ni snam bu de gyur pa ste /
analyzed: snam bu der gyur pa'am zhes bya ba ni bum pa'i ngo bo des snam bu yongs su bsgyur ba ni snam bu de gyur pa ste /
translated: Or, that cloth is transformed by it,

original: snam bu de yang blos bum pa'i ngo bor sgyur bar byed pa zhes bya ba'i phyogs 'di bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: snam bu de yang blos bum pa'i ngo bor sgyur bar byed pa zhes bya ba'i phyogs 'di bshad pa yin no //
translated: this shows the position that the mind transforms that cloth into the nature of a pot.üîΩThe words of the opponent are:

original: gang dag phyi rol gyi rgyu mtshan la ltos pa med par brjod bya la 'jug pa de dag ni 'dod rgyal gyi sgra'o //
analyzed: gang dag phyi rol gyi rgyu mtshan la ltos pa med par brjod bya la 'jug pa de dag ni 'dod rgyal gyi sgra'o //
translated: Those that engage their object without depending on an external causal process are the words of chance.

original: gang dag la gsal ba nyung zad de tshad nges pa yod pa'i spyi de dag la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: gang dag la gsal ba nyung zad de tshad nges pa yod pa'i spyi de dag la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: Those universals that have a few instances that are definite in number are called ‚Äúlimited.‚Äù

original: dper na g-yul ngor brtan pa la sogs pa lnga la skya bseng bu nyid du gnas pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na g-yul ngor brtan pa la sogs pa lnga la skya bseng bu nyid du gnas pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the five, beginning with Yudhishthira, are the sons of Pandu.

original: de bzhin du de lta bu'i rigs can gsal ba'i nges pa'i yul can gyi spyi gzhan dag la yang rtogs par bya'o //üîΩ'dod rgyal gyi sgra'i yul gsal ba'i khyad par rnams sam /
analyzed: de bzhin du de lta bu'i rigs can gsal ba'i nges pa'i yul can gyi spyi gzhan dag la yang rtogs par bya'o // 'dod rgyal gyi sgra'i yul gsal ba'i khyad par rnams sam /
translated: In the same way, one should understand other universals that have a definite number of instances.

original: gsal ba nyung zad pa can gyi spyi la rnam par rtog pa'i blo yod pa yin na don yod pa zhes bya ba 'di dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: gsal ba nyung zad pa can gyi spyi la rnam par rtog pa'i blo yod pa yin na don yod pa zhes bya ba 'di dang sbyar ro //
translated: If there is a conceptual cognition that has as its object the particular instances that are the domain of the word ‚Äúchance‚Äù or a universal that has a few instances, then it is called ‚Äúhaving a real object.‚Äù

original: de ltar na 'dod rgyal gyi sgra'i yul rang gi mtshan nyid du 'dod pa de srid du rnam par rtog pa'i blo'i yul ma yin te mi gsal ba'i rnam pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar na 'dod rgyal gyi sgra'i yul rang gi mtshan nyid du 'dod pa de srid du rnam par rtog pa'i blo'i yul ma yin te mi gsal ba'i rnam pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus, the domain of the word ‚Äúchance,‚Äù which is asserted to be an intrinsic identity, is not the object of a conceptual cognition, because it would follow, absurdly, that it would not have a clear aspect.

original: sgra las byung ba'i shes pa yang rang gi mtshan nyid du snang bar khas len na dpang po 'bras bu med pa can gyi gnas skabs de nyid du 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: sgra las byung ba'i shes pa yang rang gi mtshan nyid du snang bar khas len na dpang po 'bras bu med pa can gyi gnas skabs de nyid du 'gyur ro ;
translated: If you accept that the cognition arising from sound appears as its own characteristic, then the situation is that the evidence is pointless.

original: / de la yul du 'gyur ba gzhan gang yin pa de'i phyir khas mi len pa de'i tshe 'dod rgyal ba'i sgra med par thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: / de la yul du 'gyur ba gzhan gang yin pa de'i phyir khas mi len pa de'i tshe 'dod rgyal ba'i sgra med par thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If you do not accept that, then it follows, absurdly, that there would be no sound that is not willed.

original: gsal ba cung zad pa can gyi spyi gsal ba rnams tshogs pa zhig pa'i phyir dang / rten ma bzung ba'i spyi ni yul ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir rnam par rtog pa'i blo'i yul med pa can nyid yin no //
analyzed: gsal ba cung zad pa can gyi spyi gsal ba rnams tshogs pa zhig pa'i phyir dang / rten ma bzung ba'i spyi ni yul ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir rnam par rtog pa'i blo'i yul med pa can nyid yin no //
translated: The cognition of a universal that is not instantiated in any particulars is not a valid cognition because the universal is not an object, since the collection of particulars in which the universal is instantiated has been refuted and because a universal that is not instantiated is not an object.

original: grong dang grong khyer dang yul dang skyes bu dang khang bzangs la sogs pa zhig pa'i yul can gyi shes pa don yod pa zhes bya ba 'di dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: grong dang grong khyer dang yul dang skyes bu dang khang bzangs la sogs pa zhig pa'i yul can gyi shes pa don yod pa zhes bya ba 'di dang sbyar ro //
translated: This is to be applied to the case of the valid cognition that has as its object the destruction of a town, city, country, person, house, and so on.

original: de med na yang zhes bya ba ni phyi rol gyi dngos po med na yang de //
analyzed: de med na yang zhes bya ba ni phyi rol gyi dngos po med na yang de //
translated: Even though there is no external object,

original: rang gi 'dod pas sbyar ba'i ngo bo can te /
analyzed: rang gi 'dod pas sbyar ba'i ngo bo can te /
translated: It is the nature of something that is posited by one‚Äôs own mind.

original: gang gi tshe @160a * //
analyzed: gang gi tshe @160a * //
translated: WhenüîΩone analyzes the direction of space, one finds that there is no multiplicity

original: nam mkha'i phyogs la rang gi 'dod pas skye bo'i tshogs rgyan rnam pa sna tshogs pas brgyan pa can rnam pa du ma med pa nyid dpyod par byed pa de'i tshe yang /
analyzed: nam mkha'i phyogs la rang gi 'dod pas skye bo'i tshogs rgyan rnam pa sna tshogs pas brgyan pa can rnam pa du ma med pa nyid dpyod par byed pa de'i tshe yang /
translated: of collections of people adorned with various ornaments.üîΩWhat is the point of changing one‚Äôs mind about that?

original: de la blo 'gyur ba la don ci zhig yod ces bya ba ni rnam pa bzhi pa yin te /
analyzed: de la blo 'gyur ba la don ci zhig yod ces bya ba ni rnam pa bzhi pa yin te /
translated: This is the fourthüîΩalternative. ‚Äú

original: 'bad rtsol tsam gyis zhes bya ba de dang sbyar bar bya'o ;üîΩ/ de las gzhan pa'i rgyu mtshan thag nye ba na yod na zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'bad rtsol tsam gyis zhes bya ba de dang sbyar bar bya'o ; / de las gzhan pa'i rgyu mtshan thag nye ba na yod na zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Merely through effort‚Äù should be connected with this.

original: 'bad rtsol dang brda dran pa thag nye ba na yod na zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'bad rtsol dang brda dran pa thag nye ba na yod na zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúIf there is a proximate basis other than that‚Äù means if there is a proximate basis of effort and the memory of the sign.

original: gsal ba dang 'brel pa can ni de mtshungs te gsal ba dang 'brel pa can gyi spyi des zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gsal ba dang 'brel pa can ni de mtshungs te gsal ba dang 'brel pa can gyi spyi des zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúThat which is related to the manifestation‚Äù means that which is similar to that, that is, the universal that is related to the manifestation.

original: de bkag pa ni de mtshungs min no //
analyzed: de bkag pa ni de mtshungs min no //
translated: The negation of that is ‚Äúnot that which is similar to that.‚Äù

original: de dang gsal ba min pa zhes bya ba ni zlas dbye ba'o //
analyzed: de dang gsal ba min pa zhes bya ba ni zlas dbye ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat which is not related to the manifestation‚Äù is aüîΩcompound.

original: rten la yang gsal ba'i sgras 'ga' zhig gi tshe rjod par byed pa de ltar na /
analyzed: rten la yang gsal ba'i sgras 'ga' zhig gi tshe rjod par byed pa de ltar na /
translated: In some cases, the word ‚Äúmanifest‚Äù refers to the substratum.

original: de rnam par bcad pa'i don du gsal ba ni gsal bar byed pa ste zhes bya bas ston par byed do //
analyzed: de rnam par bcad pa'i don du gsal ba ni gsal bar byed pa ste zhes bya bas ston par byed do //
translated: Thus, in order to eliminate that, he says, ‚ÄúManifestation is the manifestation of the manifest.‚Äù

original: dbus ma'i gnas skabs kyi zhes bya ba ni gsal ba dmigs su rung ba thag nye ba'i gnas skabs kyi'o //
analyzed: dbus ma'i gnas skabs kyi zhes bya ba ni gsal ba dmigs su rung ba thag nye ba'i gnas skabs kyi'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn the present state‚Äù means in the state of the manifest that is capable of being perceived.

original: gnas skabs snga phyi dag tu zhes bya ba ni gsal ba skye ba dang 'jig pa'i dus dag tu'o //
analyzed: gnas skabs snga phyi dag tu zhes bya ba ni gsal ba skye ba dang 'jig pa'i dus dag tu'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn the prior and subsequent states‚Äù means at the time of the origination and destruction of the manifest.

original: gal te yang gsal las mngon sum phyir gsal yin zhes bya ba ni gsal ba spyi'i rten du gyur pa las spyi'i gsal ba ste mngon par gsal ba gang yin pa de ni spyi'i mngon sum gyi phyir te rgyu mtshan no //
analyzed: gal te yang gsal las mngon sum phyir gsal yin zhes bya ba ni gsal ba spyi'i rten du gyur pa las spyi'i gsal ba ste mngon par gsal ba gang yin pa de ni spyi'i mngon sum gyi phyir te rgyu mtshan no //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause the universal is directly perceived through the manifest‚Äù means that the universal is directly perceived through the manifest, which is the substratum of the universal.

original: rten mngon par gsal ba nyid kyi spyi'i mngon sum nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rten mngon par gsal ba nyid kyi spyi'i mngon sum nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The substratum is the cause of the direct perception of the universal.

original: de ni don gyi ngo bo zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed do //
analyzed: de ni don gyi ngo bo zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed do //
translated: He explains this in the following, beginning with ‚ÄúThe universal is the object-universal.‚Äù

original: gtan tshigs ma grub pa dag yin no zhes bya ba ni de ma thag pa gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: gtan tshigs ma grub pa dag yin no zhes bya ba ni de ma thag pa gnyis pa'o //
translated: The second alternative is that the reason is not established.

original: gal te rtag pa nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: gal te rtag pa nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: If you say that the reason is not established, then the response is:

original: gal te'i sgra ni khas len pa'i tshig ston par byed pa'o //
analyzed: gal te'i sgra ni khas len pa'i tshig ston par byed pa'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúif‚Äù indicates that this is a response.

original: don dam par ni de yang 'di'i lan nyid du 'gyur ba ma yin te /
analyzed: don dam par ni de yang 'di'i lan nyid du 'gyur ba ma yin te /
translated: But ultimately, this is not a response to the opponent‚Äôs argument.

original: rtag pa gsal byed du rigs pa ma yin no /
analyzed: rtag pa gsal byed du rigs pa ma yin no /
translated: It is not logical to clarify permanence.üîΩThe remaining faults are due to the fact that the opponent‚Äôs argument is based on a particular case.

original: skyon lhag ma dag ni 'di'i gnas skabs can nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe rten gyi sgo nas gsal ba nyid spyir bzung ba de'i tshe de rang dbang gis 'dzin pa ma yin no //
analyzed: skyon lhag ma dag ni 'di'i gnas skabs can nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe rten gyi sgo nas gsal ba nyid spyir bzung ba de'i tshe de rang dbang gis 'dzin pa ma yin no //
translated: When the opponent‚Äôs argument is based on a particular case, then the opponent does not accept the general case.

original: de bas na gsal ba la ltos pa dang bcas pa de nyid kyang sga las 'dzin pa de ltar na /
analyzed: de bas na gsal ba la ltos pa dang bcas pa de nyid kyang sga las 'dzin pa de ltar na /
translated: Therefore, the opponent‚Äôs argument is based on a particular case that is not independent.üîΩThus, the opponent‚Äôs argument is based on a particular case that is not independent.

original: dbang po'i tshogs 'bras bu med pa can gyi gnas skabs de nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dbang po'i tshogs 'bras bu med pa can gyi gnas skabs de nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: In that case, the opponent‚Äôs argument is based on a particular case that is not independent.

original: ci ste dbang po la brten pa can gyi spyi'i shes pa gang yin pa de nyid rten 'dzin pa @160b la ltos pa dang bcas pa yin na sgra la brten pa can ni spyi 'ba' zhig 'dzin pa can yin par 'dod de zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste dbang po la brten pa can gyi spyi'i shes pa gang yin pa de nyid rten 'dzin pa @160b la ltos pa dang bcas pa yin na sgra la brten pa can ni spyi 'ba' zhig 'dzin pa can yin par 'dod de zhe na /
translated: But if you maintain that the cognition of the universal which is based on the sense faculty is dependent on the apprehension of the substratum, then the cognition of the universal which is based on sound is also a cognition of the universal alone.

original: de ltar na yang spyi yan gar ba brjod pa nyid kyi phyir gsal ba la mi 'jug pa'i skyon de'i gnas skabs can yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na yang spyi yan gar ba brjod pa nyid kyi phyir gsal ba la mi 'jug pa'i skyon de'i gnas skabs can yin no //
translated: Even so, the error that the universal alone is expressed still applies, because the universal alone is stated.

original: gang zhig gang gi rnam pa dang bral pa de ni de 'dzin pa na rnam pa der snang ba ma yin te zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: gang zhig gang gi rnam pa dang bral pa de ni de 'dzin pa na rnam pa der snang ba ma yin te zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: That which is devoid of the aspect of something else does not appear in the aspect of that other thing when it is apprehended.

original: sngon po la sogs pa ma yin pa 'dzin pa'i shes pa la spyi sngon po'i rang gi ngo bo dang bral ba sngon po'i rnam par snang bar gyur pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni bsdus pa'i don yin no //
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa ma yin pa 'dzin pa'i shes pa la spyi sngon po'i rang gi ngo bo dang bral ba sngon po'i rnam par snang bar gyur pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni bsdus pa'i don yin no //
translated: The cognition that apprehends something other than blue, etc., is not devoid of the nature of the universal blue, and it does not appear in the aspect of blue. This is the condensed meaning.

original: de 'dzin pa'i ngang tshul can gyi shes pa la rnam pa der snang ba ni de'i rnam pa nyid kyis khyab pa yin la /
analyzed: de 'dzin pa'i ngang tshul can gyi shes pa la rnam pa der snang ba ni de'i rnam pa nyid kyis khyab pa yin la /
translated: The cognition that has the mode of apprehending that image is necessarily the appearance of that image.

original: de dang 'gal ba yang de'i rnam pa nyid ma yin pa de ltar na khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: de dang 'gal ba yang de'i rnam pa nyid ma yin pa de ltar na khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
translated: And the contradictory of that is not that image. Thus, the contradictory of the pervasion is observed.

original: sgra las spyi 'dzin pa na yang spyi rten dang bcas pa nyid gzung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: sgra las spyi 'dzin pa na yang spyi rten dang bcas pa nyid gzung ba'i phyir /
translated: Even when a universal is apprehended from a word, the universal is apprehended along with its basis.

original: sgra las byung ba'i shes pas gsal ba yang gzung ba yin no //
analyzed: sgra las byung ba'i shes pas gsal ba yang gzung ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, the particular is also apprehended by the cognition that arises from the word.

original: de bas na dbang po rnams don med pa can yin no zhes bshad pa gang yin pa de la de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /üîΩgal te mngon sum zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan gyi dogs pa bsu bar byed do //
analyzed: de bas na dbang po rnams don med pa can yin no zhes bshad pa gang yin pa de la de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi / gal te mngon sum zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan gyi dogs pa bsu bar byed do //
translated: Therefore, it is as you say that the senses are purposeless.üîΩBut if you think that the senses are purposeless because the cognition arises from the word, then we reply:

original: 'di skad du gal te sgra'i sgo nas kyang spyi'i rten dang bcas pa shes pa yin pa de lta na yang sgra las byung ba'i shes pa la gsal ba mi gsal ba'i ngo bor snang zhing /
analyzed: 'di skad du gal te sgra'i sgo nas kyang spyi'i rten dang bcas pa shes pa yin pa de lta na yang sgra las byung ba'i shes pa la gsal ba mi gsal ba'i ngo bor snang zhing /
translated: If you say that the cognition arises from the word, then the particular would not appear to the cognition that arises from the word.

original: dbang po'i shes pa la ni gsal ba yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dbang po'i shes pa la ni gsal ba yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: The sense consciousnesses are clear.

original: de nyid ni don gyi shes pa yang rnam pa gnyis te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
analyzed: de nyid ni don gyi shes pa yang rnam pa gnyis te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
translated: This is the same for the cognition of the object.

original: ming la sogs pa brjod pa la yang lan 'di nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ming la sogs pa brjod pa la yang lan 'di nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This is also the reply to the objection that the name, etc., are not the same.

original: don dang 'brel ba can gyi ming la sogs pa brjod pa na /
analyzed: don dang 'brel ba can gyi ming la sogs pa brjod pa na /
translated: When the name, etc., are related to the object,

original: gal te yang don rtogs pa sgra las yin pa de lta na yang rnam pa mi gsal ba yin pa de bas na dbang po rnams 'bras bu med pa can ma yin no zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gal te yang don rtogs pa sgra las yin pa de lta na yang rnam pa mi gsal ba yin pa de bas na dbang po rnams 'bras bu med pa can ma yin no zhes bya'o //
translated: even though the understanding of the object is from the word, the form is not clear. Therefore, the sense faculties are not without effect.

original: don so sor nges pa ngo bo gcig pa zhes bya ba ni dngos su du ma nyid du 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don so sor nges pa ngo bo gcig pa zhes bya ba ni dngos su du ma nyid du 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The object is ascertained as a single entity, because it is directly contradictory to be many.

original: tha dad snang ba can zhes bya ba 'di'i bshad pa ni gsal bar snang ba'i ngang tshul can no //
analyzed: tha dad snang ba can zhes bya ba 'di'i bshad pa ni gsal bar snang ba'i ngang tshul can no //
translated: The explanation of ‚Äúhaving the appearance of difference‚Äù is ‚Äúhaving the mode of appearance of difference.‚Äù

original: de las gzhan pa'i zhes bya ba ni gzhan pa ste /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i zhes bya ba ni gzhan pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúOther than that‚Äù means different.

original: mi gsal bar snang ba'i ngang tshul can no //
analyzed: mi gsal bar snang ba'i ngang tshul can no //
translated: It is the state of appearing unclearly.

original: snang bar gyur pa'i ngo bo la ltos zhes yul du rnam par gzhag pa na /
analyzed: snang bar gyur pa'i ngo bo la ltos zhes yul du rnam par gzhag pa na /
translated: When the nature of the appearance is posited as the object,

original: shes pa rnams mngon sum dang mngon sum ma yin pa'i khyad par ldan pa @161a * //
analyzed: shes pa rnams mngon sum dang mngon sum ma yin pa'i khyad par ldan pa @161a * //
translated: the consciousnesses are distinguished as direct perception and non-direct perception.

original: nyid dang tha dad par snang ba nyid la yul tha dad pas khyab pa yin la /
analyzed: nyid dang tha dad par snang ba nyid la yul tha dad pas khyab pa yin la /
translated: The distinction of the object is pervaded by the distinction of the appearance.

original: de dang 'gal ba yang yul gcig pa can nyid du khas len pa yin pa de ltar na khyab par byed pa ni dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: de dang 'gal ba yang yul gcig pa can nyid du khas len pa yin pa de ltar na khyab par byed pa ni dmigs pa'o //
translated: And the contradiction of that is the assertion of the same object. Thus the pervasion is the object of observation.

original: gang zhig gang gis cung zad kyang byar med pa'am grub pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: gang zhig gang gis cung zad kyang byar med pa'am grub pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Whatever is not made in the least by anything or whatever is established, etc.

original: gang zhig gang gis cung zad kyang byar med pa de ni de la ltos par mi 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba gcig yin no //
analyzed: gang zhig gang gis cung zad kyang byar med pa de ni de la ltos par mi 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba gcig yin no //
translated: Whatever is not made in the least by anything does not rely on that. This is the first probandum.

original: grub pa gang yin pa de ni gzhan gyi dbang ma yin te zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: grub pa gang yin pa de ni gzhan gyi dbang ma yin te zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa'o //
translated: Whatever is established is not dependent on another. This is the second.

original: de la bsgrub par bya ba dang po la ni khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa yin te /
analyzed: de la bsgrub par bya ba dang po la ni khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa yin te /
translated: Regarding the first probandum, there is non-observation of the pervader.

original: de la ltos pa nyid la de la cung zad byar yod pas des khyab pa yin la de 'di la med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la ltos pa nyid la de la cung zad byar yod pas des khyab pa yin la de 'di la med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In that, the dependence itself is slightly workable, and it is pervaded by that, because it does not exist here.

original: gang la med par dgag pa gtso bo yin pa de la ni khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa yin zhing /
analyzed: gang la med par dgag pa gtso bo yin pa de la ni khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa yin zhing /
translated: In that which is primarily a negative, there is non-observation of the pervader.

original: bsgrub pa gtso bor gyur pa'i gtan tshigs la ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: bsgrub pa gtso bor gyur pa'i gtan tshigs la ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa yin no //
translated: In the case of a reason that is primarily a proof, there is observation of a contradictory pervasion.

original: de nyid kyi phyir bsgrub par bya ba gnyis pa la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir bsgrub par bya ba gnyis pa la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: For that very reason, it says ‚Äúin the second probandum‚Äù and so on.

original: 'dir gzhan gyi dbang la ni ma grub pa nyid kyis khyab pa yin la /
analyzed: 'dir gzhan gyi dbang la ni ma grub pa nyid kyis khyab pa yin la /
translated: Here, in the case of the dependent, there is pervasion by non-establishment.

original: de dang 'gal ba yang grub pa nyid sgrub pa'i ngo bo tsam yin pa'i phyir ro /üîΩ// / tshad ma rnam 'grel gyi 'grel bshad /
analyzed: de dang 'gal ba yang grub pa nyid sgrub pa'i ngo bo tsam yin pa'i phyir ro / // / tshad ma rnam 'grel gyi 'grel bshad /
translated: And the contradiction of that is merely the nature of establishing establishment.

original: bam po lnga bcu pa /
analyzed: bam po lnga bcu pa /
translated: Commentary on Valid Knowledge

original: gzhan nyid yin na de 'brel med //
analyzed: gzhan nyid yin na de 'brel med //
translated: If different, there is no relation.

original: ces bya ba ni mdo yin te /
analyzed: ces bya ba ni mdo yin te /
translated: This is the sutra.

original: de spel nas 'chad pa la gzhan nyid yin na /
analyzed: de spel nas 'chad pa la gzhan nyid yin na /
translated: If it is different from the particulars,

original: don gzhan nyid gang las she na zhes bya ba ni 'dri ba'o //
analyzed: don gzhan nyid gang las she na zhes bya ba ni 'dri ba'o //
translated: then why is it not different from another object?üîΩThis is the question.

original: gsal ba las so zhes bya ba ni lan no //
analyzed: gsal ba las so zhes bya ba ni lan no //
translated: The reply is: ‚ÄúFrom the particulars.‚Äù

original: ci zhig ce na zhes bya ba ni gsal ba las gzhan nyid du yod na skyon ci yod ces 'dri ba'o //
analyzed: ci zhig ce na zhes bya ba ni gsal ba las gzhan nyid du yod na skyon ci yod ces 'dri ba'o //
translated: What is the problem if it exists as different from the particulars?

original: spyi de zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni lan yin no //
analyzed: spyi de zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni lan yin no //
translated: The reply is: ‚ÄúThat universal . . .‚ÄùüîΩAt that time, because it would be essenceless, it would not be a universal of anything.

original: de'i tshe rang bzhin med pa nyid kyi phyir 'ga' zhig kyang spyir mi 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin med pa 'ga' zhig kyang spyir gyur ba'i ngang tshul can du rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i tshe rang bzhin med pa nyid kyi phyir 'ga' zhig kyang spyir mi 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin med pa 'ga' zhig kyang spyir gyur ba'i ngang tshul can du rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: This means that it is not correct for anything that is essenceless to be a universal.üîΩThus, non-horseness is not asserted as anything at all.

original: 'di ltar rta ma yin pa nyid ni zhes bya ba ni spyi dngos por sma ba'i ngang tshul can gzhan yang rta ma yin pa nyid ces bya ba cung zad kyang mi 'dod do //
analyzed: 'di ltar rta ma yin pa nyid ni zhes bya ba ni spyi dngos por sma ba'i ngang tshul can gzhan yang rta ma yin pa nyid ces bya ba cung zad kyang mi 'dod do //
translated: This means that those who assert that universals are real do not assert that non-horseness is anything at all.

original: de ltar tshig gi don nyid kyang dngos por gyur pa de gzhan mi 'dod do //
analyzed: de ltar tshig gi don nyid kyang dngos por gyur pa de gzhan mi 'dod do //
translated: Thus, even the referent of the word is not asserted to be a real entity that is different from that.

original: tshig gi don drug ni rdzas dang / yon tan dang las dang / spyi dang khyad par dang 'du ba'o //üîΩsgra de 'dis ni gang nges @161b can ;
analyzed: tshig gi don drug ni rdzas dang / yon tan dang las dang / spyi dang khyad par dang 'du ba'o // sgra de 'dis ni gang nges @161b can ;
translated: The six categories are substance, quality, action, universality, particularity, and inherence.

original: / zhes bya ba ni mdo yin no //
analyzed: / zhes bya ba ni mdo yin no //
translated: The statement ‚ÄúThat is the meaning of the word‚Äù is the s≈´tra.

original: de ni mi 'dod pa spong ba'i sgo nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed do //
analyzed: de ni mi 'dod pa spong ba'i sgo nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed do //
translated: He explains that by the words ‚ÄúThat is not accepted as the meaning of the word.‚Äù

original: gzhan sel ba de'i ngo bor cir mi rung zhes bya ba ni dngos po rnams kyi ldog pa'i ngo bo la brten nas phyi rol gyi dngos po de dag la sgra'i brjod par bya ba nyid du rnam par gzhag pa'i gzhan sel ba gang yin pa de'i ngo
analyzed: gzhan sel ba de'i ngo bor cir mi rung zhes bya ba ni dngos po rnams kyi ldog pa'i ngo bo la brten nas phyi rol gyi dngos po de dag la sgra'i brjod par bya ba nyid du rnam par gzhag pa'i gzhan sel ba gang yin pa de'i ngo
translated: The question ‚ÄúWhy is it not suitable to be the nature of the exclusion of other?‚Äù refers to the fact that the exclusion of other, which is posited as the object of expression of a word in regard to external things, is based on the nature of the exclusion of things.

original: bo cir yang mi rung ste /
analyzed: bo cir yang mi rung ste /
translated: The nature of that exclusion of other is not suitable to be anything.

original: de ni ji ltar sgro btags pa bzhin du med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni ji ltar sgro btags pa bzhin du med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because it does not exist in the way that it is imputed.

original: phyi'i rang gi mtshan nyid ldog pa gang yin pa de'i ldog pa gang yin pa de ni rang gi ngo bo las gzhan pa ma yin pa de ltar na gzhan sel ba dngos po nyid yin gyi sgra'i brjod par bya ba nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: phyi'i rang gi mtshan nyid ldog pa gang yin pa de'i ldog pa gang yin pa de ni rang gi ngo bo las gzhan pa ma yin pa de ltar na gzhan sel ba dngos po nyid yin gyi sgra'i brjod par bya ba nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: The exclusion of the external object‚Äôs own character is not different from its own nature. Thus, the exclusion of other is a real entity, but not the content of verbal expression.

original: phan tshun tha dad pa'i don la brten nas skyes par gyur pa zhes bya ba ni brgyud pas zhes bya bar blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: phan tshun tha dad pa'i don la brten nas skyes par gyur pa zhes bya ba ni brgyud pas zhes bya bar blta bar bya'o //
translated: ‚ÄúArisen in dependence on objects that are mutually different‚Äù should be understood as ‚Äúindirectly.‚Äù

original: de ltar na re zhig dang por rang gi mtshan nyid la 'dzin pa'i blo dang phyis rnam par rtog pa skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na re zhig dang por rang gi mtshan nyid la 'dzin pa'i blo dang phyis rnam par rtog pa skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, first the cognition of the own character arises, and then the conceptualization arises.

original: de nyid ces bya ba ni phan tshun tha dad pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid ces bya ba ni phan tshun tha dad pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat itself‚Äù means mutually different.

original: de de ltar na slob dpon phyogs kyi glang po la sogs pas /
analyzed: de de ltar na slob dpon phyogs kyi glang po la sogs pas /
translated: Thus, the master DignƒÅga and so on

original: ji ltar phyi rol la gzhan las ldog pa'i ngo bo'i spyi'i sgra'i brjod par bya ba nyid du zhal gyis bzhes pa'am /
analyzed: ji ltar phyi rol la gzhan las ldog pa'i ngo bo'i spyi'i sgra'i brjod par bya ba nyid du zhal gyis bzhes pa'am /
translated: accept that the external object is the content of verbal expression as the nature that is the exclusion of other.

original: blo la snang ba'i spyi ji skad du kun la'ang ngo bo mtshungs pa'i phyir te zhes sngar bshad pa gang yin pa bzhed pa yin no //
analyzed: blo la snang ba'i spyi ji skad du kun la'ang ngo bo mtshungs pa'i phyir te zhes sngar bshad pa gang yin pa bzhed pa yin no //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúin reality‚Äù is the same as that of ‚Äúin actuality,‚Äù as explained above.

original: de nyid dang gzhan nyid du'o zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa gnyis kyi tshig go //
analyzed: de nyid dang gzhan nyid du'o zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa gnyis kyi tshig go //
translated: ‚ÄúIn reality and otherwise‚Äù is the second pair of terms.

original: de nyid dang gzhan nyid las ma 'das pa zhes bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: de nyid dang gzhan nyid las ma 'das pa zhes bya ba'i don te /
translated: The meaning is that it does not go beyond being the same or different.

original: dngos po la go skabs gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po la go skabs gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no other possibility for an entity.

original: gal te tshig 'ga' zhig las kyang /
analyzed: gal te tshig 'ga' zhig las kyang /
translated: If you assert that it is an entity,

original: dngos po 'dod na ni zhes bya ba ni gal te rang gi rten bum pa las spyi bum pa nyid de nyid dang gzhan nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin pa de ltar na yang snam bu las gzhan nyid du brjod par bya ba nyid yin te
analyzed: dngos po 'dod na ni zhes bya ba ni gal te rang gi rten bum pa las spyi bum pa nyid de nyid dang gzhan nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin pa de ltar na yang snam bu las gzhan nyid du brjod par bya ba nyid yin te
translated: If you assert that the universal ‚Äúpot‚Äù is not to be expressed as the same as or different from its basis, the pot, then it would be expressed as different from a cloth.

original: / gzhan nyid du 'ga' zhig las brjod pa'i phyir spyi de ni dngos po yin no zhes bya ba ni bsdus pa'i don to //
analyzed: / gzhan nyid du 'ga' zhig las brjod pa'i phyir spyi de ni dngos po yin no zhes bya ba ni bsdus pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the summary is that if it is expressed as different from something, that universal is an entity.

original: de nyid ni bum pa'i spyi zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed do //
analyzed: de nyid ni bum pa'i spyi zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed do //
translated: That is what is called the universal of pot, etc.

original: snam bu las bum pa zhes bya ba ni chos can gyi chos nye bar mtshon pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: snam bu las bum pa zhes bya ba ni chos can gyi chos nye bar mtshon pa'i phyir te /
translated: Pot from cloth is the quality of the qualified, because it is the quality of the qualified.

original: bum pa nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bum pa nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: the nature of pot.

original: ji ltar dngos po 'ga' zhig las kyang brjod par bya ba ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni rang gi nye bar len par gyur ba las kyang gang brjod par bya ba ma yin pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ji ltar dngos po 'ga' zhig las kyang brjod par bya ba ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni rang gi nye bar len par gyur ba las kyang gang brjod par bya ba ma yin pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Just as something is not expressible, the meaning is: not expressible from its own appropriation.

original: de'i nye bar len pa'i sgo nas btags pa'i zhes bya ba ni @162a * //
analyzed: de'i nye bar len pa'i sgo nas btags pa'i zhes bya ba ni @162a * //
translated: It is imputed by way of its appropriation, the meaning is:

original: gzugs la sogs pa dngos por gyur pa nye bar len pa'i sgo nas btags pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa dngos por gyur pa nye bar len pa'i sgo nas btags pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: imputed by way of appropriating such things as form.

original: nye ba gang zhes bya ba 'di'i bshad pa ni sgra 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan gyi chos zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: nye ba gang zhes bya ba 'di'i bshad pa ni sgra 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan gyi chos zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: What is near is the cause of the application of the term, the meaning is:üîΩthe quality that is the cause of the application of the term.

original: 'di skad du gal te 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan la la da ltar gyi bum pa sgra 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan gang yin pa de dang 'dra bar 'das pa'i bum pa la sogs pa 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan du gyur pa de'i tshe nye ba'i phyir bum par nye barüîΩbtags par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: 'di skad du gal te 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan la la da ltar gyi bum pa sgra 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan gang yin pa de dang 'dra bar 'das pa'i bum pa la sogs pa 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan du gyur pa de'i tshe nye ba'i phyir bum par nye bar btags par 'gyur gyi /
translated: This is what is being said: If the reason for applying the term to the present vase were the same as the reason for applying the term to the past vase, then because it is similar, the present vase would be designated as a vase.

original: de lta ma yin na rgyu mtshan med pa yin na ni thams cad la nye bar btags pa thob par 'gyur ro zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na rgyu mtshan med pa yin na ni thams cad la nye bar btags pa thob par 'gyur ro zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: But if it were not so, then there would be no reason for applying the term to the present vase, and it would follow that the term could be applied to anything.

original: bum pa'i nye bar btags pa nyid kyis med pa la 'gyur zhes bya ba ni bum pa'i yul can gyi nye bar btags pa snam bu la sogs pa las ldog pa med pa la 'gyur te /
analyzed: bum pa'i nye bar btags pa nyid kyis med pa la 'gyur zhes bya ba ni bum pa'i yul can gyi nye bar btags pa snam bu la sogs pa las ldog pa med pa la 'gyur te /
translated: The term ‚Äúvase‚Äù would not exist in the absence of the designation ‚Äúvase‚Äù means that the designation ‚Äúvase,‚Äù which has the object vase, would not be distinguished from the designation ‚Äúcloth,‚Äù and so on.

original: 'das pa la sogs pa'i bum pa med pa la 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'das pa la sogs pa'i bum pa med pa la 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the past vase and so on would not exist.

original: 'jig rten pa nyid kyi ma yin no zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten gyis de lta bur gyur pa dngos kyi nye bar btags pa nyid shes pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa nyid kyi ma yin no zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten gyis de lta bur gyur pa dngos kyi nye bar btags pa nyid shes pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not the case that it is worldly. The world does not know that such a thing is a designation of a real thing.

original: 'o na 'jig rten pa'i dngos kyi nye bar btags pa'i khyad par gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na 'jig rten pa'i dngos kyi nye bar btags pa'i khyad par gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is the difference between a worldly designation of a real thing?

original: 'di ltar dngos dang sgro 'dogs pa la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: 'di ltar dngos dang sgro 'dogs pa la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Thus, it is said, ‚Äúin regard to a real thing and an imputation.‚Äù

original: seng ge'i sgra dang shes pa 'jug pa zhes bya ba ni seng ge'i sgra dang seng ge'i shes pa 'jug pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: seng ge'i sgra dang shes pa 'jug pa zhes bya ba ni seng ge'i sgra dang seng ge'i shes pa 'jug pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The lion‚Äôs roar and the engagement of consciousness means the lion‚Äôs roar and the engagement of the lion‚Äôs consciousness.

original: dus de'i tshe zhes bya ba ni skad cig ma de nyid kyi tshe'o //
analyzed: dus de'i tshe zhes bya ba ni skad cig ma de nyid kyi tshe'o //
translated: At that time means at the time of that moment.

original: bum pa'i spyi la yang spyi'i rgyu mtshan can gyi shes pa ma yin zhes bya ba ni spyi rnams ni spyi can nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bum pa'i spyi la yang spyi'i rgyu mtshan can gyi shes pa ma yin zhes bya ba ni spyi rnams ni spyi can nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not the case that there is a consciousness characterized by the universal of a pot in regard to the universal of a pot, because universals do not have universals.

original: gang shes pa ni gang gi rnam pa can gyi shes pa'o //
analyzed: gang shes pa ni gang gi rnam pa can gyi shes pa'o //
translated: That which is known is the consciousness that has its aspect.

original: gang shes pa yang de yin la 'khrul pa med pa yang yin pas na zhes bya ba ni las 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: gang shes pa yang de yin la 'khrul pa med pa yang yin pas na zhes bya ba ni las 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The phrase that which is both a cognition and non-erroneous is the object-possessor.

original: 'ga' zhig las zhes bya ba ni smod pa la sogs pa brjod pa'i dgos pa lags so //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig las zhes bya ba ni smod pa la sogs pa brjod pa'i dgos pa lags so //
translated: The phrase in some way is the purpose of the statement of censure, etc.

original: rnam pa 'ga' zhig gis zhes bya ba ni rang gi bu la sogs pa'i nus pa nyid dang nus pa med pa nyid dpyod pa'i gnas skabs kyis so //
analyzed: rnam pa 'ga' zhig gis zhes bya ba ni rang gi bu la sogs pa'i nus pa nyid dang nus pa med pa nyid dpyod pa'i gnas skabs kyis so //
translated: The phrase in some way is the context of the analysis of the capacity or incapacity of one's own son, etc.

original: bzlog pas zhes bya ba'i sgra ni lugs las bzlog pa'o //
analyzed: bzlog pas zhes bya ba'i sgra ni lugs las bzlog pa'o //
translated: The word reverse means contrary to the system.

original: khyed kyi 'dod pas nye bar btags pa'i yul med na yang nus ba bzlog pas dngos yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: khyed kyi 'dod pas nye bar btags pa'i yul med na yang nus ba bzlog pas dngos yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that even in the absence of an object designated by your desire, it is a real entity by the reverse of capacity.

original: ji ltar brtag bzhin du zhes bya ba ni grangs can gyis byed pa po nyid la sogs pa rgyu mtshan 'dra @162b bar sgro btags nas yon tan gsum gyi bdag nyid can gyi gtso bor brtag pa byed pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: ji ltar brtag bzhin du zhes bya ba ni grangs can gyis byed pa po nyid la sogs pa rgyu mtshan 'dra @162b bar sgro btags nas yon tan gsum gyi bdag nyid can gyi gtso bor brtag pa byed pa lta bu'o //
translated: The phrase as it is imagined is like the SƒÅ·πÉkhya imagining the primary nature, which has the nature of the three qualities, as the cause, superimposing similarity as the reason for being the agent, etc.

original: rgyu mtshan de nyid kyi sgo nas tha mal par sgro btags nas skyes bur brtag pa byed pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rgyu mtshan de nyid kyi sgo nas tha mal par sgro btags nas skyes bur brtag pa byed pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: For this very reason, it is said that the examination of the person is done by superimposing the status of the ordinary person.

original: de la grangs can pa'i 'dod pa med na yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la grangs can 'dod pa'i gtso bo dang skyes bu don dam par med na yang /
analyzed: de la grangs can pa'i 'dod pa med na yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la grangs can 'dod pa'i gtso bo dang skyes bu don dam par med na yang /
translated: In this regard, although the SƒÅ·πÉkhya do not assert a primal substance and a person,

original: gtso bo'i sgra dang skyes bu'i sgra 'jug pa ni dngos yin no //
analyzed: gtso bo'i sgra dang skyes bu'i sgra 'jug pa ni dngos yin no //
translated: the terms ‚Äúprimal substance‚Äù and ‚Äúperson‚Äù are used in reference to the real.

original: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni phal pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni phal pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúOtherwise‚Äù means ‚Äúin general.‚Äù

original: mngon par 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni dngos por gyur pa'i gnas skabs su bab pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni dngos por gyur pa'i gnas skabs su bab pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúDesired‚Äù means ‚Äúin the context of being a real entity.‚Äù

original: gzhan ni phal pa yin no zhes bya ba ni gzhung gzhan yin no //
analyzed: gzhan ni phal pa yin no zhes bya ba ni gzhung gzhan yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúThe other is general‚Äù is another text.

original: de ni 'di skad du med par 'dod pa ni rnam pa gzhan gyis yod pa nyid du 'dod pa zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni 'di skad du med par 'dod pa ni rnam pa gzhan gyis yod pa nyid du 'dod pa zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: This is what is being taught: ‚ÄúThe assertion of nonexistence is the assertion of existence in another way.‚Äù

original: skyes bu'i dbang po'i bya ba mi byed pa'i zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: skyes bu'i dbang po'i bya ba mi byed pa'i zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚ÄúThe person does not perform the function of the sense faculties‚Äù means

original: mig la sogs pa'i dbang po'i yul la mi 'jug pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i dbang po'i yul la mi 'jug pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúnot engaging the object of the sense faculties such as the eye‚Äù is that.

original: gzhan dang po 'jug pa'i dus na snang ba dang rnam par brtag par bya ba gcig tu byed pas tha snyad du byed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan dang po 'jug pa'i dus na snang ba dang rnam par brtag par bya ba gcig tu byed pas tha snyad du byed pa'i phyir /
translated: At the time of the first engagement with an object, it is conventionally said that the object appears as one thing and is imagined to be another.

original: sgra las byung ba'i shes pa yang 'ga' zhig gi tshe gsal bar snang bar sems pa de ltar na dbang po'i 'dzin pa'i bya ba mi byed pa yang de ltar snang ba yin no //
analyzed: sgra las byung ba'i shes pa yang 'ga' zhig gi tshe gsal bar snang bar sems pa de ltar na dbang po'i 'dzin pa'i bya ba mi byed pa yang de ltar snang ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, when a consciousness derived from sound is sometimes thought to perceive clearly, the object of the sense faculty appears in that way.

original: bye brag tu smra ba la sogs pa'i 'dod pas 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dag yod pa nyid yin zhing de'i shes pa yang med pa'i don gyi yul can nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba la sogs pa'i 'dod pas 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dag yod pa nyid yin zhing de'i shes pa yang med pa'i don gyi yul can nyid ma yin no //
translated: The past and future exist because they are asserted by the VaibhƒÅ·π£ikas and so on, and the consciousness of that is not a consciousness that has a nonexistent object.

original: de bas na med pa'i don can 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i shes pa las khyad par med par snang ba can yin no zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs ma grub pa dang / dpe sgrub par byed pa'i chos kyis stong pa yin no zhes de'i phyir /
analyzed: de bas na med pa'i don can 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i shes pa las khyad par med par snang ba can yin no zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs ma grub pa dang / dpe sgrub par byed pa'i chos kyis stong pa yin no zhes de'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, the reason ‚Äúbecause it appears without distinction from the consciousness of the past and future, which have the meaning of non-existence‚Äù is unestablished, and the example is empty of the property to be established.

original: gang gi yang 'das pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gang gi yang 'das pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, he says, ‚ÄúThe past and future of what?‚Äù

original: snga phyi dag la zhes bya ba 'das ba dang ma 'ongs pa dag gi dpe ma grub pa ma yin no zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: snga phyi dag la zhes bya ba 'das ba dang ma 'ongs pa dag gi dpe ma grub pa ma yin no zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: ‚ÄúThe past and future‚Äù should be connected with ‚Äúthe example is not unestablished.‚Äù

original: sgrub par byed pas stong pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sgrub par byed pas stong pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is not empty of the property to be established.

original: snga ma phyi ma dang bar ma'i gnas skabs dag tu zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: snga ma phyi ma dang bar ma'i gnas skabs dag tu zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚ÄúThe prior, subsequent, and intermediate states‚Äù

original: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: means the past, future, and present.

original: tha dad pa med par 'dod na yang zhes bya ba ni dngos por gyur pa'i spyi'i gcig 'dod na yang ngo //
analyzed: tha dad pa med par 'dod na yang zhes bya ba ni dngos por gyur pa'i spyi'i gcig 'dod na yang ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúEven if one asserts that they are not different‚Äù means even if one asserts that they are a single universal that is a thing.

original: 'di'i de'i rten can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'di'i de'i rten can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: because it is based on that.

original: spyi ni tha dad pa'i rten can nyid yin pa'i @163a * //
analyzed: spyi ni tha dad pa'i rten can nyid yin pa'i @163a * //
translated: The universal is based on different things.

original: phyir ro // de ltar na spyi ni mang po yin gyi gcig nyid ma yin te dper na nam mkha' lta bu'o //üîΩde la nam mkha' nyid yod pa ma yin mod kyi /
analyzed: phyir ro // de ltar na spyi ni mang po yin gyi gcig nyid ma yin te dper na nam mkha' lta bu'o // de la nam mkha' nyid yod pa ma yin mod kyi /
translated: Thus the universal is many, not one, like space.üîΩSpace does not exist, but if its basis were different, it would be many.

original: rten tha dad pa yod na mang po nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rten tha dad pa yod na mang po nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: The meaning of the verse is that the universal is many, not one, like space.üîΩThe word ‚Äúalso‚Äù is supplied.üîΩThe universal is many, not one, like space.

analyzed: sems dang ldan pa rnams phan tshun tha dad pa la 'dod pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba rjes su sbyar te /

analyzed: sems kyi mtshan nyid can gyi skyes bu mang po nyid khas len pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The meaning of the verse is that the universal is many, not one, like space.üîΩThe word ‚Äúalso‚Äù is supplied.üîΩThe universal is many, not one, like space.üîΩThe meaning of the verse is that the universal is many, not one, like space.

analyzed: gzugs dang sgra dang ro dang reg bya la sogs pa la yang 'phel ba dang 'grib pa la sogs pa'i khyad par khas len pa'i phyir ro //
