original: de bas na grangs can gyi yang dngos po rnams khyad par can yin no //
analyzed: de bas na grangs can gyi yang dngos po rnams khyad par can yin no //
translated: Therefore, the SƒÅ·πÉkhya‚Äôs own entities are qualified.

original: de dag spyi'i bdag nyid du gyur pa mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir /üîΩphan tshun khyad par can rnams dngos //
analyzed: de dag spyi'i bdag nyid du gyur pa mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir / phan tshun khyad par can rnams dngos //
translated: In order to demonstrate that it is untenable that they are the nature of universals,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: he says, ‚ÄúThe entities that are mutually exclusive . . .‚Äù and so on.

original: de 'dod na ni zhes bya ba ni spyi'i zhes bya ba'i dngos po'o //
analyzed: de 'dod na ni zhes bya ba ni spyi'i zhes bya ba'i dngos po'o //
translated: ‚Äú If that is accepted‚Äù means ‚Äúif the nature of universals is accepted.‚Äù

original: gzhan gyis kyang gzhan dag dang mtshungs pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni don gzhan dang 'brel pa yin na yang de dag phan tshun mtshan nyid dang 'bral ba'i phyir ro zhes dgongs so //
analyzed: gzhan gyis kyang gzhan dag dang mtshungs pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni don gzhan dang 'brel pa yin na yang de dag phan tshun mtshan nyid dang 'bral ba'i phyir ro zhes dgongs so //
translated: ‚Äú It is not the case that other things are similar to other things‚Äù means that even if they are related to other objects, they are mutually devoid of characteristics.

original: bstan zin to zhes bya ba ni le'u dang por ro //
analyzed: bstan zin to zhes bya ba ni le'u dang por ro //
translated: ‚Äú It has already been demonstrated‚Äù in the first chapter.

original: de las tha dad pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni mthe bo las so //
analyzed: de las tha dad pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni mthe bo las so //
translated: ‚Äú It is different from that‚Äù means it is different from the thumb.

original: de yang rnam par gcod pa'i ngo bo ma yin no zhes bya ba ni gang zhig sgra'i brjod bya nyid du sgro btags pa'o //
analyzed: de yang rnam par gcod pa'i ngo bo ma yin no zhes bya ba ni gang zhig sgra'i brjod bya nyid du sgro btags pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú It is not the nature of exclusion‚Äù means that it is imputed to be the object of expression of a word.

original: de lta ma yin na dngos po med pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes pa ni /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na dngos po med pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes pa ni /
translated: If it were not so, it would be a non-entity.

original: rtag pa ni rim dang cig car dag gis don byed pa 'gal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rtag pa ni rim dang cig car dag gis don byed pa 'gal ba'i phyir /
translated: Permanence is incompatible with the performance of a function either gradually or instantaneously.

original: dngos po med pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po med pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, it would be a non-entity.

original: ltos pa zhes bya ba'i 'bras bur brjod ces bya ba'i skabs su zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ltos pa zhes bya ba'i 'bras bur brjod ces bya ba'i skabs su zhes bya ba ni /
translated: In the section beginning with ‚ÄúThe effect is said to be dependent,‚Äù

original: 'di'i 'di zhes bya ba'i 'brel pa ni gzhan cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di'i 'di zhes bya ba'i 'brel pa ni gzhan cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: the word ‚Äúthis‚Äù has no other connection.

original: 'o na ci yin zhe na ltos par brjod pa'o //
analyzed: 'o na ci yin zhe na ltos par brjod pa'o //
translated: What is it? It is said to be dependent.

original: ltos pa yang 'bras bu yin no //
analyzed: ltos pa yang 'bras bu yin no //
translated: And dependence is an effect.

original: rtag pa nyid kyi phyir rigs gsal ba'i 'bras bu ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pas sngar bshad zin to //
analyzed: rtag pa nyid kyi phyir rigs gsal ba'i 'bras bu ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pas sngar bshad zin to //
translated: It is not the effect of the manifestation of a universal because of permanence, etc.

original: dper na sgra'i don gtso bo'am zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dper na sgra'i don gtso bo'am zhes bya ba ni /
translated: For example, the word ‚Äúprimary‚Äù in the phrase ‚Äúthe primary meaning of a word‚Äù

original: de grangs can gyis rnam par gzhag pa'i brda dran pa la ltos pa'i shes pa'i ngo bo yin gyi /
analyzed: de grangs can gyis rnam par gzhag pa'i brda dran pa la ltos pa'i shes pa'i ngo bo yin gyi /
translated: is the nature of a cognition that depends on the memory of a convention established by a SƒÅ·πÉkhya.

original: de dngos po ni ma yin te ji ltar dpyad na de med pa nyid yin par bstan zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dngos po ni ma yin te ji ltar dpyad na de med pa nyid yin par bstan zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not a thing, because it has been shown that it does not exist when analyzed.

original: dper na sgra'i don dngos po thams cad skad cig ma re rer mi gnas par @163b 'jig pa'i ngang tshul can yin no zhes bya ba 'di yang dngos po thams cad gtan nas 'jig pa'i yul can nyid yin pa'i phyir de yang med pas na dngos po medüîΩpa yin no //
analyzed: dper na sgra'i don dngos po thams cad skad cig ma re rer mi gnas par @163b 'jig pa'i ngang tshul can yin no zhes bya ba 'di yang dngos po thams cad gtan nas 'jig pa'i yul can nyid yin pa'i phyir de yang med pas na dngos po med pa yin no //
translated: For example, the meaning of the word ‚Äúimpermanent‚Äù is that all things are momentary, in the sense that they do not remain for a second moment. Since this is the object of the cognition that all things are utterly destroyed, it is also nonexistent, and so it is a nonthing.

original: sgra'i don 'phrod pa 'du ba la sogs pa yang bye brag pa la sogs pas kun du brtags pa'i brda dran pa la ltos pa'i shes pa'i ngo bo yin gyi yang dag pa'i dngos po ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sgra'i don 'phrod pa 'du ba la sogs pa yang bye brag pa la sogs pas kun du brtags pa'i brda dran pa la ltos pa'i shes pa'i ngo bo yin gyi yang dag pa'i dngos po ni ma yin no //
translated: The meaning of the word ‚Äúmeeting‚Äù is also the nature of a cognition that depends on the memory of a sign imagined by the Vai≈õe·π£ikas and so on, but it is not a real thing.

original: ba lang gi tha snyad ma bzung ba'i zhes bya ba ni yul lam dus gcig la brda la ma byang ba'i'o //
analyzed: ba lang gi tha snyad ma bzung ba'i zhes bya ba ni yul lam dus gcig la brda la ma byang ba'i'o //
translated: ‚ÄúNot apprehending the convention of a cow‚Äù means not being familiar with the sign in one place or time.

original: kho bos don gang yin pa de 'di sngar mthong ngo zhes mi 'gyur la zhes bya ba ni ba lang gi rnam pa rta la sogs pa la med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kho bos don gang yin pa de 'di sngar mthong ngo zhes mi 'gyur la zhes bya ba ni ba lang gi rnam pa rta la sogs pa la med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not the case that one says, I saw this thing before, because the form of the cow, for example, does not exist in the horse.

original: brda la ltos pa med par rjes su 'jug pa'i spyi'i shes pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni don dang 'dra ba tsam la dmigs pa'i ngang tshul can sgra'i rnam pas bris pa dang bral bas zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: brda la ltos pa med par rjes su 'jug pa'i spyi'i shes pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni don dang 'dra ba tsam la dmigs pa'i ngang tshul can sgra'i rnam pas bris pa dang bral bas zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The cognition of the universal occurs without regard to convention, because it is of the nature of observing mere similarity to the object, and is free from the influence of words.

original: gtan tshigs ma grub pa yin no zhes bya ba ni //
analyzed: gtan tshigs ma grub pa yin no zhes bya ba ni //
translated: The reason is not established.

original: brda la byang ba la sogs ba lang la sogs pa spyi'i yul ba lang la sogs pa'i sgra'i don du 'gyur ba'i brda la ltos pa med par shes pa can nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: brda la byang ba la sogs ba lang la sogs pa spyi'i yul ba lang la sogs pa'i sgra'i don du 'gyur ba'i brda la ltos pa med par shes pa can nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the one who is skilled in convention, etc., has the cognition without regard to the convention that the universal cow, etc., is the referent of the word cow, etc.

original: 'dis ni phyogs kyi phyogs gcig la ma grub pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni phyogs kyi phyogs gcig la ma grub pa bstan to //
translated: This shows that the reason is not established with regard to one part of the subject.

original: 'bras bu mtshungs pa can zhes bya ba'i blo gcig pa'i rgyu can yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu mtshungs pa can zhes bya ba'i blo gcig pa'i rgyu can yin no //
translated: The cognition of the universal is not produced from the convention, because it is similar to the effect, i.e., it is the cause of a single cognition.

original: dngos gnyis zhes bya ba ni khra bo dang khu yu la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can no //
analyzed: dngos gnyis zhes bya ba ni khra bo dang khu yu la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can no //
translated: The two entities are the characteristics of variegated and spotted.

original: don nye ba dang 'brel can yin zhes bya ba'i don ni ngo bo nyid kyi 'bras bu gcig byed pa nyid du nye ba yin no //
analyzed: don nye ba dang 'brel can yin zhes bya ba'i don ni ngo bo nyid kyi 'bras bu gcig byed pa nyid du nye ba yin no //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúrelated to the object‚Äù is that the essential effect is related to the single activity.

original: 'dis ni 'di skad du brda la byang ba dag ni ba lang la sogs pa'i sgra'i don gang brjod pa dang 'dres pa nyid du rtogs par 'gyur ba de la 'das ma thag pa'i gtan tshigs kyi phyogs su byas pa yin gyi /
analyzed: 'dis ni 'di skad du brda la byang ba dag ni ba lang la sogs pa'i sgra'i don gang brjod pa dang 'dres pa nyid du rtogs par 'gyur ba de la 'das ma thag pa'i gtan tshigs kyi phyogs su byas pa yin gyi /
translated: This is what is being said: those who are skilled in language understand the meaning of the word ‚Äúcow‚Äù and so on to be mixed with the object. That is the basis of the just-mentioned argument.

original: thams cad la ma yin pa de bas na phyogs kyi phyogs gcig la gtan tshigs ma grub pa ma yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thams cad la ma yin pa de bas na phyogs kyi phyogs gcig la gtan tshigs ma grub pa ma yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: It is not the case for all [words]. Therefore, the reason is not unestablished with respect to part of the subject.

original: brda la ltos pa'i spyi'i rnam pa can gyi shes pa gang yin pa de dag kyang gsal ba'i rgyu can nyid yin gyi spyi dngos por gyur pa'i rgyu can ni ma yin no //
analyzed: brda la ltos pa'i spyi'i rnam pa can gyi shes pa gang yin pa de dag kyang gsal ba'i rgyu can nyid yin gyi spyi dngos por gyur pa'i rgyu can ni ma yin no //
translated: Those cognitions that have a general aspect that depends on language are caused by the manifestation, but they are not caused by an entity that is an actual universal.

original: de 'dra ba'i zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gcig tu 'dzin pa'i rgyur gyur pa nyid du 'dra ba'i'o //
analyzed: de 'dra ba'i zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gcig tu 'dzin pa'i rgyur gyur pa nyid du 'dra ba'i'o //
translated: ‚ÄúSuch‚Äù means that they are similar in being the cause for apprehending a single aspect.

original: rang gi yul can zhes bya ba ni nyams su myong ba'i rnam pa can mig la sogs pa'i blo'o //
analyzed: rang gi yul can zhes bya ba ni nyams su myong ba'i rnam pa can mig la sogs pa'i blo'o //
translated: ‚ÄúHaving their own object‚Äù refers to the cognition of the eye, etc., which has the aspect of experience.

original: ci'i phyir de 'dra ba'i blo skyed par byed ce na /üîΩ'bras bu gcig @164a * //
analyzed: ci'i phyir de 'dra ba'i blo skyed par byed ce na / 'bras bu gcig @164a * //
translated: Why does it generate such a cognition?

original: byed pa'i nus pa so sor nges pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: byed pa'i nus pa so sor nges pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Because the power to produce a single effect is restricted to each.

original: rgyu rnams kyi nus pa 'dra ba de la so sor nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu rnams kyi nus pa 'dra ba de la so sor nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The power of causes is restricted to that similarity.

original: gang gis ngo bo nyid kyis rnam pa gcig ces bya ba la sogs pa la gang gis zhes bya ba ni nyams su myong ba'i blos so //
analyzed: gang gis ngo bo nyid kyis rnam pa gcig ces bya ba la sogs pa la gang gis zhes bya ba ni nyams su myong ba'i blos so //
translated: ‚ÄúBy which it is naturally one aspect‚Äù and so on. ‚ÄúBy which‚Äù means by the cognition of experience.

original: rgyu gcig gi nus pa so sor nges pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni de nyams su myong ba'i blo rnams kyang rnam pa gcig rtogs pa skyed pa la gtan tshigs nyid du sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: rgyu gcig gi nus pa so sor nges pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni de nyams su myong ba'i blo rnams kyang rnam pa gcig rtogs pa skyed pa la gtan tshigs nyid du sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause the power of a single cause is restricted‚Äù means that the cognitions of that experience are also applied as the reason for the production of the understanding of a single aspect.

original: de ni 'bras bu gcig pa can nyid nye bar yin no zhes bya ba ni nyams su myong ba'i blo ni rnam pa gcig rtogs pa'i 'bras bu can nyid yin te /
analyzed: de ni 'bras bu gcig pa can nyid nye bar yin no zhes bya ba ni nyams su myong ba'i blo ni rnam pa gcig rtogs pa'i 'bras bu can nyid yin te /
translated: It is the cause of the cognition of a single effect, because the cognition of experience has a single effect, i.e., the cognition of a single effect.

original: nyams su myong ba gzhan dang 'dra ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: nyams su myong ba gzhan dang 'dra ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is like another experience.

original: 'di nyid ni zhes bya ba'i ji skad du bshad pa'i nyams su myong ba'i blo'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid ni zhes bya ba'i ji skad du bshad pa'i nyams su myong ba'i blo'o //
translated: This very thing, i.e., the cognition of experience as it has been explained.

original: gang gis rnam par phye ba yis //üîΩrigs ni zhes bya ba ni gsal ba nang mi 'dra ba dag las /
analyzed: gang gis rnam par phye ba yis // rigs ni zhes bya ba ni gsal ba nang mi 'dra ba dag las /
translated: By which it is distinguished,üîΩthe universal, i.e., the particular of the manifestation.

original: tha dad pas rigs ni gsal ba 'dra ba'i rjes su 'gro bar byed do //
analyzed: tha dad pas rigs ni gsal ba 'dra ba'i rjes su 'gro bar byed do //
translated: The universal is the cause of the manifestation of the similarity of the manifestation, because it is distinguished by the difference of the particular of the manifestation.

original: gsal ba la yod pa'i nye ba gang yin pa'i nye ba de gcig gi rjes su 'jug pa'i blo'i rten yin no zhes bya ba 'di dang sbyar pa'o //
analyzed: gsal ba la yod pa'i nye ba gang yin pa'i nye ba de gcig gi rjes su 'jug pa'i blo'i rten yin no zhes bya ba 'di dang sbyar pa'o //
translated: The universal is the basis of the cognition that follows a single universal, because it is the cause of the cognition of a single effect.

original: ji ltar ba lang dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas de nyid 'chad par byed do //
analyzed: ji ltar ba lang dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas de nyid 'chad par byed do //
translated: He explains that very thing with ‚Äúlike a cow,‚Äù etc.

original: rta la sogs pa ni rta'i khyad par ro //
analyzed: rta la sogs pa ni rta'i khyad par ro //
translated: A horse, etc. is a particular of a horse.

original: 'o na 'bras bu gcig par nus pa nyid tha dad par rjes su 'gro ba ni bla ste /
analyzed: 'o na 'bras bu gcig par nus pa nyid tha dad par rjes su 'gro ba ni bla ste /
translated: Well then, it is certainly possible that a single effect is related to different potencies.

original: de lta yang spyi dngos por gyur pa nyid grub pa nyid yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de lta yang spyi dngos por gyur pa nyid grub pa nyid yin no zhe na /
translated: But even so, the universal itself becomes a real entity.

original: de'i phyir 'bras bu gcig byed par nus pa yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'bras bu gcig byed par nus pa yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Therefore, he says, ‚ÄúIf it is capable of producing a single effect,‚Äù and so on.

original: de'i rjes su 'gro na ni zhes bya ba ni nus pa'i rjes su 'gro na ni'o //
analyzed: de'i rjes su 'gro na ni zhes bya ba ni nus pa'i rjes su 'gro na ni'o //
translated: If it is related to that, that is, if it is related to the potency,

original: nus pa gzhan gyi rjes su 'gro ba'i rgyu mtshan nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni gang la nus pa gzhan gyi rjes su 'gro ba rgyu mtshan yod pa zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar ro //üîΩde ltar na ci'i phyir 'bras bu gcig byed par nus pas /
analyzed: nus pa gzhan gyi rjes su 'gro ba'i rgyu mtshan nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni gang la nus pa gzhan gyi rjes su 'gro ba rgyu mtshan yod pa zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar ro // de ltar na ci'i phyir 'bras bu gcig byed par nus pas /
translated: then the reason is that it is related to another potency. The phrase ‚Äúthat which has the reason of being related to another potency‚Äù is to be connected to the phrase ‚Äúit is related to another potency.‚Äù

original: gsal ba thams cad rjes su 'gro ba ma yin la /
analyzed: gsal ba thams cad rjes su 'gro ba ma yin la /
translated: In that case, why is it that all instances of the manifest are not related to the potency that produces a single effect?

original: 'on kyang 'ga' zhig kho na yin /
analyzed: 'on kyang 'ga' zhig kho na yin /
translated: Why is it that some instances are related to it and others are not?

original: de ltar na 'dir nus pa'i khyad par gzhan gyi rjes su 'gro ba yin pas /
analyzed: de ltar na 'dir nus pa'i khyad par gzhan gyi rjes su 'gro ba yin pas /
translated: In that case, here the reason is that it is related to another specific potency.

original: rjes su 'gro ba'i rgyu mtshan nus pa snga ma yang brtag par bya ba yin la /
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba'i rgyu mtshan nus pa snga ma yang brtag par bya ba yin la /
translated: The reason for the subsequent cause is the prior potentiality, which must be examined.

original: de la yang gzhan yin pa de ltar na thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la yang gzhan yin pa de ltar na thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: And if that is another, then there is an infinite regress.

original: 'gyur bar ni 'dod mod kyi spyi ni gzung ba kho na na yin te /
analyzed: 'gyur bar ni 'dod mod kyi spyi ni gzung ba kho na na yin te /
translated: We do indeed accept that, but the universal is apprehended only when the particular is apprehended.

original: de bzung du zin kyang nges pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de bzung du zin kyang nges pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: Even though it is apprehended, it is not ascertained.

original: de'i phyir bzung du zin kyang zhes bya ba @164b la sogs pa smos pa la /
analyzed: de'i phyir bzung du zin kyang zhes bya ba @164b la sogs pa smos pa la /
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚ÄúEven though it is apprehended, etc.‚Äù

original: des byas pa ma yin zhes bya ba ni gsal ba la shes pa dang brjod pa 'jug pa spyis byas pa ma yin te /
analyzed: des byas pa ma yin zhes bya ba ni gsal ba la shes pa dang brjod pa 'jug pa spyis byas pa ma yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúIt is not produced by that‚Äù means that the application of cognition and expression to the particular is not produced by the universal.

original: bdag nyid nges pa ma yin pa de ltar na 'dir shes pa dang brjod pa'i rgyu mtshan du mi 'gyur ro //üîΩji ltar dbang po'i ngo bo rang nyid mthong ba po yod na zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bdag nyid nges pa ma yin pa de ltar na 'dir shes pa dang brjod pa'i rgyu mtshan du mi 'gyur ro // ji ltar dbang po'i ngo bo rang nyid mthong ba po yod na zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If it is not ascertained by itself, then it will not be the reason for the application of cognition and expression.

original: dbang po las 'das pa'i don mthong ba bskal ba yod na'o //
analyzed: dbang po las 'das pa'i don mthong ba bskal ba yod na'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIf there is an existent seer, etc.‚Äù means that if there is an existent object beyond the senses, it is seen.

original: ji skad bshad pa las bzlog gang //
analyzed: ji skad bshad pa las bzlog gang //
translated: ‚ÄúThe opposite of what has been explained‚Äù means the opposite of what has been explained above.

original: zhes bya ba ni spyi mtshan nyid la rnam pa ji tsam bstan pa de las bzlog pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni spyi mtshan nyid la rnam pa ji tsam bstan pa de las bzlog pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning of ‚Äúthe opposite of whatever is taught as the universal characteristic.‚Äù

original: de nyid ni brjod par bya ba ma yin pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed do //üîΩdngos po med pa la dmigs pa'i blo'i nye bar len pa la /
analyzed: de nyid ni brjod par bya ba ma yin pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed do // dngos po med pa la dmigs pa'i blo'i nye bar len pa la /
translated: He explains just that with ‚Äúthat which is inexpressible,‚Äù and so on.üîΩThe apprehension of a non-entity is the apprehension of a non-entity.

original: dngos po med pa'i nye bar len pa can zhes brjod kyi /
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i nye bar len pa can zhes brjod kyi /
translated: The mind that takes a non-entity as its object is called ‚Äúhaving the apprehension of a non-entity.‚Äù

original: dngos po med pa yang 'ga' zhig gi nye bar len pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po med pa yang 'ga' zhig gi nye bar len pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But a non-entity is not the object of anyone.

original: snang ba'i don mi dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni dgag par bya ba 'dod pa ni yul de la gcig tu med par 'dod pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: snang ba'i don mi dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni dgag par bya ba 'dod pa ni yul de la gcig tu med par 'dod pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúThe non-observation of the object of appearance‚Äù means that the object of negation is asserted to be utterly non-existent in that place.

original: skye ba dang ldan pa med pa nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni gcig tu dngos po med pa'i chos nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye ba dang ldan pa med pa nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni gcig tu dngos po med pa'i chos nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúThe non-existence of arising,‚Äù and so on, means that it is the mere non-existence of a phenomenon.

original: mi dmigs pa tsam zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur ba zhes bya ba 'dis khyad par du ma byas pa yin te /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa tsam zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur ba zhes bya ba 'dis khyad par du ma byas pa yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúMere non-observation‚Äù is not qualified by ‚Äúhaving the character of the observed object.‚Äù

original: de lta bur gyur pa ni yod na yang rang bzhin la sogs pas bskal pa yod pa srid pa de ltar na gnyi ga'i chos yin no zhes bya ba nyid la sogs pa la yang yod pa dang med pa srid pa de ltar na gnyi ga'i chos yin
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa ni yod na yang rang bzhin la sogs pas bskal pa yod pa srid pa de ltar na gnyi ga'i chos yin no zhes bya ba nyid la sogs pa la yang yod pa dang med pa srid pa de ltar na gnyi ga'i chos yin
translated: If it were, then it would be possible that it would be a property of both, like existence, etc., which are possible in both intrinsic nature, etc., and in existence, etc.

original: no // brjod bya yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs de dag gis gzhan gyi gtan tshigs 'gal ba mi 'khrul pa can du brjod do zhes 'ga' zhig dogs par 'gyur ba de bstsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: no // brjod bya yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs de dag gis gzhan gyi gtan tshigs 'gal ba mi 'khrul pa can du brjod do zhes 'ga' zhig dogs par 'gyur ba de bstsal ba'i phyir /
translated: ‚ÄúBecause it is the expressed object‚Äù means that some may suspect that those reasons express a contradictory, non-erroneous reason for the opponent, so in order to eliminate that,

original: des kyang 'gal ba mi 'khrul pa can nyid ma bstan to zhes smos so //
analyzed: des kyang 'gal ba mi 'khrul pa can nyid ma bstan to zhes smos so //
translated: it says, ‚ÄúIt does not teach a contradictory, non-erroneous reason.‚Äù

original: brjod bya nyid la sogs pa dngos po'i stobs kyis 'ongs pa de'i phyir gzhan gyi gtan tshigs ni ma yin no //
analyzed: brjod bya nyid la sogs pa dngos po'i stobs kyis 'ongs pa de'i phyir gzhan gyi gtan tshigs ni ma yin no //
translated: Because the expressed object, etc., come about by the power of the thing, it is not the opponent‚Äôs reason.

original: de ltar na gal te brgyud pas dngos po'i rten can spyi'i shes pa dngos po'i rjes su byed pa de ltar na yang de tsam gyi dngos su dngos po'i yul can du grub pa nyid ma yin zhing /
analyzed: de ltar na gal te brgyud pas dngos po'i rten can spyi'i shes pa dngos po'i rjes su byed pa de ltar na yang de tsam gyi dngos su dngos po'i yul can du grub pa nyid ma yin zhing /
translated: Thus, even if the general cognition that is indirectly based on things conforms to things, it is not established as an object that is directly the object of things.

original: dngos su gtan tshigs kyi don yod pa dang med pa'i rjes su byed par brjod par mi nus te /
analyzed: dngos su gtan tshigs kyi don yod pa dang med pa'i rjes su byed par brjod par mi nus te /
translated: It cannot be said that the meaning of the reason conforms to the existence and nonexistence of things in a direct way.

original: de lta bur gyur pa ni phyir rgol ba la ma grub pa nyid kyi phyir ro //üîΩdon @165a * //
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa ni phyir rgol ba la ma grub pa nyid kyi phyir ro // don @165a * //
translated: This is because such a reason is not established for the opponent.

original: byed par mi nus pa dang 'dra ba'i bdag nyid dang sgra'i yul dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas sngar dpyad pa 'jug pa nyid kyi phyir spyi la yang dpyad pa 'jug pa nyid ma yin nam /
analyzed: byed par mi nus pa dang 'dra ba'i bdag nyid dang sgra'i yul dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas sngar dpyad pa 'jug pa nyid kyi phyir spyi la yang dpyad pa 'jug pa nyid ma yin nam /
translated: If it is replied, ‚ÄúThe analysis that was applied to the object of the word ‚Äònon-pot‚Äô is also applied to the universal,‚Äù then what would be the point of this?

original: de yang rang gi mtshan nyid gcig pu dpyad par bya ba yin no zhes brjod na phan tshun 'gal bar 'gyur ro zhes bsams pa'o //
analyzed: de yang rang gi mtshan nyid gcig pu dpyad par bya ba yin no zhes brjod na phan tshun 'gal bar 'gyur ro zhes bsams pa'o //
translated: It is thought that if it is said that the analysis is only of the individual characteristic, then there would be a contradiction.

original: de ltar na 'ga' zhig ces bya ba ni spyi dngos por smra bas spyi dngos po nyid du khas len pa na don gyis rang gi mtshan nyid yin par khas len pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na 'ga' zhig ces bya ba ni spyi dngos por smra bas spyi dngos po nyid du khas len pa na don gyis rang gi mtshan nyid yin par khas len pa yin no //
translated: Thus, ‚Äúsome‚Äù refers to the proponents of real universals, who accept universals as real entities.

original: de ltar dngos po nyid yin na /
analyzed: de ltar dngos po nyid yin na /
translated: If they are real entities,

original: de la lar gdon mi za bar rung ba nyid 'dod par bya ba yin pa de ltar na ngo bo nges de'i rang bzhin las ldog pa yin te /
analyzed: de la lar gdon mi za bar rung ba nyid 'dod par bya ba yin pa de ltar na ngo bo nges de'i rang bzhin las ldog pa yin te /
translated: then they must be accepted as being suitable somewhere. In that case, they are not natures, because they are excluded from the nature of being a nature.

original: ngo bo de tsam yang rang gi mtshan nyid yin no //üîΩde bas na de la ci dngos po nyid yod pa yin nam /
analyzed: ngo bo de tsam yang rang gi mtshan nyid yin no // de bas na de la ci dngos po nyid yod pa yin nam /
translated: That much of an essence is a unique characteristic.

original: 'on te ma yin zhes dpyod pa gang yin pa de ni rang gi mtshan nyid kyi sgo nas yin no //
analyzed: 'on te ma yin zhes dpyod pa gang yin pa de ni rang gi mtshan nyid kyi sgo nas yin no //
translated: Therefore, the analysis of whether or not they are real entities is in terms of unique characteristics.

original: de nyid ni des na ci de 'ga' zhig la rung ba'am zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de nyid ni des na ci de 'ga' zhig la rung ba'am zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: That is why he says, ‚ÄúAre they suitable for anything?‚Äù and so on.

original: de lta ma yin na med pa nyid du nges pa la zhes bya ba ni rtogs pa pos med pa'i sgo nas spyi nges pa la dpyod pa cir yang mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na med pa nyid du nges pa la zhes bya ba ni rtogs pa pos med pa'i sgo nas spyi nges pa la dpyod pa cir yang mi rung ngo //
translated: If it were not so, then it would be impossible to analyze the ascertainment of a universal by a cognizer in terms of non-existence, as in ‚Äúascertainment of non-existence.‚Äù

original: yul rnam pa gnyis gsungs zhes bya ba ni slob dpon phyogs kyi glang pos 'di ltar mtshan nyid gnyis ni gzhal bya yin no zhes bya ba de'i bshad pa mdzad pa na rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid dag las gzhan pa'i gzhal bya yod pa ma yin no zhes
analyzed: yul rnam pa gnyis gsungs zhes bya ba ni slob dpon phyogs kyi glang pos 'di ltar mtshan nyid gnyis ni gzhal bya yin no zhes bya ba de'i bshad pa mdzad pa na rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid dag las gzhan pa'i gzhal bya yod pa ma yin no zhes
translated: As for the statement that there are two kinds of objects, when the master Dignaga explained that ‚Äúthe two kinds of natures are objects of comprehension,‚Äù he said that there are no objects of comprehension other than the natures of the particular and the universal.

original: gsungs so // de skad du slob dpon gyis gsungs pas rang gi mtshan nyid las gzhan pa'i spyi'i mtshan nyid kyang gzhal bya nyid du 'dod do zhe na /
analyzed: gsungs so // de skad du slob dpon gyis gsungs pas rang gi mtshan nyid las gzhan pa'i spyi'i mtshan nyid kyang gzhal bya nyid du 'dod do zhe na /
translated: Since the master said that, one might think that he accepts that the universal nature, which is different from the particular nature, is an object of comprehension.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid las zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed de /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid las zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed de /
translated: In response to that, he says ‚Äúfrom the particular nature,‚Äù and so on.

original: rang mtshan nyid las gzhan pa'i spyi'i zhes bya ba gzhal bya rang rgyud du yod do zhes bya ba'i dgongs pa 'dis slob dpon gzhal bya gnyis nyid bzhed pa ma yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: rang mtshan nyid las gzhan pa'i spyi'i zhes bya ba gzhal bya rang rgyud du yod do zhes bya ba'i dgongs pa 'dis slob dpon gzhal bya gnyis nyid bzhed pa ma yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The intended meaning of this is that the master does not assert two objects of comprehension, but rather that the object of comprehension is the specific characteristic.

original: 'dir bsdus pa'i don ni spyi yang de yin la mtshan nyid kyang yin pa de bas na spyi'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: 'dir bsdus pa'i don ni spyi yang de yin la mtshan nyid kyang yin pa de bas na spyi'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: The meaning of the compound in ‚Äúspecific characteristic‚Äù is that it is a universal and it is a characteristic, thus it is a specific characteristic.

original: de gzhal bya yin no zhes bya ba slob dpon gyi dgongs pa ni ma yin gyi 'on kyang mngon sum gyi rtogs pa'i dus na rang gi ngo bo dang mtshan nyid dang mtshan ma don byed nus pa gang yin pa de ni rang gi mtshan nyid yin no
analyzed: de gzhal bya yin no zhes bya ba slob dpon gyi dgongs pa ni ma yin gyi 'on kyang mngon sum gyi rtogs pa'i dus na rang gi ngo bo dang mtshan nyid dang mtshan ma don byed nus pa gang yin pa de ni rang gi mtshan nyid yin no
translated: The master‚Äôs intention is not that this is the object of comprehension, but rather that at the time of direct realization, the entity, the characteristic, and the sign that is able to perform a function is the specific characteristic.

original: // de bzhin du rjes su dpag pa'i @165b rtogs pa'i dus na de'i ngo bor zhen pa can gyis lkog tu gyur pa'i dngos po'i mtshan nyid dang mtshan ma'i don byed par nus pa gang yin pa de ni spyi'i mtshan nyid yin no zhes don gzhan gyi sgo nas
analyzed: // de bzhin du rjes su dpag pa'i @165b rtogs pa'i dus na de'i ngo bor zhen pa can gyis lkog tu gyur pa'i dngos po'i mtshan nyid dang mtshan ma'i don byed par nus pa gang yin pa de ni spyi'i mtshan nyid yin no zhes don gzhan gyi sgo nas
translated: Likewise, when one comprehends through inference, the one who is attached to the nature of that [object] conceives of the characteristic of a hidden thing and the meaning of the characteristic as being able to perform a function. That is the universal characteristic. In this way, through another meaning,

original: gzhal bya rnam pa gnyis rnam par bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhal bya rnam pa gnyis rnam par bshad pa yin no //
translated: the two types of objects of comprehension are explained.

original: de bas na mngon sum dang lkog tu gyur pa dag las gzhal bya gzhan yod pa ma yin no zhes ji srid du bshad pa de srid du rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid can las gzhan ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na mngon sum dang lkog tu gyur pa dag las gzhal bya gzhan yod pa ma yin no zhes ji srid du bshad pa de srid du rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid can las gzhan ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, as long as it is explained that there are no other objects of comprehension besides direct perception and inference, they are not different from the particular and universal characteristics.

original: de nyid ni rang gi mtshan nyid kyi rang gi ngo bo mngon sum gyi shes pas zhes bya ba la sogs pas gsal bar byed pa yin te /
analyzed: de nyid ni rang gi mtshan nyid kyi rang gi ngo bo mngon sum gyi shes pas zhes bya ba la sogs pas gsal bar byed pa yin te /
translated: This is clarified by [DignƒÅga's] statement The nature of the particular is the object of direct perception... and so on.

original: mngon sum gyi shes pas rang gi ngo bo rtogs pa'i phyir rang gi ngo bo dang mtshan nyid ces bya ba'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: mngon sum gyi shes pas rang gi ngo bo rtogs pa'i phyir rang gi ngo bo dang mtshan nyid ces bya ba'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: Because the nature of a thing is realized by direct perception,üîΩthe nature and characteristics of a thing are considered.

original: mngon sum zhes bya ba'i dngos po gcig rang gi mtshan nyid du bshad do //
analyzed: mngon sum zhes bya ba'i dngos po gcig rang gi mtshan nyid du bshad do //
translated: Because the nature of a thing is realized by direct perception, the one thing called ‚Äúdirect perception‚Äù is explained as the nature and the characteristic of a thing.

original: de nyid las zhes bya ba ni dngos po nyid la'o //
analyzed: de nyid las zhes bya ba ni dngos po nyid la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúFrom that very thing‚Äù means from the thing itself.

original: spyi bshad do zhes bya ba la spyi'i mtshan nyid bshad do zhes khong nas dbyung ngo ;
analyzed: spyi bshad do zhes bya ba la spyi'i mtshan nyid bshad do zhes khong nas dbyung ngo ;
translated: ‚ÄúThe general characteristic is explained‚Äù means that the general characteristic is stated.

original: / mtshan nyid brjod pa'i rgyu ni de'i ngo bor zhen pas zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: / mtshan nyid brjod pa'i rgyu ni de'i ngo bor zhen pas zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The reason for stating the characteristic is ‚Äúbecause of the adherence to its nature.‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir spyi snang bar sgro btags pa de'i phyir nye bas de'i mtshan nyid du brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir spyi snang bar sgro btags pa de'i phyir nye bas de'i mtshan nyid du brjod pa yin no //
translated: Because the appearance of the universal is superimposed, therefore, the characteristic is stated in terms of that.

original: don byed pa bsgrub par bya ba de nyid la zhes bya ba ni spyi bsgrub par bya ba la'o //
analyzed: don byed pa bsgrub par bya ba de nyid la zhes bya ba ni spyi bsgrub par bya ba la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn regard to the very establishment of the performance of function‚Äù means in regard to the establishment of the universal.

original: 'di ni khas blangs nas smra ba yin gyi bsgrub par bya ba cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni khas blangs nas smra ba yin gyi bsgrub par bya ba cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: This is a statement of acceptance, but there is not the slightest thing to be established.

original: de'i yul gyi don rtogs pas zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa'i yul gyi don spyi'i mtshan nyid rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i yul gyi don rtogs pas zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa'i yul gyi don spyi'i mtshan nyid rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause of the understanding of the object of that‚Äù means because of the understanding of the universal characteristic, the object of inference.

original: dus phyis zhes bya ba ni spyi rtogs pa las dus phyis me'i rang gi mtshan nyid la 'jug par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dus phyis zhes bya ba ni spyi rtogs pa las dus phyis me'i rang gi mtshan nyid la 'jug par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúLater‚Äù means that after the understanding of the universal, one does not engage in the particular characteristic of fire.

original: 'jug par mi 'gyur te zhes pa ni /
analyzed: 'jug par mi 'gyur te zhes pa ni /
translated: ‚ÄúOne does not engage‚Äù means

original: sngar spyi la 'jug par khas blangs nas phyi rol gyi me la sogs pa la 'jug pa bkag pa yin la da ltar ni spyi la yang 'jug pa bkag pa yin no //
analyzed: sngar spyi la 'jug par khas blangs nas phyi rol gyi me la sogs pa la 'jug pa bkag pa yin la da ltar ni spyi la yang 'jug pa bkag pa yin no //
translated: that having previously accepted engagement in the universal, the engagement in external fire, etc., is refuted. Now, the engagement in the universal is refuted.

original: dus phyis me la 'jug par mi 'gyur ba'am zhes bshad pa gang yin pa de la dpe ni bum pa yongs su bcad nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: dus phyis me la 'jug par mi 'gyur ba'am zhes bshad pa gang yin pa de la dpe ni bum pa yongs su bcad nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúOne does not engage in fire later‚Äù is the example, ‚Äúhaving delimited a pot,‚Äù etc.

original: ji ltar bum pa yongs su bcad nas bum pa yongs su bcad bar zhen pa dang ldan pa bsgrub par bya ba'i don snam bu la 'jug par mi 'gyur ba de dang 'dra bar spyi yongs su bcad nas /
analyzed: ji ltar bum pa yongs su bcad nas bum pa yongs su bcad bar zhen pa dang ldan pa bsgrub par bya ba'i don snam bu la 'jug par mi 'gyur ba de dang 'dra bar spyi yongs su bcad nas /
translated: Just as, having ascertained a pot, one who is attached to the ascertainment of a pot does not engage in the object to be established, a cloth, in the same way, having ascertained a universal, one who is attached to the ascertainment of a universal does not engage in the object to be established, an individual.

original: bsgrub par bya ba'i don rang gi mtshan nyid la 'jug par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni 'debs @166a * //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba'i don rang gi mtshan nyid la 'jug par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni 'debs @166a * //
translated: Just as, having determined a pot, one who is attached to the determination of a pot does not engage in the object to be established, a cloth, in the same way, having determined a universal, one does not engage in the object to be established, a particular.

original: mtshon pa'i don yin no //
analyzed: mtshon pa'i don yin no //
translated: This is the meaning of the example.

original: rjes su dpag pa las kyang 'jug pa zhes bya ba ni bzlog pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa las kyang 'jug pa zhes bya ba ni bzlog pa bstan pa'o //
translated: Also, from inference means that the opposite is taught.

original: gnyis pa gzhan gyi ngo bor rtogs pa 'khrul pa dag tu bzhed pa gang yin pa de ni zhes bya ba ni rang gi mtshan nyid kyi rnam par rtog pa las gzhan pa'i rtogs pa gnyis pa 'khrul par bzhed pa gang yin pa de'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa gzhan gyi ngo bor rtogs pa 'khrul pa dag tu bzhed pa gang yin pa de ni zhes bya ba ni rang gi mtshan nyid kyi rnam par rtog pa las gzhan pa'i rtogs pa gnyis pa 'khrul par bzhed pa gang yin pa de'o //
translated: The second, which is accepted as mistaken, as a realization of another nature, is that which is accepted as a second mistaken realization, other than the conceptualization of a particular.

original: rgyu gang gis de 'jug pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: rgyu gang gis de 'jug pa yin zhe na /
translated: What is the cause of its engagement?

original: gzhan gyi ngo bor zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi ngo bor zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: It is said, another nature,

original: spyi'i ngo bos zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: spyi'i ngo bos zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: meaning a universal nature.

original: de'i gsal ba'i ngo bor zhes bya ba ni de'i rang gi mtshan nyid du ste /üîΩrnam par rtog pa'i rjes su dpag pa'i gzung ba'i rnam pa'i sgo nas rang gi mtshan nyid du zhen pas rtogs pa gang yin pa de ni rang gi mtshan nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i gsal ba'i ngo bor zhes bya ba ni de'i rang gi mtshan nyid du ste / rnam par rtog pa'i rjes su dpag pa'i gzung ba'i rnam pa'i sgo nas rang gi mtshan nyid du zhen pas rtogs pa gang yin pa de ni rang gi mtshan nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúin the nature of its clarity‚Äù means in the nature of its own characteristic.üîΩThe object that is conceived through the aspect of the object that is grasped by the conceptualizing consciousness is its own characteristic.

original: rtogs pa po'i zhen pa'i dbang gis de gsal ba'i ngo bor rtogs pa yin no zhes brjod kyi /
analyzed: rtogs pa po'i zhen pa'i dbang gis de gsal ba'i ngo bor rtogs pa yin no zhes brjod kyi /
translated: The object that is conceived in the nature of its clarity is said to be conceived through the power of the conceiver.

original: de rtogs pa ni de ma yin te /
analyzed: de rtogs pa ni de ma yin te /
translated: But it is not conceived in that way.

original: yang dag par ma yin pa'i rnam pa 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang dag par ma yin pa'i rnam pa 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is grasped in an unreal form.

original: 'khrul pa yang zhes bya ba'i mdo'i tshig de dang / smig rgyu la sogs pa zhes bya ba spel nas bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: 'khrul pa yang zhes bya ba'i mdo'i tshig de dang / smig rgyu la sogs pa zhes bya ba spel nas bshad pa yin te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúand error‚Äù in the s≈´tra is explained by adding the phrase ‚Äúin regard to a mirage, etc.‚Äù

original: smig rgyu la sogs pa'i yul can gyi shes pa la smig rgyu la sogs pa'i sgras bstan to //
analyzed: smig rgyu la sogs pa'i yul can gyi shes pa la smig rgyu la sogs pa'i sgras bstan to //
translated: The word ‚Äúmirage‚Äù refers to the consciousness that has a mirage, etc., as its object.

original: de ltar na chur 'khrul pa'i rgyu 'byung ba'i khyad par la smig rgyu la sogs pa'i sgras brjod do //
analyzed: de ltar na chur 'khrul pa'i rgyu 'byung ba'i khyad par la smig rgyu la sogs pa'i sgras brjod do //
translated: Thus, the cause of the error of water is expressed by the word ‚Äúmirage,‚Äù etc.

original: de skad du ji ltar smig rgyu la sogs pa'i yul can gyi shes pa 'khrul pa nyid yin pa'i phyir tshad ma ma yin pa de dang 'dra bar rjes su dpag pa'i shes pa yang yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de skad du ji ltar smig rgyu la sogs pa'i yul can gyi shes pa 'khrul pa nyid yin pa'i phyir tshad ma ma yin pa de dang 'dra bar rjes su dpag pa'i shes pa yang yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: In this way, it is shown that just as the consciousness that has a mirage, etc. as its object is not a valid cognition because it is erroneous, so also is the consciousness that is an inference.

original: 'gyur bar 'dod mod kyi spyi don byed pa la nus pa med pa nyid kyi phyir de la don du zhen pas 'jug pa de tshad mar ni mi 'gyur na ;
analyzed: 'gyur bar 'dod mod kyi spyi don byed pa la nus pa med pa nyid kyi phyir de la don du zhen pas 'jug pa de tshad mar ni mi 'gyur na ;
translated: Although this is accepted, the engagement of that [consciousness] through the adherence to an object is not a valid cognition, because a universal is not capable of performing a function.

original: spyi'i rnam pa des kyang rang gi mtshan nyid rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: spyi'i rnam pa des kyang rang gi mtshan nyid rtogs pa yin no //
translated: However, the own characteristic is realized through that aspect of the universal.

original: de bas na de nyid la de tshad ma nyid yin pa gang gis bzlog / de ltar na rtogs pa 'di bsal ba'i don du 'khrul pa'ang zhes bya ba'i pa'ang gi sgra byas pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na de nyid la de tshad ma nyid yin pa gang gis bzlog / de ltar na rtogs pa 'di bsal ba'i don du 'khrul pa'ang zhes bya ba'i pa'ang gi sgra byas pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, how can the validity of that [consciousness] itself be refuted? In this way, the word ‚Äúalso‚Äù in ‚Äúerror also‚Äù is used in order to eliminate this realization.

original: de nyid ni 'ang gi sgras ni spyi'i zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed de /
analyzed: de nyid ni 'ang gi sgras ni spyi'i zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed de /
translated: That is explained by the word ‚Äúalso‚Äù in the verse, ‚ÄúIn general, etc.‚Äù

original: rnam pa gzhan gyis gzhan rtogs pa 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan gyis gzhan rtogs pa 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is contradictory for one thing to be understood in another way.

original: de rtogs pas de rtogs pa la gzhan gyi ngo bo ma yin pas khyab pa yin la /
analyzed: de rtogs pas de rtogs pa la gzhan gyi ngo bo ma yin pas khyab pa yin la /
translated: And when that is understood, it is pervaded by not being the nature of another.

original: de dang 'gal ba yang gzhan gyi ngo bo nyid yin pa de ltar na khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: de dang 'gal ba yang gzhan gyi ngo bo nyid yin pa de ltar na khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
translated: And that which is contradictory with that is the nature of another. Thus, there is the observation of a contradiction with the pervader.

original: de bzhin du tshad ma nyid la ma 'khrul ba nyid kyis khyab pa yin @166b la de dang 'gal ba yang 'khrul ba yin pa de ltar na /
analyzed: de bzhin du tshad ma nyid la ma 'khrul ba nyid kyis khyab pa yin @166b la de dang 'gal ba yang 'khrul ba yin pa de ltar na /
translated: In the same way, valid knowledge is pervaded by being nondeceptive. And that which is contradictory with that is deceptive. Thus,

original: sbyor ba gnyis pa yang khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa nyid yin la sbyor ba de dag kyang thal pa bsgrub pa yin no //
analyzed: sbyor ba gnyis pa yang khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa nyid yin la sbyor ba de dag kyang thal pa bsgrub pa yin no //
translated: the second syllogism is also the observation of a contradiction with the pervader. And those syllogisms are also reductio ad absurdum arguments.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid kyi bsam pa can gyi rjes su dpag pa ni tshad ma nyid yin pa zhes bya ba ni rang gi mtshan nyid du zhen pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid kyi bsam pa can gyi rjes su dpag pa ni tshad ma nyid yin pa zhes bya ba ni rang gi mtshan nyid du zhen pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The syllogism, ‚ÄúInference for oneself is valid knowledge‚Äù has the thought of a particular characteristic.

original: de ltar na rang gi mtshan nyid rtogs pa'i bsam pa nyid kyi rjes su dpog pa po 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na rang gi mtshan nyid rtogs pa'i bsam pa nyid kyi rjes su dpog pa po 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the inferential cognition is engaged in the realization of the intrinsic identity, in accordance with the intention.

original: bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du 'jug pas kyang bsam pa dang mthun par rang gi mtshan nyid rtogs pa de'i phyir ci ltar na rjes su dpag pa tshad ma nyid du mi 'gyur /
analyzed: bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du 'jug pas kyang bsam pa dang mthun par rang gi mtshan nyid rtogs pa de'i phyir ci ltar na rjes su dpag pa tshad ma nyid du mi 'gyur /
translated: And since it is engaged in accordance with the intention, it realizes the intrinsic identity in accordance with the intention. Therefore, how can inference not be a valid cognition?

original: gzhan dag ni sems par byed pas na bsam pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan dag ni sems par byed pas na bsam pa ste /
translated: Others say that it is an intention because it intends,

original: phrad pa pa yin par smra ste /
analyzed: phrad pa pa yin par smra ste /
translated: and it is a contact because it is a contact.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid dang phrad pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa tshad ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid dang phrad pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa tshad ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that inference is a valid cognition because it is a contact with the intrinsic identity.

original: de bas na tshad ma nyid yin pa'i phyir 'khrul pa ma yin no //üîΩgang gi phyir rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yul can rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma nyid yin pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: de bas na tshad ma nyid yin pa'i phyir 'khrul pa ma yin no // gang gi phyir rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yul can rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma nyid yin pa de'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, it is not a delusion because it is a valid cognition.üîΩBecause inference is a valid cognition that has the intrinsic identity as its object,

original: rang gi mtshan nyid rtogs pa kho na rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma yin no //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid rtogs pa kho na rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma yin no //
translated: therefore, the realization of the intrinsic identity is precisely the valid inference.

original: de bas na rang gi ngo bo nyid du rtogs pa yin pa de ltar na bzlog pa'i sbyor ba byas pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na rang gi ngo bo nyid du rtogs pa yin pa de ltar na bzlog pa'i sbyor ba byas pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, if one understands it to be the intrinsic reality, then the reverse proposition is established.

original: gal te de 'dra ba de yod pa ma yin no zhes bsgrub pa zhes bya ba ni don gang la zhen pas skyes bu 'jug pa'i don de la 'khrul pa'i shes pa mi slu ba med do zhes bya ba de ltar na /
analyzed: gal te de 'dra ba de yod pa ma yin no zhes bsgrub pa zhes bya ba ni don gang la zhen pas skyes bu 'jug pa'i don de la 'khrul pa'i shes pa mi slu ba med do zhes bya ba de ltar na /
translated: If one proves that such a thing does not exist, then the meaning of the statement ‚Äúthere is no non-erroneous consciousness in regard to the object to which a person is confined‚Äù is as follows:

original: 'khrul pa gang yin pa de ni tshad ma ma yin par sbyor ba gnyis pa 'di la gal te sgrub par 'gyur na zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'khrul pa gang yin pa de ni tshad ma ma yin par sbyor ba gnyis pa 'di la gal te sgrub par 'gyur na zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúWhatever is erroneous is not a valid cognition.‚Äù This is the meaning of the second syllogism.

original: thal ba dang po nyid la zhes bya ba ni gang zhig gang las gzhan gyi ngo bo yin pa de ni rtogs pa na rtogs par mi 'gyur te zhes bya ba la sogs pa la ste /
analyzed: thal ba dang po nyid la zhes bya ba ni gang zhig gang las gzhan gyi ngo bo yin pa de ni rtogs pa na rtogs par mi 'gyur te zhes bya ba la sogs pa la ste /
translated: In the first reductio, it was said that ‚Äúwhatever is of a different nature from something else is not apprehended when that other thing is apprehended.‚Äù

original: gal te ngo bo gzhan rtogs pa na ngo bo gzhan rtogs par zhen pa yod pa ma yin pa de ltar sgrub pa de'i tshe ma nges pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: gal te ngo bo gzhan rtogs pa na ngo bo gzhan rtogs par zhen pa yod pa ma yin pa de ltar sgrub pa de'i tshe ma nges pa nyid yin te /
translated: If one proves that when one apprehends a different nature, one does not apprehend a different nature, then it is not established.

original: 'khrul par ngo bo gzhan 'dzin pa na yang ngo bo gzhan du zhen pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'khrul par ngo bo gzhan 'dzin pa na yang ngo bo gzhan du zhen pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Even when apprehending a different entity in error, one sees the conception of a different entity.

original: de nyid ni 'di ltar de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston to //
analyzed: de nyid ni 'di ltar de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston to //
translated: That is what is shown by ‚ÄúIt is like this . . .‚Äù

original: bzlog pa'i sbyor ba dang po zhes bya ba ni gang tshad ma yin pa de ni 'khrul par mi 'gyur te zhes bya ba la sogs pa la ste /
analyzed: bzlog pa'i sbyor ba dang po zhes bya ba ni gang tshad ma yin pa de ni 'khrul par mi 'gyur te zhes bya ba la sogs pa la ste /
translated: The first reversed application is ‚ÄúWhatever is valid knowledge is not in error . . .‚Äù

original: nor bu'i 'od la nor bu'i blos ma nges pa yin te /üîΩnor bu'i 'od la nor bu'i blo 'khrul pa nyid yin na yang nor bu'i dngos po la mi slu ba'i sgo nas tshad @167a * //
analyzed: nor bu'i 'od la nor bu'i blos ma nges pa yin te / nor bu'i 'od la nor bu'i blo 'khrul pa nyid yin na yang nor bu'i dngos po la mi slu ba'i sgo nas tshad @167a * //
translated: The cognition of a jewel with respect to the light of a jewel is not ascertained.

original: ma nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Even though the cognition of a jewel with respect to the light of a jewel is in error, it is valid knowledge because it is nondeceptive with respect to the entity of the jewel.

original: de ltar na mi slu ba'i phyir tshad ma nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i tshad ma'i spyi'i mtshan nyid nor bu'i 'od la nor bu'i blo la yod pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na mi slu ba'i phyir tshad ma nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i tshad ma'i spyi'i mtshan nyid nor bu'i 'od la nor bu'i blo la yod pa yin no //
translated: Thus the general definition of valid knowledge, ‚Äúbecause it is nondeceptive, it is valid knowledge,‚Äù exists in the cognition of a jewel with respect to the light of a jewel.

original: de bas na de nyid tshad ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na de nyid tshad ma yin no //
translated: Therefore it is valid knowledge.

original: gal te de lta na ni mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa ma gtogs pa'i tshad ma gsum pa thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te de lta na ni mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa ma gtogs pa'i tshad ma gsum pa thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: If that is so, then a third means of valid knowledge, apart from perception and inference, would be established.

original: 'di ltar re zhig nor bu'i 'od la nor bu'i blo mngon sum du gyur pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar re zhig nor bu'i 'od la nor bu'i blo mngon sum du gyur pa ma yin te /
translated: For example, the cognition of a gem in regard to the light of a gem is not perception,

original: 'khrul pa nyid kyi phyir dang rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa nyid kyi phyir dang / mngon sum yang de las bzlog pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'khrul pa nyid kyi phyir dang rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa nyid kyi phyir dang / mngon sum yang de las bzlog pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is erroneous, because it is conceptual, and because perception is the opposite of that.

original: rjes su dpag pa yang ma yin te rtags las skye ba med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa yang ma yin te rtags las skye ba med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: It is not inference, because it does not arise from a logical reason.

original: tshad ma nyid ma yin pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: tshad ma nyid ma yin pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not non-validating cognition,

original: dngos po la mi slu ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: dngos po la mi slu ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: because it is non-deceptive in regard to the thing.

original: 'dir brjod pa tshad ma gzhan du thal ba ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dir brjod pa tshad ma gzhan du thal ba ma yin te /
translated: Here we say: It does not follow that it is another means of valid knowledge,

original: rjes su dpag pa nyid kyi nang du 'du ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa nyid kyi nang du 'du ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is included within inference.

original: de ltar na rjes su dpag pa'i spyi'i mtshan nyid ni 'di yin te ;
analyzed: de ltar na rjes su dpag pa'i spyi'i mtshan nyid ni 'di yin te ;
translated: Thus, the general characteristic of inference is this:

original: lkog tu gyur pa'i don gzhan 'brel pa las rtogs pa ni rjes su dpag pa yin no zhes de ma thag tu rnam par 'jog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lkog tu gyur pa'i don gzhan 'brel pa las rtogs pa ni rjes su dpag pa yin no zhes de ma thag tu rnam par 'jog par 'gyur ro //
translated: The inference is the cognition of another object, which is hidden, through the relation.

original: 'dir yang nor bu la nor bu'i 'od kyi 'brel pa de'i 'bras bu nyid las nor bu'i 'od de la nor bu'i 'khrul pa skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dir yang nor bu la nor bu'i 'od kyi 'brel pa de'i 'bras bu nyid las nor bu'i 'od de la nor bu'i 'khrul pa skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Here, too, the cognition of the gem is produced from the relation of the gem and the gem‚Äôs luster, because of the latter‚Äôs being its effect.

original: de bas na 'bras bu'i rtags las skyes pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de bas na 'bras bu'i rtags las skyes pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa nyid yin no //
translated: Therefore, because it is produced from the effect-evidence, it is inference.

original: de ltar na nor bu'i 'od la dang por mig gi rnam par shes pa skye ste /
analyzed: de ltar na nor bu'i 'od la dang por mig gi rnam par shes pa skye ste /
translated: Thus, first, the visual consciousness is produced with regard to the gem‚Äôs luster.

original: gang gi phyir rang gi mtshan nyid kho na rtags yin pa de nyid kyi phyir 'bras bu'i rtags kyi rang gi ngo bo rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rang gi mtshan nyid kho na rtags yin pa de nyid kyi phyir 'bras bu'i rtags kyi rang gi ngo bo rtogs pa yin no //
translated: Because the particular characteristic itself is the evidence, the nature of the effect-evidence is understood.

original: ji skad du don gyi don rtogs pa'i phyir phyogs dang gtan tshigs brjod pa'i nus pa don ma yin no zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: ji skad du don gyi don rtogs pa'i phyir phyogs dang gtan tshigs brjod pa'i nus pa don ma yin no zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: As it is said, ‚ÄúBecause the meaning is understood, the statement of the subject and reason is not able to express the meaning.‚Äù

original: de ltar na de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung ba go bar byed pa nyid du gnas pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de ltar na de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung ba go bar byed pa nyid du gnas pa yin gyi /
translated: Thus, the reason is established as the nature of that and as arising from that.

original: gzhan gyis kun du brtags pa'i rtags de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung ba'i don nyid du 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyis kun du brtags pa'i rtags de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung ba'i don nyid du 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: But it is not the case that the reason is the nature of that and the meaning of arising from that as imagined by others.

original: gal te ji ltar na rang gi mtshan nyid kyis rjes su 'gro ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: gal te ji ltar na rang gi mtshan nyid kyis rjes su 'gro ba yin zhe na /
translated: If it is asked, ‚ÄúHow is it that the reason is the nature of that and the meaning of arising from that as imagined by others?‚Äù

original: de nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni mi smra'i /
analyzed: de nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni mi smra'i /
translated: It is not said that it is by that itself.

original: 'on kyang de'i rigs can gyi rang gi mtshan nyid gzhan dang ngo //üîΩde skad du de'i rigs can zhes bya ba yang khyad par du brjod par 'dod pa ma yin pa de nyid yin no zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang de'i rigs can gyi rang gi mtshan nyid gzhan dang ngo // de skad du de'i rigs can zhes bya ba yang khyad par du brjod par 'dod pa ma yin pa de nyid yin no zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: However, it is by another that has the same type as that.üîΩIn that way, it is said that it is that itself, which is not intended to be expressed as a distinction.

original: de bas na rigs mtshungs @167b pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid rigs mi mthun pa la sogs pa'i khyad par can gyi spyi zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de bas na rigs mtshungs @167b pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid rigs mi mthun pa la sogs pa'i khyad par can gyi spyi zhes brjod do //
translated: Therefore, the reason is said to be a generality that has the same type as the reason and is distinguished by a different type.

original: gang la yang byas pa nyid la sogs pa ldog pas tha dad par rnam par gzhag pa de la yang chos dang chos can gyi rnam par dbye ba ni rmongs pa la bstan pa'i thabs su brjod pa'i don yin gyi go bar byed pa ni rtags kyi rangüîΩgi mtshan nyid kho na yin no //üîΩde skad du chos dang chos can nyid du tha dad pa blo'i rnam pas byas pa yin gyi don kyang ni ma yin te zhes gsungs so //üîΩdu ba'i rtags las rtags can gyi shes pa skye ba du ba nyid la mer sgro btags nas 'jug pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang la yang byas pa nyid la sogs pa ldog pas tha dad par rnam par gzhag pa de la yang chos dang chos can gyi rnam par dbye ba ni rmongs pa la bstan pa'i thabs su brjod pa'i don yin gyi go bar byed pa ni rtags kyi rang gi mtshan nyid kho na yin no // de skad du chos dang chos can nyid du tha dad pa blo'i rnam pas byas pa yin gyi don kyang ni ma yin te zhes gsungs so // du ba'i rtags las rtags can gyi shes pa skye ba du ba nyid la mer sgro btags nas 'jug pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Since the existence of the effect and so on are distinguished from the existence of the action and so on, they are posited as different.  The distinction of property and property possessor is stated as a method of teaching to the confused.  The meaning of the statement is that the property and property possessor are different due to the activity of the mind, but not due to the object.üîΩThe meaning of the statement is that the property and property possessor are different due to the activity of the mind, but not due to the object.üîΩThe knowledge of the property possessor, the fire, is produced from the sign, the smoke, but it does not engage by superimposing the fire on the smoke itself.üîΩ

original: 'o na ci yin zhe na /üîΩsa phyogs gzhan la'o //üîΩgal te nor bu la 'khrul pa yang nor bu'i 'od ces bya ba'i rtags de nyid la rtags can sgro 'dogs par byed pa ma yin zhe na /üîΩde las cir 'gyur /
analyzed: 'o na ci yin zhe na /üîΩsa phyogs gzhan la'o //üîΩgal te nor bu la 'khrul pa yang nor bu'i 'od ces bya ba'i rtags de nyid la rtags can sgro 'dogs par byed pa ma yin zhe na /üîΩde las cir 'gyur /
