original: 'di tsam gyis 'brel pa las byung ba nyid nyams pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di tsam gyis 'brel pa las byung ba nyid nyams pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But this does not invalidate the fact that it is a means of valid cognition.

original: 'dir yul la 'khrul pa lhag pa yod do zhes de tsam zhig brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir yul la 'khrul pa lhag pa yod do zhes de tsam zhig brjod par bya ste /
translated: Here, we should say that there is a special kind of error in regard to the object.

original: phyogs de nyid kho na la nor bu dang phrad par byed pa nyid kyis tshad mar ni mi 'gyur mod kyi /
analyzed: phyogs de nyid kho na la nor bu dang phrad par byed pa nyid kyis tshad mar ni mi 'gyur mod kyi /
translated: In that very case, it is not a means of valid cognition by virtue of bringing about contact with the gem.üîΩBut what prevents it from being an inference by virtue of bringing about contact with the mere gem?

original: nor bu tsam dang phrad par byed pa la rjes su dpag pa nyid yin pa gang gis bzlog rjes su dpag pa thams cad kyang 'khrul pa nyid yin par bzhed do //
analyzed: nor bu tsam dang phrad par byed pa la rjes su dpag pa nyid yin pa gang gis bzlog rjes su dpag pa thams cad kyang 'khrul pa nyid yin par bzhed do //
translated: He believes that all inferences are erroneous.

original: gal te nor bur 'khrul pa la rjes su 'phro ba dang ldog pa dran pa yod pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te nor bur 'khrul pa la rjes su 'phro ba dang ldog pa dran pa yod pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that there is no memory of the connection and the reversal in the case of the error in regard to the gem,

original: gal te yod pa ma yin pa de tsam gyi rjes su dpag pa nyid ma yin pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te yod pa ma yin pa de tsam gyi rjes su dpag pa nyid ma yin pa ma yin te /
translated: then it is not the case that it is not an inference merely because of the absence of that.

original: gang rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dran pa nyid med par mod la du ba las me rtogs par 'gyur ba de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dran pa nyid med par mod la du ba las me rtogs par 'gyur ba de'i tshe /
translated: If there were no memory of the connection and the reversal, then fire would be understood from smoke immediately, without delay.

original: ci shes pa de rjes su dpag pa'i shes pa yin par mi 'dod dam /
analyzed: ci shes pa de rjes su dpag pa'i shes pa yin par mi 'dod dam /
translated: Why don‚Äôt you accept that consciousness is a consciousness that is an inference?

original: de tshul gsum pa'i rtags las skyes pa yin pa de ltar na /
analyzed: de tshul gsum pa'i rtags las skyes pa yin pa de ltar na /
translated: If it is produced from a reason that has the three characteristics,

original: de tsam gyi rjes su dpag pa zhes smra'o //
analyzed: de tsam gyi rjes su dpag pa zhes smra'o //
translated: then we call it an inference.

original: gal te nor bu'i 'od la nor bur 'khrul pa rjes su dpag pa nyid yin na /
analyzed: gal te nor bu'i 'od la nor bur 'khrul pa rjes su dpag pa nyid yin na /
translated: If the error of mistaking the light of a jewel for a jewel is itself an inference,

original: ji ltar rjes su dpag pa tshad ma nyid du 'jog pa na /
analyzed: ji ltar rjes su dpag pa tshad ma nyid du 'jog pa na /
translated: then how can you posit inference as a valid means of knowledge?

original: nor bu sgron ma'i 'od dag la zhes bya ba la sogs pas dper byed /
analyzed: nor bu sgron ma'i 'od dag la zhes bya ba la sogs pas dper byed /
translated: In the passage that begins, ‚ÄúThe light of a jewel and the light of a lamp,‚ÄùüîΩyou use inference as an example.

original: rjes su dpag pa spyir mi slu bar bsgrub par bya ba la rjes su dpag pa nyid dpe nyid du rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa spyir mi slu bar bsgrub par bya ba la rjes su dpag pa nyid dpe nyid du rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not correct to use inference itself as an example in order to prove that inference in general is nondeceptive.

original: 'di ni skyon ma yin te 'di ltar nor bur 'khrul pa la 'khrul pa nyid yin na yang dngos po la mi slu ba tsam du 'dod cing /
analyzed: 'di ni skyon ma yin te 'di ltar nor bur 'khrul pa la 'khrul pa nyid yin na yang dngos po la mi slu ba tsam du 'dod cing /
translated: This is not a problem, because although the error of mistaking the light of a jewel for a jewel is an error, we accept that it is nondeceptive with regard to things.

original: du ba la sogs pa'i rtags @168a * //
analyzed: du ba la sogs pa'i rtags @168a * //
translated: The reason smoke and so on

original: las skyes pa'i rjes su dpag pa 'di ni ma 'khrul pa nyid dang dngos por snang ba nyid yin te /
analyzed: las skyes pa'i rjes su dpag pa 'di ni ma 'khrul pa nyid dang dngos por snang ba nyid yin te /
translated: This inference born of the object is non-erroneous and is an appearance of an object.

original: de lta ma yin na mi slu ba nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na mi slu ba nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were not so, it would not be non-erroneous.

original: de bas na nor bur 'khrul pa dpe nyid du bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na nor bur 'khrul pa dpe nyid du bstan pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the example of the error of the gem is taught.

original: gnyis pa la yang ma grub pa yin te zhes bya ba ni gang zhig gang gi rtog pa yin pa de ni de'i ngo bo nyid du 'gyur te zhes bya ba'i bzlog pa'i sbyor ba gnyis pa de la gtan tshigs ma grub pa yin te /
analyzed: gnyis pa la yang ma grub pa yin te zhes bya ba ni gang zhig gang gi rtog pa yin pa de ni de'i ngo bo nyid du 'gyur te zhes bya ba'i bzlog pa'i sbyor ba gnyis pa de la gtan tshigs ma grub pa yin te /
translated: In the second, the reason is not established. The second reversed syllogism, ‚ÄúThat which is the conception of something becomes the intrinsic reality of that,‚Äù the reason is not established.

original: rjes su dpag pa yang rang gi mtshan nyid rtogs pa yin no zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs ma grub pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa yang rang gi mtshan nyid rtogs pa yin no zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs ma grub pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because the reason, ‚ÄúInference is the understanding of its own meaning,‚Äù is not established.

original: brjod bya nyid phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyis bstan zin to zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: brjod bya nyid phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyis bstan zin to zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The reason, ‚ÄúBecause it is the expressed meaning,‚Äù is taught.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i rnam par shes pa'i gzung ba brjod bya nyid yin pa'i phyir dang don byed par mi nus pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pas dngos po nyid du med pa bstan zin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i rnam par shes pa'i gzung ba brjod bya nyid yin pa'i phyir dang don byed par mi nus pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pas dngos po nyid du med pa bstan zin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because the object of the conceptual consciousness is the expressed meaning, and because it is incapable of performing a function, etc., it has already been shown that it does not exist as a real entity.

original: thal ba bzlog pa dag la de nyid ma nges pa nyid du ston par byed do zhes bya ba ni thal ba dang bzlog pa zhes bya ba ni zlas dbye ba'o //
analyzed: thal ba bzlog pa dag la de nyid ma nges pa nyid du ston par byed do zhes bya ba ni thal ba dang bzlog pa zhes bya ba ni zlas dbye ba'o //
translated: He shows that the reversal of the reductio is indeterminate. The term ‚Äúreductio and reversal‚Äù is a dvandva compound.

original: gang 'khrul pa yin pa de ni tshad ma ma yin te /
analyzed: gang 'khrul pa yin pa de ni tshad ma ma yin te /
translated: Whatever is erroneous is not a valid cognition,üîΩlike, for example, the perception of yellow by one suffering from jaundice.üîΩWhatever is a valid cognition does not become erroneous.

original: dper na mig ser can gyis ser por mthong ba lta bu'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa thal ba gnyis pa gang yin pa dang / gang tshad ma yin pa de ni 'khrul par mi 'gyur te zhes bya ba la sogs pa bzlog pa gang yin pa de dag ni ma nges pa nyid du ston par byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dper na mig ser can gyis ser por mthong ba lta bu'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa thal ba gnyis pa gang yin pa dang / gang tshad ma yin pa de ni 'khrul par mi 'gyur te zhes bya ba la sogs pa bzlog pa gang yin pa de dag ni ma nges pa nyid du ston par byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: He shows that these two reductio and the reversal are indeterminate.

original: de ltar na nor bu'i 'od la nor bu'i blo 'khrul pa nyid yin na yang tshad ma nyid yin pa'i phyir thal ba ma nges pa yin zhing /
analyzed: de ltar na nor bu'i 'od la nor bu'i blo 'khrul pa nyid yin na yang tshad ma nyid yin pa'i phyir thal ba ma nges pa yin zhing /
translated: Thus, if the cognition of the jewel with respect to the light of the jewel is erroneous, it is still a valid cognition. Therefore, the reductio is inconclusive.

original: tshad ma nyid yin na yang 'khrul pa nyid yin pa'i phyir bzlog pa la yang ma nges pa yin no //
analyzed: tshad ma nyid yin na yang 'khrul pa nyid yin pa'i phyir bzlog pa la yang ma nges pa yin no //
translated: And if it is a valid cognition, it is still erroneous. Therefore, the reversal of the premise is also inconclusive.

original: 'di las zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa dang der snang ba dag gi nang nas so //
analyzed: 'di las zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa dang der snang ba dag gi nang nas so //
translated: ‚ÄúFrom this‚Äù means from among inferences and the appearances of that.

original: nor bu dang 'brel pa'i zhes bya ba ni brgyud pas nor bu'i 'od la nor bu'i blo nor bu'i dngos po dang 'brel pa las so //
analyzed: nor bu dang 'brel pa'i zhes bya ba ni brgyud pas nor bu'i 'od la nor bu'i blo nor bu'i dngos po dang 'brel pa las so //
translated: ‚ÄúIn connection with the jewel‚Äù means that the cognition of the jewel with respect to the light of the jewel is connected with the entity of the jewel through a series.

original: de ltar na re zhig nor bu'i 'od ni nor bu dang 'brel pa yin te de las byung ba nyid kyi phyir ro nor bu'i 'od dang nor bu'i shes pa yang yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na re zhig nor bu'i 'od ni nor bu dang 'brel pa yin te de las byung ba nyid kyi phyir ro nor bu'i 'od dang nor bu'i shes pa yang yin no //
translated: Thus, first, the light of the jewel is connected with the jewel because it arises from it. The cognition of the jewel with respect to the light of the jewel is also connected with the jewel.

original: shes pa de las de la 'jug pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni nor bu'i 'od la nor bu'i shes pa'i rgyud las skyes bu de nor bu de la 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes pa de las de la 'jug pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni nor bu'i 'od la nor bu'i shes pa'i rgyud las skyes bu de nor bu de la 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the cognition of that is engaged in that.

original: de ltar na blo'i snang bas rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba'i blo la snang bas rjes su 'gro ba @168b dang ldog pa 'dzin par byed ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de ltar na blo'i snang bas rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba'i blo la snang bas rjes su 'gro ba @168b dang ldog pa 'dzin par byed ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: Thus, the meaning of ‚Äúthat which is engaged in the appearance of cognition‚Äù is ‚Äúthat which apprehends the positive and negative concomitance of the appearance of cognition.‚Äù

original: de med na med pa nyid kyang ldog pa 'dzin pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de med na med pa nyid kyang ldog pa 'dzin pa zhes brjod do //
translated: And the meaning of ‚Äúthat which is engaged in the absence of that‚Äù is ‚Äúthat which apprehends the negative concomitance of the absence of that.‚Äù

original: de lha ma yin na ngo bo med pa la 'dzin pa ci 'dra ba zhig yod /
analyzed: de lha ma yin na ngo bo med pa la 'dzin pa ci 'dra ba zhig yod /
translated: If that does not exist, how can there be apprehension of the absence of entity?

original: rtogs pa po'i da ltar gyi gnas skabs la ltos pas yin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rtogs pa po'i da ltar gyi gnas skabs la ltos pas yin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is in dependence on the present state of the cognizer.

original: rtogs pa po ni lta ba po'o //üîΩde'i yul rung ba na gnas pa'i khyad par 'dzin pa la mngon sum du phyogs pa'i gnas skabs ni /
analyzed: rtogs pa po ni lta ba po'o // de'i yul rung ba na gnas pa'i khyad par 'dzin pa la mngon sum du phyogs pa'i gnas skabs ni /
translated: The cognizer is the seer.

original: da ltar gyi gnas skabs te /
analyzed: da ltar gyi gnas skabs te /
translated: The present state is the state of the apprehension of the particular that exists in a suitable object, which is directed toward perception.

original: de la ltos pa ste de'i ngo bo la ltos pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de la ltos pa ste de'i ngo bo la ltos pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúIn dependence on that‚Äù means ‚Äúin dependence on the nature of that.‚Äù

original: de ltar na gang snang ba mthong ba tsam la sogs pa tshogs pa can gyi lta ba po dang thag nye ba'i de la rag lus pas gnas pa dngos po'i rnam pa can gyi shes pa skyes bu gang yin pa de ni mngon sum yin la de med
analyzed: de ltar na gang snang ba mthong ba tsam la sogs pa tshogs pa can gyi lta ba po dang thag nye ba'i de la rag lus pas gnas pa dngos po'i rnam pa can gyi shes pa skyes bu gang yin pa de ni mngon sum yin la de med
translated: Thus, the one who is the seer, the one who is the hearer, the one who is the cognizer, the one who is the knower, the one who is the experiencer, the one who is the one who is in the proximity of the collection of the mere seeing of the appearance, the one who is the one who is dependent on that, the one who is the one who is the possessor of the form of an entity, the one who is the one who is the producer of consciousness, the one who is the one who is the person‚Äîthat one is perception.

original: pa'i phyir lkog tu gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: pa'i phyir lkog tu gyur pa yin no //
translated: Because that one does not exist, the object is hidden.

original: de skad du ci skad du bshad pa'i rtogs pa po'i gnas skabs nges par byas nas /
analyzed: de skad du ci skad du bshad pa'i rtogs pa po'i gnas skabs nges par byas nas /
translated: Thus, having ascertained the state of the cognizer as it has been explained,

original: dus nges pa'i khyad par yongs su bcad nas /
analyzed: dus nges pa'i khyad par yongs su bcad nas /
translated: having ascertained the distinction of the time,

original: lkog tu gyur pa la sogs pa rnam par gzhag pa yin gyi /
analyzed: lkog tu gyur pa la sogs pa rnam par gzhag pa yin gyi /
translated: the hidden and so on are posited.

original: dngos po'i rang bzhin dus thams cad du gnas pa gzung bas ni ma yin no zhes bstan to //
analyzed: dngos po'i rang bzhin dus thams cad du gnas pa gzung bas ni ma yin no zhes bstan to //
translated: It is not that the nature of the entity exists at all times and is apprehended.

original: dngos po las rnam par gzhag na ni lkog tu gyur pa gang yin pa de thams cad du lkog tu gyur pa yin zhing /
analyzed: dngos po las rnam par gzhag na ni lkog tu gyur pa gang yin pa de thams cad du lkog tu gyur pa yin zhing /
translated: If it were posited from the entity, then whatever is hidden would be completely hidden.

original: mngon sum du gyur pa gang yin pa rtag tu mngon sum nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mngon sum du gyur pa gang yin pa rtag tu mngon sum nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Whatever is manifest always becomes manifest.

original: 'chol par yang snang ba yin te mngon sum yang gzhan du lkog tu gyur pa nyid kyi phyir dang / lkog tu gyur pa yang mngon sum nyid du gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'chol par yang snang ba yin te mngon sum yang gzhan du lkog tu gyur pa nyid kyi phyir dang / lkog tu gyur pa yang mngon sum nyid du gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And there is confusion, because what is manifest becomes otherwise, i.e., unmanifest, and what is unmanifest becomes manifest.

original: de nyid ni de lta ma yin na lta ba po dang snang ba dag gi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la gnas skabs kyi khyad par gzhan du gyur pa ste /
analyzed: de nyid ni de lta ma yin na lta ba po dang snang ba dag gi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la gnas skabs kyi khyad par gzhan du gyur pa ste /
translated: If that were not so, then there would be no change in the state of the seer and the manifest, etc.

original: rung ba mi rung ba nyid dam mi rung ba rung ba nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rung ba mi rung ba nyid dam mi rung ba rung ba nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: What is suitable becomes unsuitable, or what is unsuitable becomes suitable.

original: de de ltar na zhes bya ba la sogs pas mjug sdud par byed do //
analyzed: de de ltar na zhes bya ba la sogs pas mjug sdud par byed do //
translated: Thus, etc., concludes.

original: 'di ltar don 'ga' zhig mngon sum yin pa de thams cad snang ba'i rang bzhin gyi gnas skabs yin par khas len pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'chad par 'gyur ba tha snyad du byas pa'i tshig dang sbyar ro zhes bya ba ni dag gi don yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar don 'ga' zhig mngon sum yin pa de thams cad snang ba'i rang bzhin gyi gnas skabs yin par khas len pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'chad par 'gyur ba tha snyad du byas pa'i tshig dang sbyar ro zhes bya ba ni dag gi don yin no //
translated: Thus, the meaning of the verse is as follows: ‚ÄúBecause it is accepted that all direct perception of some object is a state of the nature of appearance,‚Äù as will be explained.

original: lkog tu gyur pa la ji ltar tha snyad du byed ce na /
analyzed: lkog tu gyur pa la ji ltar tha snyad du byed ce na /
translated: How is it conventionally designated with regard to the hidden?

original: so sor nges pa'i ngo bor gzung ba ma yin pa zhes bya ba smos te /üîΩspyi'i mtshan nyid can yin no zhes tha snyad du byas pa yin te /
analyzed: so sor nges pa'i ngo bor gzung ba ma yin pa zhes bya ba smos te / spyi'i mtshan nyid can yin no zhes tha snyad du byas pa yin te /
translated: It is said, ‚ÄúIt is not apprehended as having a specific nature.‚ÄùüîΩIt is conventionally designated as having a universal characteristic.

original: gang la spyi'i mtshan nyid yod pa zhes bya ba'i don te //
analyzed: gang la spyi'i mtshan nyid yod pa zhes bya ba'i don te //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúthat which has a universal characteristic‚Äù is

original: rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa'i gzung ba @169a * //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa'i gzung ba @169a * // zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: ‚Äúthe object of the conceptual consciousness.‚ÄùüîΩWith regard to ‚Äúthe object of the conceptual consciousness,‚Äù and so on,üîΩit is said that the unclear nature that appears to a conceptual consciousness does not exist in a thing.

original: de ltar rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa la snang ba'i ngo bo mi gsal ba gang yin pa de dngos po la yod pa ma yin pa de bas na /
analyzed: de ltar rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa la snang ba'i ngo bo mi gsal ba gang yin pa de dngos po la yod pa ma yin pa de bas na /
translated: Therefore,

original: rnam par rtog pa'i shes pas gzung ba de lkog tu gyur pa yin no sems so //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i shes pas gzung ba de lkog tu gyur pa yin no sems so //
translated: The object of conceptual cognition is hidden.

original: de'i des de'i rang gi ngo bo zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni grub pa'i mtha' smra ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i des de'i rang gi ngo bo zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni grub pa'i mtha' smra ba yin no //
translated: The proponent of the tenets says, ‚ÄúThe object of that conceptual cognition is the essence of that thing, etc.‚Äù

original: de'i ni rgol ba'i'o //
analyzed: de'i ni rgol ba'i'o //
translated: ‚Äú That‚Äù refers to the opponent.

original: des ni rnam par rtog pa'i shes pas so //
analyzed: des ni rnam par rtog pa'i shes pas so //
translated: ‚Äú By that‚Äù refers to conceptual cognition.

original: dngos po'i de'i rang gi ngo bo 'dzin pas na rnam par rtog pa'i rnam par shes pa de'i yul don ni lkog tu gyur pa ma yin zhing mngon sum nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: dngos po'i de'i rang gi ngo bo 'dzin pas na rnam par rtog pa'i rnam par shes pa de'i yul don ni lkog tu gyur pa ma yin zhing mngon sum nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: The object of that conceptual consciousness is not hidden, but is direct perception, because it apprehends the essence of that thing.

original: rang gi ngo bo'i shes pa skyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo'i shes pa skyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it generates cognition of its essence.

original: rang bzhin las ngo bo lhag pa zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: rang bzhin las ngo bo lhag pa zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: The word ‚Äúessence‚Äù is supplied.

original: rang bzhin kho na 'dzin pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rang bzhin kho na 'dzin pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it apprehends its nature.

original: rang bzhin de yang rnam par rtog pas kyang 'dzin pa de ltar na khyad par yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin de yang rnam par rtog pas kyang 'dzin pa de ltar na khyad par yod pa ma yin no //
translated: That nature is also apprehended by conceptual cognition. Thus there is no difference.

original: gang gis na de'i sgo nas zhes bya ba ni dbang po'i sgo nas so //
analyzed: gang gis na de'i sgo nas zhes bya ba ni dbang po'i sgo nas so //
translated: ‚Äú By which‚Äù means by the sense faculty.

original: gal te rnam par rtog pa dang dbang po'i shes pa dag rang bzhin rtogs par mtshungs pas yin na /
analyzed: gal te rnam par rtog pa dang dbang po'i shes pa dag rang bzhin rtogs par mtshungs pas yin na /
translated: If it is the same because conceptual and sense consciousnesses are alike in being essentially cognitive,

original: dbang po'i sgo nas mngon sum rnam par 'jog pa de'i tshe gzhan la bde ba la sogs pa mngon sum du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: dbang po'i sgo nas mngon sum rnam par 'jog pa de'i tshe gzhan la bde ba la sogs pa mngon sum du mi 'gyur te /
translated: then when one posits direct perception in terms of the sense faculties, the pleasure of another would not be direct perception for him,

original: de la dbang po'i byed pa med pa'i phyir ro //üîΩbde ba la sogs pa 'dzin pa'i shes pas de dag gi rang gi ngo bo rtogs pa'i phyir mngon sum nyid du gzhan gyis 'dod de /
analyzed: de la dbang po'i byed pa med pa'i phyir ro // bde ba la sogs pa 'dzin pa'i shes pas de dag gi rang gi ngo bo rtogs pa'i phyir mngon sum nyid du gzhan gyis 'dod de /
translated: because the sense faculties do not function in regard to that.üîΩOthers assert that the apprehension of pleasure, etc. is direct perception because the consciousness that apprehends pleasure, etc. realizes their own nature.

original: bdag nyid 'phrod pa 'du ba can gyi shes pas bde ba la sogs pa nyams su myong bar khas len pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag nyid 'phrod pa 'du ba can gyi shes pas bde ba la sogs pa nyams su myong bar khas len pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because they accept that pleasure, etc. is experienced by a consciousness that is essentially a contact.

original: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir dbang po'i sgo nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir dbang po'i sgo nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: In order to demonstrate this, he says, ‚ÄúIf one posits direct perception in terms of the sense faculties,‚Äù etc.

original: dbang po don med par ni dgos pa med pa yin te /
analyzed: dbang po don med par ni dgos pa med pa yin te /
translated: The sense faculties are purposeless, i.e., without purpose.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa nyid kyis gzugs la sogs pa'i dngos po thams cad kyi rang gi ngo bo gzung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa nyid kyis gzugs la sogs pa'i dngos po thams cad kyi rang gi ngo bo gzung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the nature of all things such as form, etc. is apprehended by the consciousness itself which has conceptualization.

original: de bas na mngon sum dang lkog tu gyur pa tha dad pa med pa'i skyon 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
analyzed: de bas na mngon sum dang lkog tu gyur pa tha dad pa med pa'i skyon 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
translated: Therefore, not only is there the fault of the non-difference of the manifest and the unmanifest,

original: 'on kyang dbang po don med par thal ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi skyon 'di gzhan yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang dbang po don med par thal ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi skyon 'di gzhan yin no //
translated: but there is also the fault of the consequence of the uselessness of the sense faculties.

original: 'gyur bar ni 'dod mod kyi gal te yang rnam par rtog pa'i rnam par shes pa dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo 'dzin pa de ltar na yang mi gsal ba'i rnam pas yin la /
analyzed: 'gyur bar ni 'dod mod kyi gal te yang rnam par rtog pa'i rnam par shes pa dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo 'dzin pa de ltar na yang mi gsal ba'i rnam pas yin la /
translated: Although it is admitted that the consciousness which has conceptualization apprehends the nature of things, it is not clear in its appearance,

original: dbang pos ni gsal ba yin pa de bas na dbang po don med pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: dbang pos ni gsal ba yin pa de bas na dbang po don med pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: but the sense faculty is clear. Therefore, the sense faculty is not useless.

original: de'i phyir don de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa @169b smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir don de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa @169b smos so //
translated: Therefore, he says, ‚ÄúIn that case, the sense faculty is useless for that object, etc.‚Äù

original: rnam par rtog pa gang gi rgyu yi brgyud pa nye ba na yod pa yin no zhes bya ba ni ji ltar byas pa nyid dang du ba'i rtags las /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa gang gi rgyu yi brgyud pa nye ba na yod pa yin no zhes bya ba ni ji ltar byas pa nyid dang du ba'i rtags las /
translated: The cause of a conception is the presence of a proximate causal continuum.

original: sgra dang sa phyogs la sogs pa la mi rtag pa dang me dang ldan pa'i rnam par rtog pa de ni dngos po 'brel pa'i rang bzhin dang 'bras bu'i rtags kyis bskyed pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: sgra dang sa phyogs la sogs pa la mi rtag pa dang me dang ldan pa'i rnam par rtog pa de ni dngos po 'brel pa'i rang bzhin dang 'bras bu'i rtags kyis bskyed pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: For example, the conception of impermanence and the conception of the presence of fire in sound and in a place, etc., are produced by the evidence of a related entity and by the evidence of an effect.

original: / gzhan zhes bya ba ni dper na rtag pa nyid la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: / gzhan zhes bya ba ni dper na rtag pa nyid la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa lta bu'o //
translated: ‚Äú Another‚Äù means, for example, the conception of permanence, etc.

original: don mthong ba mngon du song ba can las skyes pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni dngos po mthong ba las rtags pa nyid la sogs pa'i sgro 'dogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don mthong ba mngon du song ba can las skyes pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni dngos po mthong ba las rtags pa nyid la sogs pa'i sgro 'dogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚Äú Because it arises from the perception of an object‚Äù means that it arises from the perception of an entity.

original: rtags las rtags can gyi rtogs pa gang yin pa de rtags can gyi rang gi ngo bo 'dzin pa ma yin na /
analyzed: rtags las rtags can gyi rtogs pa gang yin pa de rtags can gyi rang gi ngo bo 'dzin pa ma yin na /
translated: If the conception of the evidence is not the apprehension of the intrinsic reality of the evidence,

original: ji ltar na rtags can de'i rtags pa de yin zhes brjod ce na zhes dogs pa de la /
analyzed: ji ltar na rtags can de'i rtags pa de yin zhes brjod ce na zhes dogs pa de la /
translated: How can it be said that the sign is the sign of that possessor of the sign?

original: rtags can rtogs pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la /
analyzed: rtags can rtogs pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la /
translated: With regard to that doubt, he says, ‚ÄúThe realization of the possessor of the sign . . .‚Äù

original: de'i mi slu ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rtags can dang phrad par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i mi slu ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rtags can dang phrad par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause it is nondeceptive with regard to that‚Äù means because it causes contact with the possessor of the sign.

original: rtags 'dzin pa bzhin du zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa rnam par 'jog par byed pa rtags 'dzin pa mngon sum gyi phyis byung ba gang yin pa de rtags kyi rang gi ngo bo nyid 'dzin par byed pa ma yin pa de lta
analyzed: rtags 'dzin pa bzhin du zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa rnam par 'jog par byed pa rtags 'dzin pa mngon sum gyi phyis byung ba gang yin pa de rtags kyi rang gi ngo bo nyid 'dzin par byed pa ma yin pa de lta
translated: ‚ÄúJust like the apprehension of the sign‚Äù means that the subsequent arising of the apprehension of the sign, which is the establishment of the conceptual cognition, does not apprehend the intrinsic reality of the sign.

original: na yang / rtags la mi slu ba'i phyir rtags rtogs pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: na yang / rtags la mi slu ba'i phyir rtags rtogs pa zhes brjod do //
translated: Nevertheless, because it is nondeceptive with regard to the sign, it is called the realization of the sign.

original: 'dis ni chos can dang 'brel pa can zhes bya ba ni phyogs kyi chos nyid do //
analyzed: 'dis ni chos can dang 'brel pa can zhes bya ba ni phyogs kyi chos nyid do //
translated: This shows that the relation to the subject is the property of the subject.

original: 'phen pa'am bzlas pa'i tshul gyis ston pa ni zur gyis bstan pa ste /
analyzed: 'phen pa'am bzlas pa'i tshul gyis ston pa ni zur gyis bstan pa ste /
translated: The indirect teaching is the teaching by way of implication.

original: dang por de'i sgras ni chos bstan cing drug pa'i bsdu bas de'i rten zhen bya bas ni chos can bstan la /
analyzed: dang por de'i sgras ni chos bstan cing drug pa'i bsdu bas de'i rten zhen bya bas ni chos can bstan la /
translated: First, the word ‚Äúthat‚Äù indicates the teaching of the property of the thesis, and the sixth case ending in ‚Äúof that‚Äù indicates the subject.

original: da ni de'i sgras chos can brjod de /
analyzed: da ni de'i sgras chos can brjod de /
translated: Now, the word ‚Äúthat‚Äù indicates the subject.

original: de'i rten can zhes bya ba'i 'bru mang po pa 'dis ni bsgrub par bya ba'i chos bstan to //
analyzed: de'i rten can zhes bya ba'i 'bru mang po pa 'dis ni bsgrub par bya ba'i chos bstan to //
translated: The plural particle in ‚Äúof that‚Äù indicates the property to be proven.

original: 'di ltar 'ga' zhig las zhes bya ba ni 'brel pas stong pa las so //üîΩthams cad la zhes bya ba ni yul ji srid pa rjes su dpag par bya ba yod pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'ga' zhig las zhes bya ba ni 'brel pas stong pa las so // thams cad la zhes bya ba ni yul ji srid pa rjes su dpag par bya ba yod pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú From some‚Äù means from something that is empty of the relation.üîΩ‚Äú Everything‚Äù means that the object of inference exists as far as the domain of objects extends.

original: thams cad kyi zhes bya ba ni don gang rjes su dpog par nus pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad kyi zhes bya ba ni don gang rjes su dpog par nus pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú All‚Äù means that the object of inference is able to be inferred.

original: thams cad kyi sgra ni 'dir brjod par 'dod pa ma lus pa brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: thams cad kyi sgra ni 'dir brjod par 'dod pa ma lus pa brjod pa yin no //

analyzed: thal ba gnyis pa la yang thams cad kyi sgra ma lus par brjod par bya'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúall‚Äù should be applied in full to the second reductio as well.

original: de ltar na thal ba'i tshigs la khyad par du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na thal ba'i tshigs la khyad par du 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the reductio argument will be qualified.

original: don de 'dra ba las zhes bya ba ni tshul gsum pa'i rtags las so //üîΩso sor nges pa'i tshul gyis zhes bya ba ni rtsva las byung ba dang / lo ma las @170a * //
analyzed: don de 'dra ba las zhes bya ba ni tshul gsum pa'i rtags las so // so sor nges pa'i tshul gyis zhes bya ba ni rtsva las byung ba dang / lo ma las @170a * //
translated: The phrase from an object of that kind means from a reason having the three modes.

original: byung ba la sogs pa'i tshul gyis so //üîΩde med na yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la rtsva'i me la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid med na yang rtags de yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byung ba la sogs pa'i tshul gyis so // de med na yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la rtsva'i me la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid med na yang rtags de yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase by way of a specific determination means by way of the determination that it is a fire arisen from grass, or a fire arisen from sticks, and so on.üîΩThe phrase even though it does not exist means that even though the fire arisen from grass, and so on, does not exist, the reason exists.üîΩThus, even though the fire arisen from grass does not exist, smoke exists in another fire. In this way, all the distinctions are mutually confused.

original: de ltar na rtsa las byung ba'i me med na yang me gzhan la du ba yod pa de ltar na khyad par thams cad phan tshun 'khrul pa yin par sbyar ro //üîΩ'on kyang de tshe go byed rjes 'gro ba //

translated: However, at that time, the indicator is the universal that is the mere exclusion of the opposite of fire, which is the object of the cognition. The phrase the indicator is the universal that is the mere exclusion of the opposite of fire means that the indicator is the universal that is the mere exclusion of the opposite of fire. The phrase the indicator is the universal that is the mere exclusion of the opposite of fire means that the indicator is the universal that is the mere exclusion of the opposite of fire. The phrase the indicator is the universal that is the mere exclusion of the opposite of fire means that the indicator is the universal that is the mere exclusion of the opposite of fire.üîΩThe phrase the indicator is the universal that is the mere exclusion of the opposite of fire means that the indicator is the universal that is the mere exclusion of the opposite of fire. The phrase the indicator is the universal that is the mere exclusion of the opposite of fire means that the indicator is the universal that is the mere exclusion of the opposite of fire.

analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la go bar byed pa rtags kyi rjes su 'gro ba khyad par byed pa'i spyi'i ngo bo me ma yin par rnam par bcad pa tsam gang yin pa me'i spyi de nyid du rtogs pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
