The phrase the indicator is the universal that is the mere exclusion of the opposite of fire means that the indicator is the universal that is the mere exclusion of the opposite of fire.

original: rtags ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas de 'chang par byed do //
analyzed: rtags ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas de 'chang par byed do //
translated: He indicates that by ‚Äúthe sign‚Äù and so on.

original: rtsva dang lo ma dag las skyes pa ni rtsva las byung ba dang lo ma las byung ba'o //
analyzed: rtsva dang lo ma dag las skyes pa ni rtsva las byung ba dang lo ma las byung ba'o //
translated: Those that arise from grass and leaves are ‚Äúgrass-born‚Äù and ‚Äúleaf-born.‚Äù

original: 'brel pa can gyi chos dag la zhes bya ba 'di'i rnam par 'grel pa ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'brel pa can gyi chos dag la zhes bya ba 'di'i rnam par 'grel pa ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe related properties‚Äù is the commentary on this. ‚ÄúFollowing and reversing‚Äù are the terms.

original: chos can la zhes bya ba de tsam ni mdo yin no //üîΩchos de dang ldan pa zhes bya ba dang spel ma yin te /
analyzed: chos can la zhes bya ba de tsam ni mdo yin no // chos de dang ldan pa zhes bya ba dang spel ma yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúThe subject‚Äù is just the s≈´tra.üîΩ‚ÄúHaving that property‚Äù is the addition.

original: sgrub par byed pa'i chos dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa'i chos dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is ‚Äúhaving the property that proves.‚Äù

original: chos can la skye ba zhes bya ba 'dis ni chos can dang 'brel pa bstan to zhes bya ba ni /üîΩ'di ltar 'brel pa can gyi chos dag la /
analyzed: chos can la skye ba zhes bya ba 'dis ni chos can dang 'brel pa bstan to zhes bya ba ni / 'di ltar 'brel pa can gyi chos dag la /
translated: ‚ÄúThe arising of the property in the subject‚Äù teaches the connection with the subject.

original: chos can la rtogs pa skye ba na zhes bshad pa na /
analyzed: chos can la rtogs pa skye ba na zhes bshad pa na /
translated: Thus, in the explanation ‚Äúwhen the arising of the property in the subject is known,‚Äù

original: chos can gyi sgra 'grel pa can gyi sgra nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: chos can gyi sgra 'grel pa can gyi sgra nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: the word ‚Äúsubject‚Äù is the word for the related property.

original: 'brel pa can gyi chos de nyid la ltos nas chos can zhes rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'brel pa can gyi chos de nyid la ltos nas chos can zhes rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: and in dependence on that very related phenomenon, the subject is understood.

original: de ltar na phyogs kyi chos nyid bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na phyogs kyi chos nyid bshad pa yin no //
translated: Thus the property of the subject has been explained.

original: gsum gcig grangs ni bsal ba'am //
analyzed: gsum gcig grangs ni bsal ba'am //
translated: The number three is excluded, as is the number one.

original: zhes bya ba la'am gyi sgra ni sngar gzhal bya gnyis nyid yin pa'i phyir tshad ma gnyis kho na yin no zhes bya ba 'dis gsum la sogs pa'i grangs bsal ba byas pa yin no zhes bshad nas /üîΩda ni gzhal bya gnyis nye bar bkod pa 'di nyid kyi rjes su dpag pa yang tshad ma nyid du bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la'am gyi sgra ni sngar gzhal bya gnyis nyid yin pa'i phyir tshad ma gnyis kho na yin no zhes bya ba 'dis gsum la sogs pa'i grangs bsal ba byas pa yin no zhes bshad nas / da ni gzhal bya gnyis nye bar bkod pa 'di nyid kyi rjes su dpag pa yang tshad ma nyid du bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: The word ‚Äúor‚Äù indicates that the number two is the object of comprehension, and therefore there are only two valid cognitions. This excludes the possibility of there being three or more.

original: gsum la sogs pa'i grangs bsal ba bzhin du gcig gi grangs bsal ba yang byas pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i khyad par 'dis phyogs gzhan ston par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: gsum la sogs pa'i grangs bsal ba bzhin du gcig gi grangs bsal ba yang byas pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i khyad par 'dis phyogs gzhan ston par byed pa yin no //
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate that inference is also a valid cognition, he presents another position, saying that just as the number three is excluded, the number one is also excluded.üîΩThe example is devoid of the probandum.

original: dpe bsgrub par bya bas stong pa yin no zhes bya ba ni med pa yang gzhal bya nyid yin la /
analyzed: dpe bsgrub par bya bas stong pa yin no zhes bya ba ni med pa yang gzhal bya nyid yin la /
translated: The non-existent is also an object of comprehension.

original: de la gzhal bya nyid ma yin pa'i bsgrub par bya bas stong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la gzhal bya nyid ma yin pa'i bsgrub par bya bas stong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the probandum is empty of being an object of cognition.

original: ji ltar na rang nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa ni gzhan gyi yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar na rang nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa ni gzhan gyi yin te /
translated: How can one‚Äôs own, etc. is the opponent‚Äôs.

original: @170b gzhan dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi mngon sum gyis dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa ji ltar med par grub par 'dod ce na zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: @170b gzhan dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi mngon sum gyis dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa ji ltar med par grub par 'dod ce na zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: How can one assert that what is characterized by being perceived by direct perception, which has the characteristic of being perceived by another, is established as nonexistent?

original: de la yang zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha' smra ba'i'o //
analyzed: de la yang zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha' smra ba'i'o //
translated: Also here means in the tenets.

original: rang bzhin gyi nges pa zhes bya ba ni de yang de las gzhan pa las ldog pa'i ngo bo rang gi mtshan nyid du gnas pa'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi nges pa zhes bya ba ni de yang de las gzhan pa las ldog pa'i ngo bo rang gi mtshan nyid du gnas pa'o //
translated: Intrinsic determination means that it is present as the intrinsic identity that is the opposite of that which is other than it.

original: 'ba' zhig ces bya ba 'dis ni dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa dang ma 'dres pa can no //
analyzed: 'ba' zhig ces bya ba 'dis ni dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa dang ma 'dres pa can no //
translated: Only means that it is not mixed with what is characterized by being an object of perception.

original: de yod pa nyid du nye bar 'jog pa las zhes bya ba ni mngon sum ste //
analyzed: de yod pa nyid du nye bar 'jog pa las zhes bya ba ni mngon sum ste //
translated: From the establishment of its existence means from direct perception.

original: yod pa nye ba can ma yin pa ni sgrub par byed par mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yod pa nye ba can ma yin pa ni sgrub par byed par mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that which does not have existence is not suitable as a proof.

original: khyod kyis kyang mi dmigs pa mngon sum gyis grub par 'dod pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: khyod kyis kyang mi dmigs pa mngon sum gyis grub par 'dod pa ma yin nam /
translated: Don‚Äôt you also assert that non-apprehension is established by direct perception?

original: de'i phyir mi dmigs pa 'di ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir mi dmigs pa 'di ni /
translated: Therefore, this non-apprehension

original: rang nyid mngon sum nyid kyis rtogs //
analyzed: rang nyid mngon sum nyid kyis rtogs //
translated: is understood by itself through direct perception.

original: zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus he says.

original: mi dmigs pa yang med pa yin pa de bas na /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa yang med pa yin pa de bas na /
translated: And since non-apprehension is non-existence,

original: khyed kyis kyang med pa'i yul can gyi mngon sum 'dod pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: khyed kyis kyang med pa'i yul can gyi mngon sum 'dod pa yin no zhe na /
translated: you also assert that direct perception has a non-existent object.

original: de'i phyir gang yang kho bo cag mi dmigs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gang yang kho bo cag mi dmigs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, he says, ‚ÄúWe do not assert that non-apprehension is a valid cognition that perceives non-existence.‚Äù

original: de la med pa yul du byed pa'i phyir mngon sum gyi tshad mas mi dmigs pa bsgrub pa ma yin gyi zhes bya ba khong nas dbyung ngo //
analyzed: de la med pa yul du byed pa'i phyir mngon sum gyi tshad mas mi dmigs pa bsgrub pa ma yin gyi zhes bya ba khong nas dbyung ngo //
translated: Here, he implies that non-apprehension is not established by the valid cognition of direct perception because it takes non-existence as its object.

original: de ltar 'jig rten pha rol la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyis bskal ba can de ni don 'ga' zhig dang shes pa gcig la 'dre ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar 'jig rten pha rol la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyis bskal ba can de ni don 'ga' zhig dang shes pa gcig la 'dre ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus, ‚Äúother worlds and so on‚Äù are naturally separated from each other because they are not mixed in a single cognition or object.

original: dngos po gang yang rung ba'i gnas skabs mtshungs pa 'ba' zhig rtogs pas 'jig rten pha rol med par rtogs pa zhes bya ba ni bsdu ba'i don yin no //
analyzed: dngos po gang yang rung ba'i gnas skabs mtshungs pa 'ba' zhig rtogs pas 'jig rten pha rol med par rtogs pa zhes bya ba ni bsdu ba'i don yin no //
translated: The meaning of the compound is: ‚Äúthe understanding that there is no other world, because of the understanding of only the similarity of states of any entity.‚Äù

original: rnam pa gzhan du yang snang ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni dngos po yod pa yang yul la sogs pas bskal pas mngon sum ldog pa yang snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du yang snang ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni dngos po yod pa yang yul la sogs pas bskal pas mngon sum ldog pa yang snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause of the appearance of another aspect‚Äù means that the cessation of perception is seen even when the entity exists, because of the separation of the object, etc.

original: ci ste 'di'i 'khrul pa med pa zhes bya ba 'di ni khas blangs nas brjod pa'o //
analyzed: ci ste 'di'i 'khrul pa med pa zhes bya ba 'di ni khas blangs nas brjod pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIf it is said that there is no error in this‚Äù is a statement of the opponent‚Äôs position.

original: smra sogs la ni zhes bya ba ni brjod pa la sogs pa la'o //
analyzed: smra sogs la ni zhes bya ba ni brjod pa la sogs pa la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn speech, etc.‚Äù means in expression, etc.

original: shing sha pa ni shing rtogs par byed pa'i rtags so //
analyzed: shing sha pa ni shing rtogs par byed pa'i rtags so //
translated: The palm tree is the sign that produces the cognition of the tree.

original: chu brtan pa ni rten rtogs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: chu brtan pa ni rten rtogs par byed pa'o //
translated: The water is the support that produces the cognition of the support.

original: tshad ma'i 'bras bu can nyid yin pa'i phyir tshad ma nyid ces brjod do /
analyzed: tshad ma'i 'bras bu can nyid yin pa'i phyir tshad ma nyid ces brjod do /
translated: Because it has the result of valid knowledge, it is called valid knowledge.

original: // / tshad ma rnam 'grel gyi 'grel bshad /
analyzed: // / tshad ma rnam 'grel gyi 'grel bshad /
translated: Commentary on Valid Knowledge

original: bam po lnga bcu rtsa gcig pa /
analyzed: bam po lnga bcu rtsa gcig pa /
translated: Fifty-first section

original: gal te la la dag tu ni //
analyzed: gal te la la dag tu ni //
translated: If in some places

original: 'khrul phyir yid brtan med yin zhes //üîΩzhes bya ba ni skyu ru ra nyid yin pa'i phyir skyu ru ra ni bska ba yin te /
analyzed: 'khrul phyir yid brtan med yin zhes // zhes bya ba ni skyu ru ra nyid yin pa'i phyir skyu ru ra ni bska ba yin te /
translated: Because of error, there is no certainty.

original: @171a * // myangs pa'i skyu ru ra bzhin no zhes bya ba 'di ni 'khrul pa yin te /
analyzed: @171a * // myangs pa'i skyu ru ra bzhin no zhes bya ba 'di ni 'khrul pa yin te /
translated: The statement, ‚ÄúThe citron is bitter because it is a citron, like the citron that is tasted,‚Äù is an error.

original: 'o ma la sogs pas bcus pa la sogs pa byas pas la lar skyu ru ra'i 'bras bu mngar ba nyid kyang mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'o ma la sogs pas bcus pa la sogs pa byas pas la lar skyu ru ra'i 'bras bu mngar ba nyid kyang mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because in some cases, the citron fruit is seen to be sweet, due to the addition of milk, etc.

original: de bzhin du gzhan la yang gnas skabs dang yul dang dus tha dad pa'i sgo nas 'khrul pa srid par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan la yang gnas skabs dang yul dang dus tha dad pa'i sgo nas 'khrul pa srid par 'gyur ro //
translated: Similarly, in other cases, error is possible due to the difference of state, place, and time.

original: de skad du /
analyzed: de skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: gnas skabs yul dus tha dad phyir //
analyzed: gnas skabs yul dus tha dad phyir //
translated: Because of the difference of state, place, and time,

original: nus rnams tha dad yod na ni //
analyzed: nus rnams tha dad yod na ni //
translated: if the potencies are different,

original: dngos rnams rjes su dpag pa yis //
analyzed: dngos rnams rjes su dpag pa yis //
translated: the understanding of things

original: rtogs pa dag ni rnyed par dka' //
analyzed: rtogs pa dag ni rnyed par dka' //
translated: through inference is difficult to obtain.

original: don byed de dang de la ni //
analyzed: don byed de dang de la ni //
translated: For that and that which performs a function,

original: dngos po nus nges can gyi ni //
analyzed: dngos po nus nges can gyi ni //
translated: the substance with a definite potency,

original: rdzas khyad par can 'brel pa yis //
analyzed: rdzas khyad par can 'brel pa yis //
translated: by the connection with a special substance,

original: nus pa so sor 'joms par 'gyur //
analyzed: nus pa so sor 'joms par 'gyur //
translated: the potency is destroyed individually.

original: zhes smras pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes smras pa yin no //
translated: This is what is being said.

original: de gang la yod pa zhes bya ba ni gang la slu ba med pa ste /
analyzed: de gang la yod pa zhes bya ba ni gang la slu ba med pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThat which exists in that‚Äù means that which is not deceptive,

original: de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung ba'i mtshan nyid yod pa'o //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung ba'i mtshan nyid yod pa'o //
translated: that which has the characteristic of being the essence of that or arising from that.

original: des ni ldog pa tsam rtags ma yin no //
analyzed: des ni ldog pa tsam rtags ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, mere non-observation is not a logical reason.

original: 'o na ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci yin zhe na /
translated: What is it then?

original: gzhan dmigs pa yin no zhes ston par byed do zhes bya ba ni ;
analyzed: gzhan dmigs pa yin no zhes ston par byed do zhes bya ba ni ;
translated: It is the observation of something else.

original: 'di ltar mthong ba'i rgyu gzhan yod na zhes bya ba 'dis ni mig la sogs pa'i 'jug pa'i byed pa nyid bstan to //
analyzed: 'di ltar mthong ba'i rgyu gzhan yod na zhes bya ba 'dis ni mig la sogs pa'i 'jug pa'i byed pa nyid bstan to //
translated: Thus, ‚Äúif the cause of seeing something else exists‚Äù shows the functioning of the eye, etc.

original: de dag de la ji ltar nus par 'gyur /
analyzed: de dag de la ji ltar nus par 'gyur /
translated: How could they be able to do that?

original: gal te de la rnam par gnas pa'i phyogs la sogs pa yongs su gcod par byed pa de bas na /
analyzed: gal te de la rnam par gnas pa'i phyogs la sogs pa yongs su gcod par byed pa de bas na /
translated: If they determine the place, etc., where it is located, then

original: bum pa la sogs pa dgag par bya bas dben pa'i sa phyogs la sogs pa dmigs pa nyid ma yin par 'jug pas mi dmigs pa yin no zhes ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa dgag par bya bas dben pa'i sa phyogs la sogs pa dmigs pa nyid ma yin par 'jug pas mi dmigs pa yin no zhes ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: the observation of the place, etc., devoid of the object of negation, such as a pot, is not the non-observation of something observable. This is what is being said.

original: ji skad du bshad pa'i rang bzhin mi dmigs pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sogs pa smos pas ni khyab par byed pa dang rgyu mi dmigs pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa'i rang bzhin mi dmigs pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sogs pa smos pas ni khyab par byed pa dang rgyu mi dmigs pa gzung ngo //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe non-observation of a nature, etc.‚Äù includes the non-observation of a pervader and the non-observation of a cause.

original: khyab par byed pa ni khyab par byed pa'i rang bzhin nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: khyab par byed pa ni khyab par byed pa'i rang bzhin nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: A pervader is a nature that pervades.

original: khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa yang rang bzhin mi dmigs pa de dang ldan pa zhes bya bas bstan to //
analyzed: khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa yang rang bzhin mi dmigs pa de dang ldan pa zhes bya bas bstan to //
translated: The non-observation of a pervader is included in the non-observation of a nature. This is what is indicated by the phrase ‚Äúthat is endowed with . . .‚Äù

original: ci rigs par zhes bya ba bum pa'i bdag nyid la sogs pa ni rang bzhin mi dmigs pa dang ldan pa yin zhing /
analyzed: ci rigs par zhes bya ba bum pa'i bdag nyid la sogs pa ni rang bzhin mi dmigs pa dang ldan pa yin zhing /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúas is fitting‚Äù means that the nature of a pot, etc., is included in the non-observation of a nature.

original: shing sha pa la sogs pa ni khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa dang ldan pa yin la /
analyzed: shing sha pa la sogs pa ni khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa dang ldan pa yin la /
translated: The nature of a birch tree, etc., is included in the non-observation of a pervader.

original: du ba la sogs pa ni rgyu mi dmigs pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: du ba la sogs pa ni rgyu mi dmigs pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The nature of smoke, etc., is included in the non-observation of a cause. This is the meaning.

original: de la khas len na zhes bya ba ni ji skad du bshad pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi 'brel pa khas len na'o //
analyzed: de la khas len na zhes bya ba ni ji skad du bshad pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi 'brel pa khas len na'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúif one accepts . . .‚Äù means if one accepts a relation that has the characteristics that have been explained.

original: de 'dra ba la zhes bya ba ni ji skad du bshad pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi @171b 'brel pa la'o //
analyzed: de 'dra ba la zhes bya ba ni ji skad du bshad pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi @171b 'brel pa la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúSuch a one‚Äù is one who has the sort of relation that has been explained.

original: bstan par nus pa ni ji skad du bshad pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi 'brel pa zhes bya ba'i skabs yin no //
analyzed: bstan par nus pa ni ji skad du bshad pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi 'brel pa zhes bya ba'i skabs yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúCan be shown‚Äù is the context of the sort of relation that has been explained.

original: 'dir zhes bya ba la sogs pa le'u dang por bstan zin cing 'og nas kyang ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dir zhes bya ba la sogs pa le'u dang por bstan zin cing 'og nas kyang ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúHere‚Äù is in the first chapter, and will be shown later.

original: gal te yang gtan tshigs gsum gyi 'brel pa bsgrub pa yin pa de lta na yang /
analyzed: gal te yang gtan tshigs gsum gyi 'brel pa bsgrub pa yin pa de lta na yang /
translated: Even though the relation of the three reasons is being established,

original: dpe'i khyad par la ltos nas gtan tshigs 'ga' zhig gi zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: dpe'i khyad par la ltos nas gtan tshigs 'ga' zhig gi zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: in view of the particular example, he says ‚Äúsome reasons.‚Äù

original: de ltar de zhes bya ba la sogs pa la dbang pos mthong bar gyur cing ma mthong ba la gzung bar mi 'gyur ba gang yin pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de ltar de zhes bya ba la sogs pa la dbang pos mthong bar gyur cing ma mthong ba la gzung bar mi 'gyur ba gang yin pa nyid yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúIn that way‚Äù and so on. It is just that what is seen by the senses is apprehended, and what is not seen is not apprehended.

original: 'di la nges pa yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni 'di dbang po dag gis dus gzhan du yang mi 'dzin par nges pa yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di la nges pa yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni 'di dbang po dag gis dus gzhan du yang mi 'dzin par nges pa yod pa ma yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúThere is no certainty here‚Äù means that there is no certainty that the senses will not apprehend it at another time.

original: goms pa las gsal ba skye ba can 'ga' zhig gis gzung ba nyid du srid pa la gnod pa can gyi tshad ma med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: goms pa las gsal ba skye ba can 'ga' zhig gis gzung ba nyid du srid pa la gnod pa can gyi tshad ma med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no valid cognition that contradicts the possibility of some things being apprehended by one who has attained clarity through cultivation.

original: gzung bar bya ba la dbang po las 'das pa nyid med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gzung bar bya ba la dbang po las 'das pa nyid med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Because there is no transcendence of the senses in the case of what is apprehended.

original: skyes bu'i phul du byung ba 'di la ltos nas de gzung bar bya ba yin pa de la dbang po las 'das pa nyid med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: skyes bu'i phul du byung ba 'di la ltos nas de gzung bar bya ba yin pa de la dbang po las 'das pa nyid med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that, in relation to this excellence of a person, there is no transcendence of the senses in the case of what is apprehended.üîΩIn relation to the special states of the senses such as the eye, etc.

original: mig la sogs pa'i dbang po rnams kyi gnas skabs kyi khyad par la ltos nas zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe mig la sogs pa yul la sogs pas chod pa la sogs pa nus pa med pas rang gi yul 'dzin pa la rung ba ma yin no
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i dbang po rnams kyi gnas skabs kyi khyad par la ltos nas zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe mig la sogs pa yul la sogs pas chod pa la sogs pa nus pa med pas rang gi yul 'dzin pa la rung ba ma yin no
translated: When the eye, etc. are not capable of apprehending their objects because they are obstructed by objects, etc., they are not fit to apprehend their objects.

original: // de ni ji skad du bshad pa'i dbang po las 'das pa nyid do //
analyzed: // de ni ji skad du bshad pa'i dbang po las 'das pa nyid do //
translated: That is the transcendence of the senses as it has been explained.

original: gzhan la yang zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pha rol la sogs pa las so //
analyzed: gzhan la yang zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pha rol la sogs pa las so //
translated: In the case of others, such as the world beyond, etc.

original: 'dir gzhan nyid ni yul la sogs pas bskal pa'i gzugs la sogs pa'i khyad par ro //
analyzed: 'dir gzhan nyid ni yul la sogs pas bskal pa'i gzugs la sogs pa'i khyad par ro //
translated: Here, ‚Äúotherness‚Äù is the difference of form, etc., which is separated by space, etc.

original: 'o na gang 'di mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam pas sam du mar kha dog la sogs pa 'dzin pa de ltar na zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshad ma kun las btus pa'i gzhung phyogs snga ma dang bcas pa bshad par bzhed pas /üîΩgzhal bya des na kha dog gi / mi rtag pa ni rtogs mi 'gyur //
analyzed: 'o na gang 'di mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam pas sam du mar kha dog la sogs pa 'dzin pa de ltar na zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshad ma kun las btus pa'i gzhung phyogs snga ma dang bcas pa bshad par bzhed pas / gzhal bya des na kha dog gi / mi rtag pa ni rtogs mi 'gyur //
translated: Now, in order to explain the text of the Prama·πáavarttika, beginning with the words, ‚ÄúBut when it apprehends many colors, etc., in the aspect of impermanence, etc.,‚Äù which presents the opponent‚Äôs view,

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: he says: ‚ÄúThus, one does not cognize the impermanence of color by means of that object.‚Äù

original: sgra mi rtag pa ces bya ba spyi dang rang gi mtshan nyid kyi rnam pa can gyi blo gcig nyid yin no zhes gzhan dag sems so //üîΩkhyad par 'dzin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sgra mi rtag pa ces bya ba spyi dang rang gi mtshan nyid kyi rnam pa can gyi blo gcig nyid yin no zhes gzhan dag sems so // khyad par 'dzin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Others think that the cognition of the impermanence of sound is a single cognition having the aspect of a universal and a particular.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid yin gyi sangs rgyas pa'i rjes su dpag pa ni rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid yin gyi sangs rgyas pa'i rjes su dpag pa ni rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin pa ma yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause it apprehends a particular‚Äù means that it is a particular, but a Buddhist inference does not apprehend a particular.

original: du ma zhes bya @172a * //
analyzed: du ma zhes bya @172a * //
translated: ‚ÄúMany‚Äù means many colors, etc.

original: ba de ni shes pa khyad par dag ni mthong ba gang zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed do //
analyzed: ba de ni shes pa khyad par dag ni mthong ba gang zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed do //
translated: That is explained by ‚Äúthe seeing of the particular cognition,‚Äù and so on.

original: 'dir rjes su dpag par 'dod pa'i mtshan nyid de nyid ces bya ba ni spyi nyid mthong ba de nyid 'dir tshul gsum pa'i rtags smra ba'i gzhung la rjes su dpag pa yin par 'dod de /
analyzed: 'dir rjes su dpag par 'dod pa'i mtshan nyid de nyid ces bya ba ni spyi nyid mthong ba de nyid 'dir tshul gsum pa'i rtags smra ba'i gzhung la rjes su dpag pa yin par 'dod de /
translated: Here, the very same characteristic of the inferential cognition is called ‚Äúthe seeing of the universal,‚Äù and it is asserted that this is the inferential cognition in the treatise of the one who expounds the three modes.

original: spyi nyid bsgrub par bya ba la rtags kyi rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa yod pa'i phyir ro //üîΩdper na khyad par mthong ba'i tshad mas khyad par 'dzin pa lta bu'o zhes bya ba ni mngon sum gyis kyang khyad par 'dzin cing /
analyzed: spyi nyid bsgrub par bya ba la rtags kyi rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa yod pa'i phyir ro // dper na khyad par mthong ba'i tshad mas khyad par 'dzin pa lta bu'o zhes bya ba ni mngon sum gyis kyang khyad par 'dzin cing /
translated: Because the existence of the forward and reverse pervasion of the reason in relation to the probandum is a universal.üîΩFor example, it is like the valid cognition that sees the particular apprehending the particular.

original: khyad par mthong ba'i tshad mas kyang yin pa de bas na yul gcig la tshad ma du ma 'jug pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: khyad par mthong ba'i tshad mas kyang yin pa de bas na yul gcig la tshad ma du ma 'jug pa lta bu'o //
translated: Direct perception also apprehends the particular, and the valid cognition that sees the particular is also that. Therefore, it is like multiple valid cognitions engaging a single object.

original: de ltar na re zhig gzhal bya gnyis nyid yin pa'i phyir tshad ma gnyis yin no zhes rnam par gzhag pa gang yin pa de spangs nas gzhal bya mang ba nyid dam gzhal bya gcig la tshad ma du ma 'jug pa'i phyir tshad ma mang po nyid yin
analyzed: de ltar na re zhig gzhal bya gnyis nyid yin pa'i phyir tshad ma gnyis yin no zhes rnam par gzhag pa gang yin pa de spangs nas gzhal bya mang ba nyid dam gzhal bya gcig la tshad ma du ma 'jug pa'i phyir tshad ma mang po nyid yin
translated: Thus, having refuted the position that there are two valid cognitions because there are two objects of comprehension, the opponent‚Äôs position is that there are many valid cognitions because there are many objects of comprehension or because many valid cognitions engage one object of comprehension.

original: no zhes bya ba'i phyogs snga ma tshad ma kun las btus pa'i gzhung bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: no zhes bya ba'i phyogs snga ma tshad ma kun las btus pa'i gzhung bshad pa yin no //
translated: This is the opponent‚Äôs position in the commentary on the Compendium of Valid Knowledge.

original: yang na / gsum gcig grangs ni bsal ba'am //
analyzed: yang na / gsum gcig grangs ni bsal ba'am //
translated: Or, the opponent‚Äôs position is that the statement, ‚ÄúThe number three is eliminated because

original: gzhal bya gnyis ni mthong phyir ro //üîΩzhes bshad pa gang yin pa de sel bar byed pas na 'di phyogs snga ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhal bya gnyis ni mthong phyir ro // zhes bshad pa gang yin pa de sel bar byed pas na 'di phyogs snga ma yin no //
translated: the two objects of comprehension are seen,‚Äù is refuted.

original: de nyid ni 'o na zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i gzhung 'dis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de nyid ni 'o na zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i gzhung 'dis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: This is the opponent‚Äôs position in the text that begins, ‚ÄúWell then, this text . . .‚Äù

original: kha dog spyi la sbyor phyir ro //
analyzed: kha dog spyi la sbyor phyir ro //
translated: Because it is applied to the universal of color.

original: zhes bya ba 'dis 'di skad du kha dog la sogs pa mi rtag go zhes ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'dis 'di skad du kha dog la sogs pa mi rtag go zhes ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: This is saying that it is taught that color and so on are impermanent.

original: rnam par rtog pa 'dis ni kha dog la sogs pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid dang mi rtag pa'i spyi nyid sbyor ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa 'dis ni kha dog la sogs pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid dang mi rtag pa'i spyi nyid sbyor ba ma yin gyi /
translated: This conception does not apply the universal of impermanence to the particular of color, etc.

original: 'on kyang kha dog la sogs pa'i rgyun gyi mthar thug par 'jug pa can gyi skad cig ma mngon sum gyis bzung ba yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang kha dog la sogs pa'i rgyun gyi mthar thug par 'jug pa can gyi skad cig ma mngon sum gyis bzung ba yin no //
translated: However, it is the momentariness that is apprehended by direct perception as occurring at the end of the continuum of color, etc.

original: de nas rgyun chad pa na des dben pa gzhan dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi mi dmigs pa'i mngon sum skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas rgyun chad pa na des dben pa gzhan dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi mi dmigs pa'i mngon sum skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Then, when the continuum is severed, the direct perception of nonapprehension arises, which has the characteristic of the apprehension of something else that is devoid of that.

original: de bas na ji skad du bshad pa'i mngon sum gnyis kyi stobs kyis skyed pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i rnam par shes pa kha dog la sogs pa'i spyi nyid kyi mi rtag pa'i spyi nyid la sbyor bzhin du skye ba yin te /
analyzed: de bas na ji skad du bshad pa'i mngon sum gnyis kyi stobs kyis skyed pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i rnam par shes pa kha dog la sogs pa'i spyi nyid kyi mi rtag pa'i spyi nyid la sbyor bzhin du skye ba yin te /
translated: Therefore, the conception that is generated by the force of the two kinds of direct perception as explained above is generated as applying the universal of impermanence to the universal of color, etc.,

original: rnam par rtog pas rang gi mtshan nyid la 'dzin par mi nus pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pas rang gi mtshan nyid la 'dzin par mi nus pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because conception is incapable of apprehending a particular.

original: de'i phyir kha dog gi mi rtag pa nyid rtogs pa'i yul du gyur pa 'di nyid spyi nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir kha dog gi mi rtag pa nyid rtogs pa'i yul du gyur pa 'di nyid spyi nyid yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, this very object that is the realization of the impermanence of color is a universal.

original: rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid gcig ma yin pa de bas na @172b gzhal bya gzhan yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid gcig ma yin pa de bas na @172b gzhal bya gzhan yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Since it is not the same as the particular and universal characteristics, there is no other object of comprehension.üîΩBecause it is established by the established forms of impermanence, etc.

original: mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam par grub pa dag gis bsgrub phyir ro zhes bya ba ni mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam par dngos po nges pa gang yin pa de rab tu bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam par grub pa dag gis bsgrub phyir ro zhes bya ba ni mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam par dngos po nges pa gang yin pa de rab tu bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The meaning is that the ascertainment of a thing by the forms of impermanence, etc. is established.

original: gal te gzhan la gzhan grub min //
analyzed: gal te gzhan la gzhan grub min //
translated: If one thing is not established by another,

original: zhes bya ba ni gzhan rang gi mtshan nyid las gzhan pa'i mi rtag pa la sogs pa grub pa gang yin pa de grub par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gzhan rang gi mtshan nyid las gzhan pa'i mi rtag pa la sogs pa grub pa gang yin pa de grub par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: the meaning is that the establishment of impermanence, etc., which is different from the particular characteristic, is not established.

original: de ni spyi zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed do //
analyzed: de ni spyi zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed do //
translated: He explains that with ‚ÄúThat is a universal,‚Äù etc.

original: rgyu brgyud pa gzhan nye bar yod pa zhes bya ba ni de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung ba'i 'brel pa'i rtags kyi shes pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid do ;
analyzed: rgyu brgyud pa gzhan nye bar yod pa zhes bya ba ni de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung ba'i 'brel pa'i rtags kyi shes pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid do ;
translated: The other, the causal continuum, is characterized by the cognition of an inferential mark that is related to it by the relation of identity or causality.

original: / de'i rgyu dang rnam par nges pa'i rang bzhin me la sogs pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: / de'i rgyu dang rnam par nges pa'i rang bzhin me la sogs pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: The nature of the cause and the nature of the determination are fire, etc.

original: mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa'i khyad par du nges pa ni rnam par nges pa'o //
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa'i khyad par du nges pa ni rnam par nges pa'o //
translated: The determination is the determination of the particular, such as impermanence, etc.

original: rgyu dang rnam par nges pa'i rang bzhin gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang rnam par nges pa'i rang bzhin gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: That which has the nature of the cause and the nature of the determination is so called.

original: rgyu'i rang bzhin ni me yin la rnam par nges pa'i rang bzhin ni sgra mi rtag pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu'i rang bzhin ni me yin la rnam par nges pa'i rang bzhin ni sgra mi rtag pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The nature of the cause is fire, and the nature of the determination is the possession of impermanent sound.

original: de ltar na gnyi ga'i skabs yongs su bzung ba yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na gnyi ga'i skabs yongs su bzung ba yin no //
translated: Thus, both cases are included.

original: de'i yul can gyi sems zhes bya ba ni de 'dra ba'i rtags kyi yul can gyi sems so //
analyzed: de'i yul can gyi sems zhes bya ba ni de 'dra ba'i rtags kyi yul can gyi sems so //
translated: The mind that has that for its object is the mind that has for its object the inferential mark of that sort.

original: de yang ci 'dra ba zhig ce na du ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de yang ci 'dra ba zhig ce na du ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: And what is that like? It is said, ‚Äúsmoke, etc.‚Äù

original: spyi la sogs pa tsam du zhes bya bas ni rang bzhin dag pa bstan to //
analyzed: spyi la sogs pa tsam du zhes bya bas ni rang bzhin dag pa bstan to //
translated: The phrase merely as universals, etc., indicates the pure nature.

original: khyad par gzhan du sgro btags pa zhes bya ba ni khyad par la ltos pa yin no //
analyzed: khyad par gzhan du sgro btags pa zhes bya ba ni khyad par la ltos pa yin no //
translated: The phrase superimposed as a distinct feature indicates that it is dependent on a distinct feature.

original: de'i dngos po med par zhes bya ba ni rgyur gyur pa'i rang bzhin du gyur pa med par ro //
analyzed: de'i dngos po med par zhes bya ba ni rgyur gyur pa'i rang bzhin du gyur pa med par ro //
translated: The phrase in the absence of its reality indicates the absence of a nature that is a cause.

original: mi 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni mi skye ba'o //
analyzed: mi 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni mi skye ba'o //
translated: The phrase does not arise indicates that it is not produced.

original: tshogs pa'i khyad par las skye ba can zhes bya ba ni me long la sogs pa'i rgyu las skye ba can no //
analyzed: tshogs pa'i khyad par las skye ba can zhes bya ba ni me long la sogs pa'i rgyu las skye ba can no //
translated: The phrase arising from a special collection indicates that it arises from causes such as a mirror.

original: gi wang la sogs pas bskyed pa'i thig le la sogs pa ni mtshan ma la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gi wang la sogs pas bskyed pa'i thig le la sogs pa ni mtshan ma la sogs pa'o //
translated: The phrase such as a mark indicates such things as the drops produced by such things as collyrium.

original: 'gyur bar ni 'dod mod kyi dngos po gnas pa nyid kyi rnam pa la rjes su dpag pa'i rnam par rtog pa mngon par zhen pa yin par ji ltar shes par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'gyur bar ni 'dod mod kyi dngos po gnas pa nyid kyi rnam pa la rjes su dpag pa'i rnam par rtog pa mngon par zhen pa yin par ji ltar shes par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: But how can it be known that the conception of an entity that is a transformation is a conceptual thought that is attached to the aspect of the entity's enduring?

original: de'i phyir yod pa'i rnam par zhen pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir yod pa'i rnam par zhen pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Therefore, he says, The conception of existence, etc.,

original: rjes su dpag pa phyis 'jug pa'i tshad ma la ltos pa ma yin no zhes sngar bshad pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa phyis 'jug pa'i tshad ma la ltos pa ma yin no zhes sngar bshad pa ma yin nam /
translated: But was it not explained earlier that inference does not depend on a later valid cognition?

original: da phyis 'jug pa'i tshad ma la ltos par bshad pa de ltar na ji ltar phan tshun 'gal ba ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: da phyis 'jug pa'i tshad ma la ltos par bshad pa de ltar na ji ltar phan tshun 'gal ba ma yin zhe na /
translated: Now, if it is explained that it does depend on a later valid cognition, how can it not be contradictory?

original: 'gal ba yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'gal ba yod pa ma yin no //
translated: There is no contradiction.

original: ji ltar rjes su @173a * //
analyzed: ji ltar rjes su @173a * //
translated: How is it that

original: dpag pa ni rang nyid las tshad ma yin mod kyi /
analyzed: dpag pa ni rang nyid las tshad ma yin mod kyi /
translated: inference is a valid cognition in regard to itself?

original: rnam pa 'dis kyang yod pa'i rnam par zhen pa bstan par nus pa de lta bu'i don du 'di nye bar bkod pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa 'dis kyang yod pa'i rnam par zhen pa bstan par nus pa de lta bu'i don du 'di nye bar bkod pa yin no //
translated: Although this is so, it is set forth in this way in order to demonstrate the mode of apprehension of the cognition that conceives of existence.

original: 'o na gang gi tshe gags byed pa 'ga' zhig las dngos po dang phrad par mi 'gyur ba de'i tshe /
analyzed: 'o na gang gi tshe gags byed pa 'ga' zhig las dngos po dang phrad par mi 'gyur ba de'i tshe /
translated: But when an object does not come into contact with something that obstructs it,

original: ji ltar na yod pa'i rnam par zhen pa'i shes pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na yod pa'i rnam par zhen pa'i shes pa yin zhe na /
translated: how can it be the cognition that conceives of existence?

original: de'i phyir gang gi tshe skyes bu mi 'jug pa na yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir gang gi tshe skyes bu mi 'jug pa na yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Therefore, he says, ‚ÄúEven when a person does not engage in activity,‚Äù and so on.

original: ji lta bur gyur pa'i rgyu'i tshogs pa dang 'brel pa'i zhes bya ba ni ji skad du bshad pa'i rtags dang 'brel pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ji lta bur gyur pa'i rgyu'i tshogs pa dang 'brel pa'i zhes bya ba ni ji skad du bshad pa'i rtags dang 'brel pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúconnected with a cause that is of such a kind‚Äù means that the inference is connected with the reason that was just described.

original: de lta bur gyur pa'i rtags dang 'brel pa la rnam pa gzhan du 'gyur ba yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa'i rtags dang 'brel pa la rnam pa gzhan du 'gyur ba yod pa ma yin no //
translated: The inference is not connected with a reason that is of a different kind.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rjes su dpag pa ni rang las tshad ma yin par bzhed do //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rjes su dpag pa ni rang las tshad ma yin par bzhed do //
translated: For this very reason, DignƒÅga maintained that inference is a form of valid knowledge that is derived from oneself.

original: gtan tshigs kyi rgyud pa 'di tsam la zhes bya ba ni rtags shes pa dang 'brel pa dran pa la sogs pa la'o //
analyzed: gtan tshigs kyi rgyud pa 'di tsam la zhes bya ba ni rtags shes pa dang 'brel pa dran pa la sogs pa la'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthis much of a series of reasons‚Äù refers to the recollection of the connection between the awareness of the reason and the awareness of the object to be inferred.

original: sdod pa dang ldan pa yin na zhes bya ba ni dus gzhan gyis chod pa dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: sdod pa dang ldan pa yin na zhes bya ba ni dus gzhan gyis chod pa dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthat is, when it is separated by an interval of time‚Äù means that it is separated by another occurrence of awareness.

original: dngos po rjes su dpag par bya ba la skad cig ma nyid du 'jig pa srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po rjes su dpag par bya ba la skad cig ma nyid du 'jig pa srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it is possible for the object to be inferred to be destroyed in an instant.

original: gal te dngos po la rag lus pa'i rtags kyi stobs kyis rjes su dpag pa byung ba yin na /
analyzed: gal te dngos po la rag lus pa'i rtags kyi stobs kyis rjes su dpag pa byung ba yin na /
translated: If the inference is produced by the power of a reason that is dependent on the object,

original: 'o na ji ltar na rang gi snang ba don med pa la don du zhen pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'khrul pa can yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar na rang gi snang ba don med pa la don du zhen pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'khrul pa can yin zhe na /
translated: Well then, how is it that they are mistaken in that they conceive of their own unreal appearances as real?

original: de'i phyir de'i 'khrul pa yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir de'i 'khrul pa yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Therefore, he says, ‚ÄúTheir error is also . . . ‚Äù

original: mngon sum gyi tshad ma'i phyis 'byung ba can du ba la sogs pa'i yul la rtog pa'i rjes su 'gro ba'i blos bzung nas rtags kyi blo rang gi mtshan nyid kyi snang bas stong ba nyid yin par bshad do //
analyzed: mngon sum gyi tshad ma'i phyis 'byung ba can du ba la sogs pa'i yul la rtog pa'i rjes su 'gro ba'i blos bzung nas rtags kyi blo rang gi mtshan nyid kyi snang bas stong ba nyid yin par bshad do //
translated: The cognition that arises after the valid cognition of perception apprehends the object, such as smoke, through a conceptual cognition. It is explained that the inferential cognition is empty of the appearance of its own character.

original: gal te rtags las skyes pa'i blo tshad ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni rtags las skyes pa rtags kyi yul can gang yin pa de yang /
analyzed: gal te rtags las skyes pa'i blo tshad ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni rtags las skyes pa rtags kyi yul can gang yin pa de yang /
translated: ‚ÄúThe cognition that arises from a logical reason is a valid cognition‚Äù means that the cognition that arises from a logical reason, the subject that has a logical reason,

original: rtags las brgyud nas byung ba yin pa de ltar na rtags las skyes pa yin no //
analyzed: rtags las brgyud nas byung ba yin pa de ltar na rtags las skyes pa yin no //
translated: arises indirectly from a logical reason. In that way, it arises from a logical reason.

original: de ltar na blo gnyis kyang 'dra bar 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na blo gnyis kyang 'dra bar 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: In that case, the two cognitions would be similar.

original: rtags kyi yul can mngon sum gyi phyis 'byung ba can gang yin pa yang tshad mar tha snyad du byas pa yin te /
analyzed: rtags kyi yul can mngon sum gyi phyis 'byung ba can gang yin pa yang tshad mar tha snyad du byas pa yin te /
translated: Also, that which occurs after the direct perception that has a sign as its object is conventionally called a valid cognition,

original: tshad ma'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshad ma'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the cause of a valid cognition.

original: khyab byed ni rgyu dang rang bzhin gnyi ga yang yin te /
analyzed: khyab byed ni rgyu dang rang bzhin gnyi ga yang yin te /
translated: The pervader is both a cause and a nature,

original: 'bras bu dang rang bzhin gyi rtags dag la khyab par byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu dang rang bzhin gyi rtags dag la khyab par byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the pervader in the case of the effect sign and the nature sign.

original: khyab par byed pa de yang rnam pa gnyis yin no //
analyzed: khyab par byed pa de yang rnam pa gnyis yin no //
translated: That pervader is also of two kinds.

original: khyab par @173b bya ba yang rnam pa gnyis yin te /
analyzed: khyab par @173b bya ba yang rnam pa gnyis yin te /
translated: The pervaded is also of two kinds.

original: sems de rtags shes pa'i rgyu mtshan no //
analyzed: sems de rtags shes pa'i rgyu mtshan no //
translated: The mind is the reason for the sign cognition.

original: rgyu ni 'bras bu'i rtags la dmigs pa'i shes pa'i rgyu mtshan yin la /
analyzed: rgyu ni 'bras bu'i rtags la dmigs pa'i shes pa'i rgyu mtshan yin la /
translated: The cause is the reason for the cognition that observes the effect sign.

original: rang bzhin ni rang bzhin gyi rtags la dmigs pa'i shes pa'i rgyu mtshan yin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin ni rang bzhin gyi rtags la dmigs pa'i shes pa'i rgyu mtshan yin no //
translated: The nature is the reason for the cognition that observes the nature sign.

original: 'gyur bar ni 'dod mod kyi /üîΩde phyir dngos po'i rtogs bya yin //
analyzed: 'gyur bar ni 'dod mod kyi / de phyir dngos po'i rtogs bya yin //
translated: Although it is accepted that the pervaded is the pervader,üîΩit is not the cause.üîΩThe pervaded is the object of comprehension of the sign.

original: khyab bya rtags kyi khyab byed yin //
analyzed: khyab bya rtags kyi khyab byed yin //
translated: The pervader is the object of comprehension of the sign.üîΩThe pervaded is the object of comprehension of the sign.üîΩThe pervader is the object of comprehension of the sign.

original: zhes bya ba de skad brjod par bya ba'i sems smos pa zhig bya zhe na /
analyzed: zhes bya ba de skad brjod par bya ba'i sems smos pa zhig bya zhe na /
translated: If one says this, then one should say that the mind is the referent of the word.

original: de'i phyir gang rtags kyi rgyu mtshan ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gang rtags kyi rgyu mtshan ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, he says, ‚ÄúThe reason for the sign,‚Äù and so on.

original: 'di skad du sems smos pa ma byas na de la dngos po la yod pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po yin pa'i phyir 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs nyid bshad par 'gyur gyi rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs ni ma yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di skad du sems smos pa ma byas na de la dngos po la yod pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po yin pa'i phyir 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs nyid bshad par 'gyur gyi rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs ni ma yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: This is saying that if the mind is not mentioned, then the reason would be explained as an effect, because it is the state of being a cause and effect of an existent thing, but it would not be a reason of nature.

original: gang la yang dngos su mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes thos pa ma yin te zhes bya ba ni gang la 'gal ba gzhan bsgrubs nas dgag pa byed ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang la yang dngos su mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes thos pa ma yin te zhes bya ba ni gang la 'gal ba gzhan bsgrubs nas dgag pa byed ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is not that it is not heard that ‚Äúbecause of the non-apprehension of anything at all,‚Äù the meaning of which is that having established the contradiction of another, one should negate.

original: des na tshad ma ldog pa khas len pa med na mi 'byung ba ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: des na tshad ma ldog pa khas len pa med na mi 'byung ba ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Therefore, in ‚Äúthe non-occurrence of the repudiation of valid knowledge is not accepted,‚Äù and so on,

original: dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa'i zhes bya bar blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa'i zhes bya bar blta bar bya'o //
translated: ‚Äúthe characteristic of the object‚Äù should be seen.

original: de dang zhes bya ba ni dgag byar 'dod pa grang ba la sogs pa dang ngo //üîΩbsgrub par bya ba'i don des zhes bya ba ni brjod ma thag pa'i dgag par byed pa'i rang bzhin dang 'gal ba'am /
analyzed: de dang zhes bya ba ni dgag byar 'dod pa grang ba la sogs pa dang ngo // bsgrub par bya ba'i don des zhes bya ba ni brjod ma thag pa'i dgag par byed pa'i rang bzhin dang 'gal ba'am /
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to cold, etc., which are held to be the negatee.

original: de'i rgyu dang 'gal bas so //
analyzed: de'i rgyu dang 'gal bas so //
translated: ‚ÄúBy that which is to be established‚Äù means by the stated reason which is incompatible with the nature of the negatee, or by the incompatibility of its cause.

original: gzugs dang gong bu yod par brjod pa na zhes bya ba ni dper na 'di na grang ba'i reg pa med de /
analyzed: gzugs dang gong bu yod par brjod pa na zhes bya ba ni dper na 'di na grang ba'i reg pa med de /
translated: ‚ÄúWhen the existence of form and mass is stated‚Äù is an example. It is like the syllogism, ‚ÄúHere there is no cold touch, because form exists, or because a mass exists.‚Äù

original: gzugs yod pa'i phyir ram gong bu yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i sbyor ba 'di la ma nges pa dang ma grub pa'i skyon gnyis kyi dogs pa bsu ba yin te /
analyzed: gzugs yod pa'i phyir ram gong bu yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i sbyor ba 'di la ma nges pa dang ma grub pa'i skyon gnyis kyi dogs pa bsu ba yin te /
translated: This is an anticipation of the two faults of inconclusiveness and nonestablishment.

original: de la gcig yod par brjod pa tsam gtan tshigs khyad par can ma yin pa la 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ma nges pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de la gcig yod par brjod pa tsam gtan tshigs khyad par can ma yin pa la 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ma nges pa nyid yin no //
translated: In this regard, the mere statement of the existence of one is inconclusive, because it is not a specific reason, and there is no relation.

original: ci ste gzugs dang gong bu yod par brjod pa 'gal ba med pa ci 'dra ba 'di na grang ba'i reg pa med de /
analyzed: ci ste gzugs dang gong bu yod par brjod pa 'gal ba med pa ci 'dra ba 'di na grang ba'i reg pa med de /
translated: If it is said that the statement of the existence of form and mass is not contradictory, then it is like this: ‚ÄúHere there is no cold touch,

original: me yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin pa de bas na ma grub pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: me yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin pa de bas na ma grub pa nyid yin te /
translated: Because fire exists. Therefore, it is not established,

original: me yod par brjod pa dang 'gal ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: me yod par brjod pa dang 'gal ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because it contradicts the statement that fire exists.

original: de la skyon dang po bsal ba'i phyir 'dir yang khyab par zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la /
analyzed: de la skyon dang po bsal ba'i phyir 'dir yang khyab par zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la /
translated: In order to remove the first fault here, he says, ‚ÄúBecause there is no difference in the establishment of the contradictory and the non-establishment of the non-observation of the establishing agent,‚Äù and so on.

original: khyad par med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'gal bsgrub par byed pa mi dmigs pa khas len par mi byad pas 'gal ba yod na yang rnam pa gzhan du nges pa mi nus pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'gal bsgrub par byed pa mi dmigs pa khas len par mi byad pas 'gal ba yod na yang rnam pa gzhan du nges pa mi nus pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no difference, means that because one does not accept the non-observation of the establishing agent as an establishment of the contradictory, even when there is a contradiction, it is not possible to ascertain it in another way.

original: @174a * // yod na yang nges par ma byas pa ni med pa dang 'dra ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: @174a * // yod na yang nges par ma byas pa ni med pa dang 'dra ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Even when it exists, if it is not ascertained, it is as if it does not exist.

original: 'gal ba dang 'gal ba med pa sgrub pa dag la khyad par med pa yin pa de ltar na gang las 'khrul par dogs /
analyzed: 'gal ba dang 'gal ba med pa sgrub pa dag la khyad par med pa yin pa de ltar na gang las 'khrul par dogs /
translated: When there is no difference between the establishment of the contradictory and the non-establishment of the non-contradictory, then from what can error be suspected?

original: gtan tshigs la khyad par yod na 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni gal te 'gal ba nges par 'gyur na zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gtan tshigs la khyad par yod na 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni gal te 'gal ba nges par 'gyur na zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: If there were a difference in the reason, it would be so, means that if there were ascertainment of the contradictory, that would be so.

original: mi dmigs pa nyid las 'gal ba nges pa yang yin na /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa nyid las 'gal ba nges pa yang yin na /
translated: If there were a contradiction in the very non-apprehension, then,

original: ji skad du bshad pa'i rnam pas khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa'i rnam pas khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no difference in the mode of explanation,

original: ma grub pa'i skyon yang bsal ba'i phyir gang yang dgag pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: ma grub pa'i skyon yang bsal ba'i phyir gang yang dgag pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: In order to remove the fault of non-establishment, he says, ‚ÄúIf it is for the sake of refuting something,‚Äù and so on.

original: khyad par med pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: khyad par med pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to show the lack of difference,

original: gal te 'gal bas yin zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi bsam pa'i dogs pa bsu ba yin no //
analyzed: gal te 'gal bas yin zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi bsam pa'i dogs pa bsu ba yin no //
translated: he says, ‚ÄúIf it is because of contradiction,‚Äù anticipating the opponent‚Äôs doubt.

original: ma grub pa nyid du khyad par med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ma grub pa nyid du khyad par med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Because there is no difference in non-establishment,

original: gang gi phyir ma grub pa nyid yin pa de'i phyir khyad par med pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir ma grub pa nyid yin pa de'i phyir khyad par med pa yin no //
translated: because of non-establishment, therefore there is no difference.

original: rgyu ma gtugs pa can gyi zhes bya ba ni rgyu ma tshang ba med pa can yin pa de de nyid kyi phyir dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: rgyu ma gtugs pa can gyi zhes bya ba ni rgyu ma tshang ba med pa can yin pa de de nyid kyi phyir dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa nyid yin no //
translated: Because of the completeness of the cause, it is just that which has the characteristic of apprehension.

original: de lta bur gyur pa'i grang ba'i reg pa yod na mngon sum gyis yongs su gcod pa yin no zhes bya ba ni bsdus pa'i don to //
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa'i grang ba'i reg pa yod na mngon sum gyis yongs su gcod pa yin no zhes bya ba ni bsdus pa'i don to //
translated: The condensed meaning is this: if there is such a cold touch, it is directly perceived.
